content: I like it so far! It is a great app to use during social distancing for sure! It keeps you connected to friends and family that lives outside of your home. I would like to see more games if possible and filters fun ones as well as ones that make you look better when you get an unexpected request and you're a mess! Lmao😂 Thank you to the developers of this app! Great job and what great timing!!!

I have the OnePlus 7 Pro phone which features a pop-up selfie-camera. I can tell you, this app constantly messes with the camera, and it's super frustrating. It doesn't need to use my camera when I'm not engaged in any actives, and just changing settings and adding friends. 😡 And for others, it's a privacy concern when an app is constantly turning on the camera for use. For me it's obvious, but for many people, they wouldn't even know... and the app could be watching.

This is a great app, great concept, my only complaint is that if you want to be with more than 2 people in the call, the app starts to freeze for everybody especially during games. So is not friendly for more than 2 people calls

It is a very useful and wonderful app over all but I just wanted to write about something that could be useful to many people including myself along with the app. I think that there should be an update to allow more people in a room at once. I know personally I would like to talk to more then 8 friends at once so maybe it could be possible to allow more people in the room. Like I said it's an overall great app that is just what I would like to see in the future.

Certain parts of this are great, the concept and ease at which it allows you to just hop on and hang out with friends, the games as well. But it's very under developed. Quizzes get quite repetitive, the settings menu isn't anywhere near fleshed out enough for a calling app and the UI isn't great. I urge the developer to do all they can to capitalise on its new found popularity because this app could be a staple going forward if it's worked on. Also I've had absolutely no privacy concerns

I've used this app just once while talking with my daughter. Clear video and sound quality! Also a great way to visually share information/ideas. A great tool for visiting and following up with loved ones anywhere! There are games included in the app where loved ones could spend time visiting, having fun, and still being safe. Finally, I further understand that "group" calls are possible!? This will be my next venture!

Great. Very reminiscent of Skype on computers back in the day with the addition of games that can be played by all people participating in the call. We did notice a glitch that happened about two and a half hours into a call. Pretty much everyone's camera started flickering. A few people's cameras turned pink. Only way we were able to Force stop the app and clear our caches. Not all that bothersome, really. Not even sure if it was a problem with the program lol

Fine for quick video chats, but I can't turn off the volume! I can mute my mic, great. But even when I turn the volume all the way down on my phone, set to silent mode, I still get the voices of everyone in the call. This is fine if you are alone, but if me and my wife both want to get in on the house party on different phones, it causes horrible horrible feedback loops.

Cool app to play simple games with friends or family. The problem is that when you connect to the app, it sends an notification to all your friends with this game. If you're on the app then they can just enter without you accepting anything. The worse thing is not that it takes decisions for you but the fact that there's not even permanent settings to stop people from entering your personal space.

I don't rate apps a lot, but I really enjoy this one. It makes me feel much closer to my friends. I'd like to see more games in the future but I get the feeling it's fairly new. It drains battery but I mean what do you expect, it's a group video chat app. I haven't encountered any bugs, and it seems to work pretty well, functionality wise. The UI I feel could use a little tweaking but that's a very minor gripe. I'd also like to see a share screen mode for sharing memes Fun app, 5*

A couple of people mentioned a lack of security, which had me concerned. But, when I fully checked it out on my phone, I saw some of the very features they saw are lacking. There's the ability to "Send out My Notifications," " Get my Friends Notifications," as well as Mute or Ghost someone. So, just have a close look and you might find all kinds of things you didn't know were there. So far, I like it, but I'm new to it. For now, I'm going to give it a 4 star rating.

Confusing interface, and somehow you wind up on a call with someone without touching anything. Also, the sound the notifications make whenever someone is calling or saying hi or whatever it is, is the most annoying, high pitched whistling sound ever. It should never be considered as a sound to use for any kind of notification. It's made me jump out of my seat on several occasions.

Sadly our first Houseparty experience was an embarrassing failure - riven with bugs and limited user controls, this app is not ready for the market. It was for my wife’s 60th birthday – so kinda important to us. So my sons and I had trialled it three times. All worked well. But the actual function did not go well. After some false starts, I got everyone together and initiated a trivia quiz – only for the questions to disappear from the screen. What followed was a very frustrating half an hour where after a gap, answers would pop up on the screen with 4 x red crosses, then disappear then another answer in 30 seconds or so and so on. This experience was shared by all our guests. There was no way to intervene and so we waited for the quiz to finish but it never did. At the end of the game, unbidden, it rolled into another and so on. We tried logging out and back in – no better. In the end, very frustrated we resorted to Zoom.

This app is a very good app for friends and family. What makes the app special is that you can play games while you are on a call. I do think that they should add more game options like UNO or even a board game. My one thing is about my privacy. The app is not encrypted which is interesting. Most apps already have encryption buit in. Sure you can lock the room but I feel like that's not enough. Overall, I didn't have any issues or bugs. Very good and creative app.

This all is so much fun and I'm on it all the time. My only problem is after I accept new friends, they normally have mutual friends that pop up and they can become your friend. Well after I get a new friends the mutual friends pop up for a quick second and then dissapear so I can't add them. Houseparty if your reading this tell me why this is happening. Please.

Great concept We had a lot of fun AT FIRST (and this is in a one night time frame) then everything started to repeat. There wasnt enough variety to make this lasting fun. I even noticed in the trivia that one of the answers was wrong. Could have been more, but one for a fact. The question was on the Harry Potter trivia. Who was Marge's sibiling? Well that would have been Mr. Dursley, but they said the answer was Mrs. Dursley. Wrong! Mrs. Dursleys sibling was in fact Lily Potter, not Marge.

Cant mute the notification sound for this app, even when my phone is on silent mode, it still has sound when a notification come from this app (Huawei P20 pro). Share screen option still not functional. Should be able to control volume of the people u r calling as well so that the volume can be equalised. Shld have more settings.

Works great on mobile! Everything working as it should be and the call quality is generally better than alternatives. The only complaint I have is that using games crashes the whole chat when at least 1 person is on the PC version. I know the browser version is in Beta, I just thought I'd point it out in the app review.

Cool concept, but app layout is bizarre and not user friendly. The draw something equivalent game doesn't register many touches and is pretty awful but is fun regardless when you're not having any social interaction. Obnoxious notifications that lead to surprise video chats with friends or acquaintances. I appreciate the app for what it is during the pandemic but I don't feel compelled to use it more than I have (couple times in last few weeks).

I'm currently trying to sign up for the first time. When you go to input your birthday, make sure to adjust the year first!! I adjusted the month first, and it perceived my birthday as being 2020, and I can do nothing. I have uninstalled and am reinstalling to try again...

It's ok but would be better if the games were expanded (especially the trivia), if our current owned heads up decks from the regular game synced (Because I'm not paying twice), if we could search or see people near us that were on, whether we know them or not so we could join new ppl, and if we could share our screens like in Zoom. Oh and the freezing and the delay even with a good connection. It gets old really fast.

I loved using this app but it no longer works on my Microsoft Surface laptop. It says I need to update to a more recent version. I've uninstalled and reinstalled the app and the issue is persistent. It's also annoying that I cannot start a game, with friends, while using my laptop, as opposed to my cell phone. This app drains my phone battery quite quickly so I prefer to use a computer.

I've used this several times now with friends, and I really like it. It's been a smooth experience. For those complaining about it draining your batteries, I'd say that's kind of a given with any kind of video-based app. I just plug my phone in when I use it. I like how convenient it is, and it's been really nice quality every time.

Not the best. I had a nice 5-6 hour long chat with no breaks, yet the audio was hard to hear because it cut out a lot. Maybe I hadn't figured out the app entirely with my Samsung Galaxy Tab A, but when playing Chips and Guac the card descriptions are cut off and the cards themselves are extriemely small so they only take up about the length of my thumb. The start and stopping of games or the judge not being in the game has also been an issue with how me and a couple of friends delt with the app.

I just finished a chat with two friends who live in the Rocky Mtns, and Chicagoland, while I'm on the West Coast. We had a great time, but it took us 40 minutes to get the sound right. I'd rate it higher if it were a more 'stable' platform. A lot of bugs. This from my android phone. The other two had iPhones. Or at least one of them.

comes great games and it really makes you feel like you're really there because you got to play games with your friends at the same time and you were in the video call you can see your friends you can see other people or new friends really cool 😎and plus a lot of people like I'm saying like a lotta YouTubers recommend this and it's actually really good leg is recommended by like the all the famous people and I like like to talk to me

Downloaded this app so me and partner could do a gender reveal to our family as we can't have a little gathering/party as planned. Worked brilliantly once everyone had downloaded the app and finally sorted issues with setting up their account. Not sure why some people could easily set up their account and others it took a few hours to sort the issue, but we still got to do what we wanted in a way and chat to our entire family all at once!!

Despite all the negative reviews that state the fact that this app has problems on android devices such as deleting your account or uninstalling the app or notification problems, mine works just fine, if you still get notifications on Do Not Disturb, when a houseparty notification pops up, hold on it to then turn of notifications. The only reason I dont give this app a 5 star is because it uses queit a lot of battery and internet data. However this app is really great for having fun with friends

My facebook friends won't load and neither will my phones address book. It makes for a quiet House Party. I have reached out multiple times to the developer to no avail. Poor customer service, but otherwise a great functioning chat app. Just work out the bugs and I'll be happy to upgrade the rating!

Cool concept, doesn't work very well. First, I couldn't find a way to log out or make sure my camera and audio was off. That's a little unsettling. Then one night I was on with some friends and things were getting really glitchy so I uninstalled and reinstalled. After that it wouldn't work at all. I'm on a galaxy S9+.

Nice concept needs work. I have a Samsung A50 with one of the latest os and this app kicks me off wifi when I use it. It drains battery and data cause it refuses to stay connected to wifi. When I close the app I am instantly connected back to my wifi. 🙄 please fix this. Also needs more content, options started to recycle within a few mins of play.

I use houseparty all the time with my friends! The app is very convenient when wanting to talk. However, this could just be the wifi for each person, but whenever I'm on a call the connection will just completely give out. Though, it tends to fix itself pretty quickly.

Limited selection of games, and the categories often repeat. Also, the players keep dropping and the connection can be kind of choppy. For free, it's better than nothing, but I probably won't be using this once the pandemic passes.

It is a really good and and really fun but the thing is that it starts lagging alot and sometimes has a echo so you have to hang up and call again. Another thing is that sometimes people will cut off and they would freeze and it is just this app because when I faced time with the same people on a different app there audio and camera is completely fine.

The app setup and flow is easy and runs well, but the game variety runs out quickly. It's especially frustrating that we have already purchased extra decks in heads-up but those don't appear in houseparty; it's silly to have to pay for the same thing twice. Good enough for a free app, I suppose.

It generally don't give a review. My thoughts on the app are only improvements. One should be able to enter the app without everybody knowing they're there. I shouldn't have to know my contacts now on your app. Maybe this is something I opted into, but I don't like that at all. If I go on to accept a friend request automatically someone can join me with my permission.

I see reviews about the app feeling unfinished and not up to par and blah blah blah. I haven't seen my family in months due to this virus but this app not only let me see their smiling faces, but we all got to play a variety of fun games with each other, and it left me feeling happy and emotionally satisfied. These are interactions that most of us value now more than we ever did, and Houseparty is a great tool for that purpose. It's a fantastic app.

Cool app-- def nice in times of Corona. But if I'm handing over all this priceless personal data about myself, I'm hoping for some better games to play on the app. Maybe like battleship or idk Tetris or something so that we have at least a variety to choose from. Feel limited as of now. Still handing over data though so y'all win.

Love this App! Had a virtual happy hour and game night with my family. It was an absolute blast! I'm in Illinois and they are in Florida. It was a great way to connect. We enjoyed ourselves so much that we will be connecting weekly during the quarantine. Thank you for this wonderful app!
Fun for the first time. I was hoping that the packs I already bought for Heads Up would show up in Houseparty, but it looks like I would have to buy them again here, which is not worth it.

You actually need a house for this app -- everyone needs to be in their own room to avoid party-destroying audio feedback loops. The App's UX is also poor; unintuitive UI (e.g. settings are burried under a small icon on the friends page)

Solid 3-3.5 so far! Great idea, I can see where some of the features are in the process of being added to the app that aren't clickable yet(purchasable games I presume is one). Glitches out a little bit on certain devices, my friend was having troubles with his iPad being signed in on other devices and it was glitching a bit on my S10 when joining friends. It does eat battery on the S10 which is saying a lot and that can be improved. I would love to see maybe some adult age gated drinking games.

I wish I could do zero stars. I can't say anything about the app because it won't "update" and let me open it. I literally have hit the update button 10 times after installing it and trying to use it right away. It installs and just has the update button there again.

It's nice overall, though I do have suggestions. It drains your battery! My battery usually lasts at least the whole day, but now im charging it at least twice a day. Also, there needs to be more games. The same four games get rly boring after a while. Also kind of glitchy, but not awful

App sucks. Crashes randomly when doing basic tasks. The backend system randomly blocks people that I have added, without any facility to unblock them. Epic responded to a previous review with "email us and we'll help you" Sent them an email. Nothing. Zero response. Honestly, they didn't need someone to do corporate espionage to turn me off this app. Their buggy system and poor customer support did it all by themselves.

The issue I'm getting is, when I try to connect my Facebook friends I get a error message "Uh Oh that didn't work. Ive'd tried to shake to leave feedback within the app. It just doesn't seem to work. I would would love to rate it 5 just them issues are stopping me.

Tried this app to see and speak with my family. Unfortunately the longest it would go without interruption was MAYBE 30 seconds. Video windows would go blue and audio lagged. I kept having to log in and out to get video working again. I'm deleting as soon as I post this review.

After the latest update, Whenever I'm in a call, every 5 mins it says my internet connection is low, and changes my status to joining, disturbing the call. Kindly fix this issue as my internet connection is perfectly fine.

I love the app and use it with the family. I would give it a 5-rating if you added different sidded dice. Me and my friend would use it for d&d or pathfinder while still staying at home. I'm sure others would too. Great app!!!!!

This app is really great. The picture is super smooth and the games are great. You can ignore people and lock your rooms which is handy. The main downsides are it sucks your battery life ridiculously not to mention it is a ton of data if your not in a wifi area or out and about. Also it raises the phone temperature.

The only thing I didn't like is that when more than one person is talking it blocks out what the other people are saying. So what's the point in it being a house party app if you cant all talk and laugh together like a party? Just easier to facetime really

I like this app but now it is giving a lot of trouble at first it was going all good until now ... people taking long to load in the chat it ways saying that you having wifi problems even though some of us using data .... so i don't know what is happen to app sigh .. i really do enjoy this app cause its cool you can play games and talk to people and meet new people but jah why is it giving so much trouble now ... sigh

Great app, easy to use, very reliable. A cool addition would be clearer distinction between wave and call buttons. Sometimes I press call instead of wave and a little bit more space between would be helpful. Other than that, best video calling app I think

Sometimes if you turn down the volume, it turns down some of the people in the chat but not all. This is incredibly irritating. All volume coming from the app should be on the same volume slider, no exceptions. This effectively makes the app impossible to mute.

Stay in touch with your quaranteam ❤️ Great app! Videocalls and games in the middle. Fin for catching up and social distance drinking even. Could use improvements like extra add-on features. And kind of confusinf that when you swipe left you exit the room. Needs a tutorial(maybe there is but i didnt see?) haha still, really great ❤️

I have auto update off and didnt manually update this yet it still updated somehow. This makes me suspicious af about the app, its also just pretty lame in general, like airtime its extremely disappointing after seeing all the ads from people who got paid off to promote it. Its just basic video calling with games like draw.io so when you can just use a better version of video chatting like instagram or skype its pretty useless.

The video is smooth and the app is fairly easy to manage. Really annoyed it plays notification sounds when my phone is on vibrate AND I have all notifications through the app shut off. That means I have to sign out completely if I don't want to hear it. Would really like a fix for the sounds.

It's crazy because loads of people that we don't know are able to join the call but it's also quite fun with the games on house party but I don't like the fact that when u text someone on house party you can't unsend a message or see if they have read your text but in conclusion overall it's a nice way keep in contact with your friends during Quarantine.

When it asked for my phone number, and I wrote my number, it said that my phone number wasn't valid. I tried several time even deleted the app, downloaded it again, signed in again and it sill said it was not a valid phone number. I had the country where the phone number was from right too. With this would be fixed somehow, but the app still works regardless without having to put my phone number.

I have used this 3 times now and have really enjoyed it. I thought the connection was good and the video was clear. I like having the option of leaving the Room open or locking it so no one can come in. I'm sure I will be using it more during this Quarantine.

I use this app almost everyday and I normally have a good report for it but recently its been glitching a lot. I also cant tell when I wave at people which is a little fristrating becuase it would be so helpful if the hand moved when you wave at someone. Other than that it was a very good experience.

It's a fun way to chat and play games with family and friends. I like the games they offer, however it would be even better if there was a karaoke game/app or a way to at least play music (I tried using spotify but my friend could only hear me and not my music). What's a house party without music???

I love this app so much, I miss my friends and this is amazing to have to see all of them. I like the options that it has like ghost mode which means you won't be notified when someone enters the house or you can have one when people are in the house. The games are also fun, the app is also really easy to use.

I've been using it for a few years, and I love it. It's simplistic and easy to use. The quality is very good even over long distances and with iPhone to Android. I've tested it all. You can even have some fun with built-in games. I love this app and I think you will too while social distancing. Stay safe!

Their registration process is poor and email validation non-existent. Someone had already registered using my email and I was never notified of an account creation. I had to reset the password and change the profile settings.
Just keeps losing the connection, and takes several attempts to get back in, I don't have this problem with anything else I need connection for, disappointed, uninstalled !

It's a good app especially when u have a android and cant facetime with your friends but for me sometimes I cant see incoming calls from my friends and it get annoying sometimes but other than that I would recommend this app.

Just saw blue screens for most of the chat👎🏾 Also, couldn't hear people. Audio and video kept cutting in and out way too often. Some ppl had audio and no video and vice versa. So dissappointed, I haven't seen these people in over 90 days😩

There's a lot of negative reviews on this app so I was a bit apprehensive to try it, but it worked perfectly fine for me and my 3 friends. Audio and video quality were good and the games worked without issue. We all had a really fun time on it

Needs updating! Lags severely! Deletes on it's own have to keep downloading it to chat with friends. Games lag and are generally going to fast to even read with no options of slowing it down. Would be much better if these were addressed or at least if I dont have to download the app everytime I want to use it

Ever since the last update of this app I can no longer use it as it always has connection issues. I have no connection issues with any other app so it's a problem with this app alone. All of my people have all switched to zoom as we have no issues there.

The app its self is okay but I've had a few problems with it 1 being when I'm in a call of 3 we have alot of connection issues and breaks up alot. The app used to have games you needed to pay for, so I bought one (99¢) then, after a few months made all the games free and to this day they haven't paid the money back!

I love this app it is fun and it got me closer to my family and friends this is like a get together app manly because of the fun games but the whole reason why i gave it a 4 is because their is not much game creator of this appif you see this rraview please add more games two suggestions are guess who and uno i would like to see fun filters and screen sharing mode like messenger

It's super fun you can play games with your friends and webcam them at the same time. But I sometimes when more than 5 people join in it tends to lag or stop working. But other than that it's an awesome app:3

The ads. Evey app I use an ad for this app appears. I hate it. The stupid snapping and clapping song they use is making me more insane than the actual virus is. There is not a single app that doesn't have one of these ads. I am so sick and tired of these ads about this app in my face all the time. I can say with full confidence that these ads are more annoying than any facebook or Instagram ad I have ever had the displeasure of looking at. I sincerely hope this terrible app gets taken down.

Ok so it is overall a great app but I hate how u have to pay this game was made to cure your boredom not put a strain on my bank account also what about the ppl who can't afford to buy the other decks another thing is it drains my battery Hella fast I have to charge my phone twice a day when I used to charge it once...this is just my feedback now u have to decide if u are going to install or not

My friends hyped this app, but it doesn't appear to work well with androids. Having the biggest challenge with people seeing me and me seeing them even though camera is enabled and permissions were accepted. Seems to be a connection issue. May have worked like once after several failed attempts. 🤷🏼‍♂️

You really need to fix notifications. I really, really do not want it to play the tone when someone is in the house when my phone is set to silent/dnd. This is incredibly annoying and needs to be fixed asap.

Love this app! Especially during social distancing! Please consider adding more color choices in quick draw, and the ability to have teams in quick draw and heads up. Too many people talking at once. Hard to hear them.❤️

Can't get the video to work using the Chrome version. Using latest Chrome (80.0.3987.163) on a windows 8 i5 laptop. Have added the URL to the privacy / security settings and can use the camera in regular mode - any ideas? Not sending a video feed out or receiving one in. Have used the app on my iphone X and works well but would like it on a laptop due to screen size.

Worst video chatting app ever. Everytime I try to video chat with my friends, they always either drop or I don't see their faces, not because they covered sometimes, but because it never reached them, even if I am on my Wi-Fi. And this happens every day.

Zero stars not possible? Garbage app. Locks up on install, tells me I'm not eligible, doesn't allow you to fix. You have to uninstall and reinstall. Yes, let's waste data and time making the creator of a poorly designed app advertising money. To the designer, get bent. To potential users, don't bother.

I love this app, but there could be so much more. The game's repeat themselves quite a bit. It would be a much better app if the content was expanded and worked for android. Some of the games are missing wording on android.

Great app only things i would suggest is that the timmers on the games last longer as dont have enough time to read some of the trivia questions let alone answer them. And the rounds should be longer too add more questions ect as its very repetitive. New games like bingo would be a fun addition.

Used the app once. Couldn't see the houseparty guests' faces most of the time, just a blank screen. Cool concept if it worked better. Also, cannot delete account from Android even though they claim it's been fixed in the app. Emailed customer support and waiting to hear back.

Love it, but with all of what's going on, I think "We need to talk" on the Invite text should be changed. It sends a mixed message at first glance. How about, "Download this! We need to party" or something.

I really like this app, the only thing I would say is to get more questions for trivia and more things to draw for quick draw and things to guess for heads up, cuz it ends up repeating a lot of questions but other than that it's a great app
I always have to send the same message at least 3 times..I'll type my message, hit send, and it just deletes it instead..almost every time I send a message this happens! Drives me crazy!

definitely shares my info to other sites, I've gotten triple the spam messages since I downloaded it. Also it sends really loud notifications when a friend is online and there is seemingly no way to disable it, which is pretty annoying especially when I'm on silent mode!

I've seen other people with thier bitmojis as their profile picture but my version doesn't have the option to connect my bitmoji. When i click on my name, there's a just a blank White page with a loading indicator, but nothing ever loads...Just my name, a button to copy link, and a little blue symbol that looks like an arrow coming out of a box which also does nothing when you click on it.

This app is amazing because it let's you connect with your friends and family while playing fun games. It also is really fun because you get to them both at the same time! You get to FaceTime and play games! It is an amazing app.

I love this app so much, with the pandemic going on and social distancing, this has been super helpful and fun! Although it would be fun to have more games I am happy with this app. Great visual and audio quality.

This app is really great for just hanging out with friends. Its really easy to get running and plus, there is games that you can play with your friends that is pre-installed. Houseparty is a lot of fun and would 10/10 recommend.

It's good for communication with friends but sometimes it decides it wants to act stupid and break then u can't see ur friends list and everything like that so I don't like that part but overall it's a good app.
It is a good application, very interactive and very fun, but it becomes very bad when thinking about people who do not speak English, they should include more languages to improve the app

Facebook contacts loaded regardless if I wanted it..."you may know" stream is ridiculous, and the camera going on automatically is disturbing and I cannot control contacts and uncheck it. My face is the biggest screen and cant be switched around, don't want to see me, want to see my friends

I love this app u can call and talk to your friends in Quarantine u can also download it on phone and ipad its so good but the only thing is that any of the people u are friends with or the person u are calling if you dont lock the room they can get in also u can play really fun games with your friends i hope this helps u bye xx

It's an easy way to keep in contact with all your friends but Its very laggy and it drains my battery very quickly I was on ft with 7 of my friends on this app and my phone was on 92% half hour later my phone was on 20% but I also like the fact that you can have different options in games ect so 3 stars😁

The ads are absolutely obnoxious, had to listen those claps several times and had to wait for about 10 seconds on a blank screen to close it down. The app overall is mediocre, too many glitches and doesn't even allow me to show my camera
Its REALLY good to communicate with friends but however, if you have more than 2 people on a call i get connecttion issues. When its only 2 people on a call, the connection is perfect.

I love it. It's especially nice to use with a google phone and appliances. Leaving video messages on it is one of my favorite bits. Apple and Android phones can connect fairly well. I wish there was some sort of specific algorithm that flips the other person's view so they aren't sideways. It only happens when they have a older phone or weird model.

This is a really great app! I love that I still get to see my family while being quarantined! It has so many great features, and free! The only downsides I have are when there are multiple people in a video chat it cuts off part of someone's face. Also while I was in a call someone else called me so I dumbly picked up the phone and now the person is stuck in the group forever! I think you should add a function where the person who started the group can remove people. Thanks!

Duo is exceptional to use for video call needs. There hasn't been any issues with this app. It's a sure way to view the other caller and helps when missing loved ones. As far as video quality goes, it's clear like in actual real time as if u're looking in2 a sm. handheld tv/ or as if u c in2 another room. Video is optional too, so if your battery is low on phone or device then switch to voice only. The greatest thing about it is it's free and fast to downld. & isn't a space hog.

I love the app as it's a great way to stay in touch with family during this lockdown. However, I'm REALLY disappointed that we can't have a group call using Google Hub max, it only allows 2 devices. It works as a group of 3 or more on my phone and tablet, so why not the hub? That was the reason I bought the hub in the first place.

The picture quality is fine but today when I used it for a group calling, it can't connect with them so, now I have to walk to their house for my tution in this covid 19 outbreak with lockdown. The description said it could connect upto 12 people but I couldn't even there was only 8 people. (I came to know that as per my teacher).... :( :( :(

Hi team, The app interface is lively. Tried 1 on 1 call and it worked great!. However the group calling feature is not working unexpectedly. It simply doest connect when calling multiple people together and doest even time out. I was able to make a group for now. Can you please look into it or advice how can we use group calling effectively? Thanks Stay safe!

This is a nice and very convient app, especially now for staying in contact with friends and family during COVID-19. But more often than not the call is very choppy and glitches often. It is very diffucult setting up a meeting with multiple people. I would recommend this app to people with androids are samsungs who dont have facetime.

It's a very solid app when you are on a wifi connection. Wireless connection feels like it depends on your carrier. Use it video chat my lady every night. But there are time the camera freezes or the frames per second slows way down. Overall it's a way to keep in touch with those we care about

Does the job most of the time, but sometimes the video will drop or the call itself will freeze. My phone is not always fully charged but it is not necessarily empty either when it happens. I have very good Wi-Fi and my phone signal is great in my apartment, so I can't blame it on that either.

Truly a good app than other apps available in the market, where other apps have restrictions, least quality in video all that. However, I would like to bring to your attention on these items, 1.) Not able to remove the members from the group rather end up to create different groups for no use at all. 2.) Can introduce more number of participants to 20 or at least 15. Otherwise, I see your app is really a good app for group video calling.

The app is good to use on smartphones, but would be great if Google reconsidered to develop or modify the app to support Android TV's too. While the Zoom App supports all versions of TV's and WebCam cameras too, why can't Google develop app that supports all Android TV models and WebCams this helps communicating to Families with those staying away from them. This current situation of COVID-19 has put many countries and families under lockdown. It would be wonderful if Google considered. Thanks.

The best clarity and audeo. I just visited with my very active three year old grandson this way. He jumped on the couch while he whistled . There was no blurr or pause even very close up with fast action. Perfect sound . I am so gratified to have this contact with my beautiful family on both coasts with this great app. Thank you.

Very fun app! I love the option to leave a video message to a friend/group of friends and the ability to either call back or react with an emoji (or both!). The UI is a little bit confusing (had several friends start calls by mistake) however it seems like new features are added everyday. We just used the one to take pictures during a phone call.

The quality of the videos are very good and the app is just awesome! I am giving it four stars instead of five because when I want to record a video, the filters or effects don't appear at all or it takes at least ten to fifteen minutes for them to appear. Even when it does work, the quality of it is very bad but I am only talking about recording videos. In other ways, the app is excellent! It is good since I use it for online classes for tuition. I love it very much! It is awesome!🎉👍😍 💕 🎊

This is a very good app, the video quality is better than messenger. I also like that this is a more simplified app than messenger. My family and I love this app, it has been very useful in this quarantine. It doesn't freeze up in the middle of a conversation like messenger does.

It was quite good at first but recently I've personally stopped receiving notifications of the calls through this application on my OnePlus 6, also whoever I call doesn't receive any notification regarding the calls, I have checked it time and again with different devices inside my house, it still doesn't work out. Too bad for being a thingg of Google. Please make this work Google. This app will do wonder if it works just fine.

This app is great for anyone to use. It was a little difficult to setup. Once you do it for the first time you got it for any use to talk to anyone. This the only app for people who do not have facetime from facebook. Also, it is the only one that works with android phones. Thanks

Suggession: 1. There should be a provision to remove an added contact from the group created. Currently we have option to add contacts to the existing group but not to remove a contact. 2. If a group call is on and we need to have comment from a person not in the group, there should be a provision to call a person & join in the group discussion for that time only and not permantly adding in the group.

Hello I have been talking with my friends and for some reason it hangs us up by itself. Please fix that problem! Otherwise great app. I am on call right now and I made a group call and it keeps taking her out of call. Sometimes it gets very choppy or it has lag. And it has to reconnect way to much and we have the best internet you can get! Please fix ty!

Dear Google, I cannot find 'Moments' feature which, as support suggests, should be in setting but isn't. Is also restricted to US market only? This doesn't affect my review: Great app for video calls. Quality of video is better than other popular apps. However, text chat is practically absent in the app and there is no option to have video conference with multiple people; but you have other apps for that. Unfortunately, few people have it installed.

The only problem with this app is that when you have an account on the other phone and that phone have a duo, it will automatically log in on that phone, so thats why when somebody call you, it will also pop up on someones else phone,, hope you can fix these sir, you must prioritize the privacy, and also about rhe log in process, please fix the log in process.

awesome experience!! I was skeptical man I had tried video calls for the first time. But then, I was forced to use the app!! And let me tell you the future is now!! You can see the person's Expressions there's no hiding I mean the sound is a little bit to be desired but more than likely that's from the other side but on this side I Was Heard will and the video was consistent. Is has to be a safety issue though, behind you the world is their oyster.... Excellent purchase overall

Unable to login through this app. Tried all the potential solutions. But this app doesn't send the OTP request anymore. Duo on other mobile devices connected to same network are working good. All applications except Duo on my device too are working good. Edit: Tried all those solutions earlier. Still not working

It deleted my number from one of my friends side and on my side it keeps saying dialing and we have un-installed and re-installed this app 5 times and we are both over it......we have also been trying to see if its other things and some of the problems are from other things this is just an add on we are getting it fixed up now and have been trying to figure out the problem.

I love this app but I can't find effects or filters. My friends can do it but I can't. Things such as the purple cat,an astronaut, their face on a heart, them in the sea with jellyfish. How do I find that? When I click on the dots, I only see low light. No filters or effects. But other than that, I love this app. 👍🏻

Let me just say it is great for me. Similar to Skype, I just love it.. I have 3sons that live in different cities from me, and a 1 year old Grandson that ive yet to see, this app allows me to "visit and play" wirh him, visit my son and daughter in law whenever we want. My other son lives near them so I can talk with him also. Sometimes the other 2 find it to disruptive to just drop in (too bad I say) and don't answer or quickly text me back, but that's cool, my Mothers Day gift!

I give it 3 stars because as i was listening to my friend speaking it would every now an then break up,i could not understand what she was saying. I dont know if it is bad connection,but alot of interference,make loud buzzing sound too,other than that i really like the app but it still need more improvements. Thank you!

Video calls are great. I have disabled all notifications and I still get constant notifications that "so and so has Duo, call them!!". If this were 20 years ago and I received texts that a friend has a phone number so I should call them, I would hate that service as well. I can only assume they get these about me (and there's no way to turn that off).

The only thing i have a problem with is the quality. The quality on my phone camera is better than on duo. Ive tried re installing the app multipul times but it just wont get any better. And its only like that on my phone. I have the app on my laptop and tge quality is cristal clear.

I had the greatest time using this application. I spoke to my niece without a lot of breaking up or any kind of distracting images on the screen or anything for about an hour and only had a little bit of blurriness for my niece and I have to have our conversation. I really enjoyed the application and will and will continue to use it in the future.

When I use it for group calls lately we lose connection and have to dial in again. This is especially aggravating when it happens several times I'm a row. When I first started using it there were no problems, now it drops our group calls all the time after a few minutes all joined. What can be done to fix this?

Hey, The overall experience is good but I am not able to access the effects and filter feature. It is available on some smartphones and not on some... Why is that? Could you please rectify it, so that it is available on all type of smarrphones. Thanks.

I am a google fan through and through but why does this app not have the functionality yet to add multiple people to a video chat at a time. I shouldn't have to create a group first in order to talk to more than one person at a time. Come on Google! Facebook messaging, houseparty, and even FaceTime have the ability to do that and I doubt any of their developers are as good as Google. It's a sad day when Apple innovates before Google does. Get it together Google, it's 2020. #toughlove

Recipients cannot listen to my voice. It seems like there is no audio outgoing. However, I can listen to their voice. . Edit: Removed microphone listening to OK Google in Google Assistant and Duo is working again. . Wish there was a way to keep OK Google enabled too (using Android 10 on OnePlus 5T)

I like how it works great on cell-data and doesn't Need to have wifi service to work, like some other apps. It's hard to hear sometimes though even with the volume all the way up. Idk if that's an app issue or just means I get crappy phones. Overall I definitely recommend 😊

I think it's far superior to WhatsApp, FB Messenger and Skype. Also offers HD video calls which are clearly marked in top right corner. With others it's a bit of hit and miss. Also integration with android, especially with Samsung phones, is great!

I love this app! I'm able to video chat with my friends and family whether they/ I have iPhones or androids, and it almost always works great! The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because it does occasionally freeze up or get choppy to where I can't understand the other person or vice versa. It's been especially helpful during the Covid-19 quarantine, so that my kids and I can still get to see our loved ones while maintaining social distancing. Overall great app for video chatting!

My wife stays in a remote area with not good network. So far I've been doing video calls on Whatsapp but the video quality depends on the network strength mostly average and often hearing echo. Decided to try something and used Duo. I was very surprised at how good the video quality was throughout the day and with other cool features, I'm not going back. Wish I had used this earlier

The only thing that annoys me about the app is that when there are more than 4 people on the call, the windows keep switching up and down. It gets frustrating after sometime as you cannot concentrate on who ever is talking. Is there any way I can disable this fluctuations of the window screen?

I've been doing well with it so far. Just bought a new phone and see the duo but I have more of the people in my Duo. I haven't been able to get to them and it still tells me to open Duo even though I've opened it already. I did use the family group which only had two people and it was very clear. A lot clearer than my old phone.

This is a good messaging and video call app. Basic and straightforward. I like that about it. Sometimes the call is hard to answer if the app isn't in front. Also sometimes a call can be dropped, when another app sends notification. But my experience with this app is off grid, so I cannot say it isn't actually my connection. Overall good communication app.

I love duo but right now it's not working I have a note 9 and after a recent update it stop working rather I'm making or placing a video call it won't connect. I have uninstalled and force stop my wifi and network connection is good. I can send messages via duo but can't make a call or use the video. Also can't receive a call either. Please help so I can love my duo again. ☹️😢😥😭

App let's you talk to family face to face. Only problem I have encountered, there is a green flash on the screen slat random times, butni can live with that. All my sisters use the app as well so it is easier to stay connected.

It's very very good but it will be more good to fix some problems like(make the groups calls Voice call and video call not just video it's a very very good app it's better than WhatsApp in the video calls and voice calls I have one problem I tell it I wish you read this message and work on it Repley on me I'm sorry but I want to tell you just one problem the message when you make message it's not good I can't tell you how but make when you send message be like WhatsApp Thank you so much😊

It's fine for short calls, but it can't seem to support longer sessions. The video will cut out and freeze or the audio with become scratching and garbled. Often have difficulties talking to some of my clients but am forced to use this app by my company. Also the app isn't compatible with my tablet but won't tell me why it's not compatible, or how to fix it. Can't get any information on how to get it to work in a way that wont kill my phone/computer access.

It's an excellent little app that does exactly what you would want from a video calling tool. Very simple interface with minimal on screen interference. Great sound quality - excellent video quality - very simple and easy to use. You can talk with up to 12 people at a time, though I have not tried that yet, and upon completing the call it gives you an option to create a Duo hot link to that person on your desktop for easy redials.

I am convinced that the same design team that did Google+ designed this. There are only a handful of people that I can connect with and a lot of people that have "invite" by their names. And after having me at the other person invite each other, I still can't get their name into "Duo Contacts" and out of "Invite" limbo. Google, do you actually use your own product? ------------------ I tried your links. Still can't figure it out. So what your saying is, you don't want to design it to be easier to use like Zoom, Facebook, etc.? Got it.

Video calls have a very good quality, it's very simple to use, has some fun face filters, you can leave video messages to people and you get a wider variety of effects to use and edit your video message. One of the best video chat apps I've used. The knock knock feature is pretty cool, you can know who is calling you and see them before you answer! I hope they keep supporting and bringing new effects to the app.

We quilt together and have been using a competitor with really bad results. It kind of took all the fun out of our meetings. We blamed some of it on my poor Internet connection. Since we have been using duo all our calls are clear voice wise and picturewise. We are extremely happy with our new duo quilting.

Why can you switch from an audio call to a video call but you can't switch back or even turn off your camera? It's very annoying to switch to video for a temporary purpose but you can't switch back to audio only. You have to end the call and re-phone them. Seems like an oversight. Some more call controls within the call would be nice. Also from my video calling experience, WhatsApp is way more reliable. After awhile the video becomes so out of sync I end up switching to WhatsApp instead.

I am very pleased with how the new codec works. The video is better quality than either whatsapp or fb messenger, especially on a low quality internet connection. My only complaint is that I have to use a headset the other party can hear their voice back at them. This only happens with Duo, not with the other apps that I mentioned above.

During the Coronavirus and not being able to see my kids doing this video chat with them on Google Duo has been very entertaining and the quality and connection has been very good for me. I am able to save the videos that I have with my children in this time of need. Not being able to see them physically is hard on any parent.

Good, the voice to picture was off by 3seconds or so. A bit frustrating but worth seeing my loved one... bar none ♡ sorry I am still new, and I am dyslexic, so I don't understand 2 of the following questions? After I get more familiar with the App, I can sometimes figure out, what You are trying to ask(?) But so far no! However the 2nd Question, Yes it was in English. Thanks

The app is broken. Every time I use it it makes my phone heat up and my phone eventually shuts off due to overheating after about 15 minutes. and if that doesn't shut my phone off then the battery drains because I can't have a video call for longer than 20 minutes without the battery dying. Even if the phone is charging it still drains the battery faster than it can charge it. Please fix this app. Other companies have had this figured out for years.

Oh look, yet another calling app from Google. Hangouts wasn't good enough I guess. I started using Duo because it's the only one supported by the G. Home assistant... a disappointing state of affairs. For that, minus 1 star. Otherwise Duo works fine. Honestly, I just wanted to leave a snide comment before I uninstall. Edit: Bloatware, cannot remove! Minus one more star. Edit2: Thx for the advice, but it's pre-installed. It takes two parties to make a business deal like that, so my rating stands.

Rotating screen to see a larger view rotates display unlike other similar apps. Does not ring reliably. Does not show when the other parties phone actually starts ringing. Call quality good, but useless otherwise. Update: All bugs solved now. Works perfectly in my Android phone and PC. Updating stars.

Just discovered this app and found it to have exceptional quality. A girlfriend and I had so much fun with the animated features, it stii brings a smile to my face. Tonight, my experience was different and could only use the animated features while leaving a video message. Not sure why I could not access the animated features while on a video call?

Truly I don't think I can live without Google duos, but I must say there are some improvements I wish they would do. For starters when it's late at night, and you're talking to your significant other, about to go to bed, It would be nice if there was a way to hold down on the end button to get a silent end call option. The sound effects are very abrupt. Also screen sharing would be very handy! Like hangouts did...Otherwise call qualityA+, AI noise reduction for the background A+, Class leading!

Google Duo is a great choice for those with Samsung phones, who cant Facetime there Apple user friends. I never have had any problems with it. The only thing is that some of my friends with IPhones have the ability to use face filters during video calls, while I cant.

Easy to use! Great app. Only downside is that after a few minutes my video stops working. I can still here them & vice versa but can't see them. Hopefully they will fix that! App hasn't worked in about 2 months! When I call someone I can't see myself beforehand. If they answer it says trying to connect!

Recent updated does not allow me to use DUO without a phone number being verified. Was able to use on my old device with just wifi. Going to use Facebook Messenger or Instagram. Google is becoming less and less user friendly APPLE is really starting to look more appealing. "BEING FORCED TO MAKE THE SWITCH"

Works as well as I'd hope a video calling app would. No BS. It uses your phone number so there's no "figuring" out who to call. Pick up and go, that's all I want from it, and it works perfectly as exactly that.

The quality is top notch compared to many other video calling Apps. I have always liked it. Even when there's less connectivity, it doesn't disappoint you with quality or unnecessary buffering. If you are missing ur loved ones and want to see them all u want, this is a go to app.

I enjoyed hearing my godfather tell me in 1992 that this technology was going to be used on a daily basis. He was always on The Cutting Edge of Technology but I thought it was a stretch think that before I was wrinkly this would be a fad LOL. He soon after predicted that we would communicate via hologram I'm still waiting to see that come to life! That is your queue Google, don't forget to offer me a Beta Trial when you release it!?!

Good app. It would be great to be able to transfer calls from device to device. For example user A calls user B on the phone. User B answers on phone but wishes to take call at laptop. User B opens Duo webpage and clicks on button to transfer call from phone to laptop. Apart from that, I can't think of much else this app can improve on. Very good functionally.

The quality can be 50/50. Sometimes the audio is good and the video is bad or vice versa. They need to do more updates in order to fix the quality of the videos. I could have good reception and the caller could have good reception, but the quality is still bad. I gave it three stars because at least I can still connect and somewhat see and speak to whomever I call. It's like flipping a coin, sometimes it's good, sometimes it's not.

Nokia 7.1: My voice is not heard on both voice and video calls as well as voice and video messages. I can hear my voice on recorded and sent messages but my recipients can't hear a word. From your forum, this is a widespread issue affecting those that recently upgraded to Android 10 on the device, so your recommendation below doesn't help. Fix this!

Great useful app. Clear audio and video. Not any hitches so far. We have lots of fun using it. Only downside is my One+ gets all the effects while the hub's Samsung A50 gets none. Why is that?? Otherwise would have given 5*. Still recommend especially during this crisis.

It's hit or miss with this app sometimes it works well but most of the time there's issues to the point it freezes or you just see a blob for a person. Keep at it you might get it right one day but you're not there yet....

This app is ok. I'm still going to use it... but it has a few problems😧. First: it send video messages very slow. I don't send videos that much to people, but when someone tries to send me a video the screen says loading but it never loads😣. Secondly: the face time calls glitch alot and it's so annoying😫. And it also tends to freeze. When I try to face time someone the screen freezes or glitches and I have to send the call. Overall it not that bad of an app.

Video works great. Unfortunately, it does not enable speakerphone so you cannot hear the other person and need to hold it up to your ear (like a phone call). This has been tested on a Pixel 2 XL, Pixel 3A XL and Pixel 4 XL. It worked one time (speakerphone engagement) with a Pixel 4 XL when a disconnect and a reconnect was done, but not at any of the other times that it was tested. Please sort this bug out. Thank you.

When I'm in the middle of a video call for some reason the picture on my end goes funky. What the hell is up with that. That is really messed up in my opinion! The people of this app need to really improve their app Literally! It has good quality pictures, but needs a lot of improvements.

Great call quality. Not a problem with that. My biggest problem is that it takes up TONS of data EVEN WHEN YOU'RE ON WIFI. I realize you can turn your data off, but still. I think that's a poor feature, I ran out of data a couple of times before I realized Duo was using my data. Other than that it's great.

So this app is not that bad! Pretty cool idea and all, but unfortunately Duo literally drains your battery completely! And the phone call quality isn't that great, but at the same time, FaceTime isn't that great either. Overall, I'd say this is a good app, but not the greatest. Would love to see some improvements in quality.

Love this!! Especially during this social distancing time. Though I have had the app for years I recently started using it daily for family that's far away. Always clear picture and audio. Minimal freezing. Nice animated stamps and emojis for my daughter who likes to leave her family messages! It would be nice to get a couple games on there like the OLD Tango! That would take it to the next level but am happy with this app to date.

I had video calling on my phone through my provider and it is always disconnecting the video call and going to voice call so it's never a great connection but with this app I never have a problem. I do love the clarity and the consistency in keeping the video call going. I am very pleased with this app & hope to learn more of features it offers. Thank you!

The development seems to be getting great, new features been added constantly, but there is one thing entirely missing that is available in other video apps: once you start a group video call you can't invite more people to join in, which is frustrating, you would have to drop the entire group call just to add someone new.

We are a married couple, that knows computers, but have never used any of these video face to face calls. We have been able to use Duo without problems, it is so easy. But just try to get a doctor's office to make life simple and just call us on Duo ... No they want you to use some new untested app, or their own in-house face to face that is built into their system. We have had doctor's just give up on trying to have an appointment with them because our phone will not work with the app they use

Quality is great, audio is better than anything I've ever used. However there are no options to do anything once in a call (no camera on/off button, no add people to the call) the only way to add people into the call is to create a group and then call afterwards. It's really bad 😒. Idk how google could have released this.

I'm so glad to have added Duo for video calling. The quality of the picture was excellent, however the voice/speaker drops off occassionally. Maybe because I moved the tablet during our videocall call. During these difficult times of seperation (Covid-19) from families etc, Google Duo definitely plugged that void and allowed my family to communicate effectively and draw a lot of comfort. I definitely recommend Duo :-)

This app lags, and half the time, me and my friend can't FaceTime I am so upset with that, because this is really the only app we can use because I have and Android, and she has a iPhone. The app crashes so much. I can't even open the app half the time, and the notifications come late, it doesn't load, and me and my friend spend 30 minutes just trying to get it to work before we give up. Try to find a different app, that's what I suggest.

Like, but sometimes when I make a call, it isn't soon after that a strange number will try calling or texting me that I tried calling them and they don't know me. I only call 2 people on this, so I'm not sure what's going on. A glitch maybe? I'd hate for a stranger to be able to look in on me. 😬

We used it when we went out of state to call and see our non verbal special needs son and our friend who stayed with him. Also now with the stay at home orders and COVID19 going on my son really misses our friend and her kids so this is very useful. He gets to SEE their faces and HEAR their voices, very cool. He smiles, touches the cell when their faces change pics and they talk to him. Google Duo is a life saver someone throws you when your drowning. I love it and thank you Google.

Just started using this with one of my girlfriends. It's video quality is good 95 percent of the time. Only loses quality when there is a lot of moving around by one of us. First call was awkward, but now it's like we're in the same room together. Think we talked for way over an hour tonight. Feel a little guilty for using so much bandwidth, but couldn't be as bad as streaming a movie, could it? Anyway will keep using it unless I find out.

I have been trying to update this past 2 days still goes through at least 20 times and it still comes up as I need a update I don't use this feature way I see it anymore from all Google products if you don't go through anymore when I update the first time am not going to update tired of all your updates and it takes forever to do

With due respect I want to inform that I am facing a problem that when I create a group in Google Duo and I want to remove some members from this group but there is no option of such action. So kindly resolve this issue by adding "Remove member" option in the group setting of Google Duo. Thank you.

I think this app has alot of bugs but it is an amazing way to be able to talk to my friends, family, and boyfriend during this whole corona outbreak. It gets glitchy usually but the call quality has been very good lately I dont know if the bugs were fixed or what but I love this app and i think other people would enjoy it too!

Very good app but: 1- I can't add people to the call until I end the call and start a new one. 2- There is no group voice chat. 3- I can't cast my screen during the call. 4- The call is ended when I close my apps tabs. 5- I can't turn on and off camera the during call. You have to work on these features to get number #1.

I've been using video chatting/conferencing tools for years now as I live on the other side of Canada from family and Duo is definitely the best all around performance as far as the feature. I love that the app focuses on what's important instead of a bunch of useless features. The video is usually the most stable even when I'm using it while on roaming data in the US. I hope google continues to invest in it, if there was a way to integrate it somehow with messenger it could rival WhatsApp

Excellent video and phone conferencing. But limited in-chat options. No option to turn off camera during the video call on this android version. No option to show a default image instead of life image. Contact list is not organized. It shows all ur google contacts. It can't just show phont contacts only. It shows people who don't have the app to invite !!! Those should be on a separate list. All the drawbacks, which are major, yet good streaming.

Overall, I LOVE this app! There are some calls (in-between calls) where the quality is meeeh:/ but MOST of the time, I have NO COMPLAINTS!!:))) THANK YOU GOOGLE DUO FOR ALLOWING ME TO STAY CONNECTED VIA PHONE(VIDEO CHAT) WITH A WHOLE BUNCH OF MY FAMILY!!! GOD BLESS YOU ALL!!! GOD BLESS US ALL, ALWAYS!!! GOD IS GOOD, ALL THE TIME!!! ALL THE TIME, GOD IS GOOD!!!2800 YEE!

This is an amazing app especially being that I am team android. A great way to communicate with loved ones during this covid 19. I don't know how to inform someone I'll call them back if a voice call comes in. I don't think it's possible. They simply get disconnected. But the service is great. Thank you!!!

I have one problem with this it echoes a lot and I have no idea why it makes it so loud I can't even hear and most of the time I just go ahead and don't even talk to my friends but it is good in the Forum playing with my friends or talking to them and stressful time but just keep going getting messed up you can talk to your friends

In rhe short time I have used Duo with my family, I have found the experience to be a lot of fun. I have also used Duo in a teleconference with a professional during the Coronavirus stay at home 'era' and found the quality of the video and audio to be very good. The program has worked well for me and I am looking forward to adding more contacts soon.

Doesn't work. When I do verification, I type in phone number. I don't get a 4 number code in my messages! I get a HUGE message that looked like an error. April 2020 Update: Well, as of a few months ago, I'm finally able to open up my photo via my home feed and/or news feed without it "freezing" anymore. Now there is a new issue. I can see some of my pictures in an album with 80ish photos. I could scroll down maybe roughly 15 pictures then i get the spinning icon letting me know it's trying to load the next pictures, but it's really not. I have tried to test this on other android phones I have and they're at acting the same way. Now I try to look at the album using my iPhone and that works just fine. I'm leaning more and more towards iPhone now just because of how buggy these android apps are and bloatwares. Another thing, Facebook's new algorithm on who it thinks should see your posts is terrible. Only a fraction of my friends and family are seeing my posts now because your algorithm doesn't want to "spam" people with posts it thinks people wont want to see; meaning my posts. THENNNN you guys shove a bunch of paid ads into our faces instead?? 2019 Reveiw: After digging deep into the phone clearing out so much data and cached files, testing it with other phones, and etc, I have finally found the answer.. It was the Android Facebook update. Clicking a picture from my news feed that has multiple pictures kind of freezes the app. You can press the back button on the Android phone to unfreeze it. The average person that clicks on my picture via their home feed would probably think their app is frozen and close it out then open up again then wouldn't see my new posts with my travel pics anymore on their news feed since it was already shown on their feed. I have confirmed this is the case only with Androids so far testing it on 5 Androids unsuccessfully looking at my albums via the feed. iPhone users still can view photos via the feed, though. I do see another recent review saying the same thing. The work around for this, which I know people wont do unless they really like you or know you, would be to go to my the person's page, click on Photos, then choose that specific album they want to see. Sorry for the giant wall of text of a review. Google kills the format and shoves it into a giant block of a review.

I hope eventually a way to turn this off is implemented or it is just changed back.

I love the app and all since I use it to text my friend and been using it for about 2 years now,but your recent update has annoyed many users and im one of them,please change the text box and everything on ipad back to normal with normal slides,it's very annoying for ipad users and it just doesn't look good in general. Please bring it back ASAP!

Discord is awesome! I love that I get to FaceTime and video call my online friends! Discord is super useful if you don't want to give away your other social medias, but you want to talk to your friends. I have soooo many friends on Discord because nobody has any other social medias they feel comfortable sharing, and that's okay! Practically everyone has Discord, I 100% recommend it!

This app is great and all but the problems i keep having are the call and keep losing connection. Whenever i'm in a middle of a conversation with a friend, it keeps disconnecting for no reason. And when i join the call, sometimes it freezes. I do hope this bug will be fixed soon, it annoys me a lot.

App does.it's job however the recent UI changes made it a pain to use. More than once had I typed out a message just to notice that the send button isn't there. Trying to send something from the gallery has become annoying, as the gallery button will jump to the bottom of the screen when opening the dialog for it. The "keyboard swapping" animation when entering emoji-mode is also wasting my time.

Yeah discord is an awesome gaming and chatting app and it have always been my favourite, but ever since the last update and it hasn't really been working well for me as a tablet user as the big textures on my screen gets a bit laggy and the controls doesn't feel so comfortable like they used to. I love discord but I'm having a HUGE issue with mobile voice calling at the moment. It seems since some recent update whenever I go on my phone to vc, I cannot hear the other person or see their icon light up green when they are supposedly talking. They can hear me just fine though.it used to be fixable with back and forth one of us leaves and joins the call until it works but even that has stopped working and I will not put my true rating for the app until this bug is fixed that ruins the app.

Everytime I use discord to talk with a friend in a private call my microphone cuts out like it appears green light for them but they can't hear me whatsoever. It also doesn't allow me hearing them anymore either. The solution to this is simply rejoining the call but this is an issue that keeps persisting recently maybe because of an update. I enjoy long hour calls but when it cuts out a lot it's not really enjoyable especially while we're gaming.

This app is amazing and I really like it as it makes long distance communication easy and fun! Since I like this program I lot I wanted to support the creators by buying discord nitro; but unfortunately the only credit I have is phone credit, as I am not able to pay for it by PayPal or Google Pay. That is why I put only 4 stars, but if you add an option to pay with nitro with phone credit I'd be more happy to raise the eating and but nitro.

I love and use discord every day and I have been a nitro subscriber since the start. I have never been unhappy with it until now. the update crams two icons for photo or files in the same row as the text input and it's utterly hideous and I end up tapping things I don't mean to, it's clunky as hell. I actually left the beta JUST TO GET RID OF IT as that was the only solution multiple people in the beta feedback suggested to get a workable version of the app. I beg to make it optional at least.

This app is the best thing that had happened to me. But with the new moble UI, the colors for the bar are off-putting and the white circle is harder on the eyes. Secondly, the upload button being cut into two is just... pointless. I have seen many other users saying the same things, and I hope you listen to them. Please, bring back the old UI. Or at least have an option to use the old UI.

It's a good app, overall. The downtimes aren't too often, but are tolerable. However, the latest update 16.3(?), has completely voided this. One of the reasons Discord is so useful is due to the simple layout. On mobile, you have changed the typing area. This is far too uncomfortable. The small + sign worked perfect, with how it brought up the pictures first. With how the icons are positioned now, hitting the camera option has occured too much. Please fix this, or make an update for the previous

The current version is lovely, but it refuses to send me push notifications with sound on my Google Pixel 2xL. I've tried all different combinations of settings, checked and made sure it had the permissions. The sound just doesn't work for notifications and that's more annoying than anything.

Developers of Discord why is the text box white and why are the words I type a grey so light that you can't see it because of the white text box. I also agree with previous complaints made as well. But I'm more concerned about my eyesight as I try to read the words I type out. At least put that back to normal or make typed words black or a darker grey that can been seen properly. The words are black in light mode but light mode is ugly so that is not a solution. Please fix this ASAP, I beg you.

The app itself is fantastic!!! Love the design and infastructure. I use this for all my gaming and role-playing. However as of late there have been a couple of design choices made by the developers that have completely turned me off. The chat box used to be sleek and square like the rest of the app. They have recently changed this to be an intrusive dark oval that sits in the bottom of your screen, which by the way does not match anything in the app. Please revert this!!

I've had discord for about years, and it never dissapoints. Even going as far as to give out bigger call-rooms amid the coronavirus. Definetly giving it a 5 star for the 5 years I've spent on it. Only complaint about the app is the newer chat bubble, it seems to be lagging me slightly. Wouldn't mind an update could fix that. Thanks!

Pretty good app that gets the job done if you're not on PC. However, I'm really not a fan of the new update. The message typing box clashes with the usual Discord look and feel, and the little drawer on the side for sharing media? Clunky and annoying. And I'm not sure why, but it's very buggy on my other phone, my HTC One. I can't see the text I'm typing *at all*. It's practically white-on-white, so I have no choice but to invert my device's screen colors to be able to see what I'm saying. :\

For some reason, when the app updated, I have started noticing issues, much like a lot of people are. First and most concerning is the Add Friend button...its vanished! I cant add friends anymore and I have no clue why. Second, all the text is smaller and harder to see. There have been problems with night mode and visibility with some name tags as well. And as another person complained, the drawer slider to add photos and stuff is janky and funky... TLDR; if it ain't broke, Discord, leave it be.

I don't get it, when the app was like desktop version it was fine, easier to see online, offline friends and friend requests in separate columns, now they're all together it's kind of annoying Especially trying to find a offline friend you can't remember the name of, I can't even add people by typing their id because there's no add people button, format looked way better in the old version idk why they changed it to this one I miss when the mobile app was the mini desktop version lol

I've been using dicord for a few years now, and the text box is something of a familiar face to me. However, after the new update the change brought out a panic in me. I saw nothing wrong with it, but now I cannot recognize it at all and it legitimately bothers me. The rounded edges do not spark joy, nor does the little tab that allows you to send photos. The previous design was much easier to follow, if anything please have an option for one to switch between the old and new boxes. That is all.

I love using Discord and have been using it for awhile. I'd give it a full 5 star rating, but won't. Reason being is because pictures refuse to load. Really great on desktop. Absolutely never actually pushes notifications on my phone, even with all of the notification settings active, and being logged out everywhere else. Theres no reason I should constantly have this problem, but it pops up every other month and is really starting to piss me off.

I really enjoyed using the Discord application for talking with friends and playing games. I recently had my account disabled without reason. It's fair if I've done something wrong (which I don't believe I had), but it is unfair to refuse explanation. Please help me reinstate my account or at least elaborate on the issue.

I enjoy the app a lot. It's fun being able to chat with many people on many servers. Wonderful way to handle communications for specific chat circles. with both text and voice chat options, and an insanely deep level of potential customization. The closest I will ever get to social networking, since unlike facebook, this app is exactly as advertised, and has almost none of the downsides of the social networks.

This app is very good but it comes with problems. Whenever I go on a voice channel or call, my friends are complaining that they cannot hear me.
