I am surprised that calm takes an yearly subscription instead of monthly. I am not sure how i missed this information. I am pretty sure cost provided was monthly before subscription and I went ahead with subscription only identifying later that I have been charged for full year.

Just increased my anxiety level by 10 found out it's not a free app and found more problems as I read now don't know if I paid for or not and no way to cancel if I did pay. No X i could find to cancel and it says I still pay even if I Uninstalled the app. Help me get out of here!

I like it more than Headspace. Some great content, but more and more is being set behind a pay wall. There's free access to a delightful sleep story read by Steven Fry. If you're interested long term prepare to buy the full version.

I'm upset because when ever i put timer for specific hours but after 10 to 20 mimuts the music keep turning off automatically. This caused me to wakeup and replay it several times. Then i turned off the timer mode and i turned on the music repeat mode but the things keep happening in the same way. Dashed my hope.

I LOVE this APP!!! I cannot get over how amazing this app is!! I only youse the sounds right now. There is so, so much more to this app! I hope I can figure out more! Im fourty and thats right in there where I did not have a computer when others knew all this knowlege about computers and I was just trying to stay afloat. This is one of those apps that you should put your all into it!! It turns around and gives you twenty back!!

Tried serveral ways to cancel my subscription and was not successful. Went to google playstore cancelled but gave a cancel date of May 7th 2020 and today is April 28th it looks is they are going to charge me the $69.95 for the year so I'm not sure what's going on. I don't like a business that I can't find a telephone number to call to speak in person

This app is nothing more than a financial scam. They lure you in by advertising that they are the top of the line in their field. What they don't tell you is that if you want the full experience it will cost you $70 a year. I have found better apps than CALM and they are free! Watch it people, don't get scammed like I did. Also, those who leave a 1* rating because of the ludicrous fees they will give you the same cookie cutter auto reply. How pathetic. Uninstalled.

Good app I am from brazil and I worried a bit it would be a bit hard to use it since portuguese is my native language but english used was easy and the instructions to relax were plain and i immediately tune. it relaxed me a lot to listen to the woman and the water stream on the background while she direted me to relax. i recommend it.

To be honest I could hardly enjoy it. I was going off of it on a free account and I could hardly do anything, it really shouldn't be in the free section cause you have to pay for everything really. I'm quite disappointed. I can tell the app has potential but, I was not able to experience it in full.

I've participated in other meditation apps with significantly less I could use on a daily basis to remain calm and unstressed during my day. Calm is the best meditation app I've applied to me personally. I highly recommend this app to those who are aware they need to implement calming influences into their lives

when I first downloaded the app so much more was free before it became so popular on flights and airports I wish there were more free options especially during this covid19 time. apple store as nearly No free options, glad I have an android for personal use. iphone/ipadl/mac book for work.

I got sucked into 7 day trial. I knew there was a catch that I would be charged after 7 day free trial and backed out before authorizing anything. Instead it moved me forward when I was backing out if it. I feel I got sucked into something I didn't want and authorize.

This app is great for sleep and for meditation. However, I wish there was an option for the waves that I have to play while I'm doing other things or while my phone is off. It fulfills it's purposes though, and I love it!

The only downside that i was not made aware of is that 95% of the content is behind a paylock. A lot of the meditations, while great, are made so only the first meditation is available, and you have to have premium for the rest. Other than that, its a great app

An awesome site. I have found peace and serenity and calmness I never new. I have even introduced my mom to this method of relaxation and she has found sleep. I have learned to take a deep breathe first before I react to my child. Best site ever!!

This has a few cool things but its definitely not worth money. The amount of content they have is minuscule at best. Your better of going with some of the free apps. They have more content to choose from then Calm.

Generally, I like the app but I'm having trouble navigating the cards. Contacted help and they just kept saying I have access but somehow they can't give me simple directions to access them so I can have a different weekly focus.

this app really has helped me to stay focus and to help me wind down when I've had a long day. I have really bad anxiety and I've tried other apps to help me with that.. no app has been able to do this but CALM. So glad I've found this app and can't wait to explore more that comes with.

The description shows all kinds of sleep stories and songs to help you sleep. What is doesn't tell you is most of it is part od a $70 subscription. The only thing that is part of the free app is the white or ambient noise. Uninstalling.

This is an awesome app to help you fall asleep with! It has about 10 differnt choices of music, stories, more music and so on. This helps me get to sleep easily and it makes me feel so relaxed. I love it so much! You should try it!

This app really helped me fall asleep and stay asleep, I always had trouble sleeping and staying asleep. But $80(or whatever it is) is just to expensive for me that is to much. I would have use it much more if I could afford it
The audio issue is back again. The app will randomly stop playing the music and I have to click to start it up again. I use it on a daily basis; music @ work & to wind down @ night.

Options too limited on Free mode. I totally understand the need to upsell within the app by showing options that you can only unlock when you have Premium. But when *most* of the content there aren't usable, it really beats the purpose.

I absolutely love it bc it helps me with the very bad nerves and anxiety that I suffer with daily. However I do wish there were a few more free items but other than that it's a 5 start app All the way and I do not give 5 stars lightly.

Love the variety, accessibility and approachability of the workouts. The narration is super helpful in reminding me to breathe or knowing how to adjust and correct my form or posture. You can filter based on time, intensity, equipment (or lack thereof) or focus of your workout. I've never worked out consistently before, but using this has helped me to stick with it, even if I'm only capable of working out for 7 mins. Been using it for a month now.

For the most part apps work great on my phone, workouts are easy to follow but requires frequent stopping because you can't always look at your phone. Hence Chromecast support would be an added welcome so that I can cast the workouts on a TV. It's been wonderful to have free workouts, I will likely become a paying customers if some more thoughts are given to the functionality and ease of use of the app.

Great exercises, but the plan is just too buggy for my liking. It's not possible to adapt the plan for your schedule either. If I take a recovery day when I'm supposed to exercise then the plan keeps going ahead without me. It's not a big deal, but it's so easily fixable if they just bothered to do it.

This is a brilliant app for fitness. I have been using it for over 2 months and the results are amazing. I have lost a lot of stubborn belly fat, lost weight without any specific diet control, increased core strength, developed muscles and am Going to get a lean body very soon. Must have app for anybody who wants to get fitter, stronger and leaner. And the best part, everything is free. So just download and get set on your way to amazing fitness.

Amazing app and I really like it. However, I have some recommendations for better user experience. First of all, there are no widgets available for my phone. A widget to keep track of the plan I follow would be nice. Also, editing the plans by adding the workouts of your own choice and indicating the injuries you have, so the plan could be more doable, would be great. Thanks in advance for considering these points!

The app logged me out and stopped working for me because I can no longer sign in. It shows this error over and over all day today when I try login: "We are unable to connect to our servers right now. Please try again later." It's a shame cause I really enjoyed the app otherwise. I reinstalled the app and even tried to reboot my phone, but it didn't help. You let me down, Nike :(

The workouts are very challenging and there is a good variety of workouts to choose from.Unfortunately, the app either freezes up once opened and then crashes, or the workouts start to play but then I get the grey screen and nothing else. I tried on two different devices, a tablet and android phone with one of the results I mentioned above. I keep trying to get this to work, but I am ready to stop trying at this point. It's frustrating. My low rating is based solely on the functionality. The trainers and workouts are great, if I can only get to do them!

On one hand Nike talks about the free premium to help during the pandemic and on the other hand, it makes it absolutely impossible for the app to use it. Lots of good content but plethora of technical issues (seems purposeful in this age) in the app which kills so much time and discourage fitness! App keeps hanging! Screen sharing doesn't work, Nike expect users to exercise with the phone!!! Saved Premium content keeps getting removed. Guys - look beyond the bottom line in these troubled times!

It's a demanding coach of an app, but one thing that annoys me is that the "update schedule" function messes up the week and recovery days. An example: I just finished 3 days in a row, and was looking forward to my recovery day tomorrow. The app days after today's workout that it wants to update, and I press yes! Then it changes my recovery day to TODAY even though it perfect well knows I just completed a workout 2 minutes ago, and definitely is not on a recovery day..

It's very good. It's great as it's all rounded. You can choose Strength orientated workouts or cardio. It's more I'd say orientated towards people that want the lean athletic look. If you want pure strength or size, go elsewhere. Only criticism is that the cardio drills are very "knee" lower body orientated, and all a little too short. I'd prefer more 30-40 Mon ones too. Maybe add some new bodyweight cardio moves, like kick-throughs, reverse Burpees, thrusters,.. but other than that awesome👌

Was going to give 2/5 buy +1 because they offer premium free. I like the workout but i dont like the format or app. They dont show time per set for the timed one. Sometimes instructors talk too much more than i prefer but i cant mute it because thats the only way i know the time. Second, and the most annoying part, it doesnt pre load. It keeps pausing in the middle. That sucsk when you are doing workout. I will stick with YouTube.

I've just started trying to use it and really appreciate the free content during quarantine. However, the only way I found exercise programs usable at home is by using my TV and unfortunately, the screen mirroring/casting with NTC simply is way too glitchy to be usable. It's really hard for me to look at my phone during these more dynamic programs.

The workout gets disturbed and starts malfunctioning when paused or skipped any particular exercise or even of we repeat some exercise. This really breaks the momentum and gets you out of the workout. But if this issue is fixed the app is very good and the workout plans given are the best. I would have given it a 5 star rating except for that issue because it defeats the purpose of the app.

I have a premium subscription. The trainers and workouts are wonderful. The best that I've seen of any of these workout apps, in fact. The biggest problem I have is NTC PREMIUM content can't be cast to chromecast. I'd love to have the ability to cast the workouts with the trainers to my TV instead of my small phone screen. It's a built in feature for many of the other workout apps, I'm not sure why Nike doesn't allow it. If they were to fix that issue, the app would be the best on the market.

It was buggy before but after the new update i haven't faced annoying app issues otherwise the app is great, loads of exercises for free.. You can set up a plan n go for it. But there is a lot more that can be added in the app and it can be best app ever for fitness.

The app has great workouts but it often freezes, or the timer and visuals will stop mid workout. This is very irritating especially in the middle of a cardio workout. Not only that, but when this happens the time doesn't register with my tracking system. I've even tried removing and reinstalling the app and the problem persists. I'm glad this is happening during the free premium period. I'd be even more upset if I were paying and this happened. I'm used quality from Nike this is disappointing.

LOVE the workouts and the fact that it creates a personalized plan for me. LOVE that it's free right now. Don't love that it's super buggy (just lost a bunch of workouts when I updated my plan). I'm also confused about the friends feature. I can add friends but there's literally no data or functionality related to it so it's completely pointless. I would gladly pay for this app if the bugs were worked out. Here's hoping!

I love the app. It offers a challenge, it's easy to pick exercises, it is diverse, but the one thing that completely ruins it is the updating of the plan. The app offered the updated plan to me on its own based on how much and how hard I worked out, so I updated it because exercises were getting easy. Now the whole plan consists of recovery days. Are you kidding me? I don't mind picking the exercises myself, but it really, REALLY pisses me off. FIX this.

It is a nice, but very-very buggy app. One time I've updated my work out plan because the app suggested me to do it, but my plan changed only to recovery days... But it's ok, because I can get my workouts. But now it doesn't work, just infinite loading. That's very sad.

I like the app, even though it's missing some stuff I want from an exercise app, after one month: Let me ban exercises please (I can't do side planks because of fracture I've had and having to get up off the floor whenever they come up is a pain) Add a startup timer to the rep based workouts (On timed workouts you have 5 or 6 seconds to get in position, not having that on rep workouts makes stretching very annoying because it takes time to get into position) Otherwise great app.

Content is great, but can't say the same for the app. Complicated, confusing, chromecast does not work, casting my screen does, but the audio is disrupted. Syncing with Nike Run, doesn't work well. And more!

Hi I just found out this app recently, and I'm a bit frustrated that I did not find it sooner! I've wasted a lot of money just trying different apps with their premium offer. This is the only real Premium app! Totally Free but getting Premium Experience much more better from those eating money apps. Definitely 5+ Star on this. It will help people like me who's trying to get get fit and live a better life. Thank you for this! Request for next update. Filtering option on saved workouts Thank you!

Overall the app is excellent - The workout sessions are well curated and really helpful. The personalized recommendations are good too. Would have been 5 stars if not the problem faced recently: I have opted for the 4 week Bodyweight only plan. The plan worked pretty smooth for the first two weeks, but starting week 3, it updates daily and makes 4-5 days Recovery Days, which should not be the case. Please fix this issue.

Good exercise library, Casting is barely usable. really bad app. I believe nobody can understand why a company like Nike cannot afford a decent group of developers to create a really useful app. I was planning to pay for premium, but what for? App freezes while casting at home page, and on every premium content. Randomly freezes on regular exercises... You cannot exercise on a small phone screen while doing instructed training...

I enjoy using this app and have been using since 2017. But now I keep getting this message "Unfortunately we can't connect to our servers..." and I can't log in. This is very upsetting. Reinstallation of the app had no effect as well as clearing cash. What do you recommend?

Feed section does not show any stories. Says "it can not connect" and "try again later". Updates on plans do not always happen smoothly, sometimes the workout scheduled for the day of the update is erased when you update. Apart from that great workouts, wonderfull app for indoors training.

I always come back to this app! No matter the time of year or what my current goals are, this app has something to offer me. Even if I only have 10 minutes to fit in a serious burner workout, NTC is there! These workouts vary from easy to hard and you don't need any equipment. The app gives easy to follow instructions as you go along. I can't recommend this app enough.

Great content with the workouts however I'd like to see more variety and more workouts using one type of equipment, barbells, dumbbells and even weight plates. The app itself is very buggy, sometimes when you start to play a workout it will just show a grey screen, when you do a run that is scheduled in a plan and record through the NRC app it doesn't register on the NTC app. I'm currently on a plan and the app will notify me of a workout that is coming up but was intact from the day before.

This is a very buggy app, especially when you create a workout plan. It often does not record workouts that I've done, constantly needs to update my workout plan and ends up resetting my progress. I like the workouts but the app needs to be improved. What exactly is the point of adding friends on this app?? It literally offers no features or actions.

The workouts are great but the daily updates to the plan are extremely annoying and only add confusion. They're useless. What's the point of marking last Tuesday as a recovery day if I know that I did a workout that day? Why daily changes to the plan? Why show double entries on some days - a fake entry according to the new plan and the real entry according to reality? A single weekly plan change can be valuable if they hire a real product designer who knows how to create an intuitive layout.

I would like to add more stars to this app 'cause workouts here are really cool but today i couldn't even open it! There were green screen only and that's all. I restarted my phone but there were no any result. Hiw could it be??? And I agree with other comments about strange often updates of ur plan.

Have been signed up for gym, on and off for 3 years but never got the results I wanted. Now with Corona and everyone locked up, I got some cheap equipment and using this app. And it helps me do thing at my pace and (at my place!), but more importantly, with correct form (the videos really do help).

The content in the app is great but too many bugs. Especially audio bugs: the instructions are missing half the sentence, will randomly change the volume of the phone which makes that I miss the signal to change exercise, get beeps or simply get my ears raped by maximum volume! Also asking me if I want to update my plan everytime I open the app...

Fantastic workouts and training programmes. Would easily get 5 stars if it didn't freeze every 30 seconds. Tried to do a quick 15 min workout, spent 30 mins going in and out of the app and it would just freeze. So disappointing

I love their workouts and I love that premium it's free during these difficult times. However it's a deal breaker for me that it is not compatible with Chromecast. It's not easy to watch a little screen while working out. Tried on Apple and Android and it not only crashes the app, my phone would freeze afterwards.

The app is very confusing I have experiences tons of problems with communication between this app and the running one, loads of glitches it even got to the point where the calendar of my workout plan got all messed up and the phone was always a day late and confusing my workouts. I called costumer service and they could never help me, they only acknowledged the existence of the problems saying they couldn't do anything about it. A CONSTANT PROBLEM. DEFINITELY NOT RECOMMENDED.

The app content is amazing. The app itself is still little buggy; keep working on it. (App forgetting my plan for the first 5 seconds after I open it; I cannot touch the difficulty slider after a workout, I need to go back and click on difficulty again to edit it)

I enjoy this app alot and it's one of the best quality fitness apps I ha e tried. I do wish they had individual exercise work outs though especially for yoga. Their yoga programs seem rushed and it would be easy to get an injury. I think they need a single exercise practice area where you can improve your press-ups or down dog or what ever, it goes slowly through form and you can record how many you have done.

It's a very nice app which gives wonderful workouts it helps in transformation of our body..... But I don't know what's wrong in the updating of plan, it changes the entire schedule and whenever I update the plan that turns out to be a recovery day..... please check that out and please try to add an option of diet plans because diet is much more important that workouts.

I'm a beginner and I created a monthly program for myself on the app. However, while trying to complete the daily exercises my blood pressure rose too high and I felt dizzy. Beginner workouts are not for beginners. Other than that, very useful and rich app. It's very good even for a paid app and it's free.

The best workout application and my progress with it has been amazing. I keep recommending it to everyone and they are all thrilled by it. Organized, has a very wide range and variety of workouts, easy to use, tracks progress, just perfect!

I use this app 4 to 5 times a week as part of my program. It is good for getting variety and to focus on specific areas that I might not usually do. I do wish the instructor's voice had a little bit of personality to it

This is very nearly the app I am looking for, looks great, excellent bids, layout is great simple but also in-depth without feeling lost. Everything you expect from Nike, But (and a big one, although the app promises to get rid of that -lol)! I would love to be able to select equipment I have then have a workout I have for the equipment at home (eg, the workouts look great then it has equipment I don't have at home). If you could select the equipment, I would delete all other apps I have). Nr 5*

The app itself is very good, but when I created my workout plan things started to go wrong. Videos are bugged, even with the option "Alternative video codec" they keep buzzing. It forces me to close the app and start it again, losing my progress :(

The app isn't starting immediately... Even after several minutes it didn't start... Please fix this issue.. I don't want to miss any of workout session.... If this issue will be fixed then this is the best app I have ever worked with...

Pretty good workouts but terrible music interface with EXTREMELY limited options. Can't even link Spotify to be controlled through the app during workouts which you used to be able to do. Seems very incompetent of the designers. But I'm sure they're good people. Just didn't think this through. Please use all brain power next time. Sorry if this was harsh. But the truth hurts. Like my music experience on this app hurt.

I'm ready to rage quit NTC. It doesn't support Chromecast, and it freezes when I attempt to use screen mirroring. It's as if the developers are trying to prevent its use with a TV. Guess what, it's incredibly hard to follow along with a HIT workout on a phone screen. I'm done.

The videos don't work, programs are all either whiteboard ( bad without working videos impossible) or trainer led but not programs or in any order. So basically you have to build everything yourself. I would pay for a recorder trainer led program. This isn't even close.

I think the app is excellent! The only thing I would add given that everybody is now at home is the possibility of adding elastic bands to the equipment! That would make the workout just great! Thanks a lot for the workout.

Loved all the different varieties of workout but I keep getting a grey screen in the middle of the workout which is so pissing off and I've tried installing it in other devices to check and the problem persists. Hope you people improve the functionality so that the users can actually enjoy and make through the entire workout.

The idea that workouts without weights or a gym is a myth. The Nike Training Club app is great at being your buddy through the exercise routine. It creates a personalized plan for you based on your inputs. I am yet to use all aspects of the app but overall at this time of review, I'd say it's a great app - 5 stars

I like the workouts and it is not just as simple as other training apps. It customizes training based on my experience and strength. I have started using this app for few days and I will continue for 8 weeks to see result.

I've used this app and honestly do love it, that's the only reason why I gave it 3 stars. It would have more but for the longest time now it hasn't logged in my workouts and now the app won't even start up. It's always telling me to close and restart the app but it never works

Love the app but it keeps sending me a notification that I've just completed stage one. This has happened multiple times a day for the past three days, and I'm currently on stage three so it's getting really annoying

Everything's absolutely amazing. Everything except one thing. It keeps ending the work out at every touch. If nothing else, ask for confirmation before ending the workout. Completely spoils my mood in the middle of the workout every time I have to start the routine again.

The actual training sessions and plans are excellent. Only draw backs are that when it updates your training plan it makes a mess if the schedule. Also annoying that you need to download another app to run and record your runs.

It is a good app but the one problem I find is that they don't have workouts for people with disabilities which is not okay as it is excluding a whole community from being able to benefit from the app. I appreciate the app a lot and it has helped me but I really wish they had workouts for people with disabilities too.

It has been really helpful during the COVID lockdown. Most of the routines don't need a lot of space, there's a great variety, from easy stretching to high intensity that makes you really sweat. Better than navigating you tube looking for a training program.

I really enjoyed the workouts on this app, very well done, but it has become unusable due to glitches and crashing. Would love to keep using it if it was fixed, but for now I'll have to find another one.

I'm using this app since last November but recently it stopped working .The downloaded videos are not being played ...its showing a black screen if i start a video ..pls fix it....overall other than issue its a great app for a perfect work out..
Every time I try to cast this app to my TV the app freezes. My phone screen is way too small to use for the workouts. I would really like to use this app but it is unusable to me.

The exercise modules are great but the videos and guided exercises are very laggy on my Pixel 4. They stop mid playback and the video freezes. I've tried using the alternate video format option but it it still glitchy. Look into it please

Earlier I had given this app 5 stars, but I changed my rating as the app hangs up a lot, the workouts keeps on changing all the time, even when I've not updated, the whole progress is somehow altered, it needs to be fixed, otherwise good workouts.

on both mobile phones in our locked-down apartment the app simply doesn't load. Also it didn't allow me to register through Fb, giving different weird errors. Had to register with a different email in the end.

Nedded to fix bugs Plan update doesn't work everytime and sometimes it will multiple times in just an hour And now when i reinstalled the app its just stuck, showing server error. This is not expected from you. Please nike do something for this app qiuckly.
Workouts are generally great, but doing a minor stretch exercise on a planned recovery day automatically adds it to the plan. I also think the rating system needs a lot of work.
The app for the last week or so has not been completing video then just freezes. Sucks when you're using time based Workouts. Was good all the way up until this recent patch.
There is no option for deleting a particular workout. The app just keeps increasing in size as we go downloading the workouts. You have to delete all of them or none.
It's good, and I really appreciate that they made it free during a time that people could use it, but money's tight. They earned my money when it's back to premium.
Love the app and the collection of workouts. I wish it had the option to cast the class based workouts to a TV.

I have been using NTC at home while social distancing. I have been pretty consistent at the gym for the last couple years, so I am not a beginner, but these workouts kicked my butt. If you're looking to be challenged, NTC doesn't disappoint.

Great app! Lots of useful and good workouts especially since they made premium free ! Thanks I only gave it 4 stars because everytime I screen mirror and then start a workout the app crashes Samsung S8
Can't do a workout without having to stop every 30 seconds for buffering. No issues with loading on anything else, just with Nike.

Good, but has too many bugs. Sometimes my plan disappears, sometimes my plan suddenly changes, sometimes even clicking in the update button my plan doesn't adapt and when I open the app again the button appears again.
The App Crashes very frequently. Was not expecting such issues from NIKE, if it isnt for Android users don't post it on Google Play!! Just make exclusively for Apple users!
I receive various messages inviting me to use the activity tracker, but when I click on the button the app just brings me to the main screen. It happened also with other emails.
I love the quick work outs, no fluff and to the point. It's nice that it shows the time for each workout, too.
Great content but keeps freezing on my Android phone, esp when I'm casting to my TV. Frustrating enough for me to stop using this app and follow Popsugar Fitness on YT instead.

I started it and it was cool and great but then it stopped for every 3 training and I can't pause if I do it stopped from working at all and I need to restart it all over again 😡 Please fix it, it can be a good workout app
The different workout options are great. The one big problem is sometimes it refuses to play the workout video.
Impossibile to remove a workout from a plan after added it. general limitation to edit a plan after creating it (impossible to say not completed, impossible to reset a workout)...

Don't get me wrong, it's a great thing to have access to the premium workouts and programs for free. I really enjoy using the app, but it doesn't support Chromecast. So it's super hard to workout in my garage when trying to keep up with the trainer on my tiny phone. Also, when I tried screen mirroring, it's like the app knew and would completely stop working. I've tried on both Apple and Android. No luck.

I really like this app. Its very useful for me. but i have a problem. I use nike run club to track my running but it didnt syncs my running to Nike Training club. what should i do? by the way I use similar accounts for both.
Was perfect app, but then it started hanging and for past 3 days it hangs in between the workout and I have to restart loosing on the info and momentum.

I just got my first workout done on this app, I had so far a good, no great experience with it, I mean premium workouts for free, you can't turn that down. I have not yet had any problems on an Android phone. I had no problems downloading it on the Play Store app, and it just went smoothly after, browsing workouts and programs that fit me. I am an athlete, and this training club is not absolutely perfect to which I won't find any other app that is better, but it's free and effective.
It keeps getting stuck all the time. I have never been able to complete a single workout to the end without having to restart it.
Hi. It used to have '' your plan'' option. I can' t find my workout plan in the new update. I like to have weekly plans instead of choosing my workouts everyday. 😞 Please help me.
Great videos, the personalised plan is nice. Too bad my video keeps on freezing up despite using a different codec... Renders the whole thing unusable.
Amazing app. Variety of choices of workouts to choose from. Helps you with you work out schedule and easy to use!
Best fitness app that I have ever seen in my life. It's far much better than adidas runastic app. I don't know why it has so less rating (4.2) .This app deserves a perfect 5.
Excellent! Loved the organising of workouts according to equipment and the freedom to mix and match. Waiting for newer workouts.
Love all the workouts. You can always explore and adjust to your requirement. Great results

Amazing work out. There is just one thing that annoyed me. When I'm in the middle of a workout and then something interrupts me, I have to pause the exercise for a moment, and when I return, it says that I've finished my exercise, so I have to pick up where I left manually to continue, and when I finish, it counts me two workouts, while I've just finished my one whole workout. Please tell me how to fix it (continue my workout automatically).
Workouts are decent, but lack of screen casting is a deal breaker. I'll stick with YouTube until this is implemented on Android.
Too many bugs! It freezes halfway through the work out! I use to love this app but it's not worth downloading anymore.

The app is a mess on Android. In iOS works fine, but on Android it is a complete disaster. First of all, the number of countries is limited for some reason. Secondly, you cannot access your settings until you verify your location (which is impossible due to the previous step's problem). When you pick another country, there is no way if getting back and change it (which is also a very poor user experience, since somebody may do that by accident). And this is all related to settings part
Good workouts but the app malfunction alot. For instance, your plan schedule changes everytime you open the apps. That sucks!
So so so many bugs. Not working correctly even for a single exercise session. Worst of all time
This is a great App and has a decent library of workouts to choose from. A nice addition to your routine.
Sir last few month this app is not supported in motorola phones please solve this issue it's best fitness app I ever use.. so please solve this issue.

My favorite running app! The only complaints I have is sometimes it's difficult to change coaching plans (have to log out and log back in for it to work), and I wish the interval runs would be guided to tell you when you hit your distance interval (I don't like having to watch my phone to track my distance to switch laps when running intervals. It should be automatic)

This app is phoenominal for novice and experienced runners alike. Grest interface, great distance and speed tracking, and it works w spotify. My only gripe is with the guided runs. Yes they are 100% chock full of wisdom and useful information to make u better, but they are SO WORDY! Maybe create runs for newbies with all the talking and ones for experienced folk where its dialed back some? Idk. Either way well worth the download. Goes with me on every run.

The app states frequently that it has connection problems. It will not adapt my pace or program. It does not save my runs to an online database. I tried logging out and back in, that deleted all of my runs and did not fix the problem. Does not communicate with the Nike training app on workouts completed. Restarted my phone, created a new profile, reinstalled the app, tried connection over WiFi and mobile data, nothing worked. Currently using Pixel 3.

Great app for tracking your miles and I love the reward system! Especially love the club feature which allows you to add friends and they can see your progress and send you cheers! It would make it perfect if they would incorporate a companion app for a smartwatch that isn't Apple though. Not everyone has Apple watches

For a person who has never enjoyed running, this app has changed my entire perspective!! I'm going at it slowly and learning more about my pace. The data really helps lift you up. You can see where you are improving over time, love it!!

App not working correctly...it is not keeping none of my walks/runs. Kind of disappointing when your in a challenge and your #'s are not counted. Also disappointed that i can log none of this, wirh my back problems I'm trying to stay motivated to get these challenges completed.

The training program is great. For some reason when i was carrying my phone amd using the app to track my workout, it didn't add those miles toward my goal mileage, even though they show up in the activity section. After i boigjt mu Garmin watch, those workouts were added.

Was using it to prepare for a marathon in2020 but oh well. GPS is funky sometimes but hasn't bothered me since the last update. Overall content with everything just wish it had more running workout options.
I've been super happy with this app. I had tried a couple of different running apps in the last few week and this tracks my runs the best as well as gives different training opportunities.
This app is fine for a basic running tracker. I am yet to use the guided run features but they look useful. It lacks the detailed data and some other mapping features of competitors.
Great app for tracking workouts. The only issue I had was the auto pause would sometimes pause even while moving but luckily you can turn it off in the settings.
Great App, I can see my my stats, it motivates me, and makes me want to run more to unlock different achievements. I really appreciate that's it's free - thanks Nike!

Back in 2018 I gave Nike Run 4 stars because I like run keepers set up better. If Nike run continues to not record my runs properly and let me set up a new training plan im going to have to give it a 1 and stop using it.

Changed my life. I'm the type who needs constant motivation during a workout and music alone just wasn't cutting it. I started the guided runs with Coach Bennett a couple weeks ago and now I'm consistently running three times a week and actually feeling excited to get out and run! Thank you Nike Run Club!

Just did 15 mins of running today. Damn the coach Chris Bennet keeps you motivating while you ran, that really helps a lot, those motivation n talk while you run felt amazing, it feels like someone is running with you, you aren't alone, So I was able to complete 15 mins of running. Thanks Nike for doing it.
Stellar app. I simultaneously used and compared four apps and chose this one. Ease of use, accuracy in terms of distance, and the voice announcements made this app my number one choice.

Why aren't speed runs guided at all? I can't believe I have to manually watch my distance, pause, manually watch my rest time, and start again. That is bonkers. It seems like it should be basic functionality. Super disappointing.
Phenomenally designed app. Pushed me from couch potato to running 9km in 51 minutes in just 6 weeks - can't recommend enough aside from the few bugs that they seem to gradually fix
Love this app. I also enjoy the encouraging talks that randomly come through! Lol caught me off guard at first but it kept me going!
It's pretty good for keeping track of runs. It even continues working when your phone dies while on a run.
I enjoy the different run options..like the guided runs. They are full of inspiration and guidance. Great tracking.
Great app especially the guided run series with coach bennet. What i wish to be added on the next update 1. Galaxy / samsung watch support 2. Able to see our club mates running activity

Used the app for a couple years and logged nearly 700 miles without a single problem. Now, in the last 4 days, the app opens, the screen flashes, then suddenly closes. I have reinstalled multiple times and restarted the phone more times than I can even remember. Something has gone horribly wrong with this app. Switched to UA run mapping and it works fine....so far.

Would be such a great app. I'm really enjoying using this app to train for a half marathon. The personalised plan is great. However I can't believe the complete lack of guidance on the speed training runs. It's so fiddly to keep having to look at the app to see if I've run the required distance, then having to manually pause or lap the run and time the rest period. Other speed training apps I've looked at have informed me when it's time to run hard or rest. Nike, you need to sort it!
Can't modify settings like terrain after Garmin sync through Android, even after extensive details provided to support. Otherwise design is ok.
It is a very good app. The only problem is that it has failed to update my data on my challenges with friends.
It crashed on me when trying to start runs a week ago do I unistalled it. But after reinstall it is working again. I wish there was more coach talks after runs.

I downloaded the app to join a running challenge. The first 4 or 5 times I used it, it worked near perfectly. Then as I was preparing for a run it glitched...it wouldn't open completely but never gave me the option to turn it off, it was frustrating to say the least. I've now uninstalled and reinstalled at least 3 times. I'm not sure the source of the problem. Everything is good until I have to repeat the installation process.
The app is very accurate on the distance ran and it is very easy to use. Will definitely reccommend to all runners out there

Very clear and precise. Good motivation, indicating distance travelled during the run and how long to go before I reach the goal I set up. Also good motivation giving achievements if acquired. I had tried a couple of other running apps, but this was the best for my needs. Love the maps to look at when I've finished each time, showing where each kilometre is. Running towards a 10k at some point, the London Vitality 10,000, so this is such a help.

My app keeps crashing. I dont believe it's a memory problem on my phone, and I've also tried restarting my phone, uninstalling and reinstalling the app and going to the settings, force stopping the app and restarting it. I was looking forward to using the features on this app as I got back into running, but due the app stopping literally right after I opened. It up nearly every time, I believe I'll have to look elsewhere for my app.

Love the schedule it gives but I expected more. When running sprints, it doesn't change your intervals, you have to do it manually. Would appreciate if it gave a verbal "That's 200 meters, walk for 45 seconds/45 seconds are up, get moving!" and switched from meters to time automatically so you don't have to constantly look at your phone and click "lap" yourself. Also having trouble getting NTC workouts to check off on my NRC app.
Very good app for tracking runs. However sometimes it pauses and resumes for no reason. Recommend!

I really like the first few runs I did with Coach Bennett. I didn't like the later runs where you only get notified of the half way mark and last minute or so. I found it more engaging to have the app checking in along the way. I also think the NRC and NTR interfaces could use some work. They seem to have a hard time communicating

Had a few problems with it (once, the app kept crashing until I uninstalled and reinstalled and one of my runs disappeared once) but overall, really enjoy the app. Definitely helps motivate you to keep going while out running by talking you through how your run is going. Also, very detailed analysis of where you put in the most effort on your run via gps tracking. Overall I would recommend!

It is the best app you can possibly get to keep track of all your runs and walks. There is also built in audios with professional running coaches that will help keep you motivated and to help you build momentum to have the best run possible. There is also settings where you can record daily goals and create short and long term running plans to prepare for a race or to hit future PRs. If you want an app to run, this is your best choice!

Best running app so far. Great motivation. Edit: lost a star because it keeps asking for a review after I reviewed it at 5. Edit: lost a star for having a delete run feature somehow accessible from main stats while in use, lost a lap due to this. very frustrating. Also the update audio while running doesn't work 100% of the time. leaderboards are full of BS.

The app used to work but recently it hasn't been measuring my distance correctly, I know this because me and my brother run together but it gives us different distances for some reason. We have the same phones ( samsung j5). I believe it is my app that is faulty because my times are very inconsistent and my voice overlay cuts out half the time, however his times are very consistent and he never has problems with the voice overlay. We run on the roads and sometimes down the forest. Please sort.

Good but fails to track the course 1 in 4 times it gets used. I love the community aspect but not being able to see the route makes me question its use everytime it fails. Make sure your phone is on optimal performance because maybe that's the fault. Or maybe you can't use other music resources like Google Music player or other podcast apps. I haven't had this issue with MapMyRun, so maybe there is page to taken there as to how it functions.
Loved this app. But for a while can't create a schedule anymore somehow. Very annoying.

This app provides great motivation during the run, and even after. As you are running, the app can give you updates along segments of the run (completely customizable). The updates let you know you're progress without making you look at your phone! After the run, you can view your new achievements and review all the details of the run. The app overall is very easy to use, and the display while on a run contains all the information you need while being very easy to read. Great running app!

App worked great for about 6 weeks, but I've had nothing but problems the past 3 weeks. Runs not being mapped. Very inaccurate distances. It crashed at the end of my long run today, no data saved, nothing. This app has become incredibly frustrating. It's whole point is to track runs and it can't do that right now. Hopefully an update fixes everything soon or I'm going to switch to a different app that actually works consistently.
Why suddenly no Facebook login?I have used it for almost 2 years with my FB login and I can't login to this app at the moment..please fix this

I love this app because it keeps track of my time or miles. If I run 60 mins it let's me know my halfway point to back to start as well as if I use distance runs. The applause keep me motivated. The club feature let's me know what place I'm in with my group. I'm probably missing out on other features I haven't ventured into. 👌

Three stars because I'm conflicted. I have been using this app for about 4 years now and I can attribute how well it worked to me running my first marathon. Previously with the plan builder, selecting 4-5 runs would give me 3-4 actual runs (long run, recovery run, etc.) And only 1 or 2 speed or NTC workouts, which I hate so I always skipped or modified. Now, I'm getting 1 long run and all speed or NTC workouts, which forces me to build my own plan. Please help, Nike.

Overall the app is fantastic with GPS tracking, speed and pace accuracy. However, there are issues under the Activity>Achievements page. Streaks and challenges badges are not updated according to the runs clocked or the challenges completed. The app seems to crash in the past few weeks or just hanged. Will the next app update be able to fix the problems?

Guided runs, awesome ... my coach, awesome ... speed/interval runs, terrible ... you literally have to just track the intervals yourself by staring at the phone for the distance and then pause real quick at the right moment, count to whatever in your head and then resume workout. If you guys would simply add an automated timer when you hit the pause button during intervals, this app would be the best. If you would provide audio feedback for run distance and rest time, it would be perfect!!!
App is perfect for me. But in challenges there are some unreal runners on leaderboard. 2000 km during week? Are you serious?

This app is super cool. I'm new to running for the sake of running and this is really helpful for an athlete looking for motivation to keep running. No one ever coached me through running before so this feels so good to not feel like I need to go seek out a bunch of people and pay for anything, I just hit start and it feels like it's practically working as hard as I am 👍🏻

Quite precise tracker. Nice option with sneakers. Dislike: no elevation gained results, strava shows it. And when you're trying to set up the efforts you cannot neither go back nor save efforts without selecting something. Even I changed my mind to do it. When sharing the route there is no option to share it with actual map, just route. Overall it works like a charm

Very good app in terms of being motivational but for me being a novice runner, I'd love if there were more tip basics for the beginner such as when and how to stretch, breathing techniques while running, eating pre and post run, water and snack dos and don'ts while running, positioning the body while running, muscle attention and focus during a run, and lastly mental focus during a fun. Not too much to ask, right? 😜

The guided runs are great and really helpful and I have started doing one on the regime's to improve my fitness which is also great. But the actual timing and distances on the app are useless. I've just been for a run and was out for 33 minutes but the app decided it was 38 minutes which has completely inaccurately recorded my pace as far slower than I was. Some features are brilliant but I will continue using Strava to acurately track my runs.

Horrendous Updates - I am currently using the app updated Mar 24, 2020 on an Pixel 2 with Android 10. Every time I finish a run and end it by hitting the stop button, my phone shuts off and reboots, rendering my app and phone useless till it turns back on. And it also doesn't save the run. Please fix and update ASAP... It renders the app useless.

I really enjoy using this app. Guided runs are excellent for a beginner runner, and the coach is really useful for planning training for you. Bad thing is the tracking is so inconsistent, the route map is wrong half the time. You can import from Garmin, or enter data manually, but this really needs sorting.

I will never give a negative feedback about something that is free. I have been using this app for the last three years. Up until two weeks ago, with the exception of one other time, it no longer is accurate regarding miles run. The only thing that is accurate is the time of the run. I have tried other apps and it is the same issue. So, I guess from now on have to rely on time instead of distance.

Hey guys, great app, but I have one minor thing to improve: I'm doing a running plan created by you for a marathon, which includes interval runs, like 4 x 800m with 2 min pause in between. It would be great if the audio coach could adapt to that and call whenever I finished the 800m and whenever the pause ends. And also the program shows my run with average pace afterwards, but as I paused for 2 minutes after each interval, my pace overall is way too slow... Other than that I'm very happy :)

App was working fine until I had my run today. Finished it and suddenly the app crashed. Tried restarting my phone but still crashing, other apps work fine. Reinstalled the app and my run for today was not updated, and the app is crashing when I open again. Only giving it a 1 star to get the developer's attention to get this resolved ASAP. Other wise LIKED the app!!

I have been using this app for three years now, I originally rated it 5 stars but editing to 3. The app is good for what it is but kind of buggy. Sometimes it will map my run, sometimes it won't, sometimes the same 10k I do by my place will be further and sometimes shorter. How am I supposed to improve if I never truly know what my time was or if it recorded my run properly?

I've been using this app on my Samsung 8 without problems since August 2019, but the recent updates appear to have trashed it. Since the beginning of February, the app works for two or three days, but then fails to pick up the satellite and doesn't track my runs. There were half a dozen instances in February and two already in March (I run or walk every day). The app is very rapidly losing its functionality and needs to be fixed ... Update: April 8, 2020 Failure rate 30% Feb-Apr 2020

Use to love this app I have had it for years but recently it stopped accurately tracking a run one track. It should be an oval and I'm getting all these skewed images and inaccurate distances. I don't mind editing the distances but wish I could edit the image. Better yet edit the image and it could calculate the correct distance or even have an option to put in standard track and # of laps. Also won't track indoor track runs anymore either.

It's the best running app I've tried, and I've tried many. I'm quite amazing with the amount of content you get without any weird subscriptions, including the whole plan section. Guided runs are so good and motivating, it just gets the best of you. Also, everything is downloadable, therefore no internet needed, just a bit of preparation!

Does exactly what it says with a good easy to use interface and unlike other running apps will still record my distance and time even when the GPS on my phone loses connection. My only quarel would be that on my lock screen this app takes precedence over my music streaming app meaning i have to open my music app to skip tracks which is awquard whilst running. However this is only a minor set back and doesn't really take away from the app itself. Would recommend!.

Summary: Garbage experience. Use Strava/Garmin. Pros: It's excellent at advertising Nike deals. Notifications at mile markers. Allows to pause. Cons: Not intuitive AT ALL. Doesn't load contacts. Difficult to find (known users). No Android watch app. No music integration (it attempts to). This is only good for Nike fans, not avid runners. Ads galore

For some guided runs, the coach voice-over doesn't work when I'm using my wireless headphones. Sometimes it's completely silent, other times I hear the music soundtrack but not the coach, defeating the purpose of the guided run. As soon as I disconnect my headphones and play it again, the coach is heard. Very odd. I encounter this problem any time I want to do a speed run and it's frustrating

Great running app! I love the achievements and challenges with other runners. Makes me feel connected to the running world. I have track my best runs with the app. Only think I don't like is that I only started using this app a week ago and I wish I was using it the whole time of my running career

It is over all a good app but unfortunately the elevation doesn't work at all. Even with 200m during a 17k run, it saws 0m New issue: some times it say I run 8 km and some times 10 for exact the same distance that I'm always running. If the new update doesn't fix the issues I will deleted, there are enough alternative apps New issue: the challenges don't work properly I lot more than 100k this month and it stopped counting at 95.5km At least there are enough alternative apps in market

Hi guys! I really love the app and it has been helping me run for years now! The guided runs are my favorite! Either I'm in a mood for a run or not they always help me through it! I looove them! But lately i have run into some "trouble"....when I'm running with a guided run, and I stop at a street light to cross the street,for example, and the run automatically pauses, when I start running again, the track starts with me again, but the guided run doesn't come back anymore....

Absolutely horrendous and incredibly frustrating. This app often: Loses complete runs. Loses part of a run eg: Readout "Workout Complete: distance 12 miles" display says "4 miles" Has added extra miles onto runs. Doesn't pause when I'm static ie: waiting for traffic. Therefore pace is ruined. I've used this app on 4 different phones, had the same results. I would give this app 0 stars. I've done 1426 miles and only kept it because of my history. Once I've hit volt level, I'm done with this!

I paired NRC with Garmin Connect and Nike recognized all my walks from Garmin as runs in the NRC app. I now have 500+ "runs" which isn't accurate and has messed up my pace/mileage in NRC. There is no way to delete multiple runs at a time in NRC and deleting each run one by one crashes the app. Please add a feature to delete several runs at a time or otherwise help me with this issue. Otherwise a 5 star application for running, guided runs, setting goals through a plan, and tracking your mileage.

I adored this app for the better part of a year but a recent update removed the allow GPS tracking all the time option in my privacy settings. This has made the app guesstimate my run distances which kills a lot of the value of the app. I'm not sure why they would do this??? Makes me think they had a security issue and were forced to make the change??? Please fix the app!!

I cannot see my friends although they have added me. Why is that so? Moreover when I try adding a friend from my contacts, e.g ABC, it shows do many other ABCs on the list to choose from (I only have one friend named ABC). Lastly, I did the 60 minutes guided run, and while I was on the 33 minute mark and listening to the audio coach, the app stopped and didn't record down the run at all.. This app motivates but to be perfect, it needs to settle the issues above.

The interval running mode seriously needs improvement. The auto-pause function simply doesn't work, meaning you have to start and pause it yourself. In the likely event that you misclick after an interval, the timer will keep going, which messes up the tracking and you'll have to start over. Would also be better if there was a rest timer after you pause, that way you don't have to count down yourself.

Worked great for about 5 years, now in the last 6 months I have had to manually put in my run stats. The app stops tracking about .4 to .6 miles into a run. I have deleted apps to make room for any updates to Nike app. I have uninstalled and reinstalled several times. Unfortunately I am going to have to try a different app.

I love it, I would give 5 stars but it's really hard to search people you know and want to add to the club. Make it easier to find someone and I'll give 5 stars. I love that the app allows you to switch between your pace, mileage, and speed so easily. So far it's the best at tracking the route also!

Using this app more than 3 years ago,worked perfect since 20th of April 2020,till my last run,after crushed,cannot check the last run details and so on,just kicked me out straight every each time I tried to check,by any chance for some solution if not I have to change after 3 years,all my details,runs,infos ...... Thx
Great app for beginners. Stacked with resources and analytics to help you achieve your goals
I've used this app for several years and it's great, except you are unable to update your email address!

Love the app! Great programs and easy to use. My only gripe would be when you do the sprint portion of the program it's not guided. Ex: 9×200 you have to hit pause but you need to keep looking down to see if you hit the 200 Mt mark if you're not in a track. Not a big issue but would be nice if it let you know when you hit it or it autostopped and took your split

I would give it 5 stars but it has froze on me and counted my time but not my distance so it messed up my averages making it look like I was standing in 1 spot for 2 minutes. I had to stop my run then restart a new one. This then counted as 2 runs instead of 1 and I couldn't combine the runs. It wouldn't be such a big deal if I didn't have a goal of doing 100 miles in 30 runs. Instead, I got 100 miles in 31 runs and got jipped out of a quarter mile for when it didn't track my distance. Oh well.

Not very accurate on Android. I have been using this app on my iPhone and Google Pixel 3XL. I run the same route everyday. But still this app on Android shows I have covered more distance in lesser time even though that is not the case. Also the map of my run is incorrect many a times on the Android app. Needs fixes big time!

The app has been good but after a run it seems to take at least 30 to 45 minutes at times to sync my runs. This causes some anxiety as you start to think that your run did not count toward you challenge, goals, or competition with friends leader boards. Wish it would sync immediately like it used too.
Runs are not properly recorded, Means doesn't calculate the accurate distance ran. Not able to create a half marathon plan, it says some error 🗑️

My experience with the Nike App has been great over the years. Unfortunately I recently had my phone stolen which had my prior running data. I am currently using the Samsung A 30 and it works fine with the App. In addition, I also like that there various formats that can be used to try something new.

Great app, until I did a benchmark run as part of my plan and after finishing the run it spend over 5 min processing the run and failed to save and sync to the plan, it would also be very helpful if we could get more audio for interval and benchmark runs to hear when the interval are done without having to keep looking at the screen. Would also like to see the work out from Nike training app sync with the running plan once they are accomplished
Great app. Light . Will be great if it can manually take inputs on other health indicators
Accurate measuring of kms, able to set goals, adapt it to your running goals, love it

The app is overall amazing but lately there have been some bugs that are making it harder to keep a real track of my runs. For example, today I ran 6km but after the run was synced (after a long time, as always) it was cut down to 5km.. And the average pace was incorrectly set (it was slower than the average pace of all my splits). Please, can you work on improving that?

Never had any issues with this app and have been using it for years. I think it's a great app to record your runs and love the challenges and trophies that you can achieve, great motivation! HOWEVER, was really loving the app until I noticed it stopped tracking elevation. After some research found it doesn't track elevation unless you have an Apple watch. This is a little frustrating use to be able to do this with just an iPhone. Please change it to track elevation using all platforms.

Very inaccurate. I used to be a professional athlete so I know my pace by feel. I ran with my usual Garmin GPS watch and held my phone (Nike should really start making bigger pockets in tights/shorts cuz phones are so massive these days and they don't fit in any pocket at the back). The distance difference was nearly 1 km in NRC disadvantage! My watch showed me running 11.17 km in 48.17 min and NRC showed 10.32 km! So I'm deleting the app unfortunately

This app is great! The only problem I had while using the app is that sometimes it will glitch during my runs. The app will stop working and I had to re-download it. Other than that, I've been tracking my runs and enjoying the challenges and rewards you receive for your accomplishments.
Nike run apps keeps me in my fitness. I like that I can add challenges and that it starts and stops when I'm in my exercise.
This is good app for tracking your runs. Accuracy is good.

I was excited to use this and did my first run this morning, which was supposed to be 6x200m intervals. There is no guidance, not even a vibration when you are supposed to start or stop an interval. It is literally just a stopwatch. I can't understand why Nike would set it up like this intentionally.

I've used this app on and off for a few years now. Never had any complaints until recently. Went a run and it did not record the distance. And I used to always get a map of my route which I loved, but now all I seem to get is a circular graph. I'm not the longest or quickest runner so the app works for what I need it to do. Maybe it needs an upgrade?!

Seriously, whether you're starting or a professional already this is the best app you could use to go for a run its really guides you. I was at a level even lower than 0 and now I'm running every other day ! I love it !!!!!!!!!! On another note for improvement: there is a pb with the with Spotify when you don't use data. The guidance just stops. Would also be great if there were wys to be matched with other runners that are starting at the same time. There is great potential in this app tho !!

An essential running app. The simple process of recording your progress and mileage gives you the motivation to keep training for your next event or setting a new Personal Best. Plus the additional feature of registering your shoes on the app is also a nice touch and gives you bang for your buck.

Damn we really a better partnership between Nike and Samsung. It would be thrilling to be able to get Nike Run Club on my Samsung Galaxy watch Active2. I had this issue with the challenge (my runs weren't reported on the challenges I entered). It was resolved with the last update and everything was going smoothly but yesterday it did it again. Quite deceiving to lose a run when you're running for the 100km challenge.
Great motivator and tracker with lots of options for community events and personal coaching videos.

Great in theory but maybe needs an update. Last two runs (one a benchmark run, the other a regular quick start run) the app failed to log/save the runs. Left it open for 5+ min after the run and it was showing the spinning processing wheel, so was forced to close and reopen the app. Hence the run didn't save either time. It's a shame it has these flaws, coz it would be a brilliant app otherwise. Expected a lot more from such a powerhouse brand.
App will freeze up frequently. Takes forever to load and open.

From the day I have installed it,I am stretching each and every morning and evening for effective results. And if you have control on your cravings you can achieve well with this app challenges ! Its only 17 days I have start using it but I have sensed reducing extra fat from my body. So,Its Useful.Don't think just Install it and face the challenges.

I've only had it for a few weeks but from what I have seen this app is brilliant. It has a wide variety of workouts, challenges and exercises. I've only been doing the bikini body workout for a week and I'm already seeing results. And another great plus is that it's free. Many of the other apps like this charge you to do the same things. Highly recommend! 😊

I love this app. I only started my 30 day bikini body challenge 5 days ago and I'm already seeing results. The whole setup of the app is amazing and each work out & excersice have someone showing how to complete the movements. I will continue to use this app even after my 30 day challenge is over!:) I am also very fond of the warm ups and cool downs.
Great app but you have to hold the phone to see the timer. However you can pause if you struggle to get up or move quickly which is a big plus for me personally.
Amazing app, but is there an option to predownload the work out videos as some of them are new and by the time they load, the time runs out.🙃🙃🙃
This is an excellent app. Not over the top with long instructions that interfere with your music. But also clear and concise instructions. Lots of variety too.
such a good app! I'm on day 6 of the bikini body challenge and I'm already so much stronger than I was before :) def recommend if u wanna build muscle and spread some fat!

I downloaded this application because I seen a advertisement on my printerst application It said your 30 day fitness application was only compatible with Apple so I thought I would type your application name in to the Google play store search and I found that your application is compatible with Android thank you I will give more feed back when I use the application more and when I try out this 30 day fitness application thank you to the developer
Amazing workouts. I love that it challenges me daily and I never finish a workout unsatisfied!
Using now during quarantine, and loving it. It has kept me motivated and active. Thank you for allowing people to use it for free during this difficult time.
It is really good app because there are tons of workouts you can do. Also it times and gives breaks.
Download this app to use during this virus wave and I love it so far. It's easy and simple and something I can do in the house.
Very good and effective, and currently free! Top marks!
Veryg ood.everything timed out very nice to pick your workouts/looks. its awesome.
Fantastic app! No words to describe. Bending spoons the bestssss
I think it should get a five star because It was amazing it is so helpful to explain what we are going to be doing

Not exceptional. I downloaded it because of all the ads ig users are posting. But in their screenshots, I can see how they track each workout each day and have a record of it, but I don't have that same view. It shows me workouts and videos. That's it. It's not even in a order that's sortable to what you want to workout or which level. So no record of what ive actually done. Only if I favorite it, will it show up in a particular section at all

Nor impressed. It's just a list of exercises, with nice looking videos, but no organization or even ability to sort by level. The curated workouts have random names with no descriptions, and again can't sort by difficulty. Or sort at all. There is no way to build a profile or get the personalized experience advertised. It looks promising but there are much better apps out there.

Why is it not like the iOS version? Why didn't it have a profile you can input or a gold to advice. No guidance at all. It's like others said just a list of workout. I know your wanting to add new features but till you make it more like the iOS version this is my rating.
The app seems nice but please implement the integration with Google Fit
Nice app but it would be really helpful if it was possible to sort the workouts by area targeted and difficulty, rather than having to scroll through the alphabetical list.
Just starting to use, exercises look good. It would be very helpful to be able to sort by type and level. Also a back to top button would be nice.
Love it! Simple and easy. Just wish it specified how many to actually do. Like 5 jumping jacks for 2 mins. Something like that.
I love this app ! The workouts work & I've lost a lot of weight ❤
Not so easy... But good exercise for staying fit during the lockdown
I love this app so much it is so helpful and my favorite thing is that it is free!
Great app...clear video instructions, choose your own pace
Great app easy to use
I saw this was a app for showing healthy foods well ....NO! It was just an app with Exercises!
Where is the 30 day fitness plan? The app consists of random activities

This app is just a bunch of random exercises. If you click on the Workouts section, there is just a list of city names, which are curated workouts, but there's no way to know what kind of workout it is without clicking in to each one, since the city names aren't descriptive at all. Total waste of time.

I found out about this app through an influencer's ad and it was advertised as an app with 30 day challenges, but I can't find them, so I uninstalled. All I saw was a list of random exercises and I'm not sure which ones I need to practice, it doesn't help.
Best android app to workout
This would be more useful if you could sort the exercises, by time, by type, by body part, etc. Also , there are no 30 day challenges as noted on website.
Really good keep it coming
Just started using this app during the lockdown. Liked it.
Pointless. No 30-day challenges as stated on the website, just a collection of videos of individual exercises. Uninstalled - don't waste your time.
It definitely works.
No 30 day plan or routines to do for 30 days. App is literally a bunch of random exercise videos. Most videos do not load.
looks amateurish, You should create 30 day training plans, also group exercises based on strength, cardio etc
Very good experience

The app is great!!!!
It's very good it snot to kidish and I think it will help my workout it's only my 2nd day

جالبه
Useful

This app is AMAZING. it's literally saving my life. The only criticism I have us that when I Reach out to my coach he doesn't respond but idk if that's because I'm having a trial run. Also, the pedometer doesn't work very well. Only works when I have it open on my phone and I let the screen turn off, not as I'm on my phone for another reason while walking around. Other than that, I am beyond pleased with the tools, tips and use of psychology to help build better habits. Noom is #1.

It really is a helpful, different kind of weight loss program. The food logging, color system, informational articles, weight coach and group are all useful. I just finished three weeks and am only down a few pounds, but I've changed several behaviors. I plan to continue with it. That said - it seems here on the Google Play app that I can only download the app one time, on my phone, and I can't add it on my laptop. I'd like to have it in both places. Thanks!

I'm only on the trial, but I wish I had researched better. This "new" way to lose weight is missing key features most of the old ways have. 1) There is NO desktop app...that's right NO desktop app. For people who spend most of their days at a computer, this means you have to use your phone, even though you are probably already online on another device. 2) Android users cannot create recipes or meals to save things they eat regularly. HUH? We pay the same as Iphone users who DO have this important feature. So basically what you're paying for is a coach and color-coded food program. Lesson learned: more research before committing to something that will not serve my needs. I'll finish out my 2 week trial and cancel.

The program itself is well done, but the app is beyond terrible. They rarely update their list of known foods, and nutrition info is almost never accurate (great for tracking). If you try to add new foods, it will never be added to the app. Saved articles are sorted erratically, so it's nearly impossible to find what you're looking for. There's no way to track sodium, etc. I'd only recommend this program after they uplift their app. Perhaps the devs can reference Lose It to improve the quality.

I don't know why I took so long to commit after seeing so many ads! By far, the most comprehensive approach to health and overall wellness that I have ever seen. I'v tried keto, low carb, calorie counting, and other programs and they all work for a while, but this is the first plan that works with my brain to fix the decision making process that ultimately leads to long term success!!

I wish the food database was bigger, but other than that I really like this app. Good for tracking calories and workouts, but also the best at keeping me coming back everyday. To finish my articles/quizzes, logging my meals, connecting with my coaches and my group-all of this keeps it in my mind and keeps me on track better than anything else I've tried.

I would actually rate this a 0 if I could. Today I decided to try the 'free trial' (that actually cost me £2). I have tried every way to access anything that would allow me to enter food or exercise and instead it keeps taking me into a loop asking the same questions and wanting to charge me again. I contacted their support numerous times and they weren't particularly helpful. You can only unsubscribe in the app and as I cannot access the app at all I will no doubt be charged in 13 days.

For the person who has tried everything else. Very easy to use app ( almost too simple, no back arrows) Fun language, like a party atmosphere for losing weight. If you stay longer than 2 weeks (why not it's worth it), team coaching increases your motivation and accountability. Love the daily food logging because there is hardly any label or food that it doesn't recognize (wish the scanner worked a little better). It has revolutionized the way I think about, and the attitude I have around food.

This app is flawed in so many ways. The calories in the food log are ridiculously inaccurate. The bar code scanner is even worse, I haven't found a single food that scans correctly. The pedometer doesn't work at all, then they tell you to download a different app and sync it to theirs and that doesn't work. The coaching is canned, scripted drivel. I was really excited for this program and app but I'm not seeing any reason to pay for a product that's broken.

I love this program. I'm not far from an ideal weight, but it still helped me get back on track to eat better and be more active. I love all of the research based information on healthy eating! Noom puts food in categories of red, yellow, and green, which helped me realize I was eating food that was too "calorie dense" too much of the time. I'm seeing results and feeling better, and the best part is I still get to eat treats occasionally. Free version is great, but paid version is worth it.

Noon is a great app.!!! I have only been on for a week now, but just knowing I can message my feeling for the day helps. There is do many helpful ideas and you just log into your phone! It keeps a weight chart, how many steps you take during the day, and you log in your daily good log and it does the calories for you. It keeps a log for you to see everything you have done. I give it 10 stars!! :-)

I've been using it for 2 weeks so far. I downloaded just as I had started my weightloss journey. Have lost 6 pounds since starting using the app. I find it easier to log calories vs apps I've used in the past. It would be nice if the app saved all of the "fill in the blanks" for us un one tab with a link to original document. Then I can easily go back and reflect on my personalized goals and strategies. Noom tells us to eat lots of protein... then it should track our protein!
