Enjoying my experience so far, but load times are horrendous. When opening via a notification (like a reminder to log a meal), there is no issue. When loading from home screen, i give up after 10 minutes. I have a Samsung Galaxy s9, using high speed wifi internet. Considering this is a paid service, this might be a deal breaker for pulling the trigger past the 2 week trial.

This app is good for tracking your weight and has a lot of reading involved in order to keep you "on track". The accountability is all web-based and doesn't feel real. If there was somebody calling once a week or twice-weekly it would be way more effective especially for the price. Also if you are a runner and run several times a week you can't track any of that on the app unless you have an Apple Watch or a Fitbit. For example if you have a Garmin Running watch it won't sync up.

I've tried many diet plans I the past, but ended up gaining most of the weight back. I just started NOOM for the 2nd time (after reaching my goal and stopping too early in the "maintenance " phase. After one week, I'm feeling more energetic and lost weight. As a licensed counselor, I recognize the cognitive-behavioral components of the program.

I really like this app and program so far! I love that I can see weight coming off, but I'm not hungry. It's a very intelligent plan, different than others I have tried. I have heard it compared to weight watchers, and it is similar in that you can eat anything in moderation. However, where noom improves on the ww plan is the different categories they put your food in. Therefore you can't eat zero point food all day in order to save up for a 16 point piece of cake before bed. Recommend!

Very ghetto. Would not recommend. I was really excited to try this program. Unfortunately, the Android capabilities for this app are limited in comparison to iPhone. Your access to the program is limited during the trial. They advertise a feature to log your own recipes, but that feature is not available on Android platforms. The pedometer is wildly inaccurate. The app is glitchy and tech support is only available via a one-time messaging and subsequent emails, which is not efficient.

It's been a great and positive experience starting with Noom. I've been "Nooming" now for 1 full month and it blows my mind how small changes in your daily routine can really make a difference. The things you learn cause self reflection and many "Aha!!" moments as to how you got to the weight you are. In one month, I've lost 8lbs and don't feel deprived or that I've made radical and unsustainable changes. If you've tried other dieting methods and have been unsuccessful try this!!!

This is the best Weight Loss experience I have had so far. The app is funny and always leaves me chuckling when I check it. Very grateful for the progress it is helping me make and for the psychological aspect. I have done weight watchers and lost the weight but the underlying cause of my weight gain remained so I eventually gained it all back. With this I feel I am fixing parts of my thought processes so I won't go back to where I was before.

Week 1......so far so good. I have lost, to date, about 16 lbs which is good. Much of the information is very useful, although some of it has honestly gone over my head. The pedometer needs a lot of work. It is very inaccurate. I am using another pedometer to supplement it. I love the division of food into color categories, which is giving me greater insight into what I am eating.

I am impressed. The concept is easy to understand and follow. It takes work on the user end to stay committed but don't worry they're here for you when you start to fall off. Would have been 5 stars but I'm an Android user and can't enter recipes of my own into the app. Only available for iOS users which is silly. I am satisfied with the focus this app has given me and I think with the Noom team's help I will reach my 50lb goal.

Love all the insights on how to eat, changed the way i look and eat food, thinking about food and seeing who else is feeling the same about how we eat. The coaches are great, the support of the other members of your group is fab. . And brilliant humor 🙂. Other diets say." No don't eat that" and you deprive your self of the foods you like. This gets boring, and you end up right back with all the weight. 🤨Noom is not a diet...... it's a new way of life. Noomnerd for life.

Program is ok. App is awful. At the 200$ price point, it's just not there yet. However, when I went to cancel my subscription, I was offered a discount of 19$/month no commitment. So, if you think it's too expensive, give this a try. I still decided to cancel because it wasn't worth even that in the current state of the app. I also bought the workout and meal plan - it's also fine but not worth what they charge. Lower price point and a substantially fixedup app and it wouldn't be bad.

I have emailed and asked for help to fix the issues with my app, only to be given yet another password reset. When I open the app it has a screen that asks for my uipd code, I already signed up and purchased the workout plan, but I cannot use the app to even login. No option to even login. I have asked for the code and only get a password reset. I have received over six emails and still unable to use this app. I am going to cancel my membership.

I don't get how this is supposed to be successful. The only real feature is the food tracking, which is inaccurate. Other than that, it's just reading Pinterest-level, superficial inspiration nonsense. That doesn't produce results. There's no real approach here. No dietary plan, no workout regimen, no stats to track other than calories. I won't count the pedometer because it's junk. Never works. I can't read the messages from the "coach". I think this is just a short-term scam, honestly.

The app is reasonably good and their information is fairly informative. Be aware though that if you dont want to continue with your trial cancel before the trial is over. I was nailed on an 8 month subscription for more money than I was ready to pay. I may have set up my account wrong but just be aware. If you can set your account up for monthly payments or be ready to pay more than you want.

I find the program it offers excellent as a behavior modification tool. however, the app isn't quite there yet. For starters there is no way to connect a Samsung wearable which monitors exercise way better than the app does. You would given that half the people who track activity use a Samsung device, one would be able to hook it up to this app.

I love that all my tools are in one app. Recipes, meal logging with meal analysis, step counter (though my samsung health does not transfer my steps. I manually input them at night) bp and pulse oxygen tracking, group chat with fellow noomers, and chat with my team coach and personal coach. Oh and all the lessons have really opened my eyes to the reason I ate the way I was. My blood pressure has never been better. The support is there when I need it. THANKS NOOM!

This app is awesome! There are things I already knew but Noom breaks stuff down and I'm really understanding food now. I've learned so much and am losing weight and eating healthier. I love that no food is off limits, we just have to learn how to budget our intake. So I still get to eat what I want but I'm developing a craving for less calorie dense foods. I HIGHLY recommend this app!

The content is great and pretty much on par with what I expected. The app isn't the greatest (there are more robust calorie counter/recipe inputs); I sometimes get issues where food items will save to the wrong meal (but it still counts for the right day, so no harm, no foul). I've had a fine experience and I'm still using it 7 weeks later.

I really love reading all the articles and learning the science and psychological side of getting and staying heathy. I love the colod system they have set for food logging. The being based caloric density is awesome, but I feel like some of the food isn't always labeled correctly. Also, I don't know if it's because I am not in to the paide part yet, but my Coach doesn't answer my questions very quickly. You would think if they wanted me to stay it would be the same as the paid so, not sure

I came back to Noom after a while because it helped me to lose weight years ago before I had my baby. This app is very different from how it used to be. The step counter absolutely doesnt work, and the changes to the app basically make it useless. They want tou to pay for "courses" but it's not clear what those are - doesn't seem like the articles they used to give you. Might as well use my samsung health or myfitnesspal. I used to like Noom, but it's not good anymore. Probably going to delete.

I think this app s great but has room for some improvements. The daily articles are great for keeping me focused and improving. Logging needs some work. Scanning hardly ever works, searching frequently brings up, inaccurate info, and I wish there was a way to focus on getting a balance of foods from all food groups and hide the calorie count.

I would rate 0. I signed up for a 14 day trial period on March 31st and paid $1.00 for what was supposedly a free trial. I was not even able to access it and immediately deleted the app, I did not authorize a subscription for Noom of any amount and to my surprise, I was charged $199.00 this morning. I found a number of complaints with people expressing the same issues and could not find a phone number to contact. I want a full refund of $200.00. This is not operating in good faith.

Warning!! This app doesn't prompt you that trial is over and proceeds to charge you for 2 months. Not even an email was sent but yes they can prompt you via SMS if you haven't logged in for some time (the logic!). Also, the way to unsubscribe is not clearly stated (you have to send a request via the messaging function). And apparently, it's stated on their website that they wont refund subscription fees!! Got a shock when i checked my credit card bill and have sent in a refund request.

I have lost weight because checking in each day seems to hold me accountable. Though, I have habits that are hard to break and some of a weight loss journey is strictly will power that no app can fix. The articles are somewhat helpful, but many are uninteresting. Overall I did like this app and have lost 14 pounds in 8 weeks.

Love the app! It's very user friendly and I love that it's an interactive app. You learn things as you go & you have a health coach to guide you with check-ins. The app does a great job at helping you become accountable and aware about what you're eating & how to eat healthier including the amount of calories you've had for the day.

Love the program, logging meals so helpful. The downside is limited online coaching, takes days to get a reply, app could use more depth, i.e. place to record other info, I sometimes cant find food info on the app and cannot create it as I dont have all info for a food item, also appears to be American as limited info on Canadian foods and restaraunts, we pay the same, should be Canadian data as well. Having said that, I am enjoying it and so far quite successful

Articles are good as is the psychology aspect. The app itself is very poor. Food logging is unnecessarily tedious, the database is very limited and often wrong. No access to historical reports such as easily viewing calorie counts over time. BP logging appears to be meaningless as there are no reports. The hard stuff (psychology of weight loss) they do well. The simple stuff (app functionalty, and a decent interface) they fail miserably. I'm using it for articles but have to use other apps

You get nothing better than most free apps. Don't believe the false ads about personalized. I paid for add on meal and exercise plan. I received 30 pages of generic guides with their color coded classification (it's another way to do points like WW). Coach does not actually do anything other than send short messages every few days that make it clear it's general, they do not help look at food logs, etc. The food log is a little glitchy with no way to track daily water or provide analysis.

This program helps bring your dietary habits into focus, and shows you ways to monitor your calorie intake. NOOM will guide you through your weight loss journey, and get you to your desired target weight, within a realistic, specific time frame, and your never alone! NOOM KEEPS IT REAL! Try it, it's worth the struggle!! Aloha From Hawaii, George H.

UPDATE: Upgrading to 4 stars as I belive my previous issue with loading times w as my phone and not the app. If you are looking to lose weight and keep it off, this program works really well. I lost over 40 lbs and kept it off even 6 months after completing the program. Loading can take a bit but its not bad. However, android still doesn't have the recipe feature found on ios. When it does, I'll give it 5 stars.

The food tracker is fine, however what irks me is the fact that upon getting started in the app, it asks if you want to complete a course. After filling out a questionnaire for about 5 minutes plus load times, it tells you at the very end that you must pay for the course, something that was NOT mentioned prior to the questionnaire.

The app provides wonderful information, guides for using the information, step tracking, calorie tracking, weight tracking, and a feature that will give you a calorie count on just about everything. I would have given it 5 stars, but the directions for using the app are lacking and the mile/step/calories burned function for exercise walking does not work. Suggestion- down load Going Fit- does a fan job. Also invest in 4month pay option. So far worth it.

Still deciding whether the app is worth it. Food logging data is inconsistent. Barcode reader is pathetic when logging food. Support groups are full of people, but of my group of approximately 60 people, 3 of us post. Goal coach is heard from once a week and they ask pretty basic questions. The psychology aspect is helpful, as is the mindfulness method they suggest.

Good app, apart from it seems that your coach is just an AI bot which can't actually interact with me, the calorie counter doesn't adjust with the amount of physical exertion you log and finally, the pedometer doesn't accurately register your steps, so I have to add them manually from another app. If there were just a few improvements, this app would be life changing!

I found this app great until I got a new phone. Now I can't login, it keeps telling me to sign up with Facebook, so I press the Facebook button, the it comes up with an error saying I need an email address with Facebook? Can't seem to login no matter which way I try, very frustrating. There is no link to ask for help with login.

I started a week ago, so far it's been pretty good. Some of the material I've read has actually made me laugh, and the whole thing is worth it just for the optional exercise plan you can get. I got the free two week trial and so far I'm feeling like I'm going to keep at it after it's over. I also purchased the exercise and meal plans,which is a one time purchase. The only reason I wont give it a 5-star rating is that they only let you log food based on caloric density, not nutrients or other.

The program is good, having an individual coach and a group is great, but the number of articles to read is too many - difficult to keep up and take it all in. Feature updates needed: Thee most often input food items should stay near top of the list for ease of input. It should be easier/more intuitive to save meals/recipes. Don't want to exit out of logging meals after each, want to log multiple meals at once Bugs: (Galaxy S7) app crashes lots step counter regularly doesn't track steps

I, probably like most, struggle to get the weight off and keep it off. I've tried many different weight loss plans over the years...found one that works great...but it is extremely strict & difficult to stick to when away from home. Noom makes eating healthier easier & has given me motivation I needed to get started & stay on track! All I can say is this is working! I feel good! I like the check in every morning, the guideance, tips & tricks are easy to follow. And I LOVE the added humor!!

Unimpressed at not being warned that the payment was being taken out after the trial which was last year. Can't remember which credit card i used so as I've not cancelled another payment may have come out. As a nurse it just didn't fit into my lifestyle and not used it for ages. So noom please cancel my account and refund any payments after the initial payment made after the trial. It's good but too time consuming for me on 13 hour shifts.

I have been on so many diets through the years. I am not hungry following this lifestyle app and have steadily lost weight this 1st week. I enjoy the articles and motivating info. This is the only thing I've been satisfied with in order to lose weight. It's also easy to follow my vegetarian diet. Thanks. NOOM!

Great program! I cannot recommend it enough. You are more likely to love it than otherwise. I have lost 12lbs in 4 weeks with the program. You will learn so much about whole body health besides weight loss! It's an incredible program. And I have to mention how successful the writers are in making the articles super interactive and very humorous! Kudos!!!

I absolutely love Noom! I've lost 40 lbs. In 5 months and I've learned alot in that time as well. The reason I only give 3 stars to the app is because there are features on the iOS app such as adding recipes, seeing your whole weight graph, and changing the weight loss speed that would be super helpful in the Android version . If those were available I would definitely be giving 5 stars.

I did noom about a year ago and lost 20 lbs in just a few short weeks! I took a break and now I am ready for more! I love the accountability, the group (this comes after you start your paid subscription) the articles and I LOVE the stop light food tracking system. I missed it so much while I was away it's unlike every other app out there! it's a lifestyle changing app! P.s. check out the Facebook groups for some added accountability... they are unofficial but AMAZING!

PLEASE AVOID NOOM! Would give this a 0 if I could. Horrible app! They make it near impossible to delete your subscription and you can only do so via the chat bubble with your coach. This also shows how it's an automated system using a bot for your "coach"! They will charge you without notification once your trial ends. Please be weary there is a reason you can't manage your subscription with them via Google. I'm almost positive they won't give refunds for this lack of ethical practice.

It's. Fine. Calorie goals seem unrealistic and possibly unhealthy for someone who wants to maintain muscle mass, but lose some fat. The articles within are annoying because they're written like a Gen Z'er who puts a hashtag in front of everything. And I don't even think Gen Z'ers do that anymore. My mom loves it and she's lost a bunch of weight, so that's good. Maybe she's a better audience or ideal customer. Not sure this hits the mark for men who don't speak in hashtags.

Bait and switch I was given payment options when I first downloaded the app that were adjusted because of the pandemic, I think they were trying to encourage healthy habits. Just what I was looking for, at a price point I could afford being furloughed and all. After the trial ended, I was charged XXX. The service provided was cool but not worth the money( for me). Noom should've been clear at the beginning that my initial payment was for my " free trial" and not for my month subscription. 👎🏽

Lacks so much. This app is supposed to be used as a health hub where all information regarding weight and nutrition is supposed to be consolidated. In the 2 weeks I had the app entering food was nearly imposible. every time I attempted to scan barcode on labels they NEVER worked. Food was never found. I just ended up using my fitnesspal Also there is a built in pedometer that doesnt track steps accurately. I don't see the need for this app when the 2 most important functions don't work.

The practical tips and options provided make it easier to make healthy choices. The stress reduction and other strategies for using Noom during Covid-19 shelter in place have been very helpful. By concentrating on one goal a week, implenting one small change a day, I don't feel overwhelmed. The small daily changes really add up. The daily motivation, support and encouragement make such a difference.

I have tried many diets over the decades and this is the best for long term sustaining changes in habits. The daily app guidance is great. I have learned more than I thought possible. Losing weight and feeling stronger and healthier is possible at any age! The online coach and support group are great.

So I have 2 issues 1. Can't get it to connect to my fitbit to record steps (or anything else fitbit tracks). A free app, noom walk, is recommended, but I can't find it and it requires you keep your phone on you at all times. 2. (This is more of a personal preference) I really prefer counting macros to the color system boom uses. I feel like I'm never quite sure what color some stuff will be, but I can look at the nutrition label and estimate macros. But I REALLY like the psych aspects of noom!

I've been very satisfied so far with the trial and feel like it is worth the price once it does charge you for the year. I love the fact that it is focused on the psychological aspect of weight loss because that's personally my struggle. I would recommend for sure. I will say though, I wish there was a way to add your own recipes since I cook a lot.

You can't enter own recipes on an Android but can on iOS. I tried on my computer as well; you can't do anything there other than see your subscription. Defeats the whole purpose of eating healthier. I'm not going to waste my time trying to log a meal that has 15 ingredients, figure out how many servings of the ingredients are in the meal and then divide my entry by the number of servings.

In a lot of ways it does not work. Menu items that I vlog for several days are no longer available. Entering barcodes doesn't help. So I look at past meals animals just say "red". The actual food items don't exist anymore in their database. The pedometer does not come close to keeping accurate step counts... However the good thing is the information they provide. Very educational and useful. Would have stayed with them if the app worked better.

This app is almost useless. The only value is the weight tracking and the articles. You can not create a recipe and select portion size. It forces you to input ingredients and measurements every time. It make logging food way harder than it need to be. I am close to canceling my account and just use the free version of MyFitnessPal.

The app is very user friendly about everything except your subscription status. There is no link regarding your subscription status in the app. You have to go to the FAQ page to access your status. They will automatically charge you a flat fee of $219 for an 8-month plan even after choosing to cancel your subscription. Then you have to contact their support system and communicate through emails. Having worked with similar app before, I can assure you this is wayyyyyyyy overpriced.

Noom makes it easy to manage your calories. This is a great tool for eating normal, everyday food and I like that no food is off limits: you just have to learn how to budget the calories within the three categories. I don't have cravings and I don't overeat, so I never feel too full and bloated. It is working very well for me.

I needed something to be accountable for my weight and especially logging my foods. The 3 types of foods - green. Yellow and red help to plan what I'm going to eat. The daily psychological lessons are interesting and very helpful. My group gives ideas and encouragement. My group leader brings some fun with the challenges she presents. My coach is helpful to help me set achievable goals and encouragement.So fat it's a slow process , but I have lost weight in the 8 weeks of Nooming! About 10 lbs.

I really like this program. However after my two week trial I can no longer use PayPal to pay. It says that the payment did not go through and it is only giving me credit card options. Why can't I use PayPal? If I can't use PayPal I am not going to continue this program. I only use PayPal for stuff like this. If I could contact someone directly to figure this out I would definitely give this app five stars . HELP

It's great so far has helped me understand how to lose weight the right way. It helps me make good decisions on what to eat and how much. Helps you change the way you go about losing the weight and gives you the tools on how to keep it off. Only bad thing to me is not to fond of weighing myself everyday otherwise I love it.

Love how the app has optional functions for meal and snack reminders. Everyday is new objectives to cover along the healthy diet journey. The only thing I do not like is that you can not make modifications to recipes once you log them into your meal. Overall, great app to help keep on track for a healthier lifestyle!

I am on week 2, lost some weight week one; coaching and small, simple "lessons" are very palapable/not overwhelming; exercise does not adjust calories on android app (so you have to keep an tally in your head), and i have to manually enter step count for exercise; like i said, having the coach's feedback is a HUGE benefit

I was genuinely surprised at how great this app is. I unfortunately cant afford the monthly membership and have to quit after the 2 weeks are up. Fortunately, those 2 weeks were awesome and very good at habit building. AND noom doesnt fully force a bunch of New Age occultic stuff like most health and fitness sites do, it has a teeny tiny bit, but not enough to be a huge concern. Much appreciated.

I am surprised and pleased so far with this app. This is from someone who has tried everything. It's my first week and I already lost weight but more importantly, I'm developing better habits. Initially, I did not hold out much hope because I have tried just about everything program out there. This one is different. There is a big focus on mindset. Mindset is everything. It's the make or break in weightloss. Noom is on to something.

Okay. I actually used this app years ago when they were just getting started. I paid once for lifetime access. Apparently that was too good to be true. Still, I like the approach and wanted to try it again. I was even planning to pay. Well, I can't log recipes. I can't sync my fitness pal (but iOS users can) to do the logging on. It's hard to find my food log and the step counter is just plain not working at all. They charged me $170. And the app is only delivering 30% of what's promised.

Noom is a great app for weight loss. I would say it's optimal for those needing to lose 30 or more pounds. It is behavior adjustment and you get great information about nutrition and other "psych" tricks to get a grip on food addiction. Don't worry about the somewhat corny and at times questionable scripting. The info is very good. But you have to hang in there for the long term to achieve a lasting result.

Really helps me understand the mechanics of health. A lot of it is review for me, but this explains the why if things and really does help with the psych tricks to make better choices. I gave it four stars because it is a bit frustrating to calculate steps unless you have a Fitbit or similar device. It also doesn't track period cycle. I would also like to input a recipe and get calorie info, but I use other apps to help with that.

The app works well and has many helpful features, however they do not make it clear that it is a subscription service. They charge you with no notification or reminder, not transparent business practices for charging users and cancelling the service. I was surprised to see the charge on my CC, but of course all policies say there will be no refunds.

NOOM takes the overwhelming out of weight loss! I SERIOUSLY needed to find a way to lose weight. I decided to give NOOM a try after reading some reviews. All the weight loss 'info' out in the world is so overwhelming. I don' regret it a bit. Yes, it cost $$, but compared to other programs I've tried, at $40 a month or whatever it comes to, is totally worth it. I've learned more in 7 weeks than in all others combined & week 7 down 17 lbs!! GO NOOM!! (4☆=Would be perfect with a water tracker.)

I love the interactive feature if this app. I get support on a daily basis ..the AP is user friendly ..the recipes provided look delicious and easy to follow ..the encouragement provided on a daily basis is up to date and take into consideration all that is going on today and includes the total person ..body, mind and spirit!

This really works for me. It's sensible and doable. I did WW but they changed their point system and it didn't work for me anymore. With this app, I log my calories, but I can eat the food I want in moderation. Also, there is a lot of support with a coach and a group. It's a great app.

You need to be consistent and spend at least 10 minutes a day, reading the eating techniques, learning about healthy eating etc. I love that this app has taught me many tips and tricks about healthy eating and definitely has helped me realize my bad eating habits and thus lose weight.

I love Noom's weight loss program! The food tracker is my favorite and I love that I don't have to complete remove anything from my diet. The knowledge it gives you to help stay on track is great too. I love the witty nature of these lessons! Excellent app, you won't be disappointed.

This totally works! The app is super easy to use & as a diet IT'S WORKING! Granted, it's the end of my first but so far so good! The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is b/c the food tracking. There should be more measures for serving sizes...other than that...4.5!

This app charges you for the 14 day trial and doesn't allow you to enter into your account and begin the 14 day trial. I have not received a refund for the 14 day trial and paid for getting nothing but headaches in return. I rechecked if I could login into my account 8 hours later and I still cannot get through to start my 14 day trial.

Useless waste of time and not reponsive. It says it takes 10 minutes a day...it takes more. The coaching and goal specialist portion of this app is what I signed up for. Turns out...no responses during the trial period thus making it a waste of time since I can't experience the true purpose of this app.

I'm really loving nooms take on weight loss. I like being able to incorporate ALL foods in my diet. It's teaching me how to eat, what to eat, how much to eat. Also it's showing me why certain things in my weight loss journey happen and how to work on them and deal with them. It's definitely given me a whole new take on everything. Highly recommend.

This app has been super nice! I like the daily nutrition information and motivation. The pedometer is a little off I've noticed, but not by too much. Sometimes the food is hard to find as well, but that's with many calories counting apps! Overall though it has everything I would want from a health app as far as tracking progress.

They are scam!! Don't sign up for their 14 day trial. Uninstalling the app doesn't stop your registration, they keep charging 109 for 4 months. More expensive than personal trainer for a stupid diary keeping app. To unsubscribe you need to get in touch with a robot chat box that keeps you waiting for an hour and after that sends your request to an email box and you receive a response couple days later.

So I followed the program for 4 months and only lost 4lbs. Which is not a lot when you have 70+ to lose. I did however stop gaining weight, so that's a plus. I already ate healthy prior to this, so noom will probably help if you don't know how to eat well. I liked the ease of the program, the information is good though not news, it fits easily into the day. Use an outside pedometer. The recipes are pretty good too. My coach was not super helpful, but ok. It's not a bad program.

For weeks, all this app talks about is food, food, food. It has not even mentioned one thing about burning calories or any exercise routines. I downloaded this to help burn the last few calories and find new excercises to do since the gyms are all closed. But, it basically treats you like a 5 year old going to your primary (one lesson: if you're hungry and want something sweet, have an apple, it will fill you up more than the unhealthy candy bar, lmao).

Noom is great for helping change habits; however, there have been glitches in the system. I've been trying for 2 weeks to enter a recipe with all the ingredients and then divide it into #of portions. Can't do it. So you must be careful if you enter a meal and only want 1/2, you must calculate before or you get HEAPS of calories.

The recording off food and exercise is great, it helps with understanding balance. Some off the tips are good, asking a personal question to your coach not so good, it's like sending a question to a robot, they come back with a standard answer, not designed to your question.

Life changing! If you pay attention to what you are being taught and what you need vs what you want, this is gonna be an easy task to start. It doesn't hurt that some humor scattered in each days check in, makes it a little bit easier! My one on one counselor helps to make it a truly personal experience and I can review any issues with privacy. I have been doing this for a week and have already lost 5 lbs. Without feeling hungry, because recipes are plentiful via the Noom app! BRAVO NOOM!

Noom provides just what I needed. Weight loss is ~80% diet, and Noom helps count calories while keeping you full and without banning any types of food! Already lost 10 pounds in 4 weeks while consuming sugar, dairy, and alcohol. Just keep in mind they will charge you around $40 a month after the 2 week trial for premium version (there may be a free version). Well worth it in my opinion, as their daily articles help build healthy habits and curb unhealthy ones. Highly recommend.

The worst app I have ever seen. I just had the trial and after that they cut $150 directly from my bank account without my consent and now they are not refunding it inspite of the fact that I am not using their services at all. I am already having financial crisis under COVID-19 conditions and these people are not at all refunding my money.

I love it so far. The barrier scanner could use some work as sometimes it wrong even focus and it gets really frustrating to not be able to scan what I'm looking at quickly. But I do like the red yellow green "foods" and the fact that this is calorie based instead of point based it helps make it more realistic when i stop using it one day!

My experience after one week has been very positive. Noom adapts its approach based on how you answer a number of questions and on what information you log each day. I find it very encouraging so far, and I have lost two pounds. As a 47-year-old woman, I think that's a huge success!

Love the program so far but app is lacking features. I can't understand why the iOS app let's you add custom recipes but android won't. Also I wish you could type in food amounts instead of having to scroll always. Trying to add 200g of something would be a lot easier if I could just type 200 in. Otherwise, great service!

I love this app. It makes fasting g even easier. Moreover, you don't have to pay for ANYTHING. I downloaded an app before this one where everything had to be paid for. If you wanted your plan, had to pay, if you wanted to read article, had to pay. This app not only shows you where to find support from other fasters (and tells you how many other people are fasting on the app) but also gives you FREE helpful information.

This is a beautiful, functional and informative app! It not only helps me track my fasting but if you are new to fasting it teaches you about a variety of ways to do it! Data collection, the blogs to learn more, the community all keep me engaged and focused on accomplishing each fast i set out to do. Unlike any other fastibg app I've tried! Give it a try!+

Easy enough to use and it does what it should. That said, your reminders don't work properly. As in, I don't get reminded at all by the app. There is no notification of any kind. The way you setup a reminder is also a bit janky. There are some other minor interaction issues I have, but nothing that breaks the app and the way it works. Just little UX hick-ups. Ultimately, it could be better so I'd say do some more user testing for the next release. Can only get better.

I love this app. It works as intended, is full of useful features and not frivolous ones, it looks nice, and I love that it also provides useful information. As a tech professional, I'm impressed with the overall execution of this app. As a human trying to proactively manage my health, I appreciate and value it's design, stability, functionality and the expertise behind it. I have and will continue to recommend this app to people I care about!

Damn good app!! I never had interest in actual fasting, however I'm the kind of person to either eat one meal a day or lose the battle against my already 12y.o. binge eating disorder. When I suddenly stopped eating early this year I thought I might as well use a tool to keep track of WHEN I actually eat and when I don't. Crazy to see that I'm naturally fasting for 18-30 hours every day without even thinking about it. o.O It's really a neat tool to keep track of my habits.

So easy to use! I like that I can pick differebt plans or have a customizable plan with different hours. I can also change the fasting plan rather than ending it and wasting the hours fasted. It's cool to see the numbers of people fasting the same plan as I am around the world. This app has been an integral part of my fasting life and weight loss journey.

I really like this app for fasting. Zero - Fasting tracker is not only great for recording my intermittent fasting times but also a fantastic health recording addition. It allows me to sync with Google Fit and track weight, sleep, and more. Best part is there are no ads and the layout is easy to get. You can also adjust data too if you messed up or forgot to log. The best part I would say is the education they give on not only fasting benefits and recommendations but also pro tips! Thank Zero!

There is something wrong with the app. I started a fast, closed the app and went to sleep. I went to check the timer this morning and it can't be found. It has the screen "choose a fast". I did that already. I click on the fast timer I picked last time and says there is an ongoing fast, and i tap on that but nothing happens. I don't know how to view the fast I picked. Edit: Okay so somehow I manged to end the fast but now i cannot start a new one. I tap ' see all fasts' and then i takes me to the selection menu. I tap the one I want, and it just takes me back to the home screen with the clock and 'see all fasts'. Your app is really buggy and should not be this difficult to get it to work.

I have been using this great app for a while. Today, however, I am not able to edit starting/ending times as I used to. Whenever I spin the hour wheel it revert back to the current time. It is not allowing me to set the time to when I actually my fast a few hours earlier

I like the app in terms of tracking my fast, entering my weight once a week or whenever I choose, and honestly the act of clicking "start fast" works mentally in terms of stopping my feelings of wanting to munch on snacks in the evening. I appreciate that you can edit the end time after the fact as I forgot to click it today, so that's a good feature.

I downloaded all the fasting apps to compare them. This one is the best. Trimmed down and has most all the functionality you need, most importantly it's not bloated with ads. There is a lot that this app does right, like how it starts with notifications turned off and let's you choose which ones you want to turn on. Nice. Dark mode is a nice bonus as well. I downloaded this app with the full intention of paying between 1-5$ for a full app experience free of ads but zero was the best even fo 0$.

The app is very good for tracking how many hours you've fasted and how much you have left. I would've given 5 stars but Zero does not allow you to preset your fasting time. Say you would like to start at 1 am it's not done automatically it'll notify you that you've started but you have to manually press the START FAST button. Other than that it's a great app

Love love love this app! Thank you so much for making it free and without ads ❤️❤️❤️. It has everything I need for fasting. It's simple and quick. The challenges are also fun. The educational content it provides is the cherry on top. I don't pay attention to the stats that much, but I think it has all you might need...

Love the app so far. I would like to see the inclusion of more badges, a mood chart, the ability to also track days I exercise and the days I eat junk food. And I'd like a calendar view. Last but not least, I'd like an ongoing notification in the notification bar during my fasting period showing how many hours since I started fasting.

I really enjoy this app. Makes keeping track of my fast very easy and the supplemental trackers (weight, rhr, etc.) are great too. I've been able to see trends and correlations between the different elements. 👍 Sometimes I wish there was a social/community aspect to the app, but then maybe it would turn into a whole different beast. It's pretty great the way it is.

This is the best fasting app on playstore. Zero ads and really beautiful UI. It's really useful app. I just have a suggestion, try integration with Samsung Health app. It records sleep, heart rate and weight(if you log it), so syncing it would just populate the graph with all the details.

I'm really digging the app for the most part. The fasting timer works excellent, is easy to use, and there's lots of different fasts to choose from, right down to creating a custom fast. I like the history readouts for the fasts as well. Plus it's easy to edit your fasts if you forget to hit start or stop. I do kinda wish you could schedule a fast to start in advance also, but the fast reminders work well enough. The place that I think this app lacks though, is integration with other devices and apps. Yeah, it can sync to GoogleFit, but that's pretty limiting. I'd love to see it able to sync to other popular fitness apps and devices like FitBit and Nokia. And that's the only reason I'm taking one star off. Everything else with the app seems exccellent so far. Even the learn section is helpful. Oh, and out of the many fasting apps I've tried (I've tried so many) this is the only one I've found that's free AND doesn't have ads popping up all over. I was just looking for an app I could pay once to get rid of ads and this so far has blown my hopes out of the water. At least I hope, it's been 4 days so far and no ads yet, but another fasting app I used was similiar until a few days in and all of a sudden ads were everywhere and it made the app too annoying to use. And the only way to rid them was to pay a subscription. I deleted that app. So if that happens with Zero I will update my reveiw, but so far it seems great. My one request Zero developers (besides adding devices to sync with), is if you ever go a paid model, please don't go subscription. There's too many sub services out there these days and I refuse to add any more to my month expenses, especially for something as simple for a fasting app. But I would be happy to pay once to buy the app.

Makes it so easy to keep track of your progress and stops you cheating. You want to beat the countdown. Thing is, you go past it quite easily. Been on a week, now doing a 20:4. Great learning information included, so you understand the theory of why and what you're doing. I feel more alive, fitter and I'm actually losing fat. Done so many diets, but the weight returns afterwards. Fasting for me is the answer, it's so easy. When I diet, I'm hungry all the time, and food is constantly on my mind.

I really didn't think I needed an app for something so simple, but Zero itself is simple and very functional. The app is unobtrusive, while making the process of starting and monitoring fasts easier than normal, to the point of being almost mindless (as a simple task like fasting should be). With its nice features that are useful and not convoluted, Zero is an app anyone with interest in time-restricted eating or fasting could find beneficial to their regimen.

It keeps things simple and for me almost helps gamify fasting, I don't recommend trying to make it a game of how long you can go but it's good to see a consistent average. I tend to do 17/7 and sometimes 18/6. Easy easy easy to use. And free so who can complain.

Great fasting app, with one quibble. It would be great to be able to, instead of just setting the duration of your fast in total hours, set your start and end dates/times for your fast, and for the app to calculate the hours for you. It's not the end of the world, but if I know I'm going to end my fast at 8am on Tuesday, but forget to start the timer Sunday night at exactly 8pm, sometimes it takes an edit or two to get the times to line up accurately.

Excellent app. Very clean design and easy to use to track fasts. Guides and preset popular fasts is also a great feature. It has become a bit buggy in the last few updates. It will randomly lose track of fasting hours even when started and will show "not fasting" clock then requiring manual editing of start time or end time. Needs improvements.

I really like this app! My only problem is the weight chart... while the data is correct when looking at the chart everything has been moved by a couple of kgs so my entry of lets say 60kg ends up looking like 63 kg, which made me feel really bad thinking that I had gained weight in the begging. Please fix this!

This is an amazing app with a beautiful UI/UX design. I love the fact that you can set reminders at the half mark of your fast. This encourages and pushes me to keep going. I've had a great experience with the app so far, and I would totally recommend it to my friends.

Missing very a very obvious feature. Setting random reminders seems to be overkill. This app needs a notification for when the fast end / eating begins then another when eating end and fasting begins. Maybe this is too difficult for their developers. The lack of this feature motivated to try another app.

The what's new section is so you can give us the specific details of the update: what it fixes (specifically what it fixes, not just "bugs'), what it removes and adds etc. Not so you can say that you've updated it. We know that because it's being updated. What we want to know and deserve to know is what the update does

I switched from another app giving me trouble- so far so good! >Update: now that I've used it a couple weeks, I love it! After just completing a 36hr fast this morning I noticed when I set my new fasting type for tonight to 20/4, it kept all my previous fasts 18/6 as met goal! I love that. 👍 App I deleted made it look like I missed goals. I like that you have learning articles and the app itself does not cluttered. Everything is working great!

It is very good app, l love it. I just wish that it is had graph that shows the hours of the day you were fasting(not just how many hours) because there is no meaning to show how many hours in the day you fast if part if the fasting period is in the next day. If there is graph that shows the real hours of the day you were fasting you can start see pattern and discover what is working better for you.

Amazing App! I just finished a five day fast and the educational material is great and very helpful in supporting fasting in a healthy and successful way. I love how you can keep track of everything! Thank you Zero. I'm telling all my friends about this App!

Works wonderfully. Even like the articles and extra information given if you want to learn more. I like the fact that you can put reminders to help you, just in case you're really busy, or forget to start a fast again after finally eating. I also enjoy that you can sync information from your smart watch.

I'm enjoying this app, but it won't save my ongoing fast. I have to change it every day because it defaults to 18:6. I've tried changing it multiple ways, logged out, and emailed the help site, with no results. Aside from this frustration, I have benefited from this otherwise easy to use application.

It.. basically does what it sets out to do, but it's very simple and restrictive in it's offerings. The main dealbreaker for me was that you WILL have to open the app every day and essentially babysit it to make sure it clocks when you start/end fasting, or else it won't let you add it in later. If you didn't log your fast for yesterday, you're screwed out of credit for it. Along with a handful of annoying little bugs that make the user experience annoying, just too much irritation.

I've tried various fasting apps on android before deleting all and keeping this one. This is probably the best option with editing of fasting times and keeping track of fasting history, logging weight, recording bpm. Very user friendly, clean, simple and best of all free! It doesn't have annoying pop ups asking you to subscribe to premium. Huge plus 👍🏻

Excellent tracking tool. I love the fact that it shows the streak of how many days you have done it in a row and all together. It has helped me stay on track and on goal for my 16-19 hour fasts. Also has a great widget to keep track. Excellent app!

It has really grown on me, at first I was super peeved that it wouldn't automatically start & end my fasting, but then I realized that kinda defeats the purpose of getting to use the app lol. This is even better than BodyFast, because you can set your own times and for free, and I think I could actually lose some real weight with this.

It would be good if I had the option to start by marking the time I start eating or fasting and had the reminder to start/stop eating. I also with I had the ability to edit the time I started/stopped eating. I love all the info most! It's got really great info. I find myself only really using it for the resources because the inability to do things previously mentioned render the rest of it mostly useless

Love the app, it brought balance to my eating habits. I would love to also use the other functions of the app, but having to fill them by hand makes it difficult since I forget most of the time. Could it be possible for the app to take sleep and heart rate information form a fitness band for example? I noticed that Google fit can take information about weight from this app, and it also can gather from my mi band. Thanks, and keep up the good work!

It shuts off and stops counting your fast in long fasts. At first i thought it was me so i decided to be careful and write my fast down and mark if i hit start fast in zero. Well, it said, 2 days since last fast, in accurate. Anyway, i just edit the start fast....

Good with the exception of the fasting bars. I really enjoy this app. I love the total of fast and averaged of weight and fast. Yet I dont like seeing the gray bar of me not completing my full fast. I feel like it is shaming me because I didn't make it. Which then makes me wonder if fasting is truly for me. I love fasting and this app for the most part except for the not making your goal hour.

Been using Zero for quite sometime now, and am really happy with it. Straight to the point and do what it's suppose to do. One thing, however, it is quite limited when it comes to compatible partner apps. Would be really great if it's possible to sync it with other health apps like MyFitnessPal and Withings HealthMate, to name a few.

It has been 20 hours for my first fast and I can't explain how awesome this app is. It has walked me through. All my time and accounts up and down from it. It also allows me to put how I'm feeling and write notes if I want to then at the end of it when I'm going to log my day I get to take a picture of the first food that I consume. It's a really cool diary style Fast Tracker

I don't know if the developers are aware, but the latest update causes the app to be slow to start and sluggish when trying to transition to different pages (fasts, history, etc.) Aside from that, it's great, but having my entire phone stall when trying to load the app is frustrating.

I know this is a small gripe, but I am unable to do any fast timers that include 29 February. It keeps setting all times during 29 Feb as 1 March. Other than that issue, very simple timer for fasting. This makes my life a lot easier, as I am trying to incorporate more fasting into my routine. It also has many articles which help in understanding both the benefits of and the how to of fasting.

I don't know what's going on with this app recently. I've been manually inputting my fast time since I forget to press the start and end button. Recently it's been giving me problems and keeps adjusting my times on it's own. When I change the time, it adjusts the day and when I keep trying to put PM it won't let me and puts AM.

Although this app has helped a lot, I'd really like to see the app be more encouraging for exceeding the time goal as opposed to the punishing check box that reminds the user of failure. Reward your users for exceeding expectation, and the new goal will be to exceed. Reminding of failure, all too often, creates self defeat.

I like the timer portion of the app, but the weight logging if very glitchy. On Dec 28th I entered 213, but it says 96.6, and Jan 4th and 7th are incorrect. I deleted them and reentered, but it still shows up this way. It won't let me delete Feb 19. Weight tracking is very important to me and I wished this worked, because I really like how easy and usable this app could be. I have an Android.

I was enjoying the app until I forgot to start tracking one of my fasts. Followed directions on how to edit the times, however it isn't saving with the correct start time/date. Not sure if the leap day (Feb 29th) is throwing it off, but it let's me select any other day before the 29th. If I select the 29th, it defaults back to today (March 1). Disappointing. It throws off all my totals and averages. Also stopped receiving notifications but haven't changed my settings. 🤷‍♀️

Bugs!! This app is only good for count of fasting hours. The edit option for fasting start & stop times does not work. I've entered my daily weight ... the graph shows weight higher than logged & weights logged before this week were reduced approximately 45% by app. App is worthless if data cannot be edited by user, graphed correctly and not changed by another source than the user.

I like that I can change fast type during fast. Weight part doesn't accurately show weight on display. It looks higher until clicked. Wish to record blood pressure. I'd like the option NOT to average everything. I want to see actual numbers, not averages. It screws up my long fasts if i want to keep track of shorter periods of fast like 8 hours. I have to delete them to keep my average up. Sleep part didn't work for me bc I don't always sleep before 12am, so it records that sleep for next day.

Just started using this for intermittent fasting to help with weight loss at the recommendation of my doctor. one week in and I'm really liking having the app to track my fasts. it is a big help in keeping me honest. I also like being able to record and track weight and heart rate in the app. Adding blood pressure tracking would be great as well.

I am really liking this app. Easy to use and has a lot of information. But on the history tab with all the graphs, I understand having an average for all of them except weight. I don't want to see my average weight. I want to see my current weight. I wish there was a way to change it. I also wish there was a way to go back and change previous fasts. If I need to change a time on one for example. Just lacking some customization.

I sorta like Zero but I'm having issues using the start/end. I often have to edit the start/end times or cancel the fast and re-enter the info. Maybe it's me. I'll try it another week and see if I can figure out why I'm having these issues.

Five stars. Easy to use. No bloatage. I'm a fan of simple apps (personally I'd even styrip it down even more), and Zero is almost right there. Cool thing, it keeps running even after phone problems. My system died on me the other day and had to factory reset it. After recovering all the apps saw Zero running, still tracking my fast! Impressive.

Love this app, clean interface, good stats, and nice learning section. Would love it even more if stages of fasting (e.g. glycogenolysis, ketosis, autophagy, etc) were displayed during the fast (as I have seen on some other fasting apps) to motivate and educate. This could be as a small, discreet button or toggled, as I understand the UI has a beautiful minimalist feel to it which devs may want to maintain. Keep up the great work!!

I love this app to track my fasts. It's very easy to use, and I've used it to track my fasts from 24-72 hours. You can easily edit fasting times even after you've started. I'd love to see fitness features added and syncing with other apps; track steps, runs, workouts, calories burned, etc. and be able to be synced with MyFitnessPal, etc. for accurate tracking.

Simple to use. Does exactly what I need it to. Get more features on other apps.. but I find them over complicated. I need a timer for fasting.. and that's exactly what this does. No fuss.. would recommend. Great for logging weight too.

Useful, simple, easy to use app. I'm used to the IF lifestyle so didn't think I needed a timer - surprised to find how helpful it is! Definitely helps me optimize my fasts. Wish it had a setting for encouraging fast cycling or alternate-day fasting as I tend to fast too regularly and need to keep my metabolism limber.

Why am I unable to set the start of a fast to sometime last night!? The timer keeps on jumping back today, and from PM to AM? Edit: the developer has fixed the issue and it is back to being my favourite fast tracking app! I wish there were more widget options like a clock widget to show how long the fast has elapsed, etc.

I like how I can manually change the fast and eating window times.... I've used a few diff apps and am experiencing which one fits me best. Its motivating to see the clock running. I like Zero Fasting Tracker, however it would be nice if the time counter can run/show at the top in my notifications. Another suggestion would be if the app can continuously have the hour plans running without me going into it to log my on and off times each day. Ie: one week, month, year, etc.

EDIT: the issue I was experiencing has been resolved! Would have been 5 stars if not for the recent bug disabling the feature of a mending start and end dates/times of each fast. Been using for over 50 days and it's been a really useful tool to track my 16:8 fast, however since the most recent update I can't amend the start or end times of a fast, meaning if I miss the exact time I start or end on the app then I can't record that fast. Without this being fixed the app is useless for me.

I used to try to track IF manually & get confused. This app is so easy and does it all. I love it so much! NO glitches either! It gives a history of how long you fast, exceed ur fast, choose the fast to do that day, journal how u felt, log weight, heart rate, sleep, etc. It gives tips, reminders, & badges for fasting. It has a timer to tell you how much longer to go. If you forget to set the app you can go back & set it and edit the time! Daily must have app!

I really like it but please add a thing in the notification bar that tells us how long we've already fasted and how much time we have to go and stuff. I find that this is really motivating and keeps you on track- I usually just forget about the app which sucks.

Love this app.. I've tried about 3-4 I.F. apps and this one has been the best for me. It has a simple and attractive interface, the user experience is seamless, and the widget is supreme! Please don't ever change that widget! App offers dark mode, and plenty of helpful info to get you more educated and stay motivated

Good app, it works well but basic. I'd like to see other useful features such as connecting to other fitness wearables such as Fitbit, so I don't have to enter my heart rate, exercises and sleep manually. And motivational messaging during the fast stages, for eg ketosis autophagy etc would encourage me to open the app to check my progress more. Btw I can't log weight retrospectively which is annoying. It would be good to log fasts and weight for the past.

Love it. This is the first time i've tried intermittent fasting. First 2days are hard but then you become use to it and you feel full. Keep that water going. This app is great. You achieve your goal more that you would on your own. Its easy to use and helpline is great.

Was so much better, maybe one of the best free fasting apps out there, until it started having bugs as of recently. In my case the timer since last fasted stops counting for no reason. I specifically went for this app because it showed time since last fasted. After contacting support asking if by reinstalling Zero I will lose collected badges and never getting a reply: 2 stars until you fix your problems. I can see here that I ain't the only one. After that you will have 5 from me.

I find this very useful for recording my fasts and keeping track of the durations and hours. I don't fast at the same times each day, so the app comes in really handy then. It's also good at reminding me that my fast is approaching. There are some useful articles too.

Excellent motivator .... The thing is the syncronization of data on ios and android devices needs more attention as some of the data are well synced such as timed and recent fast graphs while sleep hours, heart rate and weight are not synced and you need to load those manually. Appreciate your attendance to such minor details for more perfection. Thank you

Smart and simple way to track fasts. Easy to understand and the simplicity makes it very pretty to look at. It's does a few things exceptionally well, with great resources to assist in making the best of IF.

Amazing app. Helps me focus my fast and I set up my Fitbit + Fit2Fit to update Google Fit to stream info into this. I would love it just as much more if it could directly connect with Fitbit! Much love. Shout out to Dr. Peter Attia for representing this app and just for who he is!

Keep track of remaining time during a fast, time since last fast, sleep, resting heart rate, weight, and personal fast stats. It has options for different lengths of fast from 13 to 36 hours and there's a custom fast option as well.

Recently it had fast running that I already ended so now my entire streak and data is messed up. Please fix this. It's been pretty slow lately. I'll click start and it takes a few seconds to register the click or I'll just simply open the app it loads oddly before going to normal. It's also started a fast when I tried to end a fast so two would be running at the same time.

I downloaded this so I could track my fasting period so I could learn some discipline because I didn't understand why I couldn't lose weight. To my surprise I learnt alot about my own bad habits with snacking at night etc (I never thought much of it before) but now I crave less sugary things and I've lost 4 kilos in a month with the 16:8 fast (mind you I just gave birth two months ago and losing weight is not easy) Will continue this for sure.

5 stars because it's my favorite for tracking fasting of all the apps I tried. My only complaint is that it seems to "corrupt" my weight log, and slowly over time the weights I've entered change on their own and aren't even close to what I've entered... This doesn't ruin the app for me though, because I use this as a companion with Google Fit.

Amazing app! It is easy to use and I love how you can customize your own fast. This app helped me get into fasting and I also love how you can edit your starting and finishing time. I would highly recommend it.

Total fasting hours and fasting stats are way off. Hours in the "journey" tab are accurate but it's too bad the averages and cumulative stats are not. App is easy to use and has a great mood feature! Hope they fix it. This is my fave fasting app

I was ok at intermitent fasting before trying this app, but after downloading it, it just makes it so much easier. It helps a lot with taking out distractions as well. The app will tell me when my fast is done, so I tend not to think about it when I'm actually fasting.

Is a basic fasting tracker. Wish it would give more information like how many hours of ketosis we've reached. Also, the entry method is cumbersome and changes itself randomly, so you always have to double and triple check things. Change it to selecting a day on the calendar and entering time, rather than the scrolling selection, please!

This is by far my most favorite fasting app. It is super simple and easy to use. It is also very pretty in the display and nothing over the top that would make it hard to use. After looking at some other apps, I think there is only one thing that would make this even better, if it had a week fasting schedule, so you didn't have to plan one yourself. But other than that, amazing!

Very easy to use, stable online when I want to use it... Never crashes.! Allows me to track and set reminders for when to fast and how long I've been in a fast. Calendar, graphs, charts are great. Fun badges can been earned among the way, for completing your pre set challenges!

Love the app. Changed my Fasting app from another one to this one as endorsed by a friend. There seem to be an issue with the Weight graph. The plot points in the graph are incorrect when compared to the Y-axis numbers.

It does what I needed it to do; tracks things like fasts, weight and heart rate to help me get a sense of the bigger picture of my weight loss journey. So far, this app has been a very useful tool for me.

Great app to track your fasting with some added features. My only bone to pick is that I wish there is a simpler way to input dates and times of previous fastings (done before installing this app) aside from scrolling through the date & time wheel as it can get very tedious as you go back to earlier fasts.

Works perfectly - Easy to choose from a list of preset fasting schedules or just as easily make your own. My only suggestion for improvement: It would be useful to have the ability to assign different fasts to different days, for example, an 8/16 fast 6 days out of the week + a 20/4 fast 1 day a week (on a preset schedule)

Really pleased with this app. Helps me a lot when fasting. I have two wishes for next update. 1 - To be able to make a plan for a week ahead, not just one long fast, but many fastes after each other. 2 - To see information as the time counts down to eating window. Information about when one approx goes into ketosis and so on.

The concept is great. But there are a lot of glitches. It will not graph my weight correctly, and saving information (such as weight and a fast) can be very slow or not save. And when I go back to the app a few hours later it still hasn't saved.

While the application itself is great it has a game breaking bug. When I try to start a new fasting period in the evening, it shows me that I am already fasting even though it clearly also shows that my fasting ended in the morning.

I love the app, I would like to see a dry fasting tab in the custom fasting options (fasting made by muslims from before sunrise until sunset, no water). The holy month of Ramdan is 29 or 30 days of dry fasting for your information, but it can be preformed also on Mondays and Thursdays of every week.

Like the app but hate when i forget to stop my fasting or start it i cannot adjust the time. I don't know if that's because they don't want us to cheat but if someones going to cheat they will. Also wish this app cant suggest healthy recipes or share pics of other people on the app.

A great tool for tracking your fasts, it helps greatly with accountability, plus adds relevant tracking metrics like weight, heart rate and sleep log. It also provides useful and helpful articles to help with all things fasting.

Great app. One issue for me is that you cannot see much detail on your fasting history. Once complete, you only see the duration. You cannot see our edit the timing or the photo attached. Also, allow the photo to be uploaded from the gallery!

I will start a fast and the next morning it shows I never started the fast. Sometimes it is the oppoaite...I will end a fast and later when I go to start one it has jumped back that I never ended the last one. This happens ever few days. So often it has happened that I am real careful to double check what I did it right.

This app is focused on your perspective, and provides gentle assistance to change behaviour. This tool had helped me the most with weight loss. Tracking feeling over time and promoting healthy behaviour was key, that said there is conflicting advice on 24h limit on fasting in the community. Stay safe. Best of luck.

I liked this app at first. But I've ran into an issue with the weight tracker. My previous readings are all wrong now. It's showing that I'm ~95 pounds lighter than what I had logged. But I like the fasting/eating timer and that there are no ads. I'm currently looking for other trackers

It's a great app for who wants to start a fasting routine. Simple and elegant design. I could easily keep track of my progress and there're many choices of fasting pathways for you to choose. I wish it would be able to sync the date with google fit.

Great app, Used it to log about 100 days of fasting, issues in logging Feb 29... Update: For those who have issue logging 29 Feb, here is a trick... 1- Force stop Zero app 2- turn data off, also wireless. 3- Change phone date and time, to whatever you want. 4- Open Zero, start fasting and Done:)

This app is very handy for keeping track of my fasts. However, I was disappointed to discover that it has a hard limit of seven days for custom fast timers. I was going to do an 8 day and 18 hour fast and now it looks like I'll have to track it as two fasts here, what a pain! I wonder why there is such a limit, really!?

Leap day killed this app. I used to LOVE Zero, have been intermittent fasting for almost 3 years. Then around leap day I tried to input a fast since I forgot to stop and start the timer. It kept switching to AM but I wanted PM. Just so disappointed after all this time it has been a wonderful app.

A very aesthetically designed and simple app. There's no way that you can complicate using this, the UI is seamless. They have a variety of timers for different fasts as well as several articles written about intermittent fasting in general. Very nice, would recommend!

I would have given you a 4 but the app suddenly can't do math. I fasted 6pm to 12pm for my 18 hour goal and the app shows I didn't meet my goal. It's happened twice this week. I just checked to see if I needed to update..nope.

What happened?? I have loved my Fitbits and the app for years. But I got the Versa Lite at Christmas, and it was great until whatever update turned it to trash! It never syncs, can never connect, and all text functionality is gone. Straight up gone for months now. Updates are supposed to bring a product "up", Fitbit. Now a have a pretty piece of trash that can't function or connect. Awesome. Fix your software, stat.

It's a good app, but it won't connect. I tried to change the watch screen and it just stopped the home screen on the watch from working. I got this as an early birthday present, and I like it except for the broken home screen (still trying to fix) and the fact that it takes FOREVER to sync! It's a decent app for just wanting to track you working out, but it isn't extremely good. Overall, 7.5/10

I used the GPS feature on my fit bit watch for the second time today, 4/23/20, and now my app is crashing only when I select "exercise this week" in the app. I have uninstalled and reinstalled and it still does the same thing. I haven't had any problems with the app until now. The app is really great and full of great info. It's really disappointing to me that my app is crashing all of a sudden. Such a great app.

I have had the Versa Lite now for a couple of months. I had trouble when I first got it with syncing to the app. Fitbit support told me to do everything I was already doing. Finally I got it to connect and had no issues with it. I updated it this week, and started having troubles with it again. It would crash every time I tried to go into my exercise log, so I uninstalled and reinstalled the app. Now I am back to the app not finding and syncing my versa. This is beyond frustrating.

I have a charge 2, and this app works great for me. I can honestly and without drama say that it changed my life. For years (decades) I have tracked my food and tried to track activity but the task relationship between intake and output was a fantasy based on what I thought at the moment (of my exercise). The biggest surprise was the number of steps per day and the direct impact that had on my overall calories. And I see the direct correlation between regular yoga and resting heart rate.

If you're looking for a free app that syncs with your Fitbit and records your workouts, it's great. You can manually add other types of workouts besides walking/running, like strength and yoga. Overall I like the app, but I wish I didn't have to go to the website to log food. Also wish I could turn off the sleep 'score' and just look at my sleep data. Would love to try the premium option, but it's way too expensive.

My only problem is with the premium (paid) features. There's lots of workouts. It would be great to get to mark favorites. Being able leave notes would be nice too. This would help us to remember which workouts we enjoyed or didn't. The sleep songs, stories, meditations should simply end when they are finished in the app should be allowed to go dark. Using a pop-up asking if we'd like to record the workout defeats the purpose and drains the battery. Ideally we should be asleep at the end.

Loved this app. Now it never syncs and I have to restart my phone in order to get it to find my device and sync. Also and even more frustrating us that it doesn't measure my sleep anymore. I'm lucky if I get sleep info every other night. Very frustrating. Update: syncing issue a little better, but now I cant log exercise. Every time I try to open it, it crashes. Come on

I don't know if it's my phone, app, fitbit or me but I can never get it to sync. Currently stuck with the wrong time on my fitbit because I can't sync it. I've had this problem with the charge 3 and charge 2. It's incredibly frustrating when I can't use my fitbit to the fullest ability. I've tried resetting, uninstalling, having it plugged in to charge, deleted all other Bluetooth devices except my fitbit and any other hacks on the internet. It shouldn't be this hard to just sync.

I would give five stars, if not for the fact that this new app will not allow me to receive notifications on my tracker. I have upgraded to a newer phone as well as a new tracker and still running in to the same issue. Just says a phone restart is necessary inorder to turn notifications on again. Which I've done several times, several. Although I've only worn a Fitbit on my wrist since 2016, it may be time to invest in a different company now.

I've had my inspire hr for a less than a year, up until now I had zero complaints. Not sure what happened this week but the app started glitching. Data would be grayed out, it wouldn't recognize my workout, would add minutes to my workout. The fitbit itself works but all the information on the app is important for me to see especially while I'm trying to lose weight. I've tried all the fixes that I've seen on the other comments nothing works. FIX THIS IMMEDIATELY!

I am currently frustrated with the Fitbit app. I've had it for a year and it's worked well up until a week or 2 ago. It suddenly isn't connecting to the internet. It's not giving me any of my sleep info, activity info... etc. None of the tracking is showing for the last few weeks. I recently decided to try the premium free trial and I'm wondering if that is what's affecting the app. Not being able to connect to the internet does not allow me access to any of the premium options either.

I used to change my clock face with my Android 6 but with the new update I can not anymore. I tried with Windows 10 as well, same problem. But this bug exist with Windows 10 and Android 6. The support was helpful but the message I got was that some apps will not be supported in older phones. Also, I learned when I select an app for my fitbit in the My Apps or All Apps, it won't go through the selected app. It will just load forever. This problem is also found on Windows 10.

"Device not found" (even when it's sitting right there). Hasn't synced for over a month now. I've had it almost 3 years so maybe this is their way of forcing me to upgrade? Still works as a watch and still counts steps, I'd delete the app but I use it to lay GPS tracks for trail mapping. Don't think I'll buy another Fitbit when this one croaks though. Worked fine for a few years.

i'm an active person anyway, but FitBit has been beneficial and eye-opening (I usually reach 10k by mid-day just by my normal routine). the app on my phone gives access to all my "stats" plus challenge friends. UPDATE: I've had my FitBit for over a year. I still love it and rely on it every day. I need to explore more of the possibilities it offers, but regardless, I'm very happy I have it.

The latest problem is still the app telling me "no internet connection" even when the Wi-Fi is on. I've tried the different fit bit community suggestions but nothing changes. I keep hoping an update will fix this problem. I have the latest version 3.17. I really liked the fit bit app when it worked. Before this app only needed a Bluetooth connection to sync. I like my fit bit. Please help.

Don't like the new look of the app. I liked the old look better. And the menstrual cycle part of the app is not working right. Won't let me put in my day's and save them, just keeps changing on it's own. So that's useless right now. Please fix bug's. And I miss the old look. Also I feel like I already paid enough for the fitbit I shouldn't have to pay for the extra's in the app if I want them. Or it should at least be cheaper. Kinda pricey if u ask me.

After the recent update, I don't get any text or call notification on the watch. I restarted my phone several times because it shows in the settings page of the app, but it didn't solve the problem. I restarted my versa 2 as well, but that doesn't the problem either. It is quite annoying, as I miss many important calls and notifications.
