For those people that said app is Crashing. It was an error from de Google Maps Server and it caused crashes not just to Lyft but to all the apps that use Google Maps as its core for showing maps.

All and all never had a bad experience using the service, until today. I was going through my bank statement and noticed a charge from lyft that didn't make sense (not for a ride or anything, just an extra charge)and when I went to the "Help" section to at the very least see what the charge was for, there was nowhere to report it. It rubbed me the wrong way. It was only a couple dollars, but now I have to comb through my statements to see if/how many times I've been charged it to figure it out.
Decent matches usually but lately it has been 10 minute waits then 2 minutes until arrival they cancel and I'm stuck with another 10 minute wait.
Good app, the discounts don't add up to much, but I'm grateful the app is simple and straightforward for nights I'm too slammed to drive my sorry butt home.
The app keeps closing and I cannot get a lyft. Fix it, this is ridiculous!!

Love this app use it all the time just ... I wish that I would see discounts for using it so much and being loyal. Also I wish that they made it a lot easier to add an edit a trip.. there is often times that I will use my account to have people picked up from different locations I do wish that the app I would ask if I was at the location before automatically inserting it for me. Other than that i couldn't be happier...
The app wont open at all. It just tells me the app keeps stopping and tells me to send feedback or to close the app. Same issue with Uber.
For some reason the app keeps crashing.....which is inconvenient for people who are trying to get home.
App worked fine until yesterday now it has been crashing and this is how l get to and from work. Have trouble shot and tried everything! Help!

When I requested the ride the price was $19.91...but after the ride the app charged more $10.45...I do not accept that because when I asked for the ride was one price, and after the ride other price?! how can the app do that?! It's like you see a product in the self for a price and when you are going to pay is other!! Sorry, but I am poor, if I knew that the ride was $31 I would rather walk and take the bus!!

Was gonna use Uber, but Uber refused my numbers while trying to schedule a ride; it verified them fine during setup though, what a hassle. Lyft worked fine though, they just wanted a second credit card, which could have been an issue cause I only had the one physical card on me, but I keep that info in a password file... So yeah, FYI, you might need to have 2 credit cards while setting up!.. I almost had to call a taxi!?

I liked this app until I changed my phone number several months ago. I followed the instructions for changing the number on the account, but have never succeeded in changing the number. Connsequenty, I am locke out of my account. I have also tried creating a new account, but cannot. Because of this, I cannot use Lyft. It would help if I could communicate with a human, but I cannot --- only with artificial "intelligence".I will take my business elsewhere. Not recommended due to lack of user support which is needed at critical times. The service is thus unreliable.
App isn't working today. Booked a ride it charged my card then app froze and would not reopennso now I don't know if ride is coming. Very Disapointed

App works well most of the time, but when I left my phone in Lyft the experience was miserable. First, with Lyft you don't receive a receipt for at least 16-24 hours so was unable to contact the driver until 24 hours later. Response from customer service took 27 hours, and you CANNOT login to your account on the web. There is no web portal and since I didn't have my phone to receive a code to login, I had to wait all day to figure out what was going on, how is there no web login to track rides?

It seems like every month this app gets worse. I was stranded at work because the app reset my card which i didn't have on me. I have yet to recieve a response (8hrs ago). Ended up walking 4.5 miles home. Two weeks ago the app made me late for work because it kept giving me a driver and when the driver reached 1-3 minutes away it would start to look for another one. It did this 5 times causing me to be a hour late. (no response from CS on this yet either) I spend over $300 a mth. DO BETTER!

Charges no matter what! drivers sit there for 15+ minutes in the same spot when you cancel your charged. all of the sudden my card dosent work added another one that works but asks for a third card for my first card cannot receive help anywhere the hell section is horrible seems like this app is ran like bots and we all know how that goes.... POST A NUMBER AND GET SOME REAL HELP HERE LYFT!

There's is no option to make multiple trips & then return home. It's been an issue with several rides. I've had to experience this on several trips & it was very upsetting. The driver should have more knowledge of how to handle this type situation without threatening or insinuating that I would have to be put out of the Lyft ride so that he could take a separate ride from someone else...& leave me stranded. Worst ride yet.👎👎👎😶😶😶

There needs to be an option where I can rate the drivers who don't like too pick up passengers, and waste your time. Because I'm tired of waiting for drives and they play games and don't show up or drive in circles

The app itself is ok, but a lot of your drivers are so lazy for 5 easy dollars! This has happened so much already where I do not know where the app sends them to pick me up, supposedly "no need to walk," but I can never find them. That itself is ok, but what is not ok is how your drivers are not responding to calls or text messages! They ignore me until they can cancel the ride. Such a waste of money and EVERY time I take lyft I am late to work because I have to find a new ride. So unfair!

I started having this issue this month when the pricing of the ride isn't stated to be true. I can confirm a ride that clearly says $13 but once confirmed, it'll bump up to almost $18. I don't understand why Lyft even shows the price if it isn't even true. This has occured 3x already within the past week. Also a note to drivers. We can't be picked up in the middle of the street where there's no sidewalk and please don't drive backwards at the entrance of the freeway.

It usually works terribly for several reasons: wrong pick up points, wrong destination points, shared rides end up costing almost the same as single rides, drivers can be nice or terrible (pleasant to deal with or the opposite, smooth drivers or others will make you vomit)... in conclusion, there is no warranty that it will be a satisfactory service at all.

The app is OK, except its map, which is terrible! 1. The current location is usually wrong by 1 or 2 blocks. 2. In Shared Economy, the map for walking to pickup destination has no arrow for direction. The round dot keeps jumping from one place to another. I had to copy the destination to Google Map every time I need to walk.
Works well.
My app keeps closing, infact, it doesn't even open when I click on it no matter how many times I trouble shoot it 🙄

Never had a problem before now. I was using this app to get to a work function, and my job will reimburse the ride so long as my home address matches my ride pick up address. I used lyft four days in a row, one ride each, and each receipt had the wrong address. Making me lose $80 in reimbursements. They apparently can't give me a correct receipt due to fraud problems. Which I understand, but if they're saying they're picking me up NOT at my pick up location, they're already commiting fraud.
Apps not working anymore and driver cant follow a blue line dont get me started on customer service and they made hard to link phones to the same account with the 1 card most people have

Need to fix your location tracking. Driver is going to wrong location and ended up.leaving when it was clearly not the place. We couldn't even make it there in 4 minutes before he left. I took a screenshot showing where our ride was and where we were. We tried 3 times and 3rd time we had to walk long to get picked up. Not fun or acceptable.

When I first started using this app, everything was fine. Not long after, it began acting up by not recognizing me but eventually it worked itself out. I found Lyft to be very dependable and efficient. I usually get a driver within a very short time. I have only had good experiences with the drivers.
App crashed continuously on me yesterday. I'm a fan and an avid user I was forced to hail a cab in the bronx amid this pandemic. I'm not mad just saying I hope that Was apart of the update

Normally I'd give 5 stars but for the past week I've been completely unable to get a ride. I search for 30+ minutes for it to not connect to any drivers even when showing drivers in the area. I've never had this issue until earlier this week and the app has become pretty much unusable since

Poor GPS tracking (for passenger location and driver) and slow to load where the vehicle is on the way to pickup. Also has issues choosing a route that is efficient. ALWAYS unreliable arrival times. It will say what the early and latest times are when choosing a ride (which I usually do if I'm running LATE getting somewhere). Better to take public transit instead - same time, costs less Not worth the price of a ride - which nearly doubled or more (even for a lyft walking-pool) in the last week.

The app works ok, but most of the driving go to the wrong adress and expect me to go where they are within one minute. I put my adress for something!! One driver went to a place that was 10-15 walking from my home and was expecting me to go where he was before he depart in one minute...like what? I'm gonna stop using this app.

This app started of pretty good never had issues until yesterday. I could not get a Lyft driver scheduled for the time I needed to travel. Then once I tried to cancel the ride it would still show searching for Lyft driver. After closing the app and reopening the app it still shows searching for Lyft drivers nearby. So I finally decided to uninstall the app then reinstall. I check my bank account today only to find out I've been charged twice from lyft from rides I did not confirm. How?

🙄 The drivers change constantly! You don't get anywhere on ⌚ because the drives 99.99% of the ⌚ are learning to use the GPS with you at the moment. Their lyft signal for the driver app is undependable, it breaks 👇 and you end up having to Google map it yourself from your phone. Do not expect to get somewhere at a certain ⌚ cuz by the times the drivers in themselves decide who's going to drive you, you'll be 30 to 45 minutes late. It is the 20th time it happens to me from multiple accounts. 🤷

So many things have changed with the updates. It doesn't show any cars in the area now and wait times are 15 to 20 minutes for drivers that are across town (I live in Atlanta). It will confirm a ride then switch to five different drivers before I actually get one to pick me up. I used to love this app and service. Now not so much.
I had to change my rating... The app has not been working for almost a week now... Please fix the issue
The Lyft app will not work with Android v4.4. Very frustrating!

Absolutely frustrating app. The GPS sucks and the service is even worse. One time someone took my ride and instead of asking why I cancelled it just charged me the $5 fee. Sometimes drivers get lost and I cant tell if theyre getting closer or further away because the gps decides to fling the car Icon miles away from where Im waiting. The app also thinks I live in a parking lot nearby. I wouldnt recommend this app to most people unless it was the only choice available.

Used this app as an emergency, last minute option. I was surprised w the reasonable fare for my one way 'Lyft' to a Drs appt across town. Now I use it all the time for planned activities; saving more money. It's the perfect alternative for ppl on the GO, no time for long rides w Public Transportation, needing a little privicy and on a budget. It's like paying $1 per mile! No surprise fares!
Helpful to get me rides. However there was a bug on here in which it would not open anymore.

This app used to be good now you have useless updates to constantly cause problems left and right I really liked it at 1st but now this app is less than worthless dirt and ash have more value I cant even create a new account. I created a new email and everything its been like this for a whole month. I deleted my old account and used the "Help" center it tells you what you already know. Ive never been this frustrated with an app before.

The gps changes my pick up address to a diffrent parking lot in my apartments so I ALWAYS have to call the lyft driver to tell the correct address. The area I live in is very spaced out and not a lot of drivers around but they ALWAYS cancel after confirming pick up and then I have to wait for another driver to confirm only for them to cancel. Once they confirm they shouldn't be able to cancel.

Prices are ridiculous and when they claim to be giving you a discount you pay the exact same or more then without the "discount". The saver/save mode is penny difference to just getting your own ride. Before Lyft was affordable and because of that i used it all the time but now Lyft is Cattering to the rich. Not everyone can afford $20-$30 round trip when your trip is 3 miles. If you travel one mile it starts at $7 everytime now. Before it was $3 maby $4.

Got stuck with the "add a second credit card" problem. I guess MasterCard doesn't work? And no, there's no issue with credit limit/balance on my card. To top it off, I can't even delete the card that Lyft won't accept. Since I only have one credit card, guess I'll just stay with Uber.

The thing I hate about this app is when it tries to charge payment to Google pay it comes back declined. Or pending. Its Infact not declined nor pending. I have spoken to Lyft support about this problem and they denied it with screen shots. As a new Lyft customer it's concerning to see this simple miscommunication of payments not rectified for some time now. Fix your damn payment system LYFT! Everything else is good. Estimated wait times, driver allerts to eta & price quotes to actual charges

It got me a safe and comfortable ride. Beyond that, I have no trust or faith in Lyft. It won't allow deletion of payment info, as they initially tell you -- you have to add other payment info before you delete the first. Why? Deleting your account takes up to 60 days. Agents are not provided articles to assist with Privacy concerns. It takes 60 days to delete an acct. Unbelievable ... Lyft has more rights to my info than law enforcement. Never EVER again. So much more to say but no room.
Been using this app for years and for the last 2 days the app keeps crashing.

Why even give us an option to upgrade to faster rides. Yeah i understand upgrading to nicer cars, or bigger cars, but faster just means the closest car will be overlooked for the sake of a few more dollars. The rides were affordable, but in recent times the prices can no longer be concidered competitive to other apps, and frankly not worth it compared to others.

I haven't been able to update the debit card information I want to use. I've also tried to enter two different credit cards and that doesn't work. The HELP tab doesn't help resolve the problem either. I've heard from Uber riders that they have been having this same issue with Lyft.

When I first started using this app I chose it over Uber because of the prices now I price compare each ride and it is always more than Uber from at the lowest $3 and can go all the way up to pass $10 pair one way ride and I'm starting to think about deleting this app all together because every single time is always more price-wise than Uber and at a time like this we need a price break where are the old Lyft prices? I can't even tip because the prices are too high
Easy, fast, no issues installing and setting sign in.

Lyft won't accept ANY of my cards for getting rides. But they accepted one of them to buy ride pass...which I cannot use. So it's like I was robbed of $4.99. The discount was applied but every time I add a card it says to add a new one because that one couldn't be accepted. Give me my money back Lyft since I can't use the ride pass! Uber would never!

Tired of expected times being continually pushed ahead. Sometimes I'll also drop a pin and it will show differently for the driver. The only reason I usually request a Lyft is if I'm running late, so if the projected time doesn't actually hit it's mark, I may as well save money and take transit to get there at the same time
Crashy! This morning the app has crashed multiple times. Thankfully, I had another rideshare app setup.
The app keeps crashing on me this has been going on for over a week. I can't afford tookeep using Uber over your app

I will never use lyft service again, pay for a ride and upon confirming ride immediately get charged, just to wait for 10 minutes in the freezing cold for the app to "cancel" my ride and to be told that there was no charge. From now on I'd rather walk than deal anyone associated with this "Service" again.

This app is just terrible. It does not accept any of my major credit cards. I have a freedom and Sapphire Chase card which Lyft is having issues with. I have been using Uber but I want the discount I receive from Lyft using my Chase cards. This issue has never been resolved which is a known issue with Lyft Tech teams. Get you app fixed with all the payment issue you guys are aware off.

had so much trouble with the app when I booked my room but thankfully the host was super nice & helped me out. as for the service in helping out people from the airbnb app or support staff, is HORRIBLE. if I wasnt for my host who was very nice enough I would of been without a room after being charged for it because of problem with it verify my card. saying they sent 2 small transactions onto my account & to check them and write the amount but they never showed up on my account. it was bad.

This app benefits hosts more than guests when it comes to accommodation. Hosts can set ridiculous terms and conditions for their cancellation policy and you are going to lose a lot more money than going to book from a proper hotel or serviced apartments. When I gave feedback to them about their unfair policy, instead of making it fairer, they make it more unfair for guests. I am referring to their strict cancellation policy where they used to indicated "48 hours and 14 days before check in" will receive full refund. However, they only took into consideration of 48 hours. Now, the policy is changed to that you can only get full refund if you cancel within 48 hours. Moreover, the cancellation policies are not clearly indicated to you when you are reserving. I will not recommend using their services.

Great way to run an Airbnb as a host. BUT it is slow, the messaging part of the app does not work well (sometimes a new message doesn't show up and I only know it's there because I also get a text with half the message or it won't load any messages and be completely blank). Many guests don't read everything and I feel like that is partly because there are too many sections. It should be easier for them to find important information. The app overall is slow. There needs to be some system updates

In my opinion, Airbnb is the best hosting app. I say this because I used several times until now and everything was perfect. If you have the smallest problem, you can write cu Airbnb support and your problem is solved with calm and patience. On the other hand I need to say that due the COVID virus situation, my flight was cancelled and in our county we had state of emergency. Because of this they made a full refund in 2 days after I sent the needed proof. I will always recommend Airbnb!

My first stay must've been a stroke of luck, because I found a lovely hostess that worked with me and my girlfriend when the apps features became limited. I haven't been able to book a place since. Critical features don't work. When I'm prompted to verify my card info by confirming micro transactions, the entry boxes do not allow me to enter the correct numbers. This is the 2nd time I've had to verify card info with no support on Airbnb's end. I had to call my bank twice in the first instance

Unprofessional Service They host have good liberty, I used AirBnB and figured out why hotels are far better option. When reserving a place the first thing you expect is privacy and unfortunately it wasn't the case. Stayed in the hosts house with hosts also staying and sharing the same premises They did not allowed us to use the kitchen which was a part of the reservation neither they made us any comfortable or explained what all areas we have access to. Keep AirBnB as your very last option!

I like Airbnb. But they took away the function I really found convenient and enjoyed which was where you were able to pay less up front and more later. I was going to reserve a place for half price today but suddenly found out that they got rid of my option. Now I'm a bit sad and worried the place I want will get taken since I can't get it yet due to the option being gone. Hopefully it won't get taken for the dates I need it for... This option was also what made them unique and different.

I tried 10 TIMES to change my password. When I finally could do it, I still couldn't access the app because inconveniently for them I changed my phone a couple of months ago so I need to get a text with a code, which I got...only to get a note that reads "You are not allowed to complete this action." This is why I stop using Airbnb, WAY to complicated. I get the security part, but Im just RETURNING to the app. This is so annoying. Poor hosts, I see why they complain so much.

I used this for the first time to book a house for my wedding party to stay at and get ready in for our wedding day plus spend part of our honeymoon in. I booked the house in February + paid the 50%. The next 50% was due in September. I was just charged the remainder without any notice or permisson. Reached out to customer service and no explanation or apologies. Very disappointed since I've heard so many good things about this app. This was a HUGE chunk of money I dont have while not working.

The app itself is fine, the reason for the low rating is how the company conducts their business. We recently had to cancel a trip due to the global COVID situation, and cancelled our airfare, lodging, etc. Airbnb effective in April had allowed full refunds to travelers that were impacted by the situation.. except they denied our request for refund because we had planned ahead and cancelled earlier than their cutoff date. We were punished for planning ahead, will not be using the service again.

Beautiful app design with very user friendly features. Everything is designed very nicely and easy to navigate. Some things for hosts can be hard to figure out which category they are in so I end up doing a lot of back and forth before finding the house rules for example. Overall very happy.

Absolutely terrible! I booked a bnb back in January for November. Recently due to COVID-19 I've decided to postpone my trip until next year instead. I've canceled the booking and can only get 50% of the cost back! They are keeping $500!Because it hasn't met the requirements that it must be canceled within 48hrs AFTER YOU BOOKED and has to be canceled 14 days before your check in date. Only if it meets both of those requirements can you get a full refund! This is despite having 7 months of notice

I had to cancel my Airbnb reservation for May due to covid-19, and not only are they witholding a chunk of money that I can only access as a credit, they kept $120 of my money claiming that it can't be refunded. Oh yeah. The app is clunky and sometimes messages aren't visible for months.

Have used this platform for booking and communicating with hosts. It works well. The app differs from the website as the app limits the advance dates you can search for availability. If you are looking for a year away booking you will have to use the web site.

I've rarely had trouble with the app. Right now, it's hard to find a number to call on the app if there are issues. It's understandable with the economic crisis they have been plunged into, but still, annoying.

Airbnb is convenient when you are traveling and want a home like stay if you use this app I recommend you rent out a guest house or Cottage. What I recommend is you take pictures of the room every time you leave to have proof of the condition you left it--in. I had someone try to extort money out of me Also The app keep blocking me from renting single room unless I choo one day

I will never again use Airbnb, my fiancee and I booked rooms through Airbnb for our European honeymoon. With the outbreak of the coronavirus all flights between the US and Europe have been cancelled and because of that, we canceled the European honeymoon. I put that as the reason for canceling under extenuating circumstances, because Airbnb said they would cover things like that during this time, and all I got was the run around, it felt like most times support hadn't even read my messages.

This is my second time staying with an Airbnb. They the people that we've always dealt with have always been courteous and kind to us. I would recommend this application to anybody because it's easy to set up and it's easy to follow directions on how to speak with a hose or write a review.
This app can be frustrating! I was trying to book and used the wrong card. My suggestion is to all confirm which form of payment you would like to use before completing the reservation. Thank youa

Really convenient for work trips or longer stays when you just need a more affordable option. It really saved me a lot of stress these past few weeks. Really easy to use and I genuinely like the reservation process. Fast and secure!
Everything was easy from checking in to checking out. First time users should look into getting discounts codes though, for perks. I didn't know till I had already signed up.
Me and my wife have used Airbnb from Puerto Rico to Miami to California and never had a problem, always great host, and every place has been pretty much what they said it was going to be
Very easy to use and find the place we where looking for. The view and hiking trails where amazing. Neighbors went above and beyond to make sure we felt welcome. The perfect getaway location.

Works and being from the northern alberta, found it much easier than motels and hotels. There over rated like a palace those nice hotels, and I am just a commoner with restricted privileges. Like cant order pizza at 2 am at river cree in west edm when I was disabled.
Love this app, we've lived every place we've stayed at and they make easy for you to reserve anywhere with affordable rates or go all out and get the luxurious places I normally wouldn't stay at.

Its not the best or the worst app for finding cheap quick stays. 100$ even for 2 nights in a nice room isnpretty legit but dont always expect these prices as they could bump up to 502 $1,000 cleaning fee if you don't throw away your trash or wash the dishes!
Used to be fine but apparently with the update it keeps crashing. Crashed ~8 times on me already today even after multiple app closures and phone reboots. Needs to get fixed.

Since the last update, reviews are no longer translated, and cannot even be copied to be pasted into your own translator. Seeing as how this app is used largely by international travelers, this is a MAJOR flaw.

During these hard times ive struggeled to find a place to stay. Crisis at home forced me into finding a new place. This virus has shut down so many places. Its hard as an essential worker to have a roof over my head thanks to every available airbnb. Those that still have their doors open. Thank you to all of you it means so much to me

Don't book Airbnb ever! I booked and paid half for a stay in New Jersey in June, 2020. Because of COVID19 (Cruise and Airline was Cancelled), I won't be able to check-in. Airbnb refused to give me a full refund. I even asked to share the loss 50/50, but again they refused. My advise to my friends is to never ever book a stay via AIRBNB! Their policies aren't fair at all!!
What a great tool to find any type of lodging. I've used the mainstream apps for hotels for years but this beats them all.

I never stay in hotels anymore. Ever since Airbnb came into my life, there is absolutely no need for one! Their prices did go up quite a bit in the past 6 months but other than that, you can't go wrong.
The app does not work right. Keeps making me re sign up or sign in but then just brings me back to the login page. So annoying!!!!
Love Airbnb HATE the app. App is very glitchy, errors all the time, nothing loads. Signs in then keeps asking me to sign in even though just did.
Love it, easy to use and great to filter to the exact style of trip you need! Easy to keep in contact with hosts. Have had loads of great trips!
I am missing the possibility of searching in a range of date, couldn't find it anywhere in the app, not even in filters.
The app is very helpful and easy to navigate. The only problem is to maybe cosider to allow monthly payment options istead of a once off full payment. Otherwise very nice.
I love using this app because it makes it easy and fun looking at properties and helps you make the right choice where to stay.
Great ideas for an app! Might be screwing up home prices in various parts of the world, but hey guys build more houses...
The app is quite good, no obvious weakness, the customer support team needs an upgrade, but overall the app is great
In the app, the customer service number for Canada is in French only. Really? Sort that out asap... Other than that the app is good

Booking was fine, but both the website and the app were glitchy when they asked me for ID details and an image of my ID. The website asked me for my "name in Chinese" (I'm from U.S.) and the app wanted me to photograph my photo ID but the picture-taking icon wasn't on the screen. It took three different tries. Finally the option for the "passport" image showed a sliver of the camera icon on my screen, so I could take a photo. Otherwise I would have been totally unable to complete this.
Great application for finding accommodations. Very fast and easy and reliable.

Delightful & comfy. The area is filled with all kinds of things to do. If you're an outdoor person, I definitely encourage a stay of at least two days minimum. One for land and the other for water. Have been there four times now and each stay has created its own epic memories. Cabin #2!
Does not support keyword search and filter by price..!! Waste of time!
great for easy lodging, and very convenient for other things that may come up.

I have tried to book on 4 occasions, on different devices, and on different wifi connections all having different issues that wouldn't let me complete a transaction. After a lot of back-and-forth with host (and the host with administration) I gave up. Weeks later I thought I'd give it a go and again it took 2 tries (first attempt timed out while confirming payment). Kind of a pain in the butt to be honest. Though -I'm sure the stay will be fine.
Simple to use, easy directions and clear policies . Spot on.

I got error messages multiple times when trying to make the reservation. and it took 24 hours for someone from Airbnb to figure out why. It should be a simple issue to let you know to upload your id. I have never needed this before. You can only send a message to host with dates so you can't let the host know there is an issue with trying to book.

Great app, easy to use, just with a few quirks. 1) The ratings are shown rounded to the nearest 0.5 so you often think they are more highly rated than they are (this definitely applies to your Saved lists, not sure elsewhere). 2) There isn't a way to change your payment methods unless you are about to book a place (or at least I couldn't find it). 3) When looking at a saved list alongside someone else (both using the app), we saw different prices - mine included service charge; his didnt.

I have never took time to review an app before, but Airbnb deserves all the credit for being dedicated to its' customers. Last month I had to cancel a trip 4 days before the check-in date due to the covid restrictions and I received a full refund. All my other experiences so far have been positive thanks to the nice hosts I reserved from.
Very satisfied with what I got. Clean, easy to arrange and all directions were sent immediately. Also liked the coupon discount
Airbnb is pretty good for the most part wish hosts could lower price a bit on rooms with low or no amenities. But over all iv had more good stays then bad. Thanks Airbnb

If you have never used the Airbnb app.be careful on how you use it because from my experience as a first time. I find myself in a situation where I was trying to get as close as I can to my place of work. I searched for the city that I was in and wound up somewhere on the countryside 30 miles away further for my job. Didn't know how to properly work the app to cancel my reservations now I'm currently charged with a $94 cancellation fee kind of expensive for an accident and misunderstanding.😒

One of the most frustrating apps I've ever used. Daily rates mean nothing as total may be higher for a stay with lower daily rate. When searching for a stay on a map, it would just jump between properties, showing you properties outside of your search area. Worst experience ever. Pity they are a monopoly, I'd better pay some other company.

Each stay is exactly how it was listed for me. I made sure to look at their individual reviews before I booked. I love that they make both the renters and the owners submit their personal info (incl. Government ID). It makes you feel more safe. From now on when traveling, I will use Airbnb. So much better than most hotels (if there more than 1 day). The only thing that made me uneasy was the THOUGHT of them having cameras INSIDE. They are supposed to tell you -- but you never know with people.

Ridiculous platform. I talked to a host through Airbnb, we got an invite to book that would last 24 hours. We went ahead and booked a car, now the house has been rented to someone else in the meantime. Why would you send an invite to book within 24 hours if it doesn't mean you actually can book it. Now we used money on a car for nothing. Reached out to support who will call back in 24 hours. Can't really use that for anything either. Not using Airbnb again.

I'm able to login to my Airbnb directly from my gmail/google account when using the laptop and the iPad app but it doesn't give me this option from the Android version of the app. Only asks for email or Facebook login. Odd. Edit: Buyer beware. Cancellation fee is very steep for the customer but it seems that Airbnb reserves the right to cancel your booking at anytime, without any reason provided and with no compensation other than your original deposit back.

I must give a critique to improve the exploring experience: show more upfront prices. It makes the process frustrating when the prices changes everytime I continue to the next screen. Now, I understand that each property has unique fees, but there must be a better way to reflect these fees in the initial search result. Two locations that are $65 a night could have $200, but you don't know until several clicks/screens later. An example could be [$65/night (+120 in fees)]

Can you PERMANENTLY DELETE my account and information from your system. It is dodgy that you do not provide users with this ability and your support team uses delay tactics. No, I am not interested in "continuing this conversation". Your app and the way it works, the way it collects information as well as the way it pushes certain properties on users is dodgy. JUST PERMANENTLY DELETE MY INFORMATION FROM YOUR SYSTEM!!!!!!!!

The reason I'm giving this app 3 stars is all simply because I do not like their format for how they list their pricing. When you look up the pricing it should include all fees and service charges. It should also include the amount that it would cost for any additional services that you may check off when filtering your search. I believe that this is an easy fix and something that the app should take into consideration.

Absolutely garbage app. Glitchy and error-ridden. First time user here. I ended up not being able to add any payment methods (on app or on desktop website), even after contacting financial institutions to check for problems on their end. Nope, it's just Airbnb's issue. Customer service calls and messaging are useless and unresponsive. Been waiting days for a reply. Don't waste your time and data on this, just get a hotel. Trust me. Unbelievable how awful this has been.

I have spent several hours over two days trying to book a trip. I am furious! The host has been great. AirBNB's new system of protecting hosts is ludicrously frustrating - and it is not really about protecting hosts. It's about AirBNB getting as much data as possible from customers. I am loathe to use them again after the stress it has caused me the last two days.

Barely useable. Every time I enter a place, it forgets my dates, you have to enter the location first otherwise this always happens. Every time I try to use the map to zoom in and search, the app stalls. Every time I select a host location on the map it pans me over to another location that's currently selected, and there's no way of unselecting it without restarting the search. Slow, searches time out 2-3 times before results are shown. Deleting. The website works better on mobile than the app.

It's a great service really. I understand they are likely to take the blame for bad services provided by hosts which is unfair but I had one issue with the App company itself which I feel should be addressed. If you do not use the App for a long time and forget your password, the recovery and reactivation process is overkill. It's good to have tight security, but in my situation, it worked against me. How can some one abroad auenticate with their (likely) native phone? Security question, plz!
Excellent app for those looking to simplify the search for accommodation and have new experiences while traveling
I love using airbnb. I find so many interesting places to stay and much cheaper than a hotel.
Photos are difficult to upload and messaging between parties is censored to prevent referring to other websites, phone numbers, etc
So far I've booked two vacations through this app. Very useful and user friendly. Will use again to book future trips.
Easy to use and when issues to arise. Customer service is easy to contact and handles issues quickly.
Too much bugs as a cohost!!! Nothing works. Getting error messages like crazy

After multiple updates, the app still will not navigate to editing sections of my listing; it keeps reverting to the main page instead of going into the section I selected. It also lacks some features such as editing payout settings so I mostly have to use a desktop computer to make changes. The main use of the app is the inbox. I'm very disappointed it's so limited. I have listed my rental property with several competitors instead.

If you are new, be prepared to take a DAY. The installation is one of the slowest I've experienced. Set up is LONG. Just when you think you are done, it asks for yet another piece of information. Like the back of your drivers license. It won't tell me up front what I need to provide. This seems less than forthcoming. The app is very slow when I tap on the bottom icons. I would stay clear of that Big Bear Hater Lady. To be fair, I will update if my outlook changes.

I thought using thia app would be a great way to find cool and interesting places to stay for a better price than hotels. While the idea is great make sure to read the fine print on the cancelation policies because it's up to the host what you get back. Further more when i tried to get a hold of someone to dispute my refund I was put on hold for an extremely long amount of time and then hung up on. By far the worst policy ever when trying to get a refund. They lost a customer in me.

I use the app, because it's the only way to get certain info for stays. However the UI is really clunky, and not very intuitive. It gets in the way of itself, offering options on things to do etc, while you're simply trying to find a place to stay. Make the search part a more prominent element and it'll be a much better app.

Great app. I host only but keeps the entire process really clear and simple on an easy format. Slight delay between app and website though (a few mins) Additionally there needs to be a better explanation when setting up maybe link to a video for each main section, like pricing, description etc.. (as my place got booked 2 mins after setting up but I didn't get time to adjust the price, because smart pricing really doesn't work like it should). Note9

Never had such a hard time trying to book a stay. I was having issues with signal so logged on another device and my account deactivated so I called twice and the second person told me that if I needed to book asap to make another account now I'm having issues with that account and not getting any solutions. I'm just trying to book for a family vacation and this is making it super stressful.

Customer Service is useless. I lost my credit card and I already updated payment method but still can't delete my old card details. The app still acknowleges my old card until my booking got cancelled. 2 consecutive times thats happened to me 1st in JPN and 2nd in SG. Tried talking to 4 different agents explaining my situation their agents are very incompetent. Always redirects me. Now we have no place to stay until departure I'm with my wife and my 2 and 3 year old kids. It's a total nightmare

Amazing that it first if all asks for Government ID then doesn't even let me take a photo of it, the screen turns green and the camera doesn't come up, not to mention the amount if apps that have access to your gallery which can access that photo once you take it. Theres plenty of other ways to verify, government ID takes it way too far.

This awful app is a slow, buggy mess. It struggled to send me verification codes for my phone number (the final verification step), then it finally did and I put the code in. Then when I tried to get a reservation for the night, this app decides it needs to verify me again. So I put in my number and it tells me too many attempts try again later. (Which is 24 HOURS). WHY DO I NEED TO VERIFY THE NUMBER AGAIN WHEN IT HAS ALREADY BEEN VERIFIED?! I was left STRANDED that night, ALONE. 1/5 STARS

In the 6 years of app use for the first time I've got a host with whom I couldn't even check in. It's been a week already, I still haven't seen any refunds or any real help from Airbnb (sort from "for one night only you can book (last moment) a hotel in central London for 40 pounds and then submit for reservation). My reservation was for 3 weeks.

I didn't like having to change my settings in my text message to show me what my text said without clicking on them. If not you can't log into the app by phone, click on your test message to see the code and then the app resets. You have to send the code again and then you end up in the same predicament.

I would give them a 0 rating if I could. I complained regarding me not receiving my travel credits when someone I referred to download and use the app took a trip, on the 1st February 2019. To this date, the issue is still unresolved. This is my first time experiencing a complaint ticket taking more than a week to be resolved. VERY DISAPPOINTING. Stop lying to your customers if you are not able to provide what you promised!

I travel for work & have used ABB over the past year. Pros: ABB is global. It is THEE App to use for work travel & vacationing. It is fairly easy to use, once you learn how to navigate the program. Cons: I don't like that you cannot book multiple reservations at one time, each one a separate transaction. And that availability is not displayed in real time. Also messages don't always display right away. Consumer Advice: always use the "Instant Book" feature.

So much easier and less time consuming to find quick rentals anywhere anytime. My job requires me to travel often and not always with great notice. Being an older female traveling alone, this is a much safer alternative then hotels. Often much cheater, therefore I am able to pocket the difference in my flat travel allowance plus have access to full stock kitchen, laundry facilities and much more roomier with comfortable accommodations. Nothing like a home cooked meal after a very long day.
Very useful.. However, must make sure you well review the options before making a decision. Pictures sometimes can be deceiving..
Nightmare on my first stay and Customer Service was just as bad. Book a hotel, they're cheaper in the long run and much safer.
Advertised price is usually very far from actual after fees are added. It appears much like a bait and switch scheme on the confirmation page

They require you to receive a text message every time you login. Repeat, not just the first time for verification but every single time you login. Overseas? Too bad. Phone is broken? Too bad. Phone lost or stolen? Too bad. You need to receive a text message in order to login.

Love it! I love the fact it feels like I'm arriving at a friend's house! I have my two boys and sometimes dog in tow, we always drive across country with tonnes of luggage and ski equipment and there is nothing better than being able to dump my gear late at night, jump in a hot shower, cook some food and settle in to watch TV! Air B N B enables us to have our vacation like we are at home.

Absolute horror of an app. My first time use and possibly my last. Accepted photo id but did not allow comparative photo. Stated 'There's a problem' but then nowhere to go to resolve it. Frustration+. Next time I'll consult Yellow pages and use the phone. Eventually I booked and paid without a comparative photo - seems $$$ trumps security - funny about that. Not an impressive start with Airbnb.

Airbnb is my preferred platform to book my accommodation for all my travels. It has listings of places that are hidden gems and those you wouldn't find on other websites. However in recent times I have noticed that they have started listing 3 and 4 star 'hotels' too. This is a platform that people use to find home stays and pads and hidden nests, not hotels.

Be careful! Don't use your dayily bank card! I canseled my booking. Airbnb refused to return my money: "We decided not to return your money. We consider that your reason doesn't emergency circumstances ". Furthermore, they were tryind to withdraw $1400 from my bank card every day for the last week. At the present time, they are trying to withdraw $450. And they can't explain that action. Don't believe their words. Airbnb steales money of clients and hosts.

This is my first time using Airbnb. I was pleased with the ease with which we found our next vacation spot; however, the phone app doesn't let me log in using the account I created when making the online reservations. All I get is an empty box that I assume should contain an error message and no direction how to fix the problem. Some guidance would be appreciated!

I had to cancel a booking at the last minute because what I found was totally different from expectations. My funds were not refunded and I had to make alternative Accomodation plans. Hosts and guests need to be able to communicate beforehand outside the chat to ensure that expectations are clear and that what is advertised is actually what you get.

It's hard to figure out the true nightly rate and it doesn't tell you if you'll pay more for the number of guests. You need to play around with dates and guests and then calculate the nightly rate for the specific situation. Finally you can then compare the price to other options. ALWAYS second guess the photos shown, what is the host hiding?

Consistently terrible customer support. You take a risk by using something like Airbnb instead of a known hotel and every time that risk has gone wrong their support polices have provided absolutely no help. If you use it, you just need to hope that everything goes right that time. The app (and website) are very buggy. Also watch out for the way they list prices, there are a lot of hidden fees that can be pretty deceptive.

After the way things were handled with the Virus situation, I will NEVER use this app again! We booked an entire month in CA and were forced to leave after a week with the state going into lockdown. I sent a message which was ignored & when I finally got a response it was just to say they closed my case. I generally book 2-3 trips a year with this APP.. guess I'll be looking elsewhere.

The referral link for a new host that the app generated for my account apparently doesn't work so when my friend clicked the link and signed up to host, Airbnb didn't give me the referral payout promised. The support team have told me that they believe my friend used the link but because it was the wrong link (which you can't change in your app as the app generates) and it's not tagged in their system, they're not doing anything to fix the problem. Terrible app and even worse customer service!

DO NOT USE THE APP. I dealt with 2 people from airbnb. They were both very helpful but the end result, one said the app might have a glitch the other said the app is a work in process.It would not allow me to book past 365 days from the date I was making a booking. Consequently I was put in a position where I have to make a second booking In the middle of high season.That meant higher rental prices and paying service fees twice .This will cost me around an extra $1000. I was offered $25 comp.

Not a great experience, being my first time ever trying something like this. I'd heard stories about airbnb, so I opted to try a different app. I read reviews on VRBO and decided to give it a try. Big mistake, the property I selected was a private suite in the back of the homeowners home. It was set up like a studio or dorm room, with its own bathroom, small fridge and desk which converted into a table. Unfortunately the ad however was misleading. When I contacted VRBO I was basically told sorry

Only used once and it was easy and we had a good experience! Rented 2 houses this year and unfortunately had to cancel so we are waiting for our refund...praying the refund is as easy as the renting it 😊 hoping to rent same places next year!

Best overall for detailed accomidations information. Property owners are great at giving needed info and providing nice accomidations. I put in my accomidation desires and the APP collects all the possable choices for me. Instead of looking thru 100s of places the APP collects it to a few.

Horrible experience, cannot get my refund after 10 days and they say it will be weeks due to the volume of cancellations. I get the volume but they need to return peoples money. Do not book if you might cancel and need a timely refund. I am out over $800 for weeks now when I cancelled well within the rules and policy. Go use airbnb, not vrbo.
Ability to finely filter to meet your needs is terrific. I like being able to view by map which is helpful if you don't know an area.

I have always used the VRBO app on my cell or simply log in from my computer. Either way VRBO has everything you would want to know (especially lots of photos and reviews!). Questions are answered immediately!

My fiance had planned a trip to Miami and booked a house with this app because of Covid he had to cancel. The refund was tedious but ones we were able to contact the owner of the house she refund everything back and was very kind to us. The problem of refund is mostly with the owners of the house not the company but the company does need better rules to sort messes like these, were owners don't want to refund.
Love this app! I have used VRBO multiple times for vacation & I have been more than satisfied with every rental....from Colorado to Canada!!

Please let me search by actual cost!! I absolutely hate searching with price as a factor in this app. It's the worst on the web. A result shows as $120 per night for a 3 night stay, then is actually $1k at checkout while a similar property shows as $140 per night for the same period and is $500. It. Is. The. Worst. Experience. On. The. Internet. I'd rather read YouTube comments.

I used to love navigating this app or their previous Homeaway app. You could look up their rates, especially for a 1 month or longer stay and the daily and monthly rates would be shown. Now they only show the daily rate and after entering your dates you get a rate based on the daily rate instead of the monthly one, which is substantially lower. So if you book based on the daily rate you get overcharged. Please bring back the former booking info for easier navigating info.

Using the app was easy and user friendly. The cancellation policy during a pandemic is unacceptable and should be revamped. Being that CA is shut down due to high numbers of COVID19, I had no cancel my trip which was paid in full ling before CA was shut down. I lost half the cost of a 6 day rental due to no control of my own. I should have received a full refund. That would have been the humane thing to do. I doubt I'll use this business again. The call to action was not answered properly.
Great places to look at lodging options. Stayed several times, property always as described and owners are great.

I love VRBO I use it to rent condo or a house for a week or so. We presently our vacation on hold due to the coronavirus epidemic. Once it's over we are planning to use VRBO to schedule our next meeting place. Thank you.
So far the experience has been great. All owners are responsive and friendly. Pricing is far too.

Biggest issue is with the advertised pricing when searching. Just like Home Away, you will find the price shown when searching is usually far less than what the real price is. Many renters charge insane amounts for "owner" or cleaning fees that make the real price go way up. Show the actual price when searching!

I have used VRBO 5 times total. The last two times have been misleading at best and borderline fraudulent. I arrived in Hawaii and was given a property different than the one I booked. It is important to note it was a less desirable property. My last experience is a cancelled reservation after it was confirmed and paid for. A different reservation platform took priority so our reservation was cancelled. I am yet to get a full refund for the owner cancelled reservation.
Fun and easy to use. Very helpful. Love dreaming about my next adventure!
Good site I found the old way a little easier but if you search hard enough you will find it.
The ability to locate beautiful properties is my favorite thing!

App is fine. Company's refund policy sucks. Due to sheltering in place, I can't go on my vacation - but the landlord/home owner got to keep my entire payment (+$900). I would have been happy with 1/2 due to this being new times / new conditions. I will NEVER use Vrbo again!
Been using VRBO for a few years. Very happy with service and results.
Works perfectly. Easy to use. Excited to use it for my vacation.

VRBO does not require property owners to refund payments for rentals even when flights are cancelled and there is no way to get there. In fact our property owner only had to issue a credit to be used in a short period of time and they were allowed to raise their rates so we would now have to pay an additional $400 to use the property.
This is a decent platform but fees are way too high and I now have to wait 20 days for a refund on my security deposit from VRBO. I liked the old HomeAway much better!!! Try to book elsewhere!!!!

I been using VRBO for our vacation each year, I have never had any problems and will continue to use them, they are the only ones I trust. I tried another and was very disappointed so I came back to VRBO.
The mobile app experience for searching seems broken? Filters don't work. Prices shown on map are much cheaper than avg price per night total. Is this the intended experience?

Used VRBO app. for our last vacation . We found a great place on the beach in Costa Rica . The app is very nice for locating a place to stay. It is easy to use , and makes booking a place quite easy. I definitely recommend this app.
Messages with the host are disappearing on a booking. If I'm not able to communicate and see messages with hosts, this app is a bit useless aside from searching properties.

Vrbo has been completely unapologetic and unwilling to work with customers whose travel plans are affected by COVID-19. They're solution to rebooking and refunds is essentially: 🤷🏻‍♀️. If you must travel, do yourself a favor and book with a different app. By using Vrbo you risk loosing a lot of money.
Love this app for booking, easy to use! Great for shorts stays or longer. We have always had wonderful experiences with VRBO rentals
Great app. Only issue I have is the mobile version doesn't show a list to specify the beds & their sizes. Otherwise useful, informative & easy to use.
Awesome, so easy to use, very extensive list of amenities and experiences to choose from. I wouldn't want to book a vacation without it. Impressive. Perfect.
I like the app for the most part. What I dont like, is when i ask to see 5+ bedroom cabins that it throws in 1,2,3, and 4 bedroom cabins as well.
Useless when I pick a price per night, then other fees are added so 2 night at $250 equals $900?? Not worth it unless all costs are added, to calculate pricing. Uninstalling.
There are lots of choices, it's easy to use and we always find affordable highly desirable properties to choose from.
Love the app all the guests can log in and get all the information updates! Easy to use!!!
Very handy app for keeping up with my trip info.
Doesn't work when you need it. Numerous times I can't load my messages or anything pertaining my rental. Never using Vrbo again. Completely trash.
Always helpful and not only efficient in saving time but also money.
Great app for vacation properties. I'm fairly new to this app and I feel like I've been missing something. Can't wait to book a location!!
No bad experiences at all easy to use and pictures are accurate. Have booked numerous trips through this company.
Awful nothing more needs to be said. Can not send a listing to a friend to review, no reference number. Going downhill...
I have used VRBO all over the world. It's easy, accurate, and reliable. And I always feel safe using it.
Always good info. I have rented many times and have never had any problems.
Have been using this app for years and it has been very reliable and accurate in renting vacation homes for my family.
I love using the app. I always fi d great places to stay, for a reasonable price.
Excellent app! Great way to figure out vacations and talk to the owners quickly!
Great app to use very helpful in my searches for my vacation

Stay far away from VRBO. Could not give them a lower rating. They refuse to refund cancellations due to the Corona virus pandemic, which is absolutely ridiculous. I guess they want to encourage travel and spread of infection? They're only looking after themselves. Their competitors, Airbnb, offered immediate refunds no questions asked. Please, please, don't use VRBO if you value the sanctity of life.
A quick and easy app to assist in finding a vacation location and amenities.
I find this app very convenient and satisfying! Prices are great and app is punctual.
Have had excellent results using this app. Easy to use. Dependable.
Easy to navigate and comunicate. Great prices for the vacation rentals!
Instant confirmations and real time chats with owners make it very convenient!!!
Very easy to use and and smooth access to vacation condo.
Easy to navigate and filter choices.
Love this app for finding places for our family to stay on vacations!
Cool app. Great if you're looking for a cabin or vacation rental.

Lost deposit, terrible customer service. My second reservation payment was not processing through the app, and I was told by the owner that they were having technical problems and I could pay through venmo to keep my reservation. Due to this outside payment I lost my $400 deposit and Vrbo customer service refuses to help in any way, because it is "my fault for using an outside payment method" so the owner stole $400 and they are being protected by the site while I get no reimbursement. TERRIBLE
I use this app whenever I'm looking for vacation lodging. It's easy to use and reliable n
We used this app when we rented a beautiful Cabin in Heber, AZ. I was so impressed with how easy it was to sneak out of town for a week
So very easy to use. You can put in anything you want for the vacation and done.
Love VRBO, I love this app! So convenient, makes traveling a breeze!
Great way to shop for a place to stay easy app to get through and communicate
Easy to use Able to target specific areas near destinations
Could not view a link for a property without downloading the app. Do not force people to download your app.
Awesome listings that are numerous and suit anyone's price range.

Ok, I'm searching rentals on Sanibel Island. That is NOT Fort Myers, Cape Coral, etc. You have to weed through properties within 100 miles! In addition, I just msged them about availability of a gas grill and bike racks for the ebikes we will be renting, they answered pretty quickly but with some horse s#*t about the cancellation policy. That is one thing that IS in the listing. It appears that they don't even read the flipping question!!! Waste of good space on my phone.
Awesome app, use it quite often and am very pleased!
This app helped us last year to find the perfect place for a family beach trip. Highly recommended.
Better than a hotel app. Helps you get off the grid!
Easy to find options for staying in specific areas
Very helpful looking at properties and maps of location
Very easy to use. Huge variety of properties.
Very slow in providing refunds. I have 2 outstanding amounting to $636.44 refunds but no action yet after 6 days.
Great site. It has helped find some fantastic places across Italy

This app is not my favorite. They might as well not even have a filter for the price. You enter your dates, and your desired location, and your maximum price per night. Then you find a place that meets your criteria, and the price immediately jumps up when you click it, or it has thousands of dollars in other fees. It's so frustrating to search for vacation rentals because the pricing is so off. I'll be deleting this app in annoyance, but hopefully they fix it and give a bottom line price.
Very easy to use and never freezes
Great app, I've used many times successfully!
Great app, very easy to use and find stuff
Great way to quickly look for properties.
Misleading! The price posted can double ot even triple in some cases due to added fees. One property's $75 per night cleaning fee was more than the actual rental. (And per night? ...C"mon!)
Easy to navigate opportunities to view many properties
Has a great interface and easy to use!
Very difficult to use and navigate.

The app will not let me use the reply and preapprove template. It is greyed out. This is very frustrating because I do not always have my computer with me. So it affects my response time negatively. Please fix! Have tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app several times, but I still can't reply and pre-approve.
Have stayed at different locations..very nice spots all. Excellent properties in great locations within all communities I have stayed in for the last few years. York Beach ME was a stellar spot
Easy booking with plenty of options
Last year was first year using VRBO. Outstanding experience!
Used it for a few years now... never had a issue at all.

I used VRBO to book a vacation house last year and it was an awesome experience. We got a 5 bdrm house with a pool for about the same as a hotel and had the best experience with easy booking and reviews so you know what to expect. We will be using it for every vacation from now on.
Works well Very fast loading Lots of selection
Love the app found a great vacation home..We be using it more in the future
Always can find a great vacation rental wherever we go using VRBO
Sometimes they send a little different like price range than what I wanted but I really like the searching opportunities and variety

Good experience overall. It's straightforward and intuitive, sends push notifications, but still there's something I couldn't find and it pissed me off. I wanted to write a review for the house I rented on my recent trip, but no luck! Can't find anything close to "Write review" button. I went back and forth several times, but nothing. Am I blind or is it not there? But where do all the other reviews come from in that case?
Always easy to navigate.

At first glance I liked the app. It is easy to use to find locations and properties. However! The price per night is misleading and not comparable. Fees and taxes are not included and can be a considerable percentage of the headline price. But the adjustment is different for each property, so you can't just add a percentage to the price you see. It would be better to show the actual price per night - the app would be more useful.
Great site. Love all the options
I enjoy how easy they make it to keep in touch with the owners of the vacation rentals and vrbo employees themselves are always ready to help with anything they can.

Whether it's a combination of updates or Android 10 being flaky, Street View is broken in Daydream now. The search flat-down does not work; it either ignores your input ("Please enter a search string" when you've typed in text) or tries to steer you to curated locations, mostly Disney ones. You can't put in a postcode or ZIP now and go to that location. In short, Street View does not give you street views.

It's good enough for the Android who has Ram of 8 GB or more, if not you need to connect the camera. And Google really needs to work on this app. I have read many reviews that they doesn't like it all still I was not believing it until I tried it and yeah it really is not nice. How they are showing map first of all when you just open the app is kinda like a problem.

I am facing the pictures gathering issues, I been using this app a long time before and have almost 215 photos with this and about 4.8 Million views, but now this is not working perfect with my Note 9, and camera keeps moving and in the end joining all the pictures make is mess.... Which should be improved

They wanted to add many new accesses to update the app. Insurance company used incorrect info from this site to determine fault of accident of my friend. Utility company has been forced by CPCU to use this as an inspection tool of their facilities which will definitely result in problems. It is not just the app but includes governments and people and companies relying on tech. way way to soon, there is a Sci Fi book that warned us...

I used to like this app but I don't like the little figure and the top recommendation photos that appear. I've looked in the app settings and I've turned everything off and they're still there. I wouldn't mind if the photos appeared for a location that I am interested in, but the figure moves to random places when I move the map and the photo covers a good part of the screen so when i pan in, the photo obstructs part of the surrounding area which i wish to view. Phone is a Huawei p smart 2019.

It's useless for taking photospheres because when you're taking the pictures the preview slowly moves to the left away from the dots even tho im holding my phone in a still position. So the app thinks that every picture is in the right spot but in real life its completely offset from the previous. This is not a hardware issue as this problem appears in other phones. I thought this was gonna get fixed soon :(

[IMPORTANT BUG] Theres this problem on newer samsung phones, for example on my galaxy a40. When taking photo spheres, even if you hold the phone still, the picture slowly moves to the left by itself. My only real use of the Google Street View app, at present, is to submit my spherical panoramas, stiched and edited on my desktop computer, onto Google Maps. This has been done ever since Google disabled Street View submissions from desktop computers, a rather infuriating decision - not everyone uses mobile phones to take panoramas. Anyway, I attempted to take a few panoramas with the app and all have ended in spectacular failiure. It might be a hardware issue with my mobile phone (LG G4), but when taking the panorama, the alignment guides and the already-taken frames drift out of alignment. Eventually you will find that you have covered the full 360 degree rotation on the app, yet in reality you still have another 90 degrees to turn. Practically, this means that every frame is spread apart by a certain distance (albeit corrected in stitching), and a quarter of the panorama is missing! Attempts at covering the tiers above and below will intensify the horror, with one tier rotated 180 degrees from another. The stitching will not repair that, as you can imagine. Needless to say, this behaviour is intolerable and makes panorama-taking entirely impossible. I suspect that either the (very good) image stabilisation system in the camera, or the phone's gyroscopes are meddling with the app's operation. As for viewing panoramas, I noticed that the app had improved slightly since when I last used it for this purpose, with less intrusive "cards". It is still much easier on a desktop computer, however. The investigation into whether all phones are genuinely compatible with this app is required, because the LG G4 evidently is not! My old G3, with less hyperactive stabilisation, worked perfectly. It would also be nice to be able to submit my panoramas to Google Maps from my desktop again, instead of sending them to a comparitively inferior device. It seems logical, but I am probably pushing my luck with that.

Good: Free  Bad: Unintuitive mess of an interface. Takes many many goes to upload a series of photospheres. Conflicting messages and a lack of progress indication makes it unclear whether a batch of uploads has succeeded, failed or is in the middle of taking place or which ones it has done and which ones it has randomly dropped. The shambolic uploading means that they do not arrive in consecutive order, making it a waste of time to start trying to connect them, and they are imperfectly positioned, which is at least manually adjustable. But this has to be done after they are already on public show. There is no option to publish and link photospheres for testing or private viewing, which is stupid as the first time you try it, and every time it messes up the uploading, your efforts are low-grade public content before you have even had a chance to edit them or improve your technique. The deal you make is that in return for the free app your pictures become content for Google, which is acceptable if free is the highest price you are willing to pay, but at least give us a chance to make the content as good as it can be before going live with it.

My app reservation was $88 in person I was being charged $400! Two days ago I'm picking up a truck the app assigns me a certain truck number then for the keys the app gave me for a different truck. App never changed the truck number in the system. I was unable to return truck.

This online process is a PAIN. Last time I used the app to check in and the first two trucks they had my hunt down were not even in the lot! It was dark, it was not properly lit. There was no customer service pine I could call for the specific location. It had snowed 12+ inches in the last 24 hours and the had plowed the lot towards the trucks so I to dig it out and scrape off the windshield myself. Could barely get the truck out of the lot. Absolute nightmare before I even started moving.
USELESS! Freezes at location selection screen every time. Galaxy S10 5G, restarted app and phone, no improvement. Waste of 30 minutes I can't get back!
Seldom or really never works, it just spins or returns errors of "unknown location" when I type in San Francisco. Got stuck for an hour trying to self check out a van.
It doesn't work - keeps crashing when I try to add images when returning a vehicle.
Tried using this app to make a reservation it kept on crashing. It also did not allow me to update my profile information. May be a good tool if these bugs are fixed.
Doesn't work. It freezes every time I try and select a location to rent from.
Doesn't work. Just cycles over and over the location permission request.
Really nice & easy to use, 5 stars from me I'm not having any problems with the app. Works fine, I love it.

App does not work. After i pick the vehicle it just loads forever. Unistalled and still the same.
Completely useless and buggy, cannot make reservations at all as it just freezes after doing, I urge everyone to use the website

HORRIBLE UPDATE... I used to use this app all the time in college. Now that i redownloaded it, it won't load a thing. Unfortunately lost my business.
Can't even sign up. Not receiving verification code.

App won't let me create an account, or even sign in with an account I created on the website.
This app doesn't work well, I can't see any of my account history or current reservations.

Problems with photos on checkout and had to call the agent even though the agent saw 7 photos and on return wouldn't go beyond "Share My Location", so I had to call to leave a message that I had returned the truck. Made me take photos of my DL AGAIN even though I put them on file and the agent confirmed they were already in, as well A waste of time on both checkout and return.
Picking up with the app takes 3 times as long as dealing with a person, and you still have to go inside to get the key so whats even the point? Complete waste of time.
Never works when I try to pick or drop of truck

Horrible. To slow and alot of bugs.
