Ok, I usually don't advertise apps, but this one is a MUST. This app is an awesome way to either touch up on a language you've already learned, or to start from scratch and learn something new. It makes learning fun. The excercises are almost like little games, with tons of ways to retain information. You can speak it, read it, type it, listen to it, see pictures etc. I encourage anyone with children who are struggling with learning and grasping a language to download this app. Safe for kids too

10/10. probobly my most used app. It teaches you new Languages step by step. you dont have to pay for anything if you dont want to. the only down fall to this app are it's adds, but i have a choice to get rid of them. Sometimes i cant hear the words at all but thats because of my crappy speaker. other than that this is the best app i've ever gotten.

I have been enjoying the app immensely. It took me a little bit to figure out how to use it to my best advantage since tips are not given by written instruction. There are also occasionally some things that could use some correcting so that is the reason for the 4 stars instead of 5. I discovered that some of my questions could be answered by doing a Google search and Duolingo had the answers on the web. However, I am having fun while brushing up on my Spanish and learning new things!

I took the test when my audio was not working, so scored worse than I would have otherwise. Turns out that you can't take the test again. You have to set up a new account and lose your progress, or work your way up through whatever level you end up in. I was trying to use the app every day, and i can see the potential, but not if I can't get an appropriate level. Irritating.

I like this app mostly for review. My only complaint is this app sucks when it comes to learning Korean. Other languages like French and Japanese were fine and easy to follow. But the way Korean is set up, it's annoying to learn. I think it would be better and beneficial to go through the letters individually instead of giving you 3 at a time and saying it's the Korean alphabet

I am an English person learning German, and although I have found this app quite useful, the English part of it is not much use for a person wanting to learn English. I say this because nearly everything in the so-called English translation is American. Very difficult to unlearn once learned, especially for a foreigner with no understanding of either language prior to this course. Useful but very basic course, also very confusing for a complete beginner.

I love this app and love how you can learn many different languages. I would have given it 5 stars but sometimes it does not pronounce the words so I then have to look the word up. Another thing is the hearts. I hate that you have hearts. If you loose all of them, you cannot play until they regenerate. Other than these issues, this app is great!

I use it a lot so I bought a subscription. I've noticed some features are still unavailable for certain languages that are available in others. I'm looking forward to Duolingo expanding features in the future, such as the "stories" and podcast elements they have for French. I hope you make these for Japanese, as well. Would also be nice to have lessons about onyomi and kunyomi kanji readings.

The hearts system needs to go. It does not encourage learning when every time you make a mistake you get punished. It didn't show up for me until recently for some reason and I haven't wanted to use the app with it since. The language learning features of the app are great, but if I get punished for learning then whats the point? The app has done so well thus far, please get rid of this broken system and let people just learn.

Very nice gradual progressions to more difficult skills and well-timed reminders to review earlier skills. But please improve: I often feel like I'm only tested on how well I type on my tiny cell phone keyboard - tedious, slow, boring, frustrating!! I'm using a pixel phone not a tablet, and make many typing errors. an option to rotate screen to sideways mode would help. Also needs more prizes traded for lingots (e. g. more idioms/slang, more chances to earn 2x pts.). Also, podcast is awesome!!

This app does a great job of teaching the language in ways that make conversational sense. Instead of disconnected vocabulary and verb tenses, you learn sentences that introduce the same, but it helps you put the pieces together. The progression matches your learning pace, and the achievements give you that competitive feel. I give this app my highest rating!

This App is absolutly educational and easy to navigate and I really like how you can earn points and made easy to use. Make learning fun. Duolingo is a very useful educational tool to help any one who is wanting to take on the challenge of learning a new language. Invite your friends to see who can be top point earner for rewards. Great job to the creator of this new and exciting way to advance your vocabulary.

I'm enjoying learning the language that I'm taking . one of the biggest problems I see is if you get a reminder and you click the reminder instead of going straight into the app it jumps you ahead in lessons which makes it tough for learning the language. I don't like the fact that it passes you when you misspell the word, just because you have the right letters.

Great way to learn. Lessons are addictive and fun. Sometimes its difficult to see why you need some of the words you will learn. Stick with it. It gets better the more you know. Does get a bit intrusive with the buy extra features. Why anyone would want to change the avatar to other dress is puzzling. Using points to buy an extra special lesson would make more sense. Maybe special words related to dining, sports or dating would be more useful.Even single lo-cost payments would bring in revenue.

It is easy to use and a great resource for learning new languages. However, it keeps showing an error. Even after clearing a level, it doesn't register it and I have to do it again! Example, after completing all 5 lessons of level 2, I should be on level 3. But the app makes me re-do level 2.

I like the app but I feel like the free version still needs some improvement. Spanish has a bunch of reading stories that help solidify what you're learning but many of the other languages do not. I feel all the languages should have the stories to help solidify and differentiate between similar sounding words.

I used to use Duolingo (obsessively, migh I add) a couple years back and got bored because it was too repetitive and never gave any insights for grammar.. Great job, you have fixed all of that! One can now listen and read to interactive stories, there's grammar tips and lots more content! With this, I think I'm back for good!

Perhaps It's one of the better app available for learning a new language. But after using for about a month, came across a lot of limitations. Sometimes i found correct answer not being verified as correct, a lot of repetition of same questions over and over again, when jump to a harder level irrelevant questions come out of no where, etc. And something call "progress quiz" cones up every now and then, with full of irrelevant questions. I guess the developers should look into these things.

I love it! I recommend using the interactive reading feature and participating in competitions! This app is a lot of fun, it engages and helps you practice all your skills and systems, even pronunciation and speaking! Teaching languages is my bread and butter, by the way :D I wholeheartedly recommend this app!

This app is so amazing its helps a lot . It gives me a new way of learning .I shared a wonderful experience with this app. Easy to operate this app. It contains so many amazing features . Its score board gives us a competative attitude towards learning of language. I really like this app because it taught me about the new world of language in a very different nd fantasic way .i just wanna say that please install this app it help u . its contains soo many international language .its awesome app.

Wonderful app that uses multiple styles of learning to help make the process of picking up a language smoother. I am currently learning Spanish and Greek. I would love to see abit more help with the learning curve for greek and the more obscure languages on offer. a And some extra help with how the alphabet works but I understand they have lots to work on with the amount of content on offer!

I love this app! I'm learning German and having a blast doing so. Ad's are minimal and not annoying like most apps. The only thing I'd change is having more things to spend your reward lingots on in the shop. I bought the whole shop by the time I hit the first checkpoint. Please add more outfits, skills, stories etc! Overall I can't complain, this is a wonderful app considering its free.

The app simply shows pictures, listening, writing, reading. It's amazing in all. However just one note I would like to ask, when learning the new language; it's better if you proceed with the option writing more. Notifications come constantly for reminders. Thumbs up!

I'm struggling a bit with where & when to use the accent marks on common words & masculine/feminine words, spelling as it sounds in Spanish, or translating what I hear, pronunciation & building speaking speed confidence & mostly MEMORY! Each day I return to my lessons only to feel the need to start from the very beginning, feeling that I can't possibly remember what I learned the day before. So far the Owl has patience with me but as I continue to advance, the Owl's patience with me may not.

With the updated version I lost all my work thus far. The new version puts an ad in your face after every segment. Trying to get past the basics again, I've probably seen the same advertisement repeated twenty times in the past half hour. After giving in and buying a subscription to get rid of relentless ads, I'm upgrading from 2 stars to 4 stars. Duolingo is a great app - as long as you are willing to pay.

so far so good. I am a plus member, and did so almost immediately. I'll get back in a month. Ok, so not bad, a few gripes. No alphabet or ability to just listen to individual words at your leisure. Also the app has many things the web based version does not, and to me, this is a big deal. I am knocking an extra star off just for that lack of functionality.

2 months ago, I would have given this a 5. Now, there is no weekly 30 min XP boost, which has caused me to work twice as hard to keep my spot in the rankings. I wish you could either bring back the boost or make the ranking something you can turn off/opt out of. The constant reminders about falling into #46 have made me beyond anxious about using the app. I get so stressed when I drop down but I'm just too tired to do 6 lessons a day to keep up.

Overall quite good. The app is essentially free, but a downside is that you only get to make 5 mistakes per day then it locks out til the following day, unless you pay. Understandable in that they need to make some money, but locking out isn't helpful. It works best if you also access it from your computer. A downside is that it doesn't go in depth to explain verb conjugation clearly, or at least not in the week I've been using it. A very good add on for me to use between French classes.

Love it and I am really learning a new language. I feel the paid version does not offer enough benefits or added value to make me take that step. Don't know how often they improve errors reported either. Swahili has a lot of wrong audio, not very interactive either compared to some more popular languages.

While the app itself is quite nice, I can't give it full marks as it is inferior to the website (that you can also view on your mobile device). The problem is that the app seems to be missing the "tips" section of lessons, at least I was unable to spot it, in which case this would be more an issue of UI/UX design. This tips section is really helpful and its lack in the app leaves the user rather helpless when the difficulty ramps up. I would also emplore the devs to further gamefy the service.

The app is not as good as the website, as it has some annoying features (hearts) and is missing some (grammar tips, discussions) that the website has. You lose a heart if you make a mistake, and can't finish a lesson if you run out. With the paid version you have unlimited hearts in the app. Besides that I think Duolingo is awesome, since it's free and a fun way to learn a language. You can compete with others on a leaderboard, which is fun. I wish it had more languages though, such as Finnish!

I'm using it primarily for Hebrew. I'm using it in combination with other language activities and software. In this context Duolingo is very helpful. My most recent discovery is that the higher levels (4 and 5) done using keyboard and not word tiles are turning my vague knowledge into precise knowledge. א or ע? Tet or tav? Also, it took me a while to discover the very helpful resources that are available only in the web version.

I like the multi tasks in this app and the instant feedback. It took me a while to work out how to get my level rather than beginners but you just scroll down the task circles to number 2,3,4 etc. I'm using 4. If you make an error, there's lots of over learning to consolidate the task.

Duolingo is a great app. The reason I give this 3 stars is because of the heart update. When you make too many mistakes, your hearts will go away making all your progress restart on that one lesson. This app is so you can learn the language, and from your mistakes. But if you make to many, you messed up.

An app that relies heavily on the "game" element of learning and floods your phone with notifications when you lose your place on the leaderboard. There is also no way to go back and work through past lessons so you are stuck relearning the same "review" lessons that never change. It also doesn't take into consideration that learning is best done with down time between lessons instead it penalizes you for doing so. The lesson plans also don't seem to follow any logical progression.

It's easy to understand most of the time. One of the only problems is that in tap the pairs lesson they gave me words I hadn't learned yet, it wasn't the type of lesson where they give definitions either, I just saw things I didn't know of and was expected to answer. This has happened multiple times. I don't know if it happens in other languages, but I'm learning Portuguese

This app is great and all but I wanted to get better at Spanish and it was really disappointing when I "ran out of lives" and I couldn't do anything else. It did give me the option to gain a life by doing a practice level. But it took forever.... to load! Almost everything takes a lot time to load!

I like it. I've learned soooo much. It even recognizes most typos I might accidentally type and if I miss accents, it tells me to pay attention to those. Only thing I dont like is the hearts. If I run out of hearts in the middle of a lesson, it deletes all my progress if I cant get more.

Fun to use. Multiple choice questions. Let's you listen, speak and translate what is written in front of you. If learning languages such as Korean, Japanese or Chinese like myself, it also helps you to read the characters and pronounce them correctly. My only complaint is that you have hearts, and every time you get something wrong you lose one. You can upgrade to not using hearts, though I think this costs money. You can practice a lesson to earn a heart though, so not the end of the world.

Im quite enjoying this app. Lessons are fun., Easy. I just wish i could go back and replay the very first lessons. Just to refresh memory. It only allows you to move forward. Which is good. But, sometimes we need to go back to remember it. If it wasnt for that 5 stars.

Great experience, but has shortcomings 1. if I ask a question there is no easy way to check for replies on android. 2. cannot swipe back to a previous question to review. 3. for beginners, sentence context is critical. piece in portugese can mean parts, a play etc. so the phrase needs to give a hint such as: piece of cake 3. actual errors a boy is not a she, etc. 4. plus needs to add more benefits, too expensive if it just removes ads. maybe add more spoken language content for plus users.

Used to be a great app.. you could use it as long as you wanted. you watched adds to make it free, fair enough.. now you've got 5 hearts and when they're gone.. you can't use it.. and especially when you start learning, you can use them up in a few minutes.. Money grabbers.

I have only used it for 4 days in a row. I find the basics I am learning useful and I find it entertaining. I think this is much better than watching TV. I just haven't figured out how to record my voice as part of the lessons. I would prefer it without adds, but it's acceptable since it's free.

I am really enjoying the lessons so far. I have been doing the French for over two weeks, about 15-20 min a day. It uses good repetition to help you recognize and use the new words, and verb conjugation. The only think I don't like is to not have the option of using a word bank instead of the 'type the English ' for understanding phrases. I am a native English speaker so getting a translation wrong due to an English typo or auto correct doesn't help me. I do like having to type the French.

I wish more languages like Hawaiian and Navajo had pronunciation included and that Japanese had a repeat option but this app is mostly free and always updating. For just a few minutes a day I've added to my foreign language comprehension immensely and am extremely grateful an app like this exists. Back in the day one had to buy expensive tapes or multiple books to get what one simple interactive app allows for free save minimum advertising at the end of lessons.

Assists with learning the basics of a language by repitition. I have combined with class room lessons and found it very helpful. The tips in each section assist with understanding the grammar. You may not become fluent with Duo but you should be able to have a simple conversation. Would certainly recommend.

Excellent app, I've had it for about five years now and the updates have been very helpful and enjoyable, especially the added stories. The adverts are very short which is hardly much of a price to pay for the great quality teaching you are receiving. Duolingo continually pushes you to learn more vocabulary which is very useful in the long run because it gives you the motivation to learn so much more than you ever thought you could. I would 100% recommend this app to people of all ages.

I found this app quite entertaining. As well as informitive. If one of your answers is counted as incorrect, there in the red area marking it so. There is an icon to ask why. NOT the flag but the other one. In it is a forum of questions and answers from other users. UNFORTUNEATLY that is not explained by the app. Trial and error.

I have been using duolingo everyday for around 4 weeks, my Italian has improved noticeably. The lessons are broken into small and quite repetitive sections and this repetition subtly causes longer term retention of the new words. As you work through the lessons previous content is regularly referred to so you dont forget the stuff you learnt earler. I cant wait to go back to Bardelino or Sauze Oulx to try it out for real.

Simple and fun. The UI is clean and the audio really helps. Sometimes I wish there were more explanations of the grammar, such as verb forms, word genders, and sentence structure. But I guess the repetition over time might help to make those things clearer.

I actually really love this app. I tried other apps to learn a language, but I just got so bored of it I stopped trying. My friend showed me this and it's like now you have a goal. There are rankings and I want to be a higher ranking than her, but I have to learn the language I have choosen to go up in my rankings. I can get more hearts if I run out by a practice but wont rank me up cause I didn't do the main course and I just love that. Highly recommend.

I think it's better for if you already know the basics of a language. I've found its especially bad at teaching absolute beginner like myself if the language has a non-latin alphabet, like Russian. But for a language like German or Spanish, it seems pretty good. Words and pronunciations stick and the lessons aren't terribly hard if you're taking your time.

Awesome! Would be 5 stars, however, knocking one off for not having the ,"tips" available on the app or a notification saying there are tips worth knowing that are accessible on the browser version. I only discovered the tips explaining some essential grammar differences after saying to a friend it would be handy to have these explained, and she said they are, just only on the browser. Using the app only, you wouldn't know. The ads aren't bad, i prefer having those to having to pay :)

This app deserves five stars. But the problem is, I have all the premium features though I already cancelled my subscription. And I couldnt even find in any of my subscriptions in play store the Duolingo one. Please fix this ASAP. I only wanted the free trial, and now Duolingo is offering me a premium for free?!!! I want to know the reason whyyyyy.

I love that there is a free app that allows you to learn languages. The app is easy to use and I find the methods of learning work for me. They integrate a lot of different learning styles that are ideal for trying to learn and remember a new language. The reason behind 4 instead of 5 stars is that I find for some conjugations there is no breakdown explaining how and when to use a certain form. You kinda have to read the comments for that question or just pay attention to the subtle differences

This is a very good app for learning languages. But, I am having some problems. Like I learn French and Korean. So I was learning French and reading the stories when there are words I didn't understand. So hv the option to tap the word and know the meaning so I did that and guess what I didn't even tap any answers but my life went.This happened today also. I didn't tap the answer's option but my life went.

I used to love this app . I understand its free and it must make money . I didn't mind the adds but now there are hearts and you get a very limited number which limits how much I progress. I'm practicing and some mistakes are made because there are different answers so the fact I have to stop and get more stars to continue the lesson and it takes ages because it asks me questions on the topic I haven't practiced yet. Please remove beards and add more adds it would be better

Used this app for couple of years and I think it's got worse. I now can't see what my total score is. I have to go on a friends profile to see what my score is. You can no longer redo lessons and you used to be able to press a key that took you to the test lesson and you'd get loads of XPs. Not any more. I can't fathom for the life of me how people get so many XPs in a week. They must be on there 24/7. Really put off using the app. And I've ever fully understood how the points works

Really enjoying the app so far. Using it to learn Japanese. Wanted to do so for a number of years but always got disheartened and given up. This app is great because I can use it little and often, and it keeps me motivated. I've learnt more in a few days than what I learnt over several weeks of classroom learning. Excellent app and its free!!!

I wish the app has the "follow discussion" button like the web version. Other than that the app is good. Other suggestions for Duolingo would be to have better and slower speakers AND not make the multiple choose tests so incredibly obvious. For example in this sentence "Mary is reading a (blank)." And my choices are: a book, a car, a tree, a couch... perhaps make the multiple choices more tricky such as misspelled the word "book" or use the plural version.

Works. Free usage is limited by numbered attempts at passing lessons which you can refill by practicing, but the practicing is always too basic to be actual practice so instead it is a time out--which is probably intentional so people feel more inclined to buy the app's premium upgrade. Other than that, no real complaints (I dislike the animation style, but that hardly matters).

I'm absolutely loving Duolingo. It's very efficient in making you practice and keep revising the new things that you learn each day. What I love the most about this app is that it has all these achievement pointers and scoring and wagers, all things to make learning fun, and yet NONE of it involves monetary payment, it is all about your merit and your learning capabilities. So it's an amazing way to learn and to stay motivated throughout the process!!

I am willing to give this app a 6 out 5 if they fix the bugs. The mobile app is not working recently. If I use the laptop then sometimes the pronunciation is not working. Ther is no doubt that this app is totally and free and best anyone could find in the market. But due to the bugs am unable to continue my learning.

This app is awesome! There are so many languages and you can learn several if you want to! It presents the learning in a fun way, with several different formats for each question in the lesson. You can invite friends, compete with people and raise up among the ranks. There are things you can buy using the lingots you earn. It's super easy to use and I highly recommend!

A great app for learning Japanese so far, as long as you are motivated by a little competition, and the classic arbitrary rewards. Definitely based on rote learning and occasionally has a small bug, but overall I'm really enjoying it, and finding it useful.

The "heart system" of making it so every time you make a mistake you lose a heart, makes it incredibly difficult to practice consistently on this app. Duolingo's entire "thing" is to make learning free, and it's really frustrating that I have to pay for unlimited hearts before getting the full experience (or of course watching an add or doing a longer than necessary "practice session"). Take away the heart system and Duo is actually a really solid learning app!

I have learned some German while using this app, a great pastime and a way to educate at the same time. I would give it a 5 star rating it they would remove the lives, they started off by making money from ads (not a problem for me as they are not so overbearing) but now they want us to pay for unlimited lives. They are getting greedy in my opinion. So in summary The lives system 1* The rest of the game 5*

its nice to know that there are no more "hearts" and it's replaced by lingots! (In my version) This is by far the best app for learing a language, unlike other apps, ITS COMPLETELY FREE and complete. It have wonderful graphics and really motivating, its very easy to use and the list goes on... If you think duolingo is lacking some features, try it in desktop, there are more features there. Finally thanks for reading this ;)

I've been using this app for a month now and it was great until I got to the first checkpoint. I have done everything at my level and the checkpoint is a test with 90% words and grammar structures I haven't learnt yet. I have no way of passing the test honestly, so this is the end of the road for me.

Very nice app that helps to develope vocabulary, correct pronanciation, build writing, and comprehension skills. The new Stories feature is amazing. The stories are not just educational, but also funny and smart! Notifications are quite annoying, but could be easily turned off. Many thanks to the creators of Duolingo!!! You, guys, rock!

I just love it. Sometimes the app doesn't respond while on the menus, but it happens so seldom and it's such a minor inconvenience that I don't feel like detracting a star from it. You're probably not going to become fluent in Duolingo alone, but by the end of a course you'll most definitely have working knowledge of the language. In order to achieve fluency, it is highly recommended to practice conversation with a native. In any case, excellent app. I use it every day.

I'm loving this app. It's helping me to achieve a goal of many years to learn Spanish. The way is slowly works you into the intricacies of the language is helping me learn so fast. The only thing I don't like is the heart energy system if you don't buy the course. But, I can understand, you need to make money to cover costs. ¡Gracias esta oportunidad!

I'm enjoying this far more than Rosetta Stone and I feel like I understand more. I even find I'm able to read my target language. Some things I would improve: I want to buy more with my Lingots (different characters, more outfits or skins, challenges). I also want to connect to other people learning my target language to try to chat, with some sort of correcting software to make sure you're communicating correctly. I would also happily pay for the app if you lowered the price...€6 mth?

this is SUCH an intelligent app. it adjusts to your learning style, it's interactive, and it has different exercises to hone your skills--speaking, listening, typing, multiple choice. it is also designed for mastery in every stage of the process. it has conversational examples and stories to learn from too. and it makes learning FUN! 💛 what used to be intimidating to learn (i.e. Japanese and its characters) is now something i'm pleasantly surprised i can read! i HIGHLY recommend this 💫

I love this app, I totally do. But not this one small disturbing bug that hinders me from leveling up. There are times after completing a lesson, the progress doesn't move and there's no way I can proceed to further lessons. The only last resort I can do is to reinstall the app and it's totally not convenient doing so. Please fix this kind of bug ASAP.

I really like this app, however i have been given hearts amd my partner has not. He is getting further than me because even if i make a small spelling mistake i get a life taken away. Have some consistency and make it fair! Also i am watching your adverts, im not going to go premium so what is the point in the lives? It just hinders my learning.

The app is easy-to-use and I like the look. Teaches well, especially with the different methods (speak it, write it, hear it). However, the app doesn't let me speak for exercises, though it used to let me; now it just cuts me off and goes red. :( Hope this can get fixed. It has been a while and this is still a problem. I updated it, my microphone permission is on, and I turned up the volume. Disappointed that this feature is still not working so I am lowering my rating of the app.

One of the best apps I have! Also happy about the lack of ads most "free to use/learn" mobile apps have. I do have one suggestion, something I found to be lacking. I'm thinking something like adding short minigames at the end of each level to see how well you know the topic so far. Just, whatever you do, don't bring hearts back--those were dark times...

The app promises much but it could deliver more. There seems to be a limited vocabulary input which could be better defined. So for example I ended up with five exercises about eating eggs in the people category. Instead it could focus on a greater selection of nationalities, different family member types, words for friends, lovers, and enemies, acquaintances, occupations, political titles, artistic types etc. ALSO PLEASE STOP THE FISH TORTURING ADS!!!

I love learning with Duolingo, it's fun! I would love to hear every single word/sentence in the exercises in the language we are learning as opposed to only certain ones. Also, I would love to be able to access a list of words/phrases that I've learned with their translations to review between lessons. And I would love to be able to read what the grammar rules are before I'm thrown into a grammar lesson. Then I could practice the rules I've just learned instead of just guessing the answer.

I like the fact that it works like a game: levels, friends, competition and many more. But no matter how high the QUALITY is or how much I ENJOY this, it's only effective if you already know some of the language otherwise it's slightly useless. Overall it works for me (and I know five languages, learning more) so I would surely recommend this product.🙂

One of the best tool for learning languages! it's step by step short lessons doesn't put any pressure on learners. Still I would like to suggest that this app should have a dedicated button for some detailed and explained grammar section, as some learners want to know grammar first, also to get some structural overview of a new language. Best wishes!

I like the repetition as it helps with memorizing the words and concepts, as well as the small achievements and other reward systems to keep me motivated. Wish there was an option where you could be asked a question in a language and then be required to answer it in that language, as a way to take a learned skill and apply it.

I started using the site when I was in spanish 1, last year. I thought it was tedious but when I started spanish 2 I realized Duo had helped me, so i downloaded it. I like that it sends me notifications to remind me i have a 13 day streak and should continue, and i love the streak freezes, tho i haven't needed them I've used them. Also, I'm considering another language after spanish. It's really helpful and kinda fun. I love it.

Great experience. I'm learning Portuguese. But it is the Brazilian Portuguese. I wish they had European Portuguese. All in all its a great app. Languages have comparatively different style modules from one another. For example a given language may not be as efficiently designed or have as much information about it as another. So the app is really good for certain languages while it may not be for another. I've only tried Portuguese and French and these are really great. Others may not be.

Great app. Makes learning the language easy and fun. It helps to do a little bit of studying on the side if you're serious. But I'm definitely enjoying it (: for everyone worrying about hearts. Earn gems to buy them or practice previous lessons to get free ones. It's honestly a good way to push you and to learn more.

I have been using this app to brush up my Hungarian, its made it a lot more enjoyable as it is in the format of a game. However I've noticed features missing, for example and most importantly, please add a 'TIPS' option for each subject in Hungarian as you have in French, where it teaches certain rules and why words are conjugated, otherwise you're just trying to figure it out on your own by first memorising words/sentences without knowing why they have certain endings or a certain structure.

Pretty bad. The app crashes too much, selecting options causes it to freeze in a loading screen, or just doesnt respond. What little I was able to complete was okay, but obviously not substantial. Everything is up to date so I have no idea what's going on.

Such a great app! I've looked at a couple of other ones and this one is by far the best and my favourite. I really like how it's playful and nicely mixed up so you don't get bored. Hasn't crashed on me yet. Voice recognition is good, content is good, it's also available for download on cellphones, Windows, Mac and also online and your progress copies over to all them with no delay. Love this app!

I love everything except how losing hearts by answering incorrectly locks you out unless you buy new hearts. It gives me anxiety to the point where I look things up online sometimes to make sure I don't answer wrong. Failures should be corrected, not penalized. I like the variety of styles of questions, the simple, fun graphics, the encouraging atmosphere, the ability to set tiny goals so if that's all you can do, so you can still feel successful. I'm a slow learner, but I keep improving.

Loving this app to death! 5 stars and kudos to the teams working behind the scenes to make this a hit. Just one question, why can't I access the "Tips" menu for certain languages like Norwegian,Romanian on the app when it is surprisingly present when accessed through the web version? I don't understand the logic behind this and I find no reason to not include the for-mentioned in the app. It wouldn't require a big deal of effort I feel. It is going to be just a simple additon.

This is great! I have always struggled to learn another language when in school in a classroom a few years back, but this works for me. Very interactive, you can set how long you want to learn per day, 5, 10, 20, 30 minutes etc. And it will remind you to practice everyday which is the key! 5 stars for sure. Oh, and its free!

Love this app in general. But only giving 3 not 5* bc I'm finding this latest update super buggy. Anyone else having trouble?? Fill in the word exercises sometimes come up pre-filled; Exercises where you choose from the word boxes what the audio said also show up pre-filled. Sometimes the audio won't play at all, or just the 'slow audio' version won't play. In the stories, whenever a character is talking and you need to complete what they said I'll lose all audio suddenly. Ads are freezing, etc

Honestly this app sucks. When trying to learn a new language, you shouldn't have this ridiculous heart system where you can't learn anymore once you run out. It basically forces you to pay for the unlimited learning and no ads if you actually want to learn a new language. It is very frustrating to say the least. I only used it to relearn a few things but the system sucks. I'd be fine with the ads but the life system just completely sucks.

SO MUCH FUN! I downloaded the app on a whim, because what else am I gonna do during quarantine other than try to learn another language, right? I really really love the app. It tells you what you do wrong, rather than make you guess, it encourages you when you do well (who doesn't love positive reinforcement?), and also is set in a way that you really just wanna keep going, keep leveling up. So glad I got the app!

An incredible app, that allows you to learn languages for free (with heart system, like a mobile game). This app is amazing overall and I am taking one star away only because, you need to have at least a basic understanding on the language you like to learn, like knowing the letters and how to read the letters in your desired to learn language.

New levels were added which made so much more sense and helped with harder levels. My issue comes when it clearly says 'bu' and options are 'ru, pu, bu and ma' you would think the creators of the app would let you chose the correct answer. What's the point of learning if u need to choose the wrong answer to move up. I liked the new additions but only if they teach you correctly.

Very easy to use, I love the stories you can read in another language and the podcasts - very helpfull! The app doesn't use much data when playing without wifi and the variety of question types helps you to learn all aspects of the language. I love Duolingo but I struggled setting it up a bit as it kept not accepting my password and not telling me why but I worked it out in the end.

Duolingo is a good app if you are looking to casually learn a language. The ads are not bothersome. Even without paying for plus u still have access to many features. 1 thing I dont like is that they used to have clubs but now have leaderboards. The leaderboards might motivate some people to learn more everyday, but the clubs were much more helpful because u could interact with other learners and play fun games that help u learn the language. Please bring clubs back.

The app is really good, however after the new update I can't use voice exercises, whenver I click on the microphone button it automatically marks it wrong without letting me attempt the exercise. This happens when I use headphones and without headphones its the same. Also as a suggestion Dark Mode would be nice to have for late night studying. Thank you for your time, I'll give 5 stars once the microphone issue is corrected. :)

The app itself is a good concept, I like the UI as well as how quickly the menus load, however, whenever I would try to upload a clip longer than a minute with a 720p resolution, the upload time took up to 30 minutes, drained my Pixel 3's battery and caused it to significantly heat up. If these problems can be resolved or optimized, I would definitely give this app a higher score. I've never experience this with any other app, including uploading 15+ minute YouTube videos.

In the era of remote learning, any resource that allows a connection is great. That Flipgrid integrates with other tools such as Nearpod and Microsoft Teams is a plus and it does so very easily. A favorite feature is Flipgrid Shorts. Recording a 10-minute standalone video that can be downloaded as an MP4 or shared through Nearpod or Teams makes teaching a lesson easier for teachers while allowing personalization. Students can watch the videos as many times as they need. Thanks for increasing shorts from 5 minutes to 10.

I like this app for assessing speaking from my ESL students. It gives them the chance to think about what they want to speak about from the prompt,and then to record - and re-record - as many times as they like until they feel like they've done well. I really like the screen sharing beta on google chrome (not the app), which allows a kind of show and tell /visual aid function to their presentation. I also like that the camera shy can cover their faces with stickers or blur the image. I don't like that app crashes a lot and many of my students have complained that they have recorded their videos multiple times, and it doesn't post for unknown reasons. It can be incredibly frustrating in that regard.

Amazing app to give students a voice. Engagement is high, interactions are meaningful, and students are the center here. The app provided you with possible Feedback for your students, which is also a great tool to assess their progress throughout the semester/year. Finally, language teachers can benefit from this app using it as a portfolio for students production. They will be able to see how much they've grown, and also have the opportunity to improve

I can't upload my videos, I need this app for school and everytime I upload a video the send bar gets to the end and then goes back to the beginning. It does this 3-5 times and says it can't upload it. I'm suppose to graduate this year and this could be the cause of me not being able to.

Great app to allow students to post quick and easy video responses and then give direct feedback (via video or comments). Also helps with privacy in only letting registered users see each other's videos. As a music teacher in quarantine, I'm looking forward to seeing all the possibilities this can offer for student collaboration, feedback and learning.

I have been using FlipGrid for a couple of years and re-introduced it to our college faculty last week. It was a massive hit with the faculty as they made the connection between remote learning and the power of video-based asynchronous discussion. They saw the value before, but remote learning put a new lens on how powerful video can be for connections.

Not fantastic. Takes up space but I have to download it for school, why can't downloading it be optional for mobile? If you intend to put ANY effort into the response you're making, be prepared to have to start again multiple times because once you get into some things, they don't let you get back to editing the video. Honestly not a fan of flipgrid, I wouldn't leave a review for this unless I was forced to use it. But I am. So here's my opinion.

Ok, I love flipgrid and all, but I have downloaded it 3 times cause it kept saying that flipgrid wasn't responding, and also, after I finished my video, I press the arrow, but it doesn't take me to the camera on flipgrid, it is plain black with an arrow and a cross, and if I press either one nothing happens, so I then have to go onto chrome and do the video again and it keeps not working, so I have to download it again and again :( :( :(

When I go to the Educator Dashboard the app opens up my browser. I am confused by that. Did I get a setting messed up? It looks like it's not me. I read about 10 reviews and I see that the Dashboard hasn't been integrated into the app. Seems the app is Mainly for Students. Bummer. I hope that is on the list to get done SOON!

Where has this app been? Have I been living under a rock or what? My HS students and I have been having a blast with it during the school closure. I plan on continuing to use it even after we are back in the building. It has been a great way to build our classroom culture and interact with each other. I look forward to expanding how I utilize this tool in my classroom.

I simply love the app. The discovery came right on time when needed during these hard times and when distance learning is a must. My students are engaged more than ever and it is fueling our creativity. 100% recomend to fellow teachers.

Flipgrid is a great and fun teaching tool for teachers to use especially during school closure where students need to stay at home and communicate with the teachers using online learning applications. I recommend all teachers to try and use flipgrid as it is very user friendly and its' features are current with vibrant colors, makes it more likable among the students. Students can share their ideas through videos and post it on flipgrid. This tool is also a great way to integrate the 21st CLD in our teaching and learning.

I love the concept, it gives my students the ability to show their learning in a different way than they are used to. It is a great way to differentiate instruction. I wish it worked in browser and you didn't have to download the app to use.

I hate that I need this for school or I would never use it. It constantly crashes anytime I try to record, which is very inconvenient when trying to complete assignments. It is full of glitches and does not work. Would absolutely not recommend

Flipgrid is an awesome and easy to use educational tool! It has allowed me to create some unique learning opportunities for my scouts during the pandemic. It has enabled educators and learners to adapt to new norms, while maintaining a high level of accomplishment.

This app is very unreliable. When I saved a draft, it scrambled up my different clips when I came back. Then, I accidentally pressed the publish button so when I tried to go back to the editing screen, it just trashed my work completely.

This app is truly something else! I love FlipGrid because it gives my preschoolers a voice. They are able to speak their mind and even view their friends answers. They all have so much fun using it, too.

Fantastic! I use Flipgrid in soo many different ways to get my students talking. I love that I can respond personally to their videos. Especially during virtual learning, this is some great 1-to-1 contact.

This has been a great way to connect with kids during distance learning! I have enjoyed seeing and hearing them respond to academic questions and show off their talents and new skills while we are all at home.

I'm a digital integration specialist and I have used flipgrid for professional development. A great way to keep adults engaged and take it back to the classroom. I wanted yo add that this has been great for remote learning and keeping a connection.

Flipgrid is an amazing program because it has motivated some of my shy learners to truly express their ideas. It has made my Reading and Writing classes more engaging because now every learner has a space to share his/her thoughts, and they enjoy seeing their classmates on the videos.

Whenever I put in a flip code, it says there is trouble with the code. It's worse because I cannot just use the website on a mobile browser either. It means that posting GB a video is simple impossible for many users.
Love using this app with my students! They love recording videos of themselves and seeing responses and it is instant engagement for me as a teacher! I works great individually or in groups.
Very engaging for remote learning, my students and I are creating videos to share what are some of the things we miss about school. The app is very user friendly!
So amazing to see my students and have a way for them to connect with each other during distance learning!♥️ The app is great and easy for me to respond back to students that way.
Great app. I use for my son's homeschooling and he loves it. I wish there could be a higher capacity for resolution or video size.
The Flipgrid app is so easy to use! I use it at school with my students and they love recording themselves featuring their inventions, book reviews, and prior knowledge videos.
Seems pretty straightforward. Not a fan that the educator interface just opens into a browser, though I understand why that is.
So far it's pretty interesting but as a very tech savvy person, the UX is a bit jumbled. I'm SO excited to use it with my kids
I love to use Flipgrid to allow my students to respond to different questions so that everyone's voice is heard, not just a few.

I have found Flipgrid to be very user-friendly for educators and students because of its easy navigation. Flipgrid is a highly engaging tool to incorporate into your teacher practice and is appropriate for students of all ages as well as for PLCs.
I have just started to use FlipGrid and the impact has been amazing. The students are able to articulate their projects better and become proficient at presenting

Flipgrid has been an awesome resource to use during distance learning. Thanks to flipgrid my ELLs can practice their speaking skills and are more engaged. They have posted videos plotting the story, sharing what they are thankful for, and even videos for our virtual talent show.
This app has been amazing in being able to keep relationships built up and contact going with my students during this remote learning time. It is fun and engaging for all!
Heard of Flipgrid but never used it much until my online masters course required it. Very simple and effective. Looking forward to diving in more with all the features.
This app is amazing! It gives my 4thbgrade students a voice and creative outlet in life. My quite students are finding their voice!!!

Flipgrid has been an excellent forum on which I've been able to communicate with my students in an interactive way. It gives them a chance to record and speak and demonstrate what they're thinking. One thing I think would be super cool in the app would be the educator dashboard integrated (instead of opening in a browser window) - I love the interface for students, though. And how easy it is to record and respond to others and watch conversations right from your phone.

My teachers use this app to connect with us and to see our bright faces.From my point of view(most of the reviews are educators) i love this app, the only thing i wish they would add is a option to add a custom image like art if you don't like your face in the thumnail. I love that you can add your own video that is edited or something like that, the reason why i love this feature is because i like editing my videos. Iv'e been on Youtube for 3 and a half years. This app is AWESOME
I have enjoyed using flipgrid as new way to stay connected with my students during the COVID-19 pandemic. I has allowed me to think outside of the box to engage students differently!
I love this app because it allows my students to take ownership and be proud of their thoughts! It also allows those students who are shy in class to express themselves.
Filipgrid is a great tool for empowering students to use their voice. They gain confidence in their abilities and are encouraged to continue to respond to challenges in fun ways.

It's been a great way to stay connected with my students during this shutdown! My only wish is that there were an easier way to leave a written reply or comment, it gets a bit frustrating having to continually make videos of myself in order to reply. If there were a "like/love/lol" response button, that would be a major improvement. Also, when leaving a reply video, why must we also re-take a new photo of ourselves EVERY time? It really gets old. FlipGrid has its "pro's" with it's "con's".

It works very well except for the fact that about 50% of the time for me, the selfie button disappears for no reason. Since FlipGrid requires you to take a selfie for every video, there is no way to get it back without closing the app and losing all your progress. I really hope the developers see and fix this, since my school intends to keep using this app, and I've had to redo SO many videos! Also please let us back track from the selfie stage to the video stage if we need to change something
Awesome program that enhances the kids learning by having an easy and fun way to show their learning and understanding.
This app is great for eliminating the written language barrier for my ELLs. Students are able express their thoughts and practice their language skills at the same time.

Absolutely love the connection I am able to have with my students using Flipgrid! Our students use a Flipgrid to document books they are reading. This allows us to create a student led reader's advisory for our school library. Our students love this application and being user friendly for students allows them confidence to complete this task independently. Highly recommend!

It's very easy to use. It enhances my students' learning experience. I use it in my French classes and it helped my students with their pronunciation and mastery of the language. My students post their French tongue twisters and daily vlog in French (of course). Being able to reply to each other's posts is a great way of interacting with each other. Slowly but surely they are able to gain confidence in speaking the language. I definitely recommend Flipgrid for academic use esp for foreign language classes.

I love using this with my students, especially with our distance learning. However, I don't understand why I can't use my phone to create or upload videos in a topic. My internet is sketchy, so uploading videos with my computer takes a very long time. If the app had that capability, I'd give it 5 stars.

This app is an excellent tool and resource to use in order to stay connected with students while dealing with the Covid-19 crisis. I am unable to livestream my lessons, but wanted a way for my students to see my face and for me to see theirs. Flipgrid is the perfect medium for just that - a way for us to stay connected in a controlled & safe setting.

I am so excited to bring this tool to my kids so they can develop amd share ideas. They are already making videos on social media and now they can at school too and really use their student voice while receiving feedback.

Flipgrid is very easy and fun to use. My students loved using it because of the variety of things that they can do with their video. the feature like stickers are very easy to customize and very engaging. it also gives courage to those who are very shy inside the classroom. it is very helpful specially during this time where we can no longer attend the face to face class. we can still see each other in a very creative and unique way.

It is fun and simple.My students and I like it. The idea of being able to communicate in the online schooling is awesome and Flipgrid allows that, with only a few steps of logging in. I also like the possibility to review and decide if a video is ok to send and also the possibility for teachers to control the reactions and activities of students. We had a minor problem with logging in. However, it only happened with one group. I reccomend the app.
Simple and secure way of engaging students vocally. Responses are secure and great teacher dashboard.

Awesome opportunity for youth to connect in fun a d creative ways. Wish the opening screen showed last few topics at least instead of drop down. And the place card is just a still from the video instead ofnthe placecard made by the topic creator. Just a few initial observations, otherwise awesome so far! Using it as a way for scouts to stay connected. Great for that!

Flip good is a very useful learning tool but there is a flaw that I must point out during a presentation I was making, I was trying to delete my last clip I messed up on but instead of doing that I deleted all of my clips and at the start over again. It is very good it to use for school but it suffers from that flaw alone by a major degree, that is it is the only reason I am making this review.
Flipgrid is a great tool to use for virtual learning! It sparks conversations and allows students and teachers to connect with one another!

I started using this app two days ago, and I already love it. It helps engage my students with each other on a face-to-face level. I also appreciate the security levels. One recommendation: I think teachers should have the option of approving videos before they are posted (like in Padlet). Thanks for this app during this Coronavirus school closing!

One of the most amazing things about this app is how easy it is for my technophobic teachers to use. I normally show them the app in practice and let the kids' enthusiasm for "flippin'" win them over. When these teachers see how much more their students respond, when they can respond on their own terms, the teachers are so thrilled with the response that they start talking about with other teachers and even sharing it with their evaluators and administrators. It is transformation for teachers

Love Flipgrid! It has empowered and given each student of mine a voice. Every student feels as if they have a say and place in my classroom. In addition, Flipgrid has provided an authentic platform for sharing, talking, dialoguing, and learning from one another. It is a safe place where students have the time to carefully record what they want to say.

I couldn't get the audio to work on my laptop, so I had to download the app. I did not spend nearly an hour recording the perfect response only for it to delete the video because I forgot to take a selfie. There needs to be a backup option to store videos. I'm removing this app. Will not recommend!

Just make the website mobile friendly for God's sake. I already have 4 different apps on my phone from different classes and I'm running out of storage space. Surely it wouldn't be that hard to make the website mobile friendly but what do I know. I'm just tired of downloading apps I guess.
Fabulous app for connecting with students and allowing them to have a voice.
This app isn't good due to have no download facilities and display automatically switching off during video operation. Regards..

Flipgrid allows students to record themselves at their own convenience (which is great for the younger siblings of those who have older siblings needing priority on tech devices, especially if the household only has 1-2 recording devices available). Students will not feel like they "missed out" on an activity that was done in real-time.

This platform would amazing in a regular face-fave classroom setting but is even more of an asset during the Learning From Home experience. It is easy to use, the students have so many options to creatively express themselves, and it's helped bring back the life to my virtual classroom!
I love this app because my students can create and share a video on a topic they are interested in. I also love how students can watch and like each others videos.

The FlipGrid app so easy to use! FlipGrid is a great way to bring student voice into the classroom and community--and the app allows students to easily record themselves or switch to recording something. The app is very intuitive to use for beginners. In addition, FlipGrid is constantly adding new features and updates to keep improving the resource.

Flipgrid has been absolutely wonderful in helping me connect with my students while we are doing emergency distance learning. Flipgrid gives me the chance to model activities and gives students choices in how they can share their voice! I have enjoyed seeing my students' creativity in responding to prompts, and it is so easy to use that even my 2nd graders can do it!

I am loving every new feature you are adding.I use it as an educator in my classroom.As a language teacher I find it very useful in various roles,to make the voice of even most shy and quiet student heard,to evaluate their spoken English skills,for Assessment as well as for global collaborations to mention a few uses.It is my favourite tool as a Microsoft educator expert .What I love most is its continuously evolving new features. Kudos to #TeamFlipgrid.

This app has been a very helpful tool for my to assign students an oral presentation. I have recommended it to my colleagues to use. I demonstrated a way it can be utilized in every subject. It allows our students to open their minds to creativity.

We love the FlipGrid app! It is really easy to use! My students can reflect on questions that they may be apprehensive to answer in front of their peers. We use it to practice languages but also for the fun to do a a big search around the school! Flipgrid is constantly doing updates and adding new features to keep the Flipgrid improving! Flipgrid brings the student voice in to the classroom!!

I want to thank the wonderful people behind Flipgrid. I used it over the last two years as a way to empower student voice in my classroom. However, Flipgrid has become a vital tool for me as we entered the world of distance learning. I reached out to the people of Flipgrid on Twitter when I had a few questions several weeks ago. They were informative, helpful, and responded quickly. I am eternally grateful.

It is a great app. Workes very well, easy to use for teachers, students and families. All the educators love it and have begun to use it in my school. This app supports ELLs and you can practice your speaking skills.

Flipgrid and the Flipgrid app have transformed my classroom by allowing students an even larger voice. I am able to see and hear student reflection, observation and thought processes. It allows me to interact with students on personal level. The app has worked flawlessly on both Android and iOS. The addition of QR codes and AR ability have raised student/teacher/parent engagement to the next level!!

I love FlipGrid for my students! It is an awesome tech tool to meet kids somewhere they are familiar.. they can video themselves and personalize their responses. They love it and it's a great break from written responses and an excellent way to do presentations, especially for distance learning.

The app itself is fine, it's just not a good design for me to be forced to download the app when there's a working web model. I'm unable to even record my voice using this platform because my PC doesn't have a webcam, so I tried using my phone but it requires you to download the app. Bad business model.

I love using flip grid with my students especially now that I don't get to see them every day #covid. Originally I only used flip grid to have the kids respond to something. But since teaching has been turned n its head i'm using flip grid to continue morning meetings, push out mini lessons, and even have a forum for the kids to write letters to each other #classroompostoffice

I am using Flipgrid through our SSO-Clever with my students. It's been a great way to connect with students while they learn remotely. I can see them, they can share their responses through an audio recording which they are enjoying. I can watch their clips, assess their knowledge of the content assigned and send them a response back quickly.
I have been using this app with my music students to turn in assignments. its easy for them to use and easy for me to grade.

Flipgrid is such a robust app for amplifying student voice! They keep improving this amazing free app and it just gets better and better. The disco library allows for teacher collaboration, shorts are fun ,and GridPals allow global connection. The fact that students can now splice various video clips together from the whiteboard feature, the flipping camera feature, the pull from camera roll feature added so much functionality. The Mixtapes make it possible to share highlights or compilations.

Dear Flipgrid developers, what's the point of having a whiteboard feature if it doesn't work? I am trying to record with the whiteboard and if I try it kicks me off immediatley, if the app isn't supposed to let you do that then maybe you should implement a tutorial so that everyone knows that. I'm sorry if this comes off as aggresive but i am trying to successfully complete my online learning and a nonfunctioning app doesn't help me do that. If this is a problem on my part please do let me know!

Wow, looking back to my first grid from 2017 until now, all I can say is my love for Flipgrid continues to grow. The capabilities of what Flipgrid can do for students needing to share their work are useful and ever evolving. Especially in the current education climate, Flipgrid is proving itself to be an invaluable digital learning tool.

HORRIBLE apps It crashes all the time. It won't show my progress of my video. I had tries this so many times and it didn't work. I couldn't upload it since my teacher said I was missing work even thought I had send it. So I have to try again and it didn't show my video.
Great for connecting for school in Kindergarten. Safe way for parents to add video n such to my 6yr old classwork in kindergarten.

I've used flipgrid since 2018 and each class I have introduced it to loves it. I love using it as a collaboration tool and where the students can use their voice. This is a must have in the classroom.

Flipgrid has been an excellent resource for me to stay engaged with my students throughout this online learning process. It puts a fun twist on the average classroom environment where students can learn and have fun at the same time by posting videos, photos with emojis, seeing and commenting on fellow classmates projects, and so forth! I'm looking forward to learning more about it!

My first experience with flipgrid but a lot of our teachers use it, so thought I would jump in, too! Looking forward to using this with my students and colleagues. I think it is a great tool especially right now with so many of us working from home as well as our kids.

Nice app, using it with my classes for the first time this week as we are all working from home - some students are accessing it easily, others are struggling to work out how to post. Planning to keep exploring how it can add to my lessons and see if I can get the majority of my students onboard.

I attempted to use the website. Which made me download the app. I then moved on to my assignments, suitably annoyed. But when I had finished a review of the book we were reading, it simply stopped working, threw an error, and crashed to the menu. This happened two more times, and I just couldn't get it to work.

I have been aware of Flipgrid for some time but in general teaching hadn't considered how I could integrate it. Now we are distance learning this platform is perfect for foreign language teaching as students can record their responses without the anxiety of others listening. Already had great feedback from students.
The idea is great, but I believe the app needs some improvement. For example, I need to do everything through the app without goings to the website and log in every time.

This has been a great way for students to discuss the story we are reading. Students are able to make a video response to my daily questions and must gather their thoughts and ideas while presenting them in a way that their peers will understand. Easy to use!

So new user friendly! My students were on and participating in a matter of moments after I created my first topic. I use Flipgrid for fun, community building as well formative/summative assessments. I love seeing their creativity and positive interactions with each other. It's been an invaluable resource during this time of distance learning as well.
This is a wonderful app to initiate students ideas, opinion. We as educators get to know their expertise. There are lot of other features for students to enjoy their learning process.
Flipgrid can be used in so many different ways and is so engaging for students. It's a fun educational tool that I use weekly.

I don't have extensive experience with the app, I primarily work from the site on my Chromebook. I am excited to see the features and give more timely feedback to my students. This is so great, especially during this mandated distance "virtual" learning due to the COVID-19 crisis.
I love how this app allows my classrooms to connect in a easy-friendly way. All the education community beneficts from it.

Flipgrid is awesome! It allows students to literally have a voice in their learning. I've used it for exit slips, formative & summative assessments. Students get specific feedback from me, they resubmit & we continue on. It's amazing! And the badges I earn for different achievements (number of hours videos have been viewed, number of video views, etc) are just icing on the cake! I highly recommend Flipgrid for any educator seeking to increase student choice & voice. Will - Elem PE teacher

Flipgrid is a fantastic way to allow for group discussion and student comments in our new digital classrooms! I have been using it as a form of assessment for topics that kids are currently learning at home. It has been a great way to track their learning and actually hear it from their own mouths! would recommend to teachers for sure!

The plus version interferes with the original version I loved and used daily. I can not recommend this to my students anymore as it has turned into a take every penny you have app and when they do the extras are only available for the US Market. Ask the question, do you want plus. If not remove all the buttons which now fill the screen, I would even pay to just remove them.

Great app! Love it! Some of the more advanced algebra isn't on the app yet, so I'll give a suggestion or maybe more on what could be added, since I needed help with it! It doesn't recognize certain things, Mostly the more complicated things! What I think could be added, I'll take changing subjects for example, is: A way to type in an equation for changing subjects for example, to say what the subject should be and what it currently is! Would be helpful, just an example btw! Thanks!

I paid for photomath plus just to see the extra steps and explanations. It was not worth it for me, as I wasted so much time trying to get the app to take the right size picture of the problem. Not only that, it would take a picture and not read the problem correctly. I took pics from my book, my worksheet, and also copied them onto notebook paper to see if the issue could be resolved, but it still wasn't after many retakes, and time wasted trying to troubleshoot. No, it was not my camera taking wierd pics, because I tried other apps (that are free, mind you), and the other apps worked just fine, better even.

It has helped me so much, especially since the lockdown because the corona virus. I can't always ask my teacher to explain the question so it's easier just to use photo math. I love the fact that the app gives you the solution instead of just the answer. Photo math has really helped during this pandemic!! 😊👍🏻

Before the new update, it was the best app for this purpose but now after the update, I think that it's the worst app because I was using it to solve problems and to remember how it was solved. After all, the main problem is, its premium version which unables us to see how the question is solved. So it is humble request to solve this issue because all the stundents can't pay the cost for premium one.

Even with the free version you still get a good explenation of the sum in question. If you want a detailed explination for a better understanding though, you will need to pay for the "Plus version". It is easy to use and gives an exact answer ,you just need to make sure that your scan is correct and all will be well. It has helped me grasp a few of the equations that I was struggling with, and with this pandemic it is a less "imabrasing" way of getting help with your maths.

Used to be so good. Then they added Photo math plus. A monthly subscription to something that was originally free.... It completely ruins the purpose of the app as a majority of the maths and equations its used to solve require the method too. This app is no where as good as it used to be. And a promotion isnt a solution as it only lasts a short amount of time and then the problem persists.

I love this app because I'm terrible at math. And normally, I don't care about the steps or explanations, I just want the answer. However, right now, I'm a parent suddenly having to teach my 5th grader math I don't understand, so the explanations and steps are necessary. And Photomath is offering a much needed free subscription until May 31, to help out during this time. Thank you!!

I tried multiple scanning a simple equation and it was able to provide me with the solutions for half of the equations and the rest it considered as invalid. I used this app to verify my solutions and it works with simple equations but with equations which are a bit harder or if it is a word equation, it considers them as invalid. I hope that the developers fix these issues with the app and I will definitely be up for changing my review.

This is honestly a life saver sometimes when I can't for the life of me figure out problems. It helps so much! I don't usually write reviews but I just had to for thia one. It's so good! I really need to thank Photomath for making the plus version free for quarantine now that we can't really ask teachers for help. Thank you so much! Shina

It used to be the best app ever before the update, and I used it whenever I needed help with solving a math equation. But with the new feature, I have to have premium before I can see the break up of steps to solve the expression. This affected me a lot because I no longer understand how to solve the math problems since all i get is a rough few steps n an answer. Also I can't afford to get premium, so this app isnt that great anymore.

Photomath is one of the app which is helpful to student jn solving their mathematicial problems and doubt where you can scan the sum or question and it solves it whereas sometimes it does not recognize the number properly but still you can type and edit it whereas step by step calculation is explained. It is one of the best helping app for students . Thanks to the developers.

It was great, until they added photomath plus. Everything used to be free until they added Plus and now you need a monthly subscription just so they can explain it a little better, it's not worth it because there are kids who use this just to understand things but there not going to pay money just to get told you have to move on number to the side and your done! They've ruined the app for many people.

This app is genius. I had an equation which I gave up and considered invalid. After trying Photomath it not only gave me the answer and a step by step tutorial, it also helped boost my confidence in solving math questions that are hard. The only downside i see to this app is that the Photomath Plus option costs and being a student i cant purchase it. I just wish everything was free. That would make it perfect 😍

Loved this app for a long time, but as I got into more complicated questions, one's that require a specific answer when there is several ways to write them, the app only gave me one option, while the other one that I needed had to be payed for. If you're looking for a basic calculator this app is handy, but if you need more in depth answers stay away from this app.

Really useful if I don't understand a question. It shows you the steps it uses to get to the answer and also explain it. Use it a lot during homework or when I don't have anybody to ask help on a question. However the app can still improve as I find it sometimes it doesn't know how to calculate some of the more complicated equations. Very satisfied overall.

This app is amazing, soooooo helpful. I don't think there are ads, none that I can remember being annoying. It's is extremely helpful if your stuck on any maths questions and gives you a step by step guide on how to get to the answer. I've just realised that you have to pay for the plus version which is quite expensive but It does really help and if you do have the money it would be a benefit but you can do without it, it just goes into more detail on the matter. 9.6/10

Used to be great. Used to just be an app where you could scan or type in a math problem and choose how you wanted it solved and it would spit you out the answer with steps of solving. BUT NOW it has all the math books in its system. So when you scan a problem in your book now, if it's not one of the first few problems, it shows part of the problem then for the solving steps and answers you have BUY a SUBSCRIPTION. Like I got this app to help me, not to empty my bank account. Do not recommend.

Used to be useful but now a plus subscription is required for any explanation. In previous update everything was available, this apps usage may vary. The Microsoft math solver has less detailed explanations but at the very least, it's free. Very unfortunate that the promotion is only limited time

Didn't open yesterday. After deleting cache and memory and then reinstalling. Today I tried again and it worked. Don't know what happened yesterday. Though it is solved now. Still 4 stars as the camera has focusing issues and sometimes is very slow. (OnePlus 6) (android 10)

This is the best app ive EVER used. Its amazing at reading everything put down and ive had this for less than an hour and have had no issues whatsoever. It solves everything percectly and when you take a photo of math problems on paper it even ignores the number before the problem! Absolutely stunning. It reads everything perfectly too and offers steps and everything and i have never been more pleased with an app. It exceeded my expectations.

This app was great helping explain math to my kids when it was free and simply provided step by step assistance... more importantly when it didn't redirect to other 'noise'. Even now, I'd gladly buy this app (if it doesn't redirect) for several dollars but I will not buy a subscription or sign up for a free limited time subscription. Think this is the wrong direction/business model...but I'm just one consumer. Lowered rating - based on your rote response it is obvious you aren't reading reviews.

before i could use this app and give it 5 stars but now it's just plain frustrating. i didn't mind photomath pro at first, as i could still watch an ad to get the detailed solution, but now i can't even watch an ad. i can't even buy photomath pro if i wanted to because it just kept loading no matter where i was, im guessing it's not available in my region. the methods for answering changed and this app is just redundant.
