Best app I ever seen on PlayStore. Full of knowledge. Free of cost, a great initiative Not only for small age group but also for those who are pursuing higher education. Amazing 🤩🤩🤩

I really love Elevate's interface. It's clean, colorful, and eye-catching. I really enjoy training with this app. It has really helped me improve my Math aptitude. This is a very well-designed and executed app. I'm using the free version now but I will upgrade to the premium version very soon. For everyone who's crying about the app being "too expensive," $40 for a whole year isn't that expensive. If you can afford a smartphone, you can afford this app.

I've used lumosity for a while and just switched over to elevate. The graphics and tasks are engaging and challenging. I haven't paid for pro yet though. You can play the games you trained that day a few more times without pro and I can't justify the cost yet. Other than that, it's a great app!

Despite my rating, I'm giving advice to the people who made this game. Instead of making the game free to install but cost money to have fun, you should make the game cost money so people will know they have to pay for it. Or you could advertise that the game costs money.

This is the most effective braining app I've came across, especially for communication skills. Fairly well designed games with constant updates. However it's recommended to mix your experience with real life. Also, it's only aimed for English speakers.
Interesting and challenging in term of your memory recalls. I think i need to read more everyday. And this app will evaluate your skills. Thanks for this. More power!

Great app, not sure about the up front price. I'm using the trial and love the variety of types of game in each category like math, writing, etc. I really liked the pretest, that you can see why your answers were wrong, and see graphs of your progress. I would absolutely have subscribed to this for a monthly fee but unfortunately can't justify paying $40 up front for an app. They have to get paid due to no ads, but monthly would be more doable for me. Maybe in the future!

Seems like a really great app, would like to give a more detailed feedback when I'll have used it for more than a week. My problem : I want to subscribe to elevate pro, but monthly and I can't find the monthly subscription anywhere, it only suggest me the yearly plan (which I can't afford). If this problem is solved, I'll change to 4 stars, and with a little more time on the app to make my mind, probably 5 stars later. Thank you in advance

The games are wonderful. fun to play and rewarding. However, I'm not understanding, the grading system, at all. Also, I'm going thru each lesson several times b4 understanding the instructions on how to 'play'. I'm guessing, it gets better the more familiar you become with the format. Still trying to decide if I can afford to keep past 7 day trial. Absolutely worth the free trial.

This app is very good for training yourself in memory, writing, math and a few others as well, my main problem with it how ever is that it requires, understandably, money to get better courses, if you don't spend some money on it, you won't get the full package unfortunately. But thankfully it does not waste your time with aggravating ads so that I'd very nice considering it's a mobile app.

Most of it is locked behind pro. Overall its a very well made app and its quite a fun way to educate and train brains. It can be seen as a game really. Im pretty sure some people can get obsessed by it. My main issue here is a big one. The app is not cheap especially for the ages it targets. Its around 45$ annually. Which is way too much considering that its a mobile app. And that its mainly targeted towards children and teenagers who probably dont even have the means to pay for it. Such as a CC

As a writer, this helps refresh my mind and builds better boundaries. As for math, which I royally suck at, I find myself enjoying the lessons. Getting to see a visualization of where I rank in these subjects really helps to motivate me to keep going. It's not drawn out and confusing. I tend to soak up more information when they're bite-sized and include helpful common-sense tips!

Come on guys, I can't even play the free version without putting up money first. "7 days free! Just select your payment plan and you can play the first week free." Why not give me a real trial without any strings attached to see if I'm willing to put up money first? This is a sure fire way to kill your app before it's noticed. 1 star indeed without even being able to experience any of it. Ridiculous!

This is a marvelous, one of a kind app. The efforts that have been put in to make this, aside from the fact that it contains stuff which really works, makes it fun and highly productive. They truly deserve to be paid for this sort of work and content. A holistic brain training in every possible field is what this contains. Must must must download for everyone, instead of the so many stupid, useless apps in the market.

The LIMITED TRIAL ACCOUNT is NOT very valuable, as it gives you EXACTLY 22 "free" (there's ads) games, and after that you can pay $40/year to keep going. These are simply brain teaser puzzles that they want A LOT of money for, and given all the research on how these really are just games and will not replace proper study and education, it's nowhere near worth the cost. I'm not even going to bother with the "free" stuff, because what is the purpose of hitting a pay wall in an app like this?
Great app! Love using it. It has no ads and provides subtle reminders about your daily session. Good explanations on each topic covered. Love it
It is a really good game. However, it forces you to buy pro. It does not even allow you to finish the daily exercise without the pro upgrade.

The app is fun and nice to use except that : 1. The timer is way to fast for many games if you are in beginner level (ex. commas, fractions). Not given enough time to think and answer. With the current speed, I do not find value in this app, it's just frustrating. I wish the AI would adjust the timer to give me more time to think. 2. Many games do not have enough content or questions(ex. Played visualization 3 times and got same words repeatedly).

It wait till you have entered all your information to tell you that you have to pay for it. Don't get it! It $40 a year if u want to know. Well that's what I'm seeing, may charge u more after the first submission.

the app is really nice, but if you don't plan to pay approximately 50 euro, you can only play 3 easy levels per day. Basically, you have to pay for it to use it. No one downloads application to use it for only 3 minutes per day. EDIT: after 1 star review developer replied and posted a link for "free" version. It's literally a link that confirms I need to pay full price to access more levels per day. If I could give it 0 stars I would!

Bought it on sale. I enjoy it. My 2 year old sits with me when I play, he likes the colors, graphics and sounds. I find it to be educational, helpful and fun. Question, Is there a way to reset all progress?

This app is phenomenal. I am 1 month in and my skills are improving as I continue to use the app. I would only like that the types of games would change daily. I am in the 80th percentiles in Math, Reading, and Writing. But at 40% in Speaking. It's not fair that I can't make progress if the corresponding games are inaccessible. I only get Memory, and I've only gotten Eloquence once. Can the games be more evenly randomized?

I really thoroughly enjoy this app. I've been doing the free trail and find it very not only fun, but helpful. I used to use lumosity years ago but got bored of it quickly so I decided to try this one out. I think it is amazing and has been helping me with being articulate in my day to day life. I just wish it was more affordable. Unfortunately, once my free trial is over I'll have to say goodbye to a lot of the fantastic perks that come with the membership. Super cool app- I reccomend!

Exceptional, beautiful, well-crafted minigames to help you hone your learning skills in reading, writing, speech, and math. A few of them are rudimentarily simple and can be repetitive, but there is always a piece of knowledge you will acquire with each game activity. There are informative stats and progress reports available, as well as extra study sessions. I definitely intend to be playing this every day.

such an awesome app!!! really fun and engaging puzzles that make me feel as though I'm truly applying myself! 5/5 but I will say this, i don't think the memberships should cost money for more than a week. maybe extend the trial to a month? Because I know you can't make something this awesome, free ~ maybe not yet. Just a thought, thanks for this fun and stimulating pastime.

Elevate offers a nice break from other activities...whether quarantine boredom or a simple "wake me up" has you wishing for a lift, it provides a few minutes of self-improvement and challenge. I like the fact that there is a simple daily tracker at the conclusion of the game. The sound effects are pretty interesting as well.

this app is more like a game cuz it helps me to understand the things i was taught in high school. it brings my life to a new "level of life" when i play it. there is no other game out there like this one. it has dofferent subjects i can choose from. i definitely recommend it to anyone out there who wants to continue learning but doesnt want to sit in a classroom for hours. this app taught me the same things i learned in middle school and early high school. thanks elevate!
The app is great but stopped saving my progress anymore. I have acheved proficiency in writing and as soon as I leave the app, it goes to advanced and gets me to work for it again.

Excellent app; a quality product which 100% worth paying for. I fell behind in school due to having chronic anxiety, and never quite mastered many basic english and maths skills. I've been using the app for a few months now, and have noticed great improvements in my speech, reading, writing, information processing and memory. It's surprisingly fun too. Thanks, Elevate :)

"Sign up for our seven day free trial then $39.99 per year after that." This is basically the message you get as soon as you complete the placement test, which mostly just consists of very basic level 1 regurgitation questions. Certainly, nothing I've seen so far is interesting enough to make me want to pay $40 for it. You're probably better off going to Khan Academy or Coursera, options that will teach you applications, not just rote memorization, and won't charge you upfront either.

Enjoying this app so far, because I'm constantly learning. It's definitely helping improve my core speaking, writing, and mathematical skills. The UI/UX of the games and the app is also intuitive and fun to work with. However, I think this app can be improved by including excercises that develop the creative side of the brain too. Furthermore, its performance metrics display can be improved by showing some meaningful data. For example, comparing the person's IQ to the avg in age bracket.

Just what I need - not many games focus on as much writing and grammar, and give right answers immidiatwly after. There are only 3 free games per day that take 15 minutes of my life. However, I don't like the fact that I am forced to do the exercises in order: because I didn't get high enough score so I couldn't even attempt the other games. I don't need an app to punish me when I am already trying my best. I couldn't even quit the game within the app! Really not happy about that.

The visuals are eloquant, albeit much more can be achieved in the daily workouts. Something that a person can customise, rather than the script that decides levels based on a single test. Also multiple sectors should be focused on daily tasks, rather than just Math and English (channeling mediums). Also subsections should be scalable.

Really loving this app! Can't wait to upgrade to Pro. I can already tell my math skills are improving because I'm answering questions faster. I just started playing this week. My goal is to improve my skills in math. I've got to get stronger! While I excel in R/W/S, and would rather play those games, I appreciate the set up of the math games and explanations when I miss something.

Haven't tried it, BUT: to use this app you need to consent to an automatic yearly subscription charge after 7 days trial. If you don't remember to cancel, you pay. If this company had any faith in the app they built, and believe it brings value to users, then they should charge on a monthly basis. But they chose to make profit off people who forgot to cancel in time or who didnt read the fine prints. Conniving business model...

It's very enjoyable, and challenging, especially if English, wasn't your native language! I feel that with each day, I'm progressing. That gave me a special sense of accomplishment. Monitoring the time and the score curve, helps me understand when during the day my mind is at its peak. Thank you for this gem. I hoped that I could pay for premium to encourage you, but sadly, in my country, it's not possible to make payments in other currencies.

It is just pure fraud and I advise everyone to stay away from the app. Once you sign up for free trial, they claim you can unsubscribe but that's pure fraud. I have been trying to unsuscribe for days and the app even said payment won't be made without your permission. That is all lies, no unsuscribe button and they are so sneaky about using your card details. Just taking people's money away is pure fraud. This is so illegal and unfair. One year plan has been activated already, I want it delete

Exceptional. I am a student of English and this app has helped me in ways I did not imagine: I read and assimilate faster I was poor at math but I'm getting better I now have countless words at my disposal to express myself I'm giving it five stars. This is the best intellectual game I've seen so far.

Love this app. It really makes you aware of certain things you might have forgotten during college or university. Plus I find it's a great way to get ready for the rest of the day. Kind of like a warm up before the actual race. Nice job guys. Highly individualistic and responsive, a great tool for kids while they are off right now. 🙏🙏🙏

3 exercises for free daily, it's a good way to train the mind. However, there are 2 glaring issues. 1. About half of the exercises have horrible instructions. The actual exercise is different from what was instructed. E.g. Estimation (instructions say slide, but in actual it's press) and Spelling (instructions say nothing about how it's going to be done, actual is just fill in the blanks!) 2. Some exercises are drastically harder than others, like Brevity, and I don't see how they would help

Even though I'd like to binge on more games in a day, I almost like the limitation of three games per day because it gets me excited each day to play my three games. And I just recently realized that you can replay the same games each day, each with new words/numbers/information. So if you're trying to achieve a higher score in each area, you can work on that as long as you like. Pretty good stuff.

It really does work, was dubious at first but it really does, I've been able to see my improvements and the games are fun and interesting, the scoring give you something to work for and to set yourself goal. Now I just have to find the money to purchase the app proper and I'll be a genius before I know it!

Everything is amazing, but I have one problem, app just closes or returns to the main screen when I try to start Subtraction game. It's not happening every time, but pretty often. Would be amazing if you can fix this issue. Edit: Now Subtraction can crash the game not only at the star, but when it almost finished, or even on after finishing last example.

Elevate is really interesting, it elevates intellectually just as the name implies, is very useful when you're in a boring state or when you want to exercise your brain apart from reading. I love the game that I want to subscribe it but the subscription charge is rather too high (N14,500/year) & there is no offer to aid in the subscription. If I subscribe this game it will be my first time to pay for a game. If you guyz can do something about the subscription charge it will be really nice.

Love the app! Really like to play it in the morning to get my brain started for the day. My only complaint is there is times when I do not know a word or not sure how it is pronounced and since you are timed (to make things more challenging) I do not have time to sound out the words. I would LOVE it if the app could say the words in some of the games. Like the game Agility.

I've used it for 2 months, and I bought it on the second week of use. I just loved it from the very beginning. I'm bilingual but not native in English, so this game will be awesome for people who want to improve their English, native speakers included. Also, the maths section is really good. I've found myself calculating faster and with a different focus. I would 10/10 recommend

I really enjoy this app. Very stimulating for the brain. Only complaint is you have to pay a subscription fee and it is charged annually instead of monthly. I wish monthly was an option. For me, $3.99/month is more budgetable than $39.99 annually.. I know it saves in the long run, but still wish is was an option so I could continue full access to all the games.

I love the mode of learning how to write, read and other modes that elevate gives me, but i have a co plain, i am trying so hard to pay for the pro session but it keeps asking me to use other cards, and trust me i have tried all the cards i have but its not responding. What should i do? I really need the pro session.

This game is like school but made quicker and fun somehow. I'm glad that the free version switches through games, but I definitely would've considered buying the full features one if it wasn't a subscription. This subscription thing will most likely not change but oh well it's still an entertaining game and something to do to keep you busy for a few minutes

Great app. I'm a teacher. Although I always did good in school, math was my weakness. I wanted to strengthen that plus it didn't hurt to get better at everything else. It really breaks down essential math skills using simple concepts. It also really helps with reading comprehension, context clues, and adding to your vocabulary. I love it, and it doesn't necessarily feel like work.! It's fun and challenging, so it keeps you engaged!

Elevate is the best brain training app on the whole store, first of all, the games themselves are not just games that our disguised as a brain training game; they actually train real world skills and teach you new things. Also the app graphics, animations and sound are very, very good. This app is very polished. I highly recommend it.

The scoring is meant to look more sophisticated than it is. It just gives you a high score, no different than an arcade game. Many of the challenges are silly with little instructions, left me looking at the screen wondering what I'm supposed to be doing.. and then you run out of time. Not so much for practice thinking, more like tolerating the extremely little amount of time given. Why is every game on a timer?? Probably because it means less content needs to be created. I want a refund.

This app is great, I only have the free version but it's honestly enough for me for 10 minutes a day or so. Only thing is there's so many flashing lights (mildly epileptic) which is to be expected here and there but the Measuring game actually made me sick I had to turn it off 😭 And when you get a good score the flashing at the end is unnecessary, but other than that it's such a great app I love it! Thank you!

So far so good, app seems to run well. I have a lot of fun with the games, it's challenging which is why I downloaded it. The math is difficult for me, they just kind of throw you in measurements which is a personal weakness without a tutorial. All things considered it's pretty great

It is only free for 7 days (this should be clearer in your app description) and you have to put in your credit card information up front (before your 7 day free trial) which I don't trust. Designed for you to forget to unsubscribe and get charged 39.99 subscription (which is yearly btw, so you better not forget to cancel next year too).

Can't even get past the sign in screen. It keeps making me retake the initial placement test over and over. After I finish it asks me to sign up with an email or other account but every time I try it says "an unexpected error has occurred". I figured it was my phone so we downloaded it to my finances phone (completely different brand from mine) and got the same result. Seems like it could be an interesting app if it was actually playable. 1 star, since 0 isn't an option.

This is a great thing to do over the corona. It turns learning into games! But the only reason I am giving four stars is because that if you dont pay money you cant do that much in one day you only get to do 3 games. That's only about 20 minutes. Because when I usually get on my 3rd lesson I usually want to play anouther game but I can only play the ones that I have already done and it gives you the same questions and if your like me you remember all the answers. But other wise it is great

It was good at first but the badges are really hard to get one is 100 day streak and other is 1000 excellent games , it is too hard there are even more worse badges than these , i got streak 80 and only one day i forgot and whole thing went which broke my heart and stopped playing this game ,i know i am irrational but i write what i think but otherwise its good.

Using the free version till now. A monthly payment option would have triggered my willingness to try the premium version. I'm finding it difficult to score. Can't tell yet if it's benefiting me. But I do get a sense lf practicing something that should improve my Writing and Listening skills.

It's an awesome game for those who want to evaluate & Elevate themselves. I love the graphics.. The statistics they show on how much I have improved.. The reports...I think I would be going for the pro version..i like the way the flexibility of choosing the games u want to play... Learning the fun way.. 🙂 ❤️😉🎮😊

This app is awesome! It has so many great qualities, that I don't even have time to touch on all of them, but I would definitely recommend it to anyone! Elevate is ad-free, fun, and offers personalized education targeting the areas in which you need the most improvement. I'm even considering purchasing the "pro" or premium content.

Warning: Developers "try" to create a addict out of the game with a 7 day free time period. actually a 6 day time frame to cancel "@ anytime" but will charge you a huge ridiculous sum if dont cancel on time. Good luck NOT getting ripped off using this. It's not really free. only allows you to play less than a few games (3 to be exact) just to try, then...ask you to play for "7 days free trials", then you to pay when forget. It's a rip off Gimmick. "Is not stealing because is legal"

Updated review: I still think an annual subscription instead of a lifetime fee is ridiculous at that price. The app is very limited in the data it gives you (for example: you can't see how you've charted in a game over time unless you've JUST finished playing it). However, it has so far genuinely improved my expressive aphasia and made me 10x more confident in my math skills. Elevate also desperately needs to be made seizure friendly. "Measuring" is fun but unplayable bc of the flashing.

I am not much of a gamer, but i like to learn English with fun. Another apps, like Duolingo, have just monotonous trainings. Here developers created games for the sake of fun. Great sound effects, also visual effects and statistics. Tons of games to choose in one app, I paid $21 for the year subscription. Free games are good, but they are short, and you cannot play what you want, only what is scheduled for you. I am very excited with such a variety of games. It's cool app!

I am enjoying this app so much. Sometimes I feel nervous, like I am back in school, but I am 56 and need some help with all these categories. It is so worth it to get the help I want without judgement, lol I recommend this app, because the daily lessons are quick and useful without having to purchase the extra lessons (which I have not). Thank you Elevate!

Engaging, enjoyable. Elevate inspires refinement, combining speed as well as accuracy in scoring. The animations add differentiation between the varying tasks, so the play feels fresh as you go from skill to skill. There is a rating feature that compares performance percentages with other players, for those who are curious about such things. Or who are competitive by nature. There are also personal skill level ratings going upwards of average by 3 more levels. Thumbs up... ready, set, go!
The games are pretty fun while being intense and remaining interesting. I am enjoying it the free version so far.

The free version of Elevate is fun and helpful, with a wide variety of games to challenge your brain. *Edit* One year later, Elevate is still my favorite brain training app, and ive been using the paid version for about six mos. Sadly, in many games ive plateaued and my scores have begun to drift down. With most in the 90th or better percentile, a few are in the 40s or below, and 2 are in the teens. Interesting to see my cognitive weaknesses. Highly recommend!

As someone who forgets words a lot, I feel like this is a good app to keep your mind active. When you have a short amount of time, it might be a good idea to open this app up instead of going on a different game or something. It's definitely helpful! It's also a very polished mobile game compared to most others, which is definitely a joy to see. This ain't no Raid: Shadow Legends.

I've never seen a game with GRAMMAR- SPECIFIC exercises! It also teaches through audio or visual learning & sometimes both! It has a variety of games with specific objectives. Any corrections to ur answers r immediate & non- threatening. I rarely leisurely read, but I'm compelled to read & exercise my brain through this highly recommended app. Feed ur valuable brain ...delicious braaaain🧠🧠🧠 Oh! & there r a few sales through the year for premium. The best I've seen maybe once is ~45% off.

I'm so sick of these apps calling themselves free when the only free thing is a teeny, tiny, dumbed down version. Worse - you don't even get that information until you give them your data. I'm going to start a list of the companies that do this and put them into EVERY. SINGLE. REVIEW. We the consumers have the power to make the changes.

I just love the design, and my communication skills definitely improved with the games they offer. It's very easy to take a few minutes and play 3 games a day. Or you go pro and improve more quickly. It's a very nice combination of playful learning, visuals and sound. I recommend to everyone who is into brain games.
Really enjoy all of the games. I bought it when it was almost half price, wouldn't have paid the full price.

I've just downloaded the game and managed to finish my first session. I would really like to have a opportunity to converse with the persons behind this brilliant app. I accidentally came across it by watching motivational videos. Just a pity I can't afford the subscription at the moment, but I'm surely telling people about this app. I'm really hooked onto the ingeniousnis about this app. And I live in a crime poverty invested area. I really would like to see the potential of the app.

I like it. I really enjoyed my one-week trial and just paid the annual fee so I can play this game all year. It's challenging, there are plenty of games to choose from, and I feel good spending my time playing something that will sharpen my mind instead of wasting my time playing something that dumbs me down. For what amounts to less than $5/month, I feel it will be well worth the price over the next year. Looking forward to gaining mastery in all subjects! Time to Elevate my thinking! 🧠

The app is very easy to use. They always ask for your feedback which helps with the learning games they design. I've been using the app for over a month now and it has helped me remember things I had forgotten over the years as well as newer things I was uneducated in. Overall I enjoy the app,helps keep my mind sharp.

Amazing App it helps alot while being engaging the only negative I have really come across is in the punctuation game with commas if you pick the wrong area your given one of the answers and it proceeds I dont think it should do that it should be counted as an error and shown at the end of that trial on the wrong location(s) and the correct one(s) if it's not a valid location for the punctuation then it should just state (invalid location). That's all so far.

The issues I had has been resolved and I would like to say that the app is really great and has so many games different from the ones I have seen before...I gave it four stars because the premium package is too expensive for me although I wish I could afford it and the free games are also very limited.

I've seen plenty of ads for this learning / improvement app - none of which even hinted at the idea there was a cost Additionally, the cost is quite high - $40 a year. The results it gave me from my answers to their rudimentary questions were, quite simply put, B.S. I tested them by purposefully answering the math questions with all random choices, while the writing skills section I knew entirely - yet received the same score for both sections. Coincidence, or scam? Maybe a bit of both.

Very streamlined, a lot more detail than other brain training games. The games/challenges are brilliant,, it also tells you where you are most advanced. The only thing I would change is the yearly cost and make it monthly, I'm not currently working so can't afford the yearly cost in one go, so I have given the 7 day free trial a go, even in the further info about the app, it says that elevate offers a 14 day trial and I only wish that I could continue with it.

I really enjoyed this app, but the cost is a bit high. I also feel that having an option for untimed games, especially math-based, would have been more beneficial. The race against the clock heightened my anxiety and I would sometimes pick randomly, rather than genuinely figure out the answer. And while I appreciate the explanations given for incorrect answers, because they interrupted the flow, I would have preferred them at the end of the training. An ADHD version would be amazing!

This Game is Wonderful!, Love the fact that how you can replay the games or activities you've done on the day! It is still pretty good considering the fact at how good the game is as I am not using the Pro Version! In Conclusion for me it is a 10/10!

It's a nice game. But I downloaded it hoping I could change the language to German to better my German training and understanding. I think this is a great way to introduce yourself and find your level of how much of another language you really know. It does that much for me in English and i consider myself already a "good enough" English speaker. Please consider hiring a team of translators to get the app in different languages. Then you would surely get my money.

Elevate - Brain Training Game is simply great and enjoyable. it keeps me engrossed. One of the best games that I have come across. I had given Elevate a 5 star rating even earlier. Now you can take it to be a 7 star rating from my side. I have tried other games, such as Lumosity. But most of the times I get the feeling that those games do not make me any more intelligent than what I am. In fact I get the feeling that their games treat you like a moron. Elevate is at a different level altogether.

It's motivational and keeps me trying to better my score. It WAS very good but in the last few days it has stopped synchronising between my devices, so I am losing all my progress and the number of continuous days I have been using it. Please can you tell me what is wrong, I have tried uninstalling & reinstalling it to no avail & am becoming quite distressed!!!! However the extra games are good fun & because of the sync problem I can now train twice a day!

A pretty interesting app, but you can't go as far as you'd like unless you pay. Some of the activities really do make you think though! I keep getting a decent run of days played, then something happens and I've gotta start over....dangit!

A well designed UI and with beautiful aesthetics, this app helps you spend your screen time in the most productive manner possible - improving a variety of skills. The gamification of content is top-class - engaging without being over the top, keeping the right parts of the brain focused. The assessment reports and recommendations are very detailed and informative, and the mainstay of the app. PS: @Devs - Please, let me know how to get in touch. Would love to work with you.

I love this app. It's challenging and app is easy to navigate. I like the prior history and progress reports, the immediate feed back, and keeping my mind sharp. Quick little note, I've always greatly disliked math. I've been working on that attitude, (I'm over 50), and actually ended up with math as my highest score. The after free trial price is probably fair honestly at $39.99 annually, however, I just don't have the funds for this at this time. I do need it for gas and groceries.

Helpful, engaging and most importantly, fun! Whether you're a novice or expert, proficient or deficient, you're bound to gain knowledge and understanding regarding personal skills necessary for success in the world of English-speaking with this app.

This app is fun and has many many tools to help improve and sharpen your brain. I've had it for a few days and I'm grateful I found it; I will definitely buy the pro version of the app. I highly recommend this for adults who are out of school and find their mind is less sharp than it used to be.

*original review at bottom* Update - developers have been in touch to point out that I could have used the app anyway but I have now uninstalled it and no longer feel the urge to use it. Four stars due to a positive response from developers, though I do think that the app was misleading when first opened as it implied that all that was on offer was a free trial. **Original (incorrect) review: Bait and switch - not a free app but a free trial.

I honestly wish this app was a bit more affordable, but to be honest it must be worth every penny. I'm an English teacher and this app helps me sharpen my skills. I love incorporate it to my private classes too! Students have found it to be a rewarding challenge.

Excellent UI. Enjoyable games. A few suggestions for improvement: A monthly option for PRO would be nice - I'd probably subscribe monthly. Progress is slow if your ability is far above the starting ability - should be an option to increase the difficulty or the rate of change in difficulty if you believe your ability is significantly above the current level. There is also a lot of brain training games in scientific literature - would be awesome if some of those could be brought to elevate.

Excellent App when I have some spare time to improve my skills. It's just 3 days into the app but I can already see the difference in my ways of working. I think I am able to consume oral data better and process it at much faster pace. 5 stars!

I really like it. It keeps my thinking game sharp. Only negative is why this game costs as much as it does. This is an app that people can benefit from and we are charging for people keeping their brains healthy? I did the free trial but thats all. Hope to see for free or at least cheaper in the future.

Games are fun and challenging. Enjoyable experience. However, I do prefer being able to play games we've already unlocked to let us practice in our own time. But I understand where the 1 day 3 games concept comes from. Great app.

This app is amazing , especially when english is your second language. Most of us read, watch, hear english all day but sometimes we still don't find the right words do express. Some of the games are pretty hard because you play against the clock and that makes everything more fun. Good job guys. I wished this app was there for many other languages.

Some of the tasks are very challenging, which is good, but how they describe the game can be a little confusing. The game is really helping me with skills, and I'm glad I got it. The free version let's you do 3 games a day, which is better for me than frustrating myself by repeating levels that challenge me over and over and not get a better score. This app is better than the other brain skills apps I've tried. I highly recommend this app to anyone who would like a good daily challenge.

Good and bad. Good at traing and teaching but not always in a good way. In the brevity training, it does teach brevity, but at the cost of poor communication. For example: I enjoy playing football, the "playing" should be removed? Why? It is an essential part of the sentence to determine if they like playing or watching, two very different outcomes.

The was pretty fun when you use it. However I just got charged through my PayPal acct for this app, which I never consented to when I downloaded it. You guys should definitely have a notification feature telling the user in advance that they're going to be charged, and for what. How do I cancel this "subscription " IMMEDIATELY?? I dont see any place in the app where u have the option to subscribe or unsubscribe.

My mother lived with dimentia and then Alzheimer's disease for several years before she passed away from related issues and malignant breast and lung cancer. I believe that mental exercise can help support brain function and stave off aging related brain dysfunction. This app helps me keep my brain sharp, reminds me how educated and intelligent I actually am and inspires me to learn and improve in areas I have not often challenged myself to grow in, specifically math.

Lots of bugs with Android Notifications Notifications on Android should show a sneak peek of the content of message (they only show title). Also, messages on the same thread should NOT generate several notification. Finally, I still see the notifications of messages that i have read after opening the app and reading them, which is rather annoying. If these are fixed, it is easily a solid great application.

I liked it most because it serves me as a student and a TA too. However, it has a bug on Android that text field of follow-up doesn't show the text immediately, that I need to tab the field again to show it.
It is a good app. I found it very useful to acess my resources from sources.
Very buggy. App crashes when responding to polls
After resetting password, I am unable to access my classes and other materials.
Not very user friendly and not RTL languages friendly. The resources page shows all of the recent announcements and the actual resources appear on the bottom, so it takes a lot of time to access it.
Not as good as the website. Installed the app, then uninstalled it and just used the web version in a mobile browser.
Good app, but please add dark mode for Android Q (only takes two or three lines of code!)
Bad app loading slow
Sometimes doesn't load all posts for a given class.
Superb app for online class.
Bad app. Bad ux, no option to delete
Does not load LaTeX code in android app.

I like that this app's notifications don't go away when we choose one notification. I wish the UI was more inspiring. It's usually tough to share links of posts with others through the app. Also a simple button to pin/unpin posts would be nice. When a follow up to our post/reply has been posted, the app should ideally auto scroll to exactly where that particular discussion in the post is happening - else we are forced to search for such posts. Its' not easy to simultaneously reference other post
Maths equations written in latex do not render in poll options.

Have you ever thought to yourself, "I want to use Piazza on my phone, but only if the interface is terrible and screws up the formatting and the functionality of the desktop site!" If so, this is the app for you! Seriously, just open Piazza in your phone's browser.
The app crashes when I try to check my messages and when I try to post a question. These issues render the whole thing useless.
Buggy and unintuitively designed. Most of the time crashes when you try to post things. 100% of the time if you try to post with an image. This corporation is a cash farm, not a software firm.
There is a bug where an answer or reply gets posted as blank in the app. I have to use the browser then to post the answer.
Opening a pdf forces you to use luminpdf or anypdf in a web browser app. The problem is the pdf never loads. Why not allow us to open pdfs in a pdf app or download files?
app is buggy, cant able tologin. technical architecture is flawed. always displaing old data even after refreshing.
the loading bar at app start loops forever, so I am not able to use the app because of this bug
The Perfect app. Easy to use. Not glitchy. One of the best UIs I have seen. 💯
fast and simple. cannot open documents on mobile.
The basic functionality is there, but i wish threads loaded a bit faster.
"We send you an e-mail every four hours for every class you're enrolled in, even if nothing actually happened. You are not permitted to unsubscribe." 11/10 the best website ever made
No notifications despite numerous reinstallation and clearing data
There is something wrong with this update I can't access my account please fix it
Doesn't refresh feed for some reason, completely useless
Cannot post questions as app crashes.
They really need a way for me to get to the resources folder, it's not that helpful to just be able to get to discussions
Not even opening just loading & loading
Download resources problem fixed for app
No tabs for assignments. I need to scroll past all the questions looking for the post saying "there js a new assignment, link"
can only acces Q and A. you cant access the resource tab
have to manually refresh to get the updated content
Great application. Thanks a million
Why in this apps I can't link
doesnt offer all the services available in website. doesnt show resources in APP.
I can't sign up or log in
Great for answering questions and saving the instructor time
My professor decided to use this vice Blackboard. The only thing that shows up in the app is a Q&A. No grades, no assignments, no schedule. Not very useful.
It doesn't shows the lectures class teacher uploaded!!!
Please make the app prettier lol.
Missing dark theme
doesnt even logins in
Best mobile experience
It's OK, butt whenever i try to write a new question it collapse down and couldn't ask my question 👎
the terms of this website is really sick, it disgusts me.
Very good app
You can't even download resources. What a waste.
Need to Access resources
Time wasting .. gay ads .... nothng useful ... Dnt try it .. dnt 'wSte ur data ..
worst-ever! share the experience
Made it more easier
Not really good
The new update sucks
Osm
Bad
Good
Pretty good
Nice
Amazing

Was going to complain about a clunky UI but hey, what do you know, they actually fixed it in the last update before I could review. Well done. Let's see if it also stops logging me out every few days now...

They have finally revamped the UI after several years and what a 
difference! It is a lot more useful, with more features. Almost the same as 
the full website! I don't know what took you so long, but thank you!

Great app for the question and answer part of Piazza, but I was hoping this app would have the folder feature so I could fully access my class. There are homework assignments posted on Piazza in a folder that I can't access through the app. Otherwise great UI and overall good app.
I can't even access most of the content in my class
Add dark theme please
Really helpful for discussion

Great app, but I wish there was a way to choose which class to display 
because some instructors do not mark classes inactive even if semester is 
completed.
New UI is substantially better. Great work!
Thanks to all the guys who finally updated the UI and added notifications!

It's really basic and loses a ton of functionality from the web version. 
The most glaring is the fact that you can't navigate a thread by a timeline 
like you can with the web page. This leads to you not being able to figure 
out what replies were new and what order they were posted in. It's okay for 
quick look ups of posts, but pretty terrible for posting and following 
along a long thread. Also doesn't respect the rotation of the device, so on 
tablets it can't work in landscape mode. Edit: PLEASE DISABLE ORIENTATION 
OVERRIDE. I installed an app to force the app into landscape mode and it 
worked fine, so there's no reason for the app to override the rotation. 
Edit: The orientation override is still here. The app looks fine on a table 
in landscape mode when used with a 3rd party app. I don't know why this 
hasn't been fixed yet.

It's good. Until I updated to Oreo (pixel, 8.0.0). Just freezes when i try to launch the app. Update: It's been like this for a couple of months now: completely unusable and freezes my phone. Giving it one star.

Most irritating thing: push notifications don't work. The app works at the most basic level, but it's not very good.

App is good but lacks some of the things I liked about the web version. Had 
to get the app because piazza web is a struggle to use on mobile

I installed it and it seems like only students and instructors can use it. Software developers are not allowed to use it. Q&A session shouldn't be limited to only students and instructors. The scope seems to be limited, if i'm not wrong.

notify students of posts of other students too.

Never notifies of any new posts, even when I have notifications enabled.
I am using it constantly  and some people r mostly posting anonymously and can someone help me find who are they and how to find anonymously post
Needs material design, garbage
From a student point of view, this app is very good. I use this app more than using piazza on computer.
Worst app ever seen.
Needs a UI upgrade badly

Indecipherable interface
Meh

Outdated

The online web design version is great however in the app you have to scroll to each answer and click to view it, then back out still back down to view the next question. It should be possible to scroll through question by clicking next.

I love this app, it allows me to access my coursework via my phone without having to struggle with the zooming in and out of the Blackboard website on my browser. I did give it 4 stars instead of 5 because it doesn't do an automatic login, I have to do a web login everytime I use the app but that's not as bad as doing everything over the web so just 1 star less for that.

Very buggy app, I used not have any issues before but now every time I open a course to check either grades or announcements it just tells me that there is a error from your part in a red banner at the bottom of the screen and won't show anything. Still one more year left before graduating so I hope this gets fixed soon. For now I'll leave a one start rating for the poor performance this entire semester.

This app was absolutely horrible before the recent update. I think it is still not as nice as the Apple version but regardless this app has improved with the recent update. The main problem I had was when you would click "Grades", it would NEVER load in so you can see the actual grade distribution. It was super annoying and I am SO happy it is fixed. It has been like 6 months now lol. Anyway, thank you for actually listening to your users' feedback and don't stop :)

Whatever latest update has made this app worthless. If I wanted a web login on my phone, it's easier to do so through the browser. The whole point of downloading this app was for it to function as an app... Not a browser wannabe. This happens every so often, but this has been a current issue for the entire week. (And yes, I have uninstalled/reinstalled, restarted after reinstalling... But I won't be factory resetting it) Really hoping graduate school won't use this, I'm over this platform.

This app is terrible. Things don't display properly. When trying to send an email, I can't even move the screen to read it before sending. I can't get documents to download. I have to go through the login process every time I open it, even with the same device, sometimes just when I push the back button. It didn't have all these problems during Spring 2019, when I first used I. It was much more user friendly and ran in the background without logging me out every single time.

Odd compatability, I use this with samsung dex to try take notes etc at the same time as browsing module content. Videos freeze when you move to another app, which browsers dont do. Also the app doesnt resize in dex, and small winow sizes can have issues with the layout on the module selection screen. apart from that the app is preferable over the terrible web ui.

Its functionality is limited so I'm not quite sure what the point of this app even is. Commonly can't display course contents except pure text, and even then the formatting gets weird. Can still check due dates and announcements though, this format's a little easier to glance at that then in "desktop mode" on a phone browser.

This app is so buggy as to be nonfunctional. For half of my classes, the "grades" page never loads. It says "Something went wrong" with no explanation. Over the last three hours I've received over 100 toast notifications for the same posted assignment. After uninstalling and reinstalling the app, it no longer allows me to even log in!! When I sign into my school's website, instead of properly logging in through oauth, it just opens up the Blackboard web inside the app. What do I even do now??

Something is wrong. I have used this app for years and I have never had issues. Now it doesnt show grades or messages from instructors. It looks different like it did an update and failed. Its horrible. I'm uninstalling and reinstalling to see if that works. What a mess. Oh and when I try to go back to a previous page it kicks me out and takes me to the login screen. I think that happened like 20 times just trying to find my grades or announcements.

The Blackboard app is unintuitive, has limited features, and lots of bugs. Much worse than competitors. Announcements don't arrange chronologically (maybe some are pinned? Blackboard doesn't indicate that). Why can't it preview documents in Box like on desktop instead of needing me to have a dedicated Office app? Why doesn't the app have any way to view submitted assignments? Also, If I'm playing music (from a different app), adding a reply to a discussion post will pause my music.

It used to work fine but with the last update, when I sign in, it doesnt bring me to a mobile friendly page. I'm just looking at the regular web version, but doesnt function well. It used to bring me to a mobile friendly site that looked completely different than the online site...

With having children and a busy schedule, I love this app. The notifications help alot too. When I'm busy with the kids or daily life, a new assignment or grades posted, or announcement from one of the instructors, it makes it very easy to stay informed and up-to-date with my course load.

The new update is terrible! Everything you claim you fixed is exactly what's happening. I didn't experience this before. The format is just like the webpage now but slow, stupidly slow. Navigation is anything but friendly anymore. Wish you would just change it back.

Ok app overall; however, I'm having issues with the activity stream. Under upcoming it's still showing me assignments that were due 2 weeks ago. I keep getting a message on the bottom of the screen that says "there seems to be an issue on our side. " Please fix this, it would be nice to just open up the app and see upcoming due dates

I can't see any of my announcements on the app. Everything else seems to be working but there's a problem with viewing announcements. If this can be fixed it would be great. Edit: yes I am seeing an error while loading announcements. I am unable to view them right away

This app really is amazing. It helps to get a broader view of your course work, as well to organise it better. I think the one thing that could make it better is the addition of notifications for Discussion boards/forums. That would be really great. Other than that, it's a really useful app, especially when you don't or can't have any contact classes.

I did not have any problems with the app until the update was done to my android, now I can not enter in the collaborate virtual clases and this is a problem for me. I hope you can fix it. That is the reason I will not give a 5 star as of now until you fix the problem.

Fantastic. Actually a better UI than in browser in some cases. Simplifies the interaction enough to make a cluttered class look palatable. All the functions are there. I didn't expect it to be a perfect transfer from browser, but it works great for me.

The only thing you can do is post to class discussions. Everything else is listed but as soon as you try to view or open the tasks you receive an error. You cannot open books or videos for weekly content. If you want to read the material or perform weekly tasks, you must use a computer.

This app is awesome, and comes really handy. Recently when it got some bugs and people started giving reviews about the bugs they are having, developers quickly fixed those bugs, which is also good developer response, which I like about this app now too along with the fact that it lets me navigate through my course details and all the stuff very easily and effectively.

"There seems to be an issue on our end, check back again later." This error shows up almost anytime you try to do anything like check your grades, look at due dates, etc. The app has SOME functionality but overall it's unreliable more often than not.

My school forces a login via the browser. This is not a problem, however the app keeps using just the browser once I'm logged in. The app now serves no purpose but I used to be able to use this as intended. Your users are depending on you in this time of crisis as professors and students must communicate; expedient work would be very appreciated.

Certainly the worst mobile lms app I've experienced. Most functions are usable but the whole experience is clumsy and errors are common. Cumulative grades take a while to update even if I can see the graded assignment on blackboard, many files won't open (or download) through the app, submission through the app is also a game of chance as it often won't work. Also it often defaults to mirror the website when opening certain folders... so why not just use the website?

I would give a higher rating because I used to live the app for the most part. I heavily rely on it for school. I can't even access the app anymore because it sends me straight to the browser when I log in and I can't get out of it at all. I can't do anything to fix the app so for now it's sitting useless.

Due to covid my professors are posting video lectures which I can't view on the app, but can export to my gallery, but when I export both apps crash. Also, I keep getting the same notifications blowing up my phone that I dismissed at first in January. I have limited access to any other platform to use blackboard and need it for my assignments. Videos are mp4 files, exporting to my phone gallery and Google photos, both crash about 5 mins after opening the exported video.

Activity Stream does not load/update. Keeps on saying: "There seems to be an issue on our side. Please try again later." Update 17/04/2020: After dismissing all old updates/notifications via the website it seems to be working now.

Blackboard is great for the most part, but the app is not consistent with loading final grades in real time. In addition, the inability to review to teacher's comments on graded submissions within the app is quite restrictive. Also, the incompatibility with Google Drive documents displays the laziness of Blackboard's development team. Those errors disallow me from rating this app higher. When said errors are fixed, I will update my rating.

The new features aren't helping as much. The version before the update was much more easy to use than the one right now. I talked to some of my others classmates and they say the same. Other than that the application was useful before than now.

I don't know why, but my activity stream isn't working anymore and I no longer receive notifications from the app, which is annoying as I used to. I've uninstalled the app 3 times and still nothing. The notifications are what help me stay on top of my work. Is there a way to get them back?

It is extremely difficult to use. 1, there isnt an option to dismiss all notifications at once. 2, collaborate is not integrated within the app, instead, it relies on browser..hence, it is extremely unstable.

I imagine this APP provides some useful metrics for the institution. It seems to be an industry standard for university in Australia however it comes up short of what I expect as a student. The interface is drab, the lack of integration with other Apps as as well as the cloud providers is frustrating. Maybe I just expect too much from IT in making our life simpler and seamlessmso we can get on with learning.

Collaborate only runs in the browser. It would be great if it ran inside the app...The experience inside the browser it's no the best one. I think it was a bad decision moving the platform to the browser.

App is a little hard to navigate at first but I use it daily so it's not too bad. I like it because it allows me to take my school with me and I can access mostly anything. However, I cannot access my grades. It shows an error whenever I go to the grades tab.

Good app, simple and straightforward to use on your phone. Great way to access PowerPoint presentations or class notes etc. Always up to date, best place to receive notifications from lecturers or college, which is why I use it several times a week.

I love this app it is much easier than the website, I have two problems with it 1. I need to type the e-mail and password everytime I want to log in and 2. Qit doesn't give any notifications when something updates

It doesn't even let me access my university on the app, I've uninstalled and installed again like 4 times and it always says the same "there is an issue on our side, try again later" it worked fine before.

I hate the recent update. It does not allow you to toggle around the class or between classes without kicking you out and having to sign in again. Please fix this! Remove this update or return it to the way it was before.

After my last review developer got back to me stating the issue was fixed. I updated and the app is running great again, I can now see the mobile version and all concerns/issues have been addressed! Thank you!!!
After the update on April 8, 2020 the app does not open after i login. It stays on my college web page. Prior to the update it was working fine. I am using Android FYI. Please look into it.

Made a review telling creators that newest update messed a lot of things up, and they got back to me and fixed it within 2 days! Very responsive and helpful staff to fix this issue as quick as possible. Good job guys!
After logging into the app via my Internet browser, it never goes back to the app itself. I also have to constantly keep logging back in. I might as well just use my phone's Internet browser.

I have to login Everytime now. It is basically like when you login with your browser. What is the point in getting the app now?! It literally says I have to do a web login then shows up like I am just using my web browser?!?

Whatever update just occurred on April 7th makes you have to log in every single time you want to use the app and has essentially eliminated the mobile site from it. It now seems to only run the desktop site for our phones.

No update. My SP20 courses are not reflected in the application and the information presented is from 4 years ago. I understand that the application is not synchronized with the institutional account of the University.

This app is terrific! I can stay up to date on what assignments are coming up and when they are due. I also receive important announcements from my professor that assist with my academics and time management. VERY HAPPY!!

Helpful to look at readings, tasks, and other class assignments while on the go. It can offer me some additional minutes of reading time I otherwise wouldn't have as I am working or travelling.

Well am truly expressed how well placed everything is put , you can easily view the content and interact with your classmates and lecture , really gives you the feel of an actual classroom , I truly recommend it

I love this app, HOWEVER! It would be really nice to be able to see direct messages with the instructor, like having an Inbox?! That'd be cool. Just saying 😁

This app is alright. It keeps on logging me out and sometimes doesn't show my grade. Other than that, blackboard does a really good job on notification.
New update fixed the issue from the last update. Everything is working properly again. Very helpful app for students.
Constant problems. Cant even provide feedback to their tech support via the app. Now the app is down. When I login, it doesn't take me to my school courses.
It is great for school. My only problem is that I can use the blackboard collaboration in the app its self it redirects me to the website.
Really good app. Can participate in online lectures, record them, communicate and collaborate with groupmates, share files.
Not always the fastest to show things but it's ok. Happy I can use it when working. Needs a update through even though it's a good app

Works great! My only problem is that I'm not about to check blackboard messages on the app.
Sometimes, it's a little buggy. It logs me out every so often which is a pain. But over all decent for checking due dates and grades.

Very convenient for when I don't have my computer around. I can submit work and check my grades and more. App is also easy to use.
facing problems with uploading files, doesnt stay logged in for long periods, have to sign in every 3-4 hours
I thought the app was pretty good untill the new update, hopefully there is a patch or update to make it more like it was before the most recent update.
The latest update just made it so much worse, now it's asking me to sign in every single time i want to use the app. This is not a mobile friendly app.
The new update to Blackboard has totally screwed everything up. The interface is horrible now and it makes mobile learning much more difficult.
I had an issue before but support was very nice and they fixed it. Great app.
It's not bad but notifications sometimes dont go away even after they were read or dismissed and the interface isnt as great as on canvas to me
Could have dark mode and also more accessibility. Plus some of the contents can't be viewed unless I'm on desktop.

This app isn't terrible. It gets the job done, but the last update is causing for half of my things (including grades) not to show up the right way. When it is properly working, it does what it's intended to do. Just know that you cannot always see some things that are there when you get on a computer. The app isnt capable to show and do everything. After two updates, I am still having issues opening things I used to be able to see or open. I can't even see my grades anymore.

Honestly the app has always been a bit gimmicky but now I can't even check my grades on the app "something's wrong" is the error message I get for every single class, mind you it works perfectly fine on desktop. You can't open certain files others you can it depends on what software you have downloaded on your phone and for goodness sake stop making me sign in every single time I get on the app, it's ridiculous

Extremely helpful for the adult learner. Always being on the go, I am usually left in the dark when it comes to my grades. Not any longer! This app helps me stay up to date on my academic progress as well as keep me on track with upcoming assignments. There are a few bugs: sometimes I am unable to view the individual assignment grades and/or feedback from instructors. Overall, I completely recommend downloading and using this app!

Excellent for an elearning student. Only problem I find is downloading lectures to listen to it later. It doesn't allow me to. Also, when listening to a lecture and stopping half way through, you can move to the last spot you listened to. So if the lecture is 30min and you stopped at 14min, it doesn't allow you to move to the 14th minute. You have to listen to it all over again. Other than that it's really great
Great app. Everything is perfect I have been using it for 4 months now no ads or problems. Keep up the good work.

I would rate this app 0 if I could. The old update was functional and now there's no reason to use this app because it functions just as if I was in a browser but it doesn't load any files. It doesn't save my login info when it used to in the old update. Because it doesn't save my login info I can't receive notifications. It is useless and clunky.

I constantly get a Sign On error. I tried to reinstall the app, clear cache but I get the same error. It used to work but now there is no point in having the app anymore since I have to use a browser to log in. I would give it more than a star for the way it used to work but in the current state I can't use it at all.
Really easy to use and makes the discussion boards a lot easier to navigate and see in real time.

Ever since most recent update, it wont show my grades correctly. When I open grade section the grades aren't color coded anymore and instead are surrounded by a black bubble and when you click on them they dont load. Just a red x at the bottom appears. It's frustrating because I've been using this to view my grades for my first 2 years of college and now I have to use my browser instead.

The app is helpful for keeping track of upcoming assignments and working on some that are mobile friendly. However, it would be nice if announcements were permanently dismissed. Every time I log in I am clearing a stack of messages, over half of which have been dismissed at a previous point. I have announcements from 2018 that just dont leave, lol.

I love that I can work from my phone but what bothers me the most is the old alerts that still pop up from 2017! I've checked them off, I've clicked on them hoping it will come off after I "view" it but they still show everytime I open the app. The same on my laptop/home computer. If they can fix that glitch, then I'll give the app five stars.

Latest update (Feb '20) has left this app malfunctioning. This was a great resource for staying on top of my course work but now I can't view my grades, can't see content uploaded by my professors, and can't trust that I'm getting all of my notifications. We're in the middle of the semester, please fix the app so it works like it used to!

Used to be able to submit work on here but it's really buggy recently. When I try to submit it just says "something went wrong." Have have tried clearing cache AND data for the app and the same problem persists. Also the activity stream won't show you anything due today. It reloads and after that you have to go searching through course content to see what it was.

Very helpful. It will not guarantee a passing grade. But it will increase your chance of passing drastically. It doesn't give you the answers to the test directly, but will challenge yourself to be in a "testing mode" and make you more comfortable during a test setting. It won't give you everything you need to learn, but will provide a big part of it. And remember, quizlet is created by students/ teachers that attended the lecture before you.

The best app for creating flash cards and learning many things, hands down. You won't find similar app better than this, download now no brainer. And don't forget to subscribe to the annual plan for more features and to support the developer, kudos. I learn faster after using this app 100% effective and beneficial. You can also use this on PC which helps a lot.

This is a great tool for fun learning. My grades have increased because of this app. Including me, needing extra practice in their studies, and retaining information seemed impossible before I come to use this app. No more spending time writing on flash cards, especially for those who has bad handwriting. This is eco friendly, and convenient for students. Very user-friendly.

I've had this for over a year now. Worth the premium if you're studying a new language because you can upload your own description pictures or memory map images, record voice for pronunciation and study offline. But if you don't need the extras then the free version should be sufficient.

I love it! I've been learning Korean for more than two years and I've realized a few days ago how helpful this app is! It's helping me so much to learn vocabulary, and it's fun. I also love that I can choose more than one language to translate the word I'm learning, so I can use the language with which I find easier to remember or to understand the meaning of that specific word. I want to say I'd like it to tell you how much words you've learned and advanced in a period of time, and widgets!

I really like this app, and it's very helpful in allowing me to study vocabulary. I've definitely seen my grades improve a lot since I got this app. One thing, however, is it seems that the app performance is noticably worse on Android than it is on Apple. When I owned an iPhone SE, sets loaded in less than a second when I clicked on them. Now, it could take up to twenty seconds on my Samsung Galaxy S9, even if the sets are downloaded.

Perfect flashcard app with customizable decks. Different modes of learning and playing with no annoying ads. If you're interested in learning a new language or anything for that matter that requires memorizing things, this is the perfect choice. Other things that make this great are: web support, and native dark mode.

I am giving only 4 stars because it is missing what I wish they add on it.. 2 features that I would like for this app to improve. 1) it should let the user upload image on the term and not the definition only. ALSO, if you can upload more than one image in the term or definition then the better 2) the multiple choice test features should let you pick up choices only from that term that you are answering and not mixing all the choices from the definitions

It's the first time I tried this app and it's soo good!! I wasn't able to learn any new material that I got. I was literally dying for an app to save me! And then, it dropped at my home screen and voila! I downloaded it!!! It's such a great app I've learnt everything noww!!! Kudos!!!💜💜

Great study tool. You can create your own flash cards. You can take from other users' study sets (though I would recomend verifying their information). The quizzing options are the best part. Instead of memorizing your flash cards, the quizzes allow you to actively learn the content.

Overall pretty awesome. It would be nice to have some level of text edit option even if not in full but there is the paid option for full text editing among other benefits. My only complaint so far: when selecting Japanese (romanji) it still pronounces some of it in the American alphabet. Ex: あ is pronounced "ah" [language - japanese] A is pronounced "ay" [language - japanese romanji] This feature is awesome but I feel appropriately matched Pronunciation for romanji would be awesome.

At first I totally will give quizlet 5 star because I really like quizlet I found it much appealing easy to use and alot better than ankidroid to learn a new language. . . but it would really be much much better and if guys add an srs feature in it as well like Ulangi. . . Please just that add an srs feature in and it would definitely be 5 star for language learners like me. . .

This app has improved a lot since I first used it several years ago. The user experience is fantastic! It does a great job at helping you learn new vocabulary for a foreign language. I will be recommending this to others for sure. The one thing I would like to see added would be the ability to play the audio for all cards at one time.

Great! Easy to use, easy to edit, effective and fun study methods, but the best part is access to thousands of public sets on anything you can imagine made by other students and professionals. Wonderful program, app, and business model I will use indefinitely.

A really useful method of learning with the ability to test oneself and share study sets. The ability to use photographs is a great feature and it would be even better if more photographs could be added to one side of a 'flashcard'. I recommend this app for memorising a variety of things.

Absolutely amazing and tremendously helpful in clearing concepts. I am enjoying studying with the help of this app. You can revise any topic in just 2 minutes. And you can even share your flashcards with your friends. A big thumbs up to quizlet for this app. 👍

I highly recommend this app when learning, I just started learning a new language and it's a huge help when it comes to memorizing vocabulary, since it comes with pictures and audio you won't get bored as much as reading plain text. 😊

Easy to use. Im happy to have found an app the lets me add photos easily with the plus version. I have made two sets of flashcards and enjoy the quiz formats that help me learn new cards and reinforce ones already learned. Great app. Money well spent!

My experience has been good. My knowledge has grown as a result of this app. Quizlet hasnt failed me and I'll continue to rely on quizlet throughout my education. I gave it a 4 simply because I couldn't find questions to my specific medical terminology textbook

This app has a very high rating in Play store 4.7. Quizlet helps you quickly memorize words. You can make sets(groups of words) and teach them as flashcards. After studying, you can choose how to test a test of four possible answers, right/wrong or self-spelling words. This app is also available in the paid version, but it's free enough for me. You can also share your sets with other guys in this app. I like it so much. I memorize vocabulary for my tests quicker than it was before. It’s convenient. In this app you can practice new words as many times as you want. If you don’t use this app, let’s download it now.

I have aced every test so far and I can say this app helped me do that! I not only highly recommend this app, I strongly urge you to get it!

II would give a zero if I could. The Alexa app is slow, not easy to navigate, skills are stupid. I have an echo Show. No reason that i should need my cell phone to install a skill when i should be able to just install the app or "skill" directly to my echo show. Alexa is dumber than a box of rocks. She gives crappy non relevant answers, plays the wrong music, can't do most of what i ask, and just all around sucks. For a multi billionaire, it's a joke that this is as good as it gets.

It won't respond when saying "alexa", home button has to be pressed or the Alexa app opened on purpose for it to work. I would give it 5 stars if it could work normally like Google Assistant does. Until then, the app isn't useful at all. And also I have to take into account the fact that it's not possible to install it on my Google approved Android TV box.

This app has great features and an awesome interface, but takes forever to respond to any input, I am sure it is not my device and my wifi network.
