I still have intermittent connections between Alexa app and Alexa Echo Input device. 😤

App mostly works for my home automation. Oftentimes my devices get duplicated for no reason and it causes issues. I have to go in and manually delete duplicates. Lot of the skills are terrible. They either flat out do not work or are a pain to use. Alexa search and translation features are pretty bad unless you're looking for entertainment. I hope they keep working to improve it because it has a lot of potential, OTOH they have a long way to go to catch the leader.

The app speed has finally increased: Alexa has become a integral component to my cooking. More i can all for anything from ounce-to-gram conversions to the safe cooking temperatures for chicken. There are still hiccups, but overall improvement is amazing. It's easy to count on "her" to announce Weather Service warnings and my daily schedule. Congrats, Alexa. You're now an essential worker!

Update 5/3/20: continues to be weak link in Amazon Universe. Please help out with support and fix all these crashes. Love Amazon Alexa Universe. How can such great products fail so miserably when it comes to a straightforward app? Not sure what is going on, but I have had to uninstall and reinstall the Alexa App every 2 months, manually clear cache and force stop daily, and clear all data monthly on my Android I doubt this is what I would define as a reliable app as a result.

On BT: Cannot disable loudly announcing "NOW PLAYING FROM [DEVICE]" when it's been 10 min from the last time it was playing. Through Alexa service: I ask it to play something, it says ok playing... But I hear nothing because it's actually playing on a different speaker in the house, disturbing the person in that room. Very frustrating experience on both counts and I dread using these speakers now.

This app needs lots of work. Slow, buggy, and nearly useless for those of us with phones 6 months old or more. I primarily use this app for selecting music to stream to my echo devices, and to access my shopping list. That's it. No reason it should take nearly a minute to open the app. Very memory intensive app.

Very intuitive, smart application/device design & UI for people whom aren't tech savvy, and helpful in a way that is kinda like, Artificial Intelligence esq. The fact that you can use Amazon Alexa with Wi-Fi enabled smart devices, such as lamps & lightbulbs themselves, humidifiers, remote cameras, and hell... even the power strips and outlets are Wi-Fi enabled smart devices. Anyway, it's very impressive and it's also convenient for these same devices to be able to connect to your Google Assist.

Horrible app. During this covid homestay, I've updated my network with a new TP-Link wifi 6 router. The Help within the app instructs me to go to device and "change wifi" settings. When I get to the device & work my way to where I should be at, I'm unable to locate the words "change wifi." Since I can't get anyone over the phone to help due to covid, I have several Echo units sitting there useless.

Recently my dot no longer knows one of my devices when I say to turn it on. Too often it either turns on the wrong device or nothing at all. For some reason light/plugs I have listed as "corner" "dining" and "sink" all turn on when I say "kitchen" and only one of them is even in the room kitchen. Others are in dining and living rooms. So frustrating I'm ready to eliminate it all

would be nice if would change the voice on the device that needs this app for. I have this for the eco, but would be nice if had options to change the voice just like the language. I have a device in several rooms . Some are paired together hidden for music listening. Great sound if you use the different speakers together . Easy to pair . Easy to start up . I use Alexa devices for turning on my lights in different rooms . It is part of my daily function now . I do advise to use a wifi expander. This will help one get the wifi signal throuhout your house to each device. With AMAZON music playing your favorite tunes on all speakers or just one room . It's great!!!!!

Good app, not really that much more to say, but i like that you can add games to your echo, i just think it would be really cool if you added voices, i know they are working on it, but people like Samuel L Jackson and Robert Downey Jr would be soo cool. Overall 5/5.

It's amazing!!! I've managed to connect all my media devices with a harmony remote and it's skills+ control my heating & lights with hive skills. Two perfectly integrated hubs. Programme a harmony remote to watch fire TV,, TV,,, and now TV. I have a echo dot connected to my 5.1 Av receiver for music audio books and radio. An echo show to see the nursery and front door cameras. It can even put the kettle on

Without home wifi the setting up with a mobile phone as the as a hotspot is unnecessarily complicated and takes too long. Then if you leave the area and hotspot signal is lost to Alexa... you have to start all over again! It is infuriating! Alexa should always automatically reconnect to the hotspot.

My first review in September 2019 was that this app "Constantly crashed rendering it unusable. Such a shame. I expected better from Amazon." Very pleased to say that recent app updates seem to have fixed the problems and it's now working really well. Thanks Amazon for fixing this

I have been using this app for 6+ months, and haven't even scratched the surface of what it has to offer. Great App, I'm so glade my son turned me on to it. I would have given this app 7 stars if that was available for it. I would definitely recommend this app, but you need to get the ( in the house dot) to work together with this app.

This app lacks a lot of skills that should be included with the app. For example there has been numerous times that Alexa does not understand what music selection or task she should be performing. There should be an alternative for these eras in the app. I'm sure there's lots of other things but this one comes to mind for me now. Also I would like to create a playlist for music from my app.

Never really use the app on its own. But the app when I have used it is really good. On that basis it would be 5 star but amazon have to much power and access and I'm not sure I trust them. I have more trust for Google for some reason but there products in the same space are not as good. :( If you want to improve things bring the data into the users own sandbox. Very disappointed! :( The reason I bought a speaker with Alexa in it was that I thought I'd be able to play music from my Spotify account and Alexa would be the tool to do it via voice control - as advertised. Just a really good app that works like a charme, very good and convenient to use. Also works with Tekin, switch plugs and very easy to install just upload the Tekin app first or from the box that gives you control of the Tekin units, but then Alexa app will find it once the units through the app are registered to your Wifi router, then the units pop up on the Alexa app and you then have duel control, via Alexa or the Tekin app called "Smart life " , and that's it all ready to go .

My experence with this application is poor. Overall this app is very disapointing.

She's kinda dumb but sometimes can figure out what you want after 10 attempts. You can't connect to everywhere group when streaming something via bluetooth from your phone. You can play amazon music everywhere, but nothing off the internet or your own music or anything of your choosing. Only whatever is already on Amazon. Kinda pointless. I'd recommend Google home instead. The Alexa app is not convenient.

My main complaint is that the starting page is nothing but things to try or setup. Even things you've already setup will still be there. This page should be an overview of devices, enabled routines, alarms.... Otherwise, this does what I need it to.

Love my Alexa! Sometimes, while watching a movie, I will ask her trivia questions about the actors or historical facts. At others I asked her about the weather or to give me weather notifications. I use her for timers and alarms. And of course there's always the daily chicken joke. She's the best!

Literally the worst app I've ever used. It is painfully slow to wait on the app to switch menus or to have it decide when to connect to an Alexa device. Awesome, almost everything what I expected Ive got. Love this so very useful Alexa reminds us to get thiongs done tells us the news plays music so so many awesome skills. This is one of the best things you could have it is so helpful, and my echo dot is great but with this app it makes everything simpler, i mean what is simpler than voice commands, this is, not gonna lie i love it when my brother is using it for music and i can just change it for a prank, u got my 5 star rating well done Amazon.

Excellent app ashame it costs so much to run off of multiple devices that said hasn't struggled to find particular music im interested in and I'm fairly certain it wouldn't struggle to find anyone elses taste either other than price for multiple devices would be 5* can't complain on anything else

Alexa is quite a character as a digital 🤯 being. Very seldom is a question or request not 🤔 completed. Amazon has a very good app here. Would like to give it my own wake up 😎command. We have 8 😱 echoes through out our home, even our master bathroom. Good job Amazon.

Love Alexa. I just downloaded the app and got a one week subscription. The app keeps displaying "Can't show this content right now. Try checking your data connection". There is nothing in the settings to contact customer service. I have restarted my phone, erased and downloaded Bumble again and it still doesn't work. FYI I did try using the app both with data and wifi.

Be careful, they have an auto renew clause in the original T&Cs. They will NOT make this clear again if you do a free trial or a subscription. They have been charging me, and I wanted to confirm when the subscription was activated as I did not recall any activation. It took me 3 requests and three emails just to get T&Cs off the customer rep. Highly unhelpful.

Just a money grab, gives you a few likes then it locks with a message that you have reached your limit for the day upgrade to get more likes and if you don't upgrade it takes a couple of days to start the likes again. Tries to entice you to pay by showing blurry faces of people that liked you. Most of the profiles are of ladies that are looking for Instagram followers anyhow.

It can already be difficult to find a match, so when Bumble makes matches expire after one-two days, they are effectively preventing you from making a meaningful connection. Bumble wants you to NOT find a partner, and pay them for the privelege. The people behind this idea/app should seriously consider being a phone sanitizer, or seeing how close they can stand to the front of a running engine of a 747.

Inaccurate or lies. I spend money to get in the spot light then I get a notification saying "your spotlight is paying off you have a new like". The kicker is that Im all caught up and out of people to match with so when I open the app after it says that there is no one to see haha... Nice bs tactics to try and make people think they didn't waste money.

The idea may seem better than Tinder but their algorithm is so crappy. Waste of time: do not recommend. I tried the Bumble 14 day trial and swiped normally. That is to say I didn't swipe right on everyone. Not getting any matches, I had three girls try to find me on Bumble to test if I am even visible. Even after filtering to my profile filters, they didn't find me until almost the very end of the queue. I understand not getting matches, that's just life, but for being one of the top online dating service, they have to either make all profiles equally visible or be more transparent about how their algorithm works. I am betting even after getting their paid service, they are relying on you to pay for the "Spotlight" bonus to make your profile even remotely visible. What a waste of time.

Absolutely awful. Just got a notification that a match was about to expire... It had expired almost 24 hours ago, without even first notifying me that I had a match. Edit: all notification settings are as they should be, both within the app and from Android's app settings. Even so, I just got another notification for an expired match, even though I had been in the app not even 4 hours ago and the match wasn't there. What's the point of a dating app if it malfunctions all the time?

I used to be on Bumble a long time ago! Back then, there was unlimited likes, and you could shake your phone up to 3 times to go back if you missed a like. They removed the unlimited likes, you get very low swipes and then you have to wait 24h for another limited swipe. Like this wasn't enough, they removed the "three shakes" to go back on a missed match. I understand the goal of an app is to make money: it's business, but I used to be a big fan but now..I'm upset and I'm not the only one!!😭

All reviews are true, the imposed 24 hour swipe limit is not lifted. If you read their FAQ, you simply need to reach out to them to reset... Considering the volume of reviews stating this, the time span associated with it, and the acknowledgement of it on their FAQ, this appears to violate the Google Play's policy on minimum functionality and spam. Highly recommend reporting them as I have done, or just pass on this app!

Yet another dating app that pushes payment by providing a bad experience. Today it notified me that a previous match could be re-matched if I payed a subscription. Funny thing is I never received any notice that I had matched with that person. I've used this service for three years, only dated two people, and I matched with them out of desperation not desire. Neither went past a few dates. This need I feel to pay, coupled with my bad experience, means I cannot recommend this app to anyone.

Haven't used it in weeks, went on it today and it says "you've reached the end of the line, you'll need to upgrade." Couldn't find any "support" or "help" on the app so I'm just gonna uninstall it and let you know via this review. Cheers! Everyone else is right, idk what you need to do to get matches in this app but when it worked i got nothing. I even followed the bumble tutorials for making an attractive profile. Waste of time, cashgrab.

I'm not understanding how this algorithm works. I'm using BFF mode. Bumble tells me there are 47 people who've swiped right; however, I've only matched with two people. I've probably swiped right on at least 30 profiles and my range is set at 60 miles. Why am I getting no additional matches with that kind of ratio? I highly doubt all those people are outside of the 60 mile range ring.

Used to be great until greedy devs decided to paywall the number of swipes you get. Common among these apps, but Bumble gives you half the swipes of competitors and double the wait: at least 48 hours cooldown, and even then you often need to restart the app to swipe again. Add to that long-standing bugs like no notifications and matches you will never ever find and this app is now completely worthless. I recommend literally anything else over this.

This app is such trash. It isn't the funnest to navigate. It feels like you are missing something (a rewind button) on top of that, the app likes to show you this "Beeline" where supposedly people have already liked you but it's bored out unless you pay for it of course. You never match with those people though. I thought, ohh eventually I will come across them and if I do like them then we'll match but NOPE never do. Almost like they put fake people up just so you'll pay to see them.

So far so good. Most of the text interactions & follow up conversation seem legit. Easy app to figure out. My one HUGE peeve here..is that once you complete a tidbit in one of the 'profile prompts' that prompt CANNOT be removed from your profile. EVER. The user can only edit the content within. I changed my mind about wanting to share several of these..and now they are waste of space that say 'to answer later' or something to that effect. I feel slighty..slighted. I like that I reach out first.

I used this app a few years ago with no problems. This time though, after my introductory round of matches I hit my swipe limit for the day. So I came back the next day and found that my swipe limit was still reached. Day 3, my swipe limit is still reached. This is clearly a bug because I have swiped exactly zero times in 48 hours, so I reach out to support. What do I get? A condescending boiler plate email explaining why there is a swipe limit. Thanks, uninstalled.

The app will give you notifications for messages after you've seen recent ones. As of late, when looking through profiles, any tilt of the phone whatsoever triggers them asking if you want to backtrack a swipe. This sensitivity makes the app almost impossible to use unless the phone is laying flat! You also get notifications for people liking you but they are nowhere to be found and I have a paid subscription.

Not a fan of swipe limitations. You guys were doing just fine without it before. Infact, swipes are alot more limited compared to other apps. Such a shame. They used to stand out, now they are a copy. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Updated after dev response - dropped the rating to a 1 star after they tried to give me the most lamest excuse for swipe limitations. We aren't gullible; we know what we like. We dont appreciate the b.s. you give us. I'm swiping you left and your competitors right. Bye scrub.

This app has an annoyingly short match expire timer. It lasts only a day. So if you don't check in or get a notification that you got a match then they're easy to miss. The app then let's you rematch for £2.50. It's a really scummy tactic since you're only buying an extension to the potential match and a sneaky auto subscription. The other person might not respond at all so it's clearly designed to take advantage of desperate people that will pay £2.50 to keep the hope of a match alive.

Used to been great until they added the "You've hit the end of the line -- for today!". Missed it where I can swipe as many as I can without any restrictions. Now they took that away and making you pay to get that feature. For the better future of this app, please bring back the unlimited swipe feature that's standard for everyone.

Good: the app is really easy to use, not cluttered, not junk.. smooth and responsive. The developers are Swift and didn't make it overly complicated for no reason, the layout and the design/method of matching I think is very good.. great idea.. Bad: there's not enough women on it, and in a city of 1.5 million people I ran out of matches in two days of swiping on the free version. Paying is a complete waste.. it feels like a complete money grab scam.

This app is great and user friendly but has extreme flaws. Most of the matches I see on here are either instagram influencers trying to boost their following, narcissistists looking to get their attention and validation fix, or just straight up idle accounts. This app is also starting to go down the same road as Tinder by limiting functions and abilities unless you pay. Do not use, install or even recommend. You're better off staying single guys.

I downloaded it for the BFF feature, however apparently I'm only allowed to be friends with men because I'm a man. The majority of my friends are and always have been female and I think restricting my friendships to only men is a very backwards way to exist. In conclusion, this app is a sexist waste of time.

Overall it is a good app but the major drawback is that it forces you to communicate with a match within 24 hours. It basically guarantees that you can't really use the app if you're not going to have time to chat in a short window. And there is no general browse feature so if someone's profile comes up that you like, but you don't have time to talk, you either have to stop where you are and close the app, or swipe and risk losing the connection.

One of the few decent dating apps, very few limits etc which makes it still really accessible if you don't want to pay for a subscription and it actually listens to your age and distance preferences etc.. the verification tool on profiles is also really nice to be reassured you arent wasting your time. Love it

This app went from being a semi-decent Tinder competitor to a trash, money-grabbing, poorly optimized turd. I figured maybe it was my phone causing notification errors, and matching problems, but nope, it's just the app being trash. Browsing the reviews and seeing the walls of 1 star reviews, it's clear the developers really don't care about this app, so why should I?

It used to be great. Now, after hitting a newly imposed "swipe limit" it'll take days to be allowed to swipe again. Back in the prime of this app, if someone was on, and you haven't swiped on them, you'd get that option. But I guess the devs decided that they didn't like the app being great🤷‍♂️

You get notified about a new message, but checking your messages, nothing shows up until you open the message feed with the user. It also notifoes you that "someone likes you", but going and checking nothing happens. Just false messages to get you back online. Misleading. In other terms, decent app.

I would rate 5 stars except for I believe that there are fake profiles, however not near as many as other dating apps. Please stay on top of this! The other minor suggestion is that you allow back tracking on a "right swipe", even if it's to allow people to more closely explore their possible match, but not make people unmatch *Update* most people I talk to concur that the responses from matches with a yellow background and white text is incredible hard to see/read

I am stuck on the screen that says we will donate to your charity of choice if you leave a message on a match I have had to reinstall three times I would like a refund on my monthly boost that I just applied for I believe it is $23. I am all set. It was a font size issue. Wanted to update review to 4 stars due to it being my error!

Ridiculous in theory - I just wish there was a free, high quality dating app that truly cared about making connections first, money second. All of them are so focused on paying just to generate contact or see who's interested, which is unfair. I get it's the way it is, just wish it wasn't the case.

I've tried bumble 5 times and each time is the same thing: first day you get 15+ likes. Afterwards it's 1 a week. Keep in mind...LIKES, not matches. You're better off deleting your account every few days, after whatever matches came from the first day expire (because women dont actually write) so that you can create a new profile and get yours back in stacks for more likes. And why is it that each time I restart, I'm mostly seeing the same profiles...instagram women trying to get followers. SMH

Just a money grabber.Prices are deceiving. They take a full payment for subscription cost. I was caught out because it is NOT clear! Eg. If it says £11 for 6 months. That's £11 per month for 6 months and they take the FULL payment. Its really unfair & ridiculous to users. Plus even as a woman the app itself is not great and not as user friendly as others. I would reccomend using hinge or POF have had much better matching success on these & pricing options are VERY clear.

So the app is definitely a good way to meet people of all different walks of life. I wont say that you'll meet someone special, but you will meet people. Though you might just have an experience like me, and others, where you're using the app to network and get a random message that you are blocked because you supposedly broke some rules of service. They wont give you any warning or even an explanation of what rules that you broke. Apparently this is common. Google it

The app used to let you "backtrack"( if you accidentally swiped left) for free, but now they're charging you $12.99CAD a WEEK to do so VS Tinder which charges you $20 a MONTH for the same thing. It's now more expensive than Tinder with no real perks. The amount of deleted/remade accounts is still astonishingly high, even though I shouldn't have to see the same profile twice after I've already said "no".

Very disappointed. I had 2 accounts cancelled in 2 days. No reason supplied. . I wrote twice regrading both these occurrences with no response from Bumble. Maybe they need to practice what they preach. 16 April 12:59PM Thanks for contacting Bumble Hi there and thanks for contacting our support team! There are few things we like less than auto-replies, but feeling ghosted is one of them. Our worker bees are buzzing as quickly as possible to answer all of our incredible users....

Terribly buggy app. Get email notifications of new interests and when you check the app, there's nothing. Even after matching women only have 24 hours to initiate which is idiotic when everyone's super busy. Will delete after my subscription is over. Terrible waste of money so don't do it. Try Hinge, Match or eHarmony.

Probably the best dating app in the market right now. All it's features are incredibly smart and allow you to get a great idea of who each person is. There is a pretty big problem with the filters not actually functioning, I have my maximum distance set to 16 km away and I frequently get suggestions up to 30 km away.

Very poor app. I've tried this with 3 different phones but this app won't access directly through a WiFi network. You have to use your phones personal data which is not acceptable. I'm going to delete this app again. Also there are not enough daily likes and they obviously blatantly keep people who like you away for a period of time.

Had to delete and remake my account and lost all my matches because a screen saying "add a photo" kept popping up and made it impossible to use the app. Also now it's added a new swipe limit and you have to wait 24 hours to swipe again or even see profiles. Plus, even when I have my settings to "women" it keeps showing me men every few swipes. Was trying bumble out because I heard it's better than other common dating apps like tinder but It's probably one of the worst.

Overall really good app. If I may suggest something for bizz, I think we should be able to be more specific about what we do and what we're looking for in a way that's filterable. That way bumble bizz could show us people more people related to what we do first. I think that would make it more efficient for networking. I also noticed a problem where I have to close and reopen the app in order to read the messages I get notifications for, makes it a bit annoying to message on. Otherwise I love it

I keep having issues with this app. The first issue was that I couldn't message anyone I matched with, also I couldn't boost again because it was saying I messed up the payment. I tried it 5 different times. Then I got locked out and I used the auto fill that had my saved password and that didn't work.

It's a good app and I get a decent amount of women messaging me. But I feel as though some of the services shouldn't cost extra like why would I want to pay to see who likes me. If I like them it will be a match if I don't it won't. So the beehive thing in my opinion is useless And should just come a free option or

Disappointed. Spent well over 100 dollars on this app. The apps spotlight feature does not use your filters rather just broadcasts you aimlessly at everyone. So the likes you are going to get are not going to be what you are looking for at all. After the first two days you likely wont have any likes for a while either even with the Boost function activated. The app does not use any kind of algorithm to match people and its basically just a hope for the best senero.

Not a bad app. I think that matches should last a week, and that men should be able to make the first move after that week. I mean, even when girls are forced to make the first move, they don't. Wow, and now there is a limit to swiping? Taking this review from 3 stars to 2

They limited the number of likes to about 10 per day now...which is supposed to increase the quality of matches? But it's no different than CMB, where that model doesn't work. Bumble removed their undo swipe feature, and their Superswipe is about 2x pricier than Tinder's. It's like Bumble decided to adopt the worst of all features from dating apps. Pretty disappointing😑. After scrolling through the reviews, it looks like I'm not the only one who disagrees with the direction Bumble is taking

So I paid the money for the premium membership. Very unhappy with it. You still cant write a message to someone. Then if you want to send the heart button it cost you even more money ontop of what you already spent. It was just a total waste of money. I emailed them asking for a refund and was told no. I had no dates from this app and two or three conversations that went nowhere. I had more action from plenty of fish. Please save your money.

Payment thieves. I had cancelled my subscription in January, via the support team through email & all I get is the run around answers to why they have still being taking continual payments. I had no extra "boost" functions available on the app so i couldn't even tell they were charging me for service I wasn't even getting! In the end a "supervisor" Elaine replied my email on how to navigate the cancel subscription and closed off my enquiry as being resolved. DO NOT USE ANY EXTRA PAID FEATURES!

These aap is outstanding. I would like to say that you will find someone here, 99.99% are real users. The thing for which i had take 3 stars back is when i sweip right left, many times without any touch on phone the profiles goes to left itself . I am damn sure you want to sell your premium which is SPOTLIGHT. I am not getting a single match!! I don't know why? Please see these and work on it. You should singn up and make friends as well as your Life partner.

This app is the worst. The only way you can get matches is if you pay premium (I paid $50 for a 3 month plan). If you're a guy wanting to date girls you're better off IRL or somewhere else. The only good thing this app did was listen to my suggestion for sending out motivational messages to keep going. All the girls on the app will only interract with you if you're Ryan Renolds or Elon Musk. I'm NEVER using this app again. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

This app is ridiculous, I have try reaching out to bumble multiple times and being ignored since April 13th. I was charged for something that I did not purchase and did not even receive a receipt of what I purchased. I have to transactions and asked for clarification and they sent it up to a supervisor and nothing!

No support available. No restore purchase option. I accidently purchased six months boost instead of 1 week which cost me almost £80, and no way of getting that rectified. Deleted and reinstalled the app, and it's no longer recognised. Once you've purchased any in app elements they're not recognised anyway. Expensive rip off - don't bother!!

I find bumble vastly superior to Tinder in every conceivable way. Find friends or romantic partners by switching tabs and independent profiles, filter out who you want to see with 2 free filters and when you swipe left on someone I like how it removes them from your "who likes you list"(on the free version anyway). Profiles are a lot more intimate too with questions and labels. Im surprised Bumble isnt more popular/has more downloads. I get more likes on Tinder but more matches on Bumble.

Get this, so not only are swipes limited and you RARELY and I mean RARELY see your matches but I have 13 likes and I can't find any of them because I've run out of swipes continuously just trying to like someone back. It takes days to match with people that have liked you (and even then you may match with the worst one of them all) it's just a terrible app I loved the concept of girls chatting first BUT I'm NOT a fan of paying $24.99 a month just to reveal who liked me back.

It's a good dating app with plenty of quality people. Concept of having women is control of commenting first is good. Only suggestion to improve the site would be to allow women the option if they want to make the first move. I have met women who say they hate making the first move and don't know what to say. Perhaps give them the ability to choose certain guys they may be interested in to make the first move. Like they can pick one guy each day to give the first comment control to.

Load of rubbish had lots of matches but never speak to you even extension of the 24 hours to give extra time and still don't say hello to you, looking think these matches are fake and the users don't exist complete con,even when paying you still have to pay to go in spotlight and you don't get many coins when buying them and it's 2 coins not 1 to be put on The app Hinge is a lot better people speak to you on that no way paying again for this, thus app should be shut down for fraud. Thumbs down👎

A lousy system. It is stacked against men. You have to d ecide right or left based mostly on a picture. You get locked in to auto renew with no way out. There is no setting I can find to stop this feature. Messages to the company have not been responded to. I have been stuck in auto renew for 3 or 4 cycles.

Probably one of the worst apps out there. From their humble origins, they've become far too money hungry. I paid for all the premium services to give a detailed, scientific synopsis: Fairly inactive app, likely due to the following: 1. Many inactive, old user accounts 2. Limits number of swipe per day, unless you have premium 3. Sneaky subscription service 4. No unique features, they've copied other apps(and done it poorly). 5. Outdated programming. Overall: Don't waste your time. Deleted.

Sadly despite bumble's premise to be a proper dating app its quite disappointing. 1 its glitchy matches dont show for days without refreshing search criteria and verification disappears after matching. 2 bumble thinks its awesome for showing people outside of your criteria therefore guys are swiping on me 2.5 hrs away 3 this is what's mostly in the paid liked you 'bee line' guys miles away. So paying is a waste. 4 Tech support just copy and pastes answers see below. 5 bathroom, tongue & dic pics

an aggressive moneygrab of an app, with possibly the most uselessly condescending social media support team of any app I've ever seen. "intentional connections?" my guy, how about you give me *any* connections before you force open my wallet. tinder is worlds better in actual functionality, which is a damned shame because bumble's concept *was* so much more interesting and promising.

Zoomed wayyy in to all of my pictures when I tried to post them. I wanted to show (and see in other people) at least a tiny bit of their surroundings to get to know what they like doing... finally just gave up. Maybe I'll try again later if they get it fixed

Good idea and hardly any fake profiles BUT app is USELESS. Does NOT show matches unless you force close app all the time. Then time runs out before you actually see them. Timer needs to be longer not everyone has time to check every day. Feel sorry for those that pay for this.

I used this app for a while now and I wanna say that this app is a joke. If you match with someone, be prepared to not receive any replys back. It's like they on purpose match you with someone, so that you pay them to see/extend and rematch. They even decided to make it worse, by increase prices and put a limit on swipes per day.

Good app but needs to allow install on SD card for Android. Too many apps are competing for internal storage, that's why SD cards were invented. Soon I'll have to choose which apps to keep and which to dump, and eventually delete this one because I don't have to have this app on my phone.

I wish there is an option for ZERO STAR for this apps. Bought 3 months Boost subscription & after about a month, I had to deleted my profile due to personal issue. Decided to re-registered later with same phone number & email address but found out previous Boost subscription which still left 2 months was not tag to the profile. Reached out to their Support Team but they are not helping at all. Wasted my money. DO NOT DOWNLOAD OR BUY ANY SUBSCRIPTION FROM THIS APPS!!

I thought it was a good app until they took my account down. Apparently people can report me because I dont look old enough even though I am 20 years old. This app has terrible communication and does not even ask you to verify your age to prove how old your are. Terrible app.

Had the same profiles in my bee line for the last few months, would be nice if i could swipe on them eventually or just have them expire. UI is pretty good, app works fast enough, and i like this app better than tinder but I'm not convinced that any service is being provided if they never show me the profiles that swipped on me months ago.

The end of the line feature makes the app for me unusable. Don't know how much limit is but I've and it so at 11pm it let me swipe again but only two people an hour later at 12 though okay should be better now nope only one person. It is pointless to use if it's a stupidly low amount you might as well add random people of Facebook or Instagram or Snapchat and message them.

Not many users, I applied 1 filter with max distance but it always tells me that there is no more to swipe and I need to expand filter. Please add an "don't show" option in filter, especially in religion filter. I want to exclude a religion because I DONT wanna see women with hijab in my list.

Better search filters than some other apps. Still very low character limit for writing profiles. People often complain about the superficial interactions they have on these apps and encouraging users to write more detailed introductions would really help to initiate more meaningful conversations

The app is ok, good for meeting people on and chatting. Most users seem unwilling to use some of the features provided but thats fine. The microtransactions for coins and mothly boosts are a bit dear. If im honest i have a sneaky suspicion the app waits for you to sped somethig before connecting you with people sometimes but i cant prove it so.. its good if you want to meet people and date i guess. Not had much luck myself but you cant fault an app for user error/inefficiencies

Haven't been on bumble for years. Redownloaded and created an account. Just over 24 hours after making an account and 12 after buying premium for $30 it logged me out and wont let me log back in. I hadn't had any matches or communication with anyone at all up to this stage.

So today, someone I've been talking to for 3 days now and were going quite well, suddenly disappeared without reason. I assumed she ghosted me for whatever reason but now I'm not sure. I noticed older matches I've had are suddenly disappearing today too, which is very odd. Is there something wrong with my profile or technical difficulties you guys are having?2 or 3 of the other people I had as matches, I haven't spoken to on Bumble in several months so, did they all just happen to unmatch today?

Fraud! Out of nowhere you charge me with a subscription while your app has been sitting on my phone. Just because I had my payment details saved I have been charged incorrectly and there has been no communication from your teams regarding the same. Absolutely horrible service.

This app is definitely better than Tinder. I would recommend this app, especially if you are a female looking for a date. I have had a better experience with guys on this app just being generally more pleasant than those I came across on Tinder. It is very easy to set up your profile and easier to identify guys that you would be compatible with. On Bumble, you get to see a bit more of someone else's personality than on Tinder which only features room for a bio and anthem.

Just another dating app looking to make money for every small feature and trading user experience and functionality instead. Also have heard many people complaining about how they collect your private data including conversations, photos, location etc. and use it to their advantage by selling it outside.

stupidest support team ever..could not resolve my billing issue.After repeated exchanges with them and after providing all details that my cards and accounts are working properly. The last message from them said by cards do i mean gift cards!!!!! seriously, of course i have checked my credit cards.. really disappointed with such mediocrity

If you purchase premium items, you will get no matches and thats not the case with Tinder, trust me you will get enough likes there (without premium purchase) It means you just loot and fool your customers with fake profiles even after purchasing coins. Its 24 hrs system makes it worst and out of the league.

- They don't care about people, they care about money... - 24 hour expiration of matches is a pure greed move. They want you to get mad and buy more extensions. - Plus they have auto renewal default on subscriptions and hide behind terms of service if you forget and they charge you.

The app keeps telling me that I've missed matches and offers to let me rematch by paying. These aren't people it showed me in the first place. I first wrote this in the app as it asked me to review. Imagine my shock when it didn't actually post it to the Play store. Stay away from this app and don't give them your money!

Would be a lot better if the "date features" actually worked. It doesn't associate people's preferences as it suggests. Definatley doesn't associate peoples sexual preference/orientation. Can't delete profile prompts. Limited swipes. Costly compared to other simular apps.

Horrible app it's a waste of time. I doesn't matter how many matches you get. It's an app were women have to make the first move. All that happens is you match with someone and 24 hours later it expires. I've tried this app a few times and all the time it's the same thing.

App layout and color and function is good. But the question is does it work? So i installed okcupid and Bumble at same time. Am just swiping everyday and not a single match.. just three match. I accidentally swiped guy and other was women but men worst and last was women but time expired no response. So am questions does it work? Any1

It's a wonderful app with genuine profiles. It's way better than Tinder or its ilk. True to its objective it truly empowers women by leaving the ball in their court. It also gives us men the satisfaction of knowing that you'll be connected to real people and not some miscreants behind fake profiles. It also gives men the pleasure of receiving pickup lines from women! Highly recommended. Way to go Bumble!

Oh it was only a matter of time before bumble would remove the free backtrack option. Why not start charging for basic signups too? I remember a point in time when the app was actually fun to use, less restrictive,and wasn't all about the bottom dollar.

This app is no better or worse than other apps, they've micro transaction it to the point where its almost useless unless you pay for the upgrades. Just like the other apps its all looks based, women want a man who's a 10/10 and if your anything other than that expect to get Ghosted hard which this site is famous for.

Every time i try to upload a photo of me with a facial scar, it keeps getting moderated, i don't see why this happens, even with a similar app did the same thing. I've had this app for about a week and have cashed out twice so far. It works but sonetimes I'll get far into a survey and something either breaks. At one point I was almost done with a long survey and got flagged for something, losing all my possible points. I used to dislike this app the most compared to other survey apps, but they seemed to fix all of their bugs the last month. It's now my favorite. They always have surveys and they don't drag you along anymore just to deny you at the end. I hated how much it did that in the past. Sometimes it takes a while to get enough to cash out but when you do, you get it within minutes.

I do not normally write reviews but this app has got to be one of the most legit ones out there. The money you get is real. I have currently made $50+ in two weeks. Not every survey you'll be eligable, but keep trying. You have to be honest when doing surveys or you'll be kicked from them. The only drawback is that you need 500 points to redeem your money but that isn't hard to achieve. I've cashed out 5 times with no issues and I get the money instantly. This app overall is solid.

On the mobile app the surveys disappear once you click on them so you can't be sure of what you may earn. Also, it can be frustrating with some surveys as it will show you are almost complete, and then says you don't qualify for the survey after 15 mins. A little rough at times and inconsistant.

The surveys will start and stop in the middle you cannot finish them. Too many times this has happened. Then you get either 0 points or two points or three points. If you're lucky most of the time you get nothing but a blank white screen going nowhere.

It may not be much money, but its reliable and will work. They even give you a few points if you don't qualify which no other survey site does I don't think. Also, there customer is fast and they work out your probably as fast and efficiently as they can.

It is very frustrating seeing that the survey "filled up" while I'm in the middle of taking it. How about once it's reached a certain amount of fullness, closing it so more people can't join? That way no one gets kicked out of a survey.

After expending several minutes 20+ in the survey and finish the survey you always get a message saying "ups" you didn't qualify and just get like 3 points for it... like your time is not worthy, 20 mins for 3 cents... I like the idea but it looks like they are just using you

over all is a good app for litte extra money, but some of the surveys just waste your time for not suitable recommondations. some of the survey says will cost you 10 mins, but when you spend almost 7 mins, it shows you that you r not qualified.

Best survey app on the market right now. Hands down. They ALWAYS have surveys available. They don't allow your info to be sold or shared unless you agree. You don't always qualify but that's the only down side. Trust me. The other survey apps I've used either never have any available or want you to go to other sites to give your info. The customer service is impeccable! Everything is cut and dry with time spent and points made. Give it a try! I've cashed in 25 bucks so far!

Was great, until you complete an ENTIRE survey and waste 20 MINUTES just to get disqualified at the end of it. What they need to do; is make it so that you do all the qualifications at the BEGINNING of the survey. Another problem; is that despite your best effort you will always get conned out of money. I've sat and done a 30 minute (promising 30 or more cents) survey just to get 3 cents at the end of it. Lastly, halfway through the surveys, they magically fill up and give you NOTHING .

Two words: Rip Off. I cannot count the number of times that after completing at least 33% of a survey I was sent back to the dashboard with an explanation that I either did not qualify for the survey, or that it filled up. Often they would give a token of 2 or 3 points. The fact is, these people want the information they are getting rich on, but are unwilling to pay for it. A waste of valuable time. Third Parties: If you really intended to be responsible, you would GET NEW CLIENTS.
It's a good app but it's extremely frustrating the amount of times I have FULLY completed a survey just for it to then pop up saying I didn't qualify or the survey filled up. That's total BS

Go-to survey app with a fair system and easy cashout. The surveys can be long so if you like doing surveys in your spare time check it out. You can win gift cards as well as cash out to your paypal account or directly to your bank.

The first couple of days the app was giving plenty of surveys to take. I don't know if the weekend makes a difference on how many surveys you receive, but they have slowed down tremendously. Update on last review. There are plenty of surveys during the week. It does slow down on the weekends.(been using two weeks)You are not going to get rich, but I did earn an extra $100.00 in two weeks! Beat app out there in my opinion.

Awesome app. I've cashed out many times. Payment is immediate which is good. It's legit and it's nice that they let you do surveys several ways. Also the promos they run are great too. If you put the time and effort in to it - It really is worth it. Would recommend this app very highly to all my friends, and family.

The app won't always give out the correct point total. Sometimes I'll start and finish a survey that says it's worth 10+ points, but it'll only give me 3 points for completing it. The app was great for like 1 month then all of a sudden it keeps telling me its surveys are unavailable to check back in a couple of hours. I've been going through this issue since Good Friday. Good ever since I rated the app. Recently it has been giving me more credit for the time I've spent doing the surveys or maybe it's starting to send me the right ones for me to do but thank you for responding to my last review and I'm impressed with my past couple of days using the application. Thanks and hope it gets easier to get some extra funds cause every little bit helps. Great job!

Great to get small amounts of cash. Can be addictive. Some frustration with finding surveys or getting half way thru a survey then it says you dont qualify. Over all, I have checked out a few other companies, this one seems most reliable with out gimmicks that cause you to get phone calls or emails.

So far in less than 2 weeks I've redeemed $12 and am loving this app. I don't get the same survey twice and if I don't qualify I still get 2-3 pts for trying which adds up. I highly recommend, this is easier and faster than inbox dollars where you have to reach $30 just to cash out.

I keep try to redeem my points, and I keep trying to verify my account but it won't let me. The surveys are quick and esy, and if I am not able to qualify it gives me 2 or 3 points. At first this was a good first couple of days, then after I received two payouts, all of a sudden the app seems to be playing the game a lot of time wasting app' s play, you are ask a ton of questions , you figure you should be taking survey by now, and then it says sorry our survey is full or you don't qualify and you don't even get the couple of cents you should get, wow really I thought it was one of the better app ' s. It took one whole hour to get three could have been four cents? I

It is a good app and all. You do get your money. But it seems hard to obtain any points to do so. Anytime I click on a survey, I would answer the first question, and it will be like "error!" You can get a few dollars a week at best because the surveys often trick you on payout by first saying the survey will give you 50 points for 18 minutes or something then saying the survey filled up after filling out questions for 10 or 20 minutes and give you 2 points for "trying". Locked account after only two tries to get earned gift card - I earned enough for a $5 Amazon gift card but when I went to cash out the app does not allow me to redeem, even though I had verified the account. I have been using this site for years and I find it to be one of the best survey companies. They payout quickly and and consistently have surveys available all day and night. Good job guys.

Good app, very real, I was able to earn my first transaction within a week of downloading, just have to be willing to put in the time. Survey Junkie is a nice app. It is easy to use and nice way to make extra cash taking some surveys. Having to qualify for surveys can be annoying when you don't qualify several times consecutively, but they still give you a small amount of points for trying. Haven't seen any surveys over $2.50 but have heard they exist. Worth trying if you're bored and want some extra cash.

Don't waste your time. Spend several minutes filling out surveys just to be directed back to the app to be told they're filled up or that you don't qualify. I really like this app. I like to fill out surveys. And it took me a long time to find a legit survey app. But, this app is one of the legit ones out there! I'm so happy I came upon this app. I would reccomend this app to anyone who wants to earn some easy money filling out surveys

This is a joke I downloaded it and tried to do the surveys you'll answer all the questions then get a the survey has filled up message and get kicked out.. What they do is get you to answer the survey and on the last question kick you out so they don't have to give you the points but get the surveys filled out anyway... So they don't have to pay you.

App is a piece of garbage. Collects all sorts of personal data wasting your time and violating your privacy. Then you are told you didn't qualify, survey no longer available or filled up etc.. I do not like this survey app. I take a survey and after 3 or 4 minutes when it seems like they have gotten the data they need it tells me uh oh every survey can't be a winner and I get 3 points. I've been using survey junkie for years now and you can cash out at $10 and if you are disqualified or kicked off of a survey you still are awarded two or three sons which is at least a consolation for providing a partial Completion of survey. Literally every time I finish a survey it tells me the survey filled up and I get 2 points instead of the amount I should've. Every time without fail it does this. I think the total amount of points should be upped since we spend so much time attempting them.

One of the better ones out there and they actually pay out. And they have great flexibility in payout methods when many others fall short. PayPal payouts are FAST. Takes a bit to get verified at 1st but understandable why they do this, they don't want scammers, etc. Plus their customer support was super easy to work with. Would recommend!

Out of ALL of the apps for making money, this is truly the ONLY ONE that has DELIVERED! And best of all it ONLY takes 500 points to cash out- equivalent to $5.00. AND it has NO HIDDEN TRICKS, or DAYS YOU HAVE TO WAIT to withdraw! It also DOESN'T DECREASE YOUR EARNINGS the closer you get to your goal! I would recommend to ANYONE interested in earning REAL MONEY and not getting super, to give SURVEY JUNKIE a shot! I promise you WONT be disappointed! 5 STARS ALL THE WAY!!!!!!

WARNING!!! Deceptive and makes false promises! They SELL YOUR PRIVATE DATA until you opt out! Their button to "Download your data" does not allow for a download at all. I am concerned that my payment information was sold as well. When I emailed Survey Junkie about this, they promised to email me my data within 30 days, but never did. When I followed up in a further email, they claim to have already emailed it to me (which they did not) and have now said they won't reply! Do not trust!!!

I just started doing surveys with Survey Junkie. I keep seeing a caption in green that says "OPEN IN PLAY STORE" when that is where I am right now. When I tap on the caption, it takes me to "Website Not Available ". But I can still receive and do the surveys thru my email address.

The app freezes up constantly, or the surveys will go on for 15 minutes then suddenly you aren't selected after answering 15 min worth of questions!! The payouts are horribly small, literally pennies. This is one of the worst survey experiences I've had in 20 years.

This is the only app besides coin pop and inbox dollars that actually legit pays. This app is even better though theres no wait time to get money it comes through instantly and I absolutely love it and the minimum is 5 bucks which is definitely doable. I've been playing a week now and have cashed out at least 7 times I'm just so thankful for this app and I wish there were more like this.

I have belonged too lots of survey companies in the past 10 years. But the majority I delete within @ few months. Mainly because it's impossible to get the points I have earned. There's only a few that I have held on to over the years. MyPoints, Google Opinion Rewards and now Survey Junkie. In fact SJ is my now, ABSOLUTELY FAVORITE SURVEY COMPANY. Unlike many companies, you get to earn a few points even if you don't match. Great App too. Thanks, Survey Junkie. You're the BEST!!

Read the fine print guys! The information the app is requesting access to isn't worth it! Browsing data? Online transactions including purchase history and account info? Emails? Forms, financial info, secured sessions? Seriously??? I'll pass! Not opening myself up to fraud.

Horrible experience. Just recently hit my $10 mark and I am still unable to redeem my rewards. Ive updated my "e-GiftCard email and PayPal email". I have everything on my account up to date with my phone number, address etc... PLEASE FIX THIS SITUATION. THERE IS NO REASON FOR THIS TO BE HAPPENING.

I downloaded this app over an hour ago. I've accumulated $2.27 in that time, but I'm not allowed to access it until I hit a higher amount. In the meantime, I am continuously disqualified for surveys. This app is awesome and is true to what it advertises. Unlike other survey sites, its simple and fast to earn and cashout. Used daily and very pleased. Recommended for anyone who wants to make a quick buck and has a little extra time on their hands.

Honestly id love to give a good rating as this app would seem to work well but ive been over a month waiting for a call or a postcard or SOMETHING to allow reward redemtion and yet recieve nothing but emails telling me to take more surveys when the 50+ dollars i have already earned will not pay. They do pay for surveys. Sometimes the surveys are misleading. WASTE OF TIME! After using this app extensively, I changed my rating to inform others not to bother. I did everything asked of me. This app gives lame excuses to keep you using it. STAY AWAY!
I like this app but I wish u could get more money for how much time u spend on doing the survey.

Survey Junkie is, in my experience, better than most survey apps. It allows you to cash out at just $5 and gives points for survey attempts even when you don't qualify. My only complaints are: Some surveys require you to provide your contact information at the end, so if you don't want to be contacted you have to forfeit your points. The qualification questions can be as long as the surveys themselves.

So I had posted a review after a few days of the app and was pretty happy. I was able to get $10 pretty quickly. I'm still answering survey's with this app but due to the lack of survey's I've downloaded a different survey app.

It was okay, Got my first $5.02 reward with a few hours of surveys. Takes a while to actually find surveys that you somehow qualify for.
