Lol..Pathetic, but hey!!

I Like getting money. This app gives me money. Lol even if you dont qualify for a survey the app will usually give you 2 or three points for trying. There are always surveys to take. They ad up as quickly as you take them. 500 points = $5.00. You dont need a math degee to figure it out.

I originally rated this app 4 or 5 stars. I was eligible for at least 1 out of every 5 surveys. Conviently, after I rated it a good review, I'm being denied for almost EVERY SINGLE SURVEY. I MIGHT get 1 out 10, if that. Sometimes I spend a good 10 minutes on a survey, THEN get told I didn't qualify. Survey JUNKie is right. I don't recommend this app any more.

I usually dont write reviews, but i need money fast. And with this app, it was working really well for maybe the forst hour. After that, it keeps telling me my surveys arent working or that it messed up or something. Wont give me all the points for the surveys either, itll only give me 2 or maybe 3 at the most. I dont know whats going on, but i about to delete the app and ive heard a lot of good things about it. Not impressed.
The best survey app. I have gotten $60 in gift cards so far.

Despicable I litterly try to enter my email to sign up and it doesn't let me type. At first it does until you click.the bar to enter your email it quickly takes you to the privacy policies once you click accept it takes you back to the sign up box and doesn't let you type. And i know its not my phone because i go to google after and works like a charm. Unbeliveable it tried restarting my phone and nope same thing I imidietly uninstalled it😡

I really like this app I had issues cashing out my giftcard I chose and after writing to them explaining the code I got said invalid when I tried putting it on m amazon account they sent me a link to the gift card fixing the invalid problem they are so helpful!

Okay app. Plenty of surveys. Just have to have alot of patience. Several surveys take up to 30 minutes and then tricks you into signing up for other services and you don't get credit for even taking the survey. I've spent hours taking surveys and hardly got any credit because of this.

Thought it was going to be a good app but it won't let me scroll down to answer the questions and when I tried to contact customer support to tell them about it all it would say is error I would definitely find a different app

Same situation as the other 1 🌟 ratings. It's annoying to spend time answer all these questions just to be disqualified! I wish there was a better filtration from Survey Junkie, especially if the survey is already full so I don't waste my time.

I did a survey that was roughly 25-30 minutes and on the very last question the app froze and it never returned so I had to close the app out and it didn't give me my points. Also, it was not the first time!

It is a good app to earn money taking surveys. I rated it 4 stars because I find that I will often get part of the way through suveys and then be told that Im not elidgable to take the survey. This can be a big annoyance and waste of time for me. Customer service is very polite and responds in a timely manner.
Good, reliable, and legit. Transfers are easy. My only complaint is that sometimes surveys don't give the full points they state. Also, it takes a few minutes for points to update.

One of the better free survey sites. A mix of activities to capture our interest and more surveys with questions relevant to the turbulent times in which we live. You'll make some pocket money and more importantly be a part of some valuable market research.

Getting paid for your opinion is alot better then playing those nonsense games with annoying ads that always pop up and when you get "close" to cash out...NOTHING. Try Survey Junkie for pocket cash!! Instant payout with paypal!!

I just want to get to the cashout goal & i will be deactiving this app. It is horrible the surveys will kick you out for not qualifying after answering like half the survey 10 minutes in and i didnt qualify ? Lol yeah okay. Majority of the surveys dont work . it sucks there is way better survey apps than this trash.

They're legit, they give you headaches though, I was determined to get my 500 points so Ican buy me a simple night cap🤷🏿‍♂️ once I hit 245 (about halfway) mobile friendly surveys stopped showing, Only ones available we're surveys you had to be on a computer to take, so what I do? Went to my car got my laptop and hit my 500, but that's lame that you guys hide surveys just because someone is accumulating points quickly, isn't that the purpose? Anyway I'm going to get my drink and uninstall✌🏿

Idk how this is supposed to the the top app. It keeps telling me a survey is full or I dont qualify. At first I thought it was because my profile wasnt finished. Nope, that wasnt the issue. The app just sucks. Dont waist any time because I'd you donr get $5 cent by cent then you cant redeem anything.... complete BS.

This is one of my favorite survey sites . I get a couple points a lot of times even if I don't qualify & I get paid not long after cashing out within a hour or two faster than I get paid by any survey site & I have tried quite a few . I can cash out on this site a lot sooner than other sites.

Quality surveys and the cash out is five bucks! I have been taking surveys for almost two decades and this site is one of the best. I joined a few weeks back and have cashed out twice with no problems. The surveys are not too long with immediate points.

I cant complain about extra money. It is usefull for getting a tiny bit of extra cash to go out for coffe or something, plus i enjoy quizzes so it isnt difficult for me. Its a good way to be productive while sitting at home in quarantine

This App is amazing no joke! It legit pays you for your opinion, and also allows you to cash out at $5 unlike the other Apps were you have to have a balance of $10 or more to cash out, I'm in love with SurveyJunkie! 😍
Experian is great in always giving me up to date alerts! Thanks Experian!

Answering pre qualifying questions and then once you start the actuall survey it says you didnt qualify is really annoying and when you chose a survey it says this survey is full lets fine another. Your better off finding an actuall job this app is worthless.
You HAVE to try this app guys! Love making money taking surveys without the bs? I've tried a bunch of apps and this IS by far the BEST!
This app is ok started out great but now not so much. It sometime can be frustrating when you get to the end of a survey and hit submit then it tells you that you didnt qualify.

Sucks. Surveys take to long. The company says I am not using their app and here I am eating from the link on the app. Again told was not using their app. So all buttons on this app are linked to another app and only thing I can come up with is this must be a fishing app to steal personal information. Please do not down load.

I tried this app a second time after I got falsely banned on a survey site. When I finally made 10 I had to call the supporters. When I did I immediately redeem for a 10 dollar gift card and it went in instantly. Still has low paying surveys, but its quicker? I dont know give it a shot. I struggle with terrible anxiety and I'm a huge intervert but the call was short and they verify my account, thank god.

I absolutely love Survey Junkie. Ive been paticipating for quite some time, but getting them to call me to confirm my paypal set up has been a real nightmare as I've been anxiously waiting for quite some time. You can really succeed with this app at making money and the surveys are easy to navigate.

I like it. I wish you did not have to answer 20 questions before finding out you don't qualify for certain surveys. I wish it was a way they could use our profile to match you to surveys we qualify for to save our time but other than that I like it.

It let me redeem my first 500-600 points. And now i just maid maid exactly 500 points again and been trying to redeem them and now its not working it says im in all be called by customer support in 48 hrs hopefully all get this resolved. Then all change my review to 5 stars. Thanks.

For someone like me who could really use the extra cash for some entertainment. My sister and I are able to get ten dollars in about 2 and a half hours, and ten bucks goes a long way. This app is very good for those who need the money.

I absolutely love my nest cameras, and the app too. I owned nest cams before, and if my memory serves me correctly, you used to be able to customize the settings a bit more, way back when. I'm giving 4 stars because I know for a fact there was the option to turn the status light completely off, which isn't a big deal or anything, but I really liked that option. Other than that, the app, and setting up these awesome cameras, is all super simple.

Replay of camera events could be improved. Remove the plus/minus 10 sec. icons. Improve the slide bar and let the user choose where to stop the event replay. It is difficult to slide the replay to a particular point on an event. When I lift my finger from the slide bar at a given time during an event, the time moves away from my choice. I can't lock it in to the exact time that I want to review.

Almost perfect, we have two thermostats tied to sensors. Three interior cameras and 1 IQ camera. Plus the three smart fire and carbon monoxide detectors. The only issue I have is the nest thermostats they have to be adjusted from time to time. Sometimes they're just a little too warm and other times just a little too cool. As our schedule varies a great deal. The smart thermostats do learn but they learn on repetitive basics. This is not the case with our extremely variable schedule.

App works great when the camera is sitting idle, I can open it up and have no issues. BUT, the second someone rings the door bell, I click on the notification and I get nothing, just the loading circle and it goes on for a minute sometimes. Only way around this is to close the app completely and reopen it and click on live. Extremely frustrating! As far as the Nest thermostat goes, this is our 2nd house and our 2nd thermostat! Cant live without it!

Great function and great use. Only things that make it hard to use is not being able to use multiple screens at the same time and watch video from different angles at the same time. Don't mind paying for the storage of the video but they could make getting video easier to download. Nest could step up their game but they choose not to. A little development might sell the product itself.

Really love the outdoor camera system I have with nest......but it critically needs some improvement in just a few areas. Notifications are almost always late receiving. I was also looking at investing in the indoor home security system, but it seems to be too expensive and complicated. A Much more streamlined system can be thought of at a drop of a dime. Wishing and hoping they make some major changes and focus on streamlining the system such as Ring.

It is a very confusing app and it does whatever it wants. I set it to a specific temp, I expect it to listen and it doesn't. It will just turn off and be delayed for no apparent reason. I wish it would at least send a notification why it is turning off or is delayed a few minutes. You try to maneuver through the app trying to find out how to disable the smart learn and you figure it out but then for some reason it still decides to turn off or delay.

Works about 50% of the time. When it works it's awesome. It just doesn't seem to work any time you actually need it. Especially the thermostat. That thing is super frustrating. Constantly says it's offline. And the doorbell likes to notify me that someone was there 15 minutes after the event occurred. It's a great idea, just wish it worked better. Both products are brand new. App was just downloaded and the most up-to-date version. Both phone and products have been rebooted. Issue occurs on all phones in the house including both iphones and androids.

I love being able to control my thermostat, BUT I hate fighting with an app that thinks it knows better than me. I will set thermostat to where I want it and then realize a couple hours later, my house is miserably hot. So I go in and find that the schedule - which I've deleted several in a month - thinks it knows better. For that reason alone, I do NOT recommend ever buying this product.

Could be better. One of my biggest complaints is the history function. Why can't I see what device has don't today? I have to wait until the next day to see any run times, never day of times. Also another cool feature is if you could back your history to the cloud and save more than just a week. Maybe be able to do year to year comparisons.

Very basic and lacking. Basic notifications are absent. When someone disarms or arms the alarm, a push notification should be presented. Also if the alarm goes off, an alarm, not a notification, should be played. There are so many basic features this app could and easily should be able to to. If someone is serious about improving this app, give me their email and I'll send my idea (free of royalties).

This thermostat is not optimized for radiator systems. Even after "learning" for months, it still turns off the boiler too early, especially when outside temperature is 40s degrees. As the result, it turns on the heating system way too often than it should be. And ~99% of the energy is waist since it boils the water tank for 15-20 minutes, sends the steam only to several main pipes inside the walls then turn off the boiler while all radiators in rooms are still cold!

I just found out that I do not control my own camera's settings and google can change settings at will. I just rec'd a notification that my cam has been changed without my consent to "conserve" during covid-19 outbreak. I am not happy at all with this development. 1 star because I had no clue Google gets to make decisions for me, and regardless of their motivation, I believe it is improper to change something that someone was negotiated w/o consent. Regardless if I can reset it back.

Sometimes it does what it is supposed to do which is to notify upon person based motion. With the latest release it skips the person recognition (such as when a package is delivered) and only works if a zone is defined. The issue is the zone doesn't catch the person but instead goes off for rain, flickering lights and other assorted nonsense. Tried the developers fix. Nope. Update has just made the Ring doorbell useless. Changing from 2 stars to 1 star.

Fantastic when it's working. There have been multiple times we were leaving for our beach home and upon trying to warm the house up ahead of time, either one or both of our beach house thermostats was not responsive. That hasn't happened in a while but it has happened too frequently. The main reason we bought Nest thermostats for our vacation home was so we could warm it up before our arrival so when the function doesn't work even though you have Google hub internet that is working....not cool!

Samsung s10e here and can barely hear through the camera's speaker. Not an issue with the doorbell. I understand this is a Samsung software issue, but its a Google product. I'll give it a couple weeks and then return it if its not fixed. Its not the microphone. I've adjusted that. Its the fact that your programming on Samsung phones uses the phone's ambient microphone instead of the voice microphone. The volume coming out if the talkback speaker directly on the camera is too low to be heard.

Should be able to boost central heating for a predetermined time like you can do with the hot water. This feature is found on I one of the oldest central heating programmes and should be on the app. I like the other features on the app which provides a really good bearing system. I check frequently to monitor boiler usage and see where I can make savings.

I wish this app had better analytics and models as to how much time it thinks it will be turning on in the coming months, estimations of how much money will be used, etc. There's a lot of data it can learn about your house as it turns on and off and it seems that Google is not doing much. Would barely call it a "smart" thermostat.

Many of the advertised features seem to be intermittent, they come and go (detecting people, motion, packages, movement etc). The hardware is the finest but I pay for features that mostly aren't there. Without the cloud features the hardware is just over priced. Update, let me clarify. I am subscribed to nest aware, on several cameras detecting people, motion, packages and movement notifications are in my opinion unreliable.

Great video quality, but not sure as good as I expected from all the hype I heard. Still worth every penny and more you will pay for the features. You paid for em, now pay again to use em. 50 first 30 each added. Just stick with primary ones and rest are fine on 5 days but ads might drive you insane. Only reason for me no 5 starvis lack of clip control. I don't know if a way to delete all the irrelevant stuff. There's a plan that flys in loop 24/7 in one room and camera hasn't caught on yet so..

Really like the concept. I'm extremely impressed with the wide angle and range of motion. The other part I want to try is the 4 range section areas that can be set up. Discouraging is the monthly subscription and the fact that the try for 30 days free was automatically started the day it was set up. With the video recording. Also not impressed with the phone location showing me Home one Second and five Seconds later Away from Home 24/7 that's Outrageous! There are connectivity issues as well.

The camera has clear a crisp video... Especially in highest mode. I do however wish the app included some manual settings to adjust the lighting peramiters. Don't get me wrong it is an excellent camera for your average setting. Audio communication is an added benefit and works better than expected. Super easy set-up, only downside is bulky wires (if unable to hide) that is.

Couldn't be easier. Was a breeze to setup and install. I love the fact you can run the fan to circulate air so things don't become stagnant. It's always learning and improving our living condition which is especially nice with this quarantine nonsense going on. A welcome improvement over the basic programmable thermostats of the past.

Great app but the reason I am giving a lower rating is due to the fact that you cannot access camera from more than one device without removing camera from the other device. I house sit for a relative and wanted to be able to view and monitor camera with my phone but the app will not allow me to do so without removing from my relative's phone.

5/1/20 update - Both of my thermostats were replaced and within 24 hours of installing the new ones I was experiencing the same problem as the old ones. Can't get anyone from Nest to respond. What a nightmare! ---------------- Just spent five hours on a Nest Chat session, was transferred to five different agents. After the last one was unable to help me the session conveniently (for Nest) expired. Terrible customer support.

Thermostat keeps going into away when everyone is at home. Messed around with all the settings but still no avail. The app doesn't always load up first time it is clicked. You have to clear the app from the memory then reopen it. Not the most intuitive when setting schedules. In fact feels very rudimentary. Disappointing overall from what should be top tier app and equipment Reply: I have previously disabled "use phone location" but no help. Just randomly sets itself to "Away"

You can no longer view events for the same day, let alone the previous week? Why is this change happening? When purchased, this device did not require a subscription for the same day video, now I would have to view the doorbell live view or get nothing at all. Very frustrating, do I need to change a setting? Edit: reached out to Nest/Google, no way to get live video unless you pay at least 5 dollars per month. Why not bundle this service into my Google drive?

Viewing recording history and clips is super obnoxious. Can't tell if the video is playing or loading half the time. I reeeeaaally don't like that I can't delete individual clips and have to delete the entire history instead. The app is not intuitive and I still haven't figured out how to use all the nest Aware features. I hope they improve it so I don't end up regretting this investment... I would like the toggle switch for camera on/off were more easily accessible in the app

Amazing app & thermostat. But I wish there were an option to change the schedual for all the nights or all the days, at once. Instead of having to do them individually. Individually is great for when you only need to adjust a couple days. But some of us don't ever go anywhere. Other then that, the app is fantastic!

A couple of weeks ago I was FORCED to add google to my Nest app (Google Nest) or it would not let me access my Nest app on my phone to adjust temperature. Now I cannot even get the thermostat to show on my app at all. It only shows HOME (no thermostat) and AWAY. Why was I forced to add Google? I dont want it, it messed everything up.

Not Great Not Terrible. Cameras will freeze and or there will be hours where a connection was lost despite setting the camera to data usage saver settings. I dont like how there is blue light now which is visible in darkness. This should be a feature you can turn off. The resolution further than 20 feet is not good and becomes pixelated. The microphone speaker to speak through using the app is terrible. You can barely make out what is being said through the speaker

Great potential yet very mis-management. Thermostats history needs to show starting current day. The camera history (without subscription) is absolutely the worst even though the cameras aren't cheap whatsoever. They seem to purposely stifle the camera history feed to force you towards subscription. Only thing that works great is Nest Protect, but I feel like Google will find a way to end that entire product line as it works so perfectly. Overall, was a HUGE fan of Nest but no longer recommend!

Ever since google took over nest app and devices have been functioning faulty. Camera just kicks off wifi for no reason whatsoever and other devices too. Totally sucks.. not mentioning that while cameras are off recording option is still being paid for. And now I get clever response about restarting camera and router!?! I'm an idiot and I don't knwo that. Thank you for presuming I'm a moron!!!!!

You replied and said you would look at this feature. But you won't. This has been posted all over the internet since 2018. Every single security camera system on earth has a split screen view. I have 4 cameras and want to stream at least 2, if not all of them. This should 100% be a feature. Don't waste my time making me come check your generic response. Either do something about it or lose a customer.

Still controls the thermostat just fine. I migrated to google and now my wife can't be added to the home. Her personal email is through her College G Suite and can't be used for Google home. She is not going to make another Gmail just to be able to use the thermostat. Very disappointing that the Google migration requires everyone to have a Gmail. It was much better before. The only other Google home hardware I have is a Chromecast, so it isn't much use to me either.

Initially easy install. But now after a few months we want to subscribe to the monthy service to store cameras activity. I keep getting the message when i go into subscriptions service to begin sign up that "no devices" and i CANNOT find how to get my two cameras, which are working and on my Nest/Home screens to show up as registered, etc!! I have no way of FINDING how to accomplish this and/or to sign up for NEST AWARE subscription because it isnt recognizing my devices!! MADDENING

Nest guard and thermostat get offline too often. I've tried everything but it still goes offline. The problem is it goes offline at night when I'm in bed and to be getting up at midnight can be frustrating to reboot it. Everything is connected to wifi and the only thing that goes off is the thermostat and nest guard. Not a happy camper.

Unrealible and useless. sends notifications when an insect flies in front of camera at 3 am or when clouds move overhead but not when a truck drives right up to the camera and a person jumps out of it. Motion detection is severely flawed and defective. Tech support is absolute garbage, non responsive. Plagued with server outages where you can not even access your camera on the LAN. Horrible product from a horrible company.

"your nest is offline" "your camera is offline" "your thermostat is offline". Also, best be prepared to shell out for their subscription if you get the doorbell. Otherwise the thing is useless for checking who came to your door an even just hour ago. Good luck getting an image if you get packages stolen. Ps: everything on my end is updated, maybe Nest can work on their app instead of replying to reviews with useless suggestions.

Since we have a Nest Hello we use it quite a lot. Integration with Google Home and the app responsiveness are great. I wish however to have an option to pause the video. We have an Android TV and the Nest app is available there too. However, it only allows me to sign in at Nest, and not at Google. That's a real miss.

Love the Nest. Works perfectly for our half underground warehouse space. We use the Nest to drive our hydronic heating system. We control it via the on-wall unit or the smartphone app for scheduling if we're away from the house. Perfect for our hydronic system that other than in the depths of winter the hydronic system only needs a few judicious bursts to keep the place moderately warm. The Nest's "detect when we're at home" learning algorithm is another great cost saving feature.

Decent, but far from perfect. App consistently mismanages the temperature. It's a common occurrence that I'll feel a bit cold, check the app to see the what's going on, and find that the heat has not kicked on, even though the temperature is 2 degrees below where it should be. After I open the app, Nest seems to realize it's busted, and start running.

I have a camera, doorbell and a thermostat linked to this app, Marjory of the time I get notifications after they happen(seconds to 10 minutes later) sometimes i won't even get a notification(walk past the driveway camera every morning and it hardly ever picks up my motion(about 1 out of 8 motion notifications). Most recently I'll get notifications but won't get the video clip of the motion. Doorbell is offline A LOT!(not a wifi issue) and the Thermostat NEVER stays at desired temperature either

No pause function on video playback, thats ridiculous. For the IT giant to be this lazy not to add such necessary basic function which also requires a subscription fee, very disappointing. Service is also not stable. They only notify u when the problem is fixed after there are technical issues so u would waste a lot of time calling technical support and they still tell u to check the service status while theres none when the problem occurs. Problem still remained even they said it was fixed.

CONSTANTLY asks me to enable 2-factor authentication. How about an opt-out?? Regarding the developer reply that I can disregard this message: My problem is that I am forced to disregard this message nearly every time I open the app. I wish to say "Never prompt me for this again" and never be prompted. I understand the value of 2FA and I don't care about it for my thermostat.

Great, easy to use app. Only gripe is connectivity with the app to the thermostat is problematic, but can be resolved by going to thermostat and checking connection to Nest app. There nothing that indicates why connection was lost so can't determine what the cause to prevent future instances and I never have issues with connectivity from thermostat to network since Google Home works to control thermostat and manually checking network connection appears to have no issues.

On several occasions the thermostat has set itself to 61. I have checked the Eco settings and adjusted them to where they should be. It has also failed to come on when the temp is 1 or 2 degrees below the setting, e.g. it will let the temp fall to 66. I like the heat set at 68 and the cool set at 74. I have not owned it long enough to observe how it will behave in the summer months.

The user interface isn't intuitive. The air conditioning on button is hidden behind multiple menus. The schedule keeps appearing after being deleted. It seems to arbitrarily turn the air conditioner on and off. Why can't it just turn on the air conditioner and let it stay on? Is that too old fashioned? Stop trying to be fancy.

Some features are great and app is clear and easy to use...while others remain non-working or malfunction for odd reasons...the location option to determine if I am home has never worked...also I have corrected the heating schedule to go no higher than 66 degrees, yet the unit for some reason changes that to 68 throughout the day - frustrating

The Google Hello and Yale Lock functionality is very limited on the Nest app. For example, when a guest rings the bell there is no way you can unlock the door while taking to them on the camera. You will have get out of the camera screen and go to yale lock screen to unlock the door. Then go back to the camera screen to let your guest know that the door is unlocked and come in.

For a smart thermostat it's not really smart- The cooling/heat feature are either heavy on the cooling side or heavy on the heating side. Meaning, in the fall and spring when temp outside varies day to day. Inside one day might be cool at night and the same temp another day might be warmer inside. Adaptive learning is annoying and off but turns itself back on somehow in app. There are some good features like fan scheduled on and off. Schedule temp feature needs to be a calendar not 7 days.

Works well. However, the app needs redesign to make moving among devices easier...too many steps/screens to navigate to go from one thermostat or camera to another. This could be easily solved by having the device list displayed along one edge of all screens, irrespective of how deep into any device information a user may be.

Fit and finish of the app is good, and it is easy to navigate. Issues: Video notifications have slowed over time to Ring levels. After my promotional Aware subscription unknowningly expired and I renewed a day later, face recognition pretty much never works on known faces, and it doesn't even acknowledge new unknown faces 90% of the time

Pretty good app! For the most part I am very pleased with the nest ecosystem but opening the app when viewing a trigger is very slow. The mail carrier rung the doorbell and waited at the door, I pressed the notification as soon as it rang but it took more than 30 seconds to load and I couldn't tell him to leave the package. For whatever reason it works slightly faster when using the Google home app. I am using 100mbps internet so I don't understand why it's so slow, other than that it's great.

Notifications do not work. I have tried everything I can think of short of a factory reset on my phone. I bought a Nest doorbell and the stupid Nest app thing doesn't even notify me if someone walks up on my porch or rings the doorbell. I'll be returning it for something else. A video doorbell is useless without a working app.

I think the app is okay, but I'm only giving it 3 stars because I think my issues are with the doorbell itself. I keep getting several false alarms. And I'm not talking about when a bird fly's nearby, or when a cat or raccoon or opossum walks up on the porch. These are instances when literally nothing is in the picture. But then I get an offer to 'sign up' for something that entails a monthly fee. Seems seriptitious.

I love it! It's been super helpful, especially during this Pandemic. I know when it's safer for me to go outside (we live in new construction & there are tons of contractors around) , it allows me to talk to people without having to open the door & I can keep an eye on my neighborhood. I also love how it all works with my other Google products, it's been a game changer!

The best part of the app is the ability to use it remotely when you're already upstairs and tucked into bed, or when you're away from home. It does have its slight inconsistencies with the unit not kicking on when set on the Heat/Cool mode. But overall pretty satisfied with no major complaints.

It's never quite worked like advertised. It never preheats the house when I'm coming home and randomly heats the house when I'm on holiday. It also doesn't have a save function for programmes - I'd love to have a 'school holidays' and 'normal' timetable I can switch between. Over all think I should have gone 'hive' instead

App doesn't have option to record video if camera not added to subscription. Constantly show that camera is offline, have to refresh several times till it starting showing wideo. App definitely need some improvements and bug fixes. Subscription is expensive compare to competitors. Wish it would give options to record video on to phone or tablet device vs cloud.

Trending sucks. Remote sensor configuration is weak. Edit: more configuration with remote sensors like custom times and high/low/avg temps has been suggested many times but you guys don't listen. I would like to see a graph that shows temps of my house at least hourly to see how it's performing. I'd like to see exactly when setpoint changes. Your history tab is very unfriendly and useless.

Glitchy, some times takes for ever to load stream from doorbell and when you scan thru time line it doesn't show crucial frames it just skips it. Definitely not paying premium for it. Works well for an alarm system. No slack or glitches with that. App could use some improvements. Overall it's ok, but not a 5 star.

Would be nice to have a trend of the temperature in your house and outside throughout the day. Would also be nice if you could set lockouts on heating and cooling. I should be able to prevent my A/C from coming on if it's 40 outside but warm in my house from say cooking etc. Would save a lot of manual intervention. Having the trend info would allow me to see how my house performs during certain temps outside which could help me better determine if I should heat if it's going to be hot out later

OK...It has a challenge in the "Home/Away" feature. It isn't very reliable. Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't. I checked and re-checked my settings and everything on my end appears to be good. Also, the camera kept identifying my chair as a person. So, it does need some work.

Absolutely disgusting. Worst app I have ever used and that is because I cannot even get passed the first stage. There is no option to select South Africa as a country, nor Africa as a region. What is the home address information used for anyway and why is it critical enough to stop the registration process? Yes i am referring to nest app. I can not select Africa as a region

Awesome tools in general. Would get 5 stars if it did smarter things like let you set a temp and stay on it hot or cold (like hotel rooms do) versus a temp range. Also could use an option to adjust temp in half degrees (ex: 68.5f or 72.5). Also if it aet temps based bbn on outside temp if outside temp is higher than inside set temp it could auto adjust using one of the above settings.

I love it I can watch my cat or my 2 boys 16 and 11 if I run to the store plus I can see all around my house outside and nobody knows that and the volume is execclent. Highly recommend this app for anyone looking for home equipment to màke sure my house stays safe. We caught a person trying to break through our Florida Room door I said I had called the cops and he ran faster than I could ever imagine someone running. It's an excellent app.

The app works really well in terms of functionality, but I don't know why I can't do something as simple as change the time when my HVAC system will use room sensors rather than my main thermostat. Being locked in to the four general time blocks the app automatically provides is very annoying and seems unneccesarily restrictive.

Desperately needs a "hold temperature" function, and a way to run only the fan while the heat/ac are off. Maybe even a way to schedule the fan to circulate air for at least 5 or 10 minutes each hour if heat or cooling are not used. But seriously, without a Hold Temp feature, the Nest doesn't meet a very basic need for a thermostat, "smart" or otherwise. Nest likes to remove features and ignore customer requests, and I regret giving them a chance instead of ecobee. Not cozy.

A decent amount of glitches that is unacceptable in a product like this. Even the google help instructions don't match the current version of the app. Works with Nest changed in the last year and the help files haven't been updated. Never been so dissatisfied with a google product.

Great App. 3 star rating because when changing settings it has a mind of it's own. Even after deleting old settings, I find weeks or more later the old settings are populated into the program along with the new settings. Always have to keep checking up on it. Unreliable for that issue.

The video and sound work very well. Zoom works great. I like being able to creat a clip to save some footage. The app has been reliable. The feature which is missing for me is the ability to easily create a snapshot of the current screen, i.e. save just one frame as a picture. I would rather not have to do a phone screenshot.

I just Live the Thermostat it's just great. It's smart and you can controll it from your phone. It's just wonderful. I've never owned a Thermostat like this before. I've owned programmable ones before and they were just so hard and confusing to program this Nest Thermostat does everything for you. Love Love it!

Something changed on my account and now I'm not able to access app on my device to monitor my little ones. Having it on the devices in the kitchen etc allows me to keep my phone free from the app and always have the app open on the other devices...Spoke with a tech at Nest, they mentioned it could be the server,but the issue happened when I setup 2 step verification. I tried taking it off to see if would remedy the issue, but to no avail..

The installation was a breeze! I love that I am able to have access to our doorbell camera from multiple devices. The app is definitely user friendly. The clarity is great and doorbell microphone is a plus. I definitely recommend the Nest doorbell camera. Hopefully Nest will come out with a floodlight camera.

For the amount of money you have to pay for the equipment and ongoing subscription, I expect better. Frustrating app to use. Has issues connecting with the central server more often than not. And you can't see video or silence an alarm without connecting. Can't recommend at all.

When Google bought Nest they discontinued the Works with Nest compatibilities, which means that i lost a key functionality: the ability to turn on my Nest fan with voice commands to my Google Assistant. Google should have thought about all the functions they'd be ending and created patches before doing so. Very mad at Google right now. 🤬 ETA: the Yale door lock goes offline CONSTANTLY. PLEASE FIX

Great if you pay the monthly fee for doorbell, not good if you don't. If you're not paying the fee it detects motion and takes a pic but when a person comes to the door it'll say it's motion and blur the picture. Pay $300 and without the monthly fee it's just a doorbell, and app won't take a picture.

Very functional, I can see what the family is doing while I'm at work. I'm only using it for the thermostat right now. I like to nudge that cooling up so they don't cost me a fortune and cooling bills. I especially like the function to turn on the fan circulation and the house that seems to move air around the hotter rooms and definitely saves money as the compressor is not on.

This allows us to control the temperatures in our 2and home that is 300 miles away. Great to keep our heating and cooling costs low while protecting the home from freezing or being too hot. It allows me to control the temperatures when guests want to stay there. It's just Perfect!

Still not switching to eco mode when I am away from home, have to do it manually. All settings are correct on my phone. Nest shows I am away from home but doesn't switch to eco mode like I have set it to do. Been like this for a few months now and the last app update didn't fix it.

The notification when someone rings the door bell and by the time you can speak to the person it's about 45 seconds later. If someone is walking towards the door or away from the door... it doesn't record it like a video, there are only one or two photos unless you are viewing it live. I'm very disappointed.

It's horrible. I see people in my camera, the app alerts me, but when I try to zoom in on the face it always zooms in elsewhere. The pinch to zoom is horrible. I have yet to get the speaker to work, so talking to the person at my door not even possible. I expected more when I bought this camera

Really easy and convenient to use. However I notice from time to time I noticed my app sometimes switches my ac and heater off. This is the 2nd home I've been in with this random issue and only when I use the app. Otherwise much more convenient than having to wall upstairs to touch the thermostat.

Keeps dropping offline and hasn't shown me the history in over a year. Talked to tech support and they followed a script and weren't able to help at all. Edit: I have a Pixel2 phone with the latest OS. I also have automatic updates turned on, so the version is not the issue.

Cameras are basically useless unless you pay the monthly fee. Still screenshots only and very hard to pinpoint what might have caused the camera to go off. Disappointed in the account of money I spent on these only to have to pay more monthly if I want any benefit out of them...

Everything works fine but there is no volume control. I may have to take my child to the emergency room!! We tested it and the speakers were a no exaggeration ear bleeding loud. I checked it out as well and my right ear went numb and is now burning. This is extremely dangerous!

The Nest is great. From being able to check and/or change the house temp from anywhere, we're very happy with the Nest. Eco mode has saved us a lot of money in a short period and the "change filter" reminders on the app and wall mounted control are extremely helpful.

I love how easy it is to control the temperature in your home from wherever you are. The app is wonderful, has minor bugs, sometimes it goes offline and cannot connect to the thermostat but it comes back within minutes. If you have nest, download this app.

Been using Nest 5 years or so, suddenly couldn't access account. Tried "forgot password," and it wasn't sent, not even to spam. Tried upgrading to the latest version in Google play store, and now can't even open the app on my Samsung Galaxy 9+. Nest has gone from useful to useless...

I was happy enough with my nest doorbell until it became google nest, google looking for access to my linked email and way too invasive for my liking, i cannot find access in order to update my subscription for year two, so i now just have basic features that are rubbish tbh. Should have purchased another make, not straight forward when it came to setting up the existing door bell either.

It was great for about 3 weeks, then it stopped recording video Ive been trying to subscibe and can not find the right link. THIS IS NOT VERY USER FRIENDLY. The reviews say that the video doesnt work even after you subscibe! Has this been fix and if so how do i do it!?

Please edit the schedule feature of the app to allow the user to use text to enter the desired temperature. The slider format is extremely difficult to use, especially if you are trying to set upper and lower bounds that are close together. You will never get them where you want them.

It works very well. Since I started using this my utility bills are much lowered than it used to be. But once in a while I am experiencing some problems with the wifi connection or unit is OFFLINE. Other than that it works for me excellently.

Just got the Nest Gen 3 and have been waiting for that opportunity for a while to replace my Honeywell. It had the same function generally besides all the learning the Nest does on its own, but now I have the older Nest and the latest in one interface and it is so easy to either set it myself or let it figure it out on its own and it ties in with the Google hub effortlessly.. I just speak to it and it does it.. I love it!!

Nest has everything I wanted. Upgraded from a cheap chinese cctv system. Has notifications, motion sense etc as well as whole home integration with all nest products. Currently have a CCTv camera and doorbell hooked up, have not 1 single complaint about any of it. Will soon add some smoke alarms and more cameras. 5*. Would never buy anything but nest from now on.

It takes a little time for the thermostat to learn your habits, but seems to work well. The app is a great plus. You can set your thermostats when away from home. There are also indications of whether or not you are using energy wisely. Much better than the old style of thermostat.

This device is sleek and modern. The Nest device is easy to install and the operating system was made for novice people. I am able to control it, and save electricity when I forget to turn off the thermostat from anywhere. One of the best smart home device ever made.

Keep getting "Nest had trouble communicating" Network error message when I try to login. I can login through the chrome browser so it must be something wrong with the App. Update: I have re-installed the app but the latest version keeps crashing while loading the camera's video.

Takes too long to pull up video. A delivery truck can be come and gone by the time I get the video up. I have a new Pilex 4XL phone, high speed internet, and Nest cameras and hubs all around the house. Nest cameras could not be more lame. I have a Pelco DVR system in a second home, with POE cameras and the video comes up instantly and provides much more usable functionality than the Nest system. On the Nest system all you can see is a circle going round and round waiting on video to load.

Everything was working flawlessly up to the last few days. When I try to connect (live stream or playback) on an external network, it hangs on step 2/3 “authenticating”. I am not doing anything different than before. It was working for months. If I am on the same network of the cameras, I can authenticate without a problem – I am not changing anything different. I don't understand. I tried resting it, deleting it and adding it again. Nothing.

Their products work it just takes a while before updates or features become available. Wouldn't advise backing products or getting soon after release, but eventually they get things working. Band is kind of useless in its current state, hopefully things get better. The costs are cheap so you can't complain, for the most part they work, but lack features you'd be willing to pay extra for.

Worked OK until recent update. Accessing the live view after viewing events would cause a soft crash and it being stuck at 1/3 when trying to connect to the camera. Normally closing and reopening the app fixed it as long as you went straight to live view. Now after the update that workaround no longer works. Actually, you can't even view live view at all now, save for the random time it does decide to work. For me that was just once. I have yet to be able to view live view and playback since.

This app continually has bugs. You have to check the camera, literally, daily to verify it's still connected and doesn't need power cycling to work again. The app stops detecting events despite settings being the same and you have to uninstall and set it all up again. The cameras are cheap, but they really can't identify faces and they certainly can't identify license plates. They aren't true 1080p, they're upscaled, low bitrate, interpolated videos that basically give you a glimpse. User:1 year

Video previews are starting to show in my gallery on phone. I blocked the app from having access to my storage but when I open the app it requires the storage permission. Also playback does not work most of the time and when the SD card fills it never writes over the the oldest video. The card just stays filled. I understand that this is an inexpensive camera but it makes me not want to pay for the paid service.

New updates have turned this into a proper security system! If you opt to install an SD card for continuous recording (which I strongly suggest) you now have the ability to push the "Playback" button and jump right to the full recording. Also, you now have the ability to group products. So now I have all of my porch lights grouped together and set to a schedule. Absolutely love it! Keep up the great work guys, just keeps getting better. If your looking for a security system, check Wyze out.

Have only had the cameras for about 2 weeks. The app has worked pretty good until today's update. I can get the cameras to connect if I back out of the app a time or 2 - or 3. The cameras are having trouble connecting/authenticating. As of right now this is about the only way to view the Wyze cameras, so it's pretty important. Hopefully this gets rectified soon. An app for streaming media players, such as Roku is also needed.

I have 2 web cams for four months now, a pan cam and a basic cube. Love them, always connected and rarely missing a thing and with the sd cards I can play back anything. They may need to be plugged in but since they detect motion they can sit on a window sash and shoot through the glass, it's great. Think I may need to get another one!

Lots of connection issues and freezes. The camera is decent especialy when viewed through different software. Unfortunately the wyze app has some issues Edit: Lowered rating. More issues; latest update broke the software. I wouldn't trust these as baby monitors. Too unreliable. I can't have random updates breaking the app, forcing me to wake my child up in order to reset the device in the middle of the night. An old baby minitor from the 70s is more trust worthy....

Wont connect, way too much work. After getting the product and app, following directions to a T. Reset device, reset router and still wont connect. Find out that out of the box I may need to do a manual firmware upgrade just to use the product? Too much hassle when i have a ring cam that worked right out of the box no problem. Really dissapointed, please save your time and money.

Having constant issues with door sensors going offline! Yes tried all your suggestions. The bridge is blue when i restart or remove or unplug. It comes back strong blue.. my door sensors are may 5 feet both front and back. They worked fine for awhile but after update. STOPPED OFFLINE! something wrong with these door sensors defective?? I have 3 wyze cams and motion no issues. But this door sensors are a on going issue.! How can you help me fix this???

Had 8 devices hooked up and running...until a few days ago, when everything went offline. The app does not open as well. Worst of all, my security cameras went offline and they are externally mounted inside their cases... don't know whether its a software (app) thingy or whether i should start opening up the camera cases to reset the equipment. Disappointed

Upgraded the in hopes of fixing the issue, and it did, but what's left is a new issue on the device options page where it just spins and spins and like the other issue I have FC the app to fix it. You guys really mucked up an app that was formerly perfect. SMH Really not happy with recent updates. The updates satisfied wyze but mucked everything up for me. Can't even setup my can again after error 90. Wth wyze?

Best monitor camera out there based on price and features! A friend recommended to me and we now use 4 cams, 3 door sensors, 1 motion sensor around the house. Wyze has great integration with the sensors and free cloud storage as well! This camera is good enough for monitor baby although without temp check and separate parent monitor unit. 1. Need to support separate monitor unit so we can always see without the phone 2. Need voice announcement (i.e. "front door is open") from the monitor unit.

Installed last week.. now it wants to update with new permissions: Contacts, SMS and Call Logs. WHY DOES A CAMERA APP NEED THOSE PERMISSIONS? I changed to a different antivirus when it wanted those permissions. The only thing I could figure out was the app wanted to send SMS messages to my Contacts and let them know I used the app. I wish Google would start looking at the apps and decide what permissions are reasonable and what may be using permissions to 'backdoor' my devices.

I've had a wyze cam for a couple of years now. I had to move it so I disconnected it and connected into another room. Now the wyze cam won't connect and can't add product either. So I thought just to sign out and uninstall the app. However when I reinstalled the app again, it kept all my info, I didn't even need to sign back in. I have the two factor authentication , I cleared the cashes and signed out of the app and then uninstall it and still when I install it back, it keeps me logged.

My two cameras used to work great and setting them up was super easy. But now, after changing my wifi password, I can't get them to connect to the app. It looks like it's about to finish then freezes and fails. I've tried everything suggested and still no luck. I used to recommend these cameras to everyone but now I can't. And I have to buy new cameras from someone else. Such a shame when it used to work so well.

Cameras will not connect for about 6 days. Our wi-fi provider has checked our download and upload speeds and we are fine. All of our cameras have unplugged and started as a new device. Still no change. We have spoken to the Wyze Wizards and we have tried everything recommended and still the cameras will not connect. I'm pretty confident that the problem is with "Wyze" instead the people who buy their products. Please fix your technical problem! Ticket #524981

Was great, but no more. I've had my cams for 2 years now, bragging and showing off the deal I recieved. I just ordered a new cam, went to install and saw I had to upgrade app. After downloading new app, my old cameras will freeze periodically, and the new one is even worse. Changed to 360p, and tried other selections. A little better, but still freezes with all. I wont be bragging any more. Now I'm ashamed to show them now. Even the video is not clear, and all I did was downloaded the new app!

Cannot access my Cams anymore with this update. Can turn Cams on/off but no picture in the Live Stream screen. Liquid keep trying to fill and stays at 1/3 complete. Did factory reset and same problem. Been having issues since day one with these Cams and every update get worse and worse. At this point my Cams are useless since I cannot access them. Prior to this update they were working fine but had other issues with the app. like crashing when accessing the settings and other features.

So for the first time since the Pan Cam's release I can give this 5 stars. I just realized I need to enable the "detection settings" and that will set where the camera resets to.. before wouldn't stay put. The text is so small and there's no obvious explainable of this. Especially with all the other options spread around like pan on or off while watching the Livestream, or setting way points deep in the settings. It's all over the place. I suggest bringing it all together with a nice layout👍

What happened??? It was running very good until now (just before the new update), now it just goes to Authentication & takes ages to get connected to the Camera. Also noticed, the live cam is freezing a lot. I thought it's my Camera or the phone, & reset them all, but still the same. Also noticed in the setup, notifications, we can choose person (which was not there eatlier). Please fix it.

Love their products ! But the Android App ver. needs work ! App varies from ph to phone with same maker. Ie. - Wyze band with alexa to authorize app plug 1.3.46 failed to authorize and left user with a blank screen & an unauthorized device. Both are LG ph's - Daily driver ph - "No can do!" Home hotspot ph - It works ? Still waiting for overrun (in a panademic) tech support to get back to me (day 3). I understand the delay. Just would like a solution. Btw- Beta versions would not open

I was super excited to receive my wyze camera in the mail! I got it hooked up easily and placed inside on my front window so it shows my front porch and my driveway. The picture is great for daytime but doesn't work with night vision on (which I anticipated since I have triple pane glass). However, I am extremely bummed out that the motion detection doesn't pick up people... I want to see people walking up and around my house. What's the point if all I see are the cars driving past my house?????

This app is working just fine, it's the cameras that are constantly giving me problems by shutting down or going offline. One of my camera's disconnected from the app and will not connect so now the product is useless! I uninstalled it because nothing else worked and then I tried to reinstall the camera. It will not connect because the app/camera only works on 2.4ghtz not 5. Why should I lower my wifi just to install 1 camera? The other 3 cameras work just fine, well, mostly! Besides that, my network does not offer the option to downgrade the ghtz. Now what!!!!

update: had to clear app cache & data to get it back to work. Still a problem with the PanCam vs the regular Cam in that the recording/playback of the PanCam sometimes does not register (0/0 storage?) but on some days it just works. *** With the new update, the app just goes to a blank screen. Everything was working fine before. Please test it more before releasing. Hope there will be a fix asap!

I have had 2 cams for year or more. Starting about April 25, neither cam works. 2 separate locations. Nothing has changed with set up. I have disconnected, reconnected etc. Nothing. I use this to help care for my mother with dementia and I have been without it now for 48 hours. Very distressing

Needs permission from Google to get text notifications to the band. Otherwise works pretty well. The cameras are great. The band has a hard time distinguishing between me being a couch potato watching a movie and sleeping. Not clear to me how the shortcuts function works. Mind blowing for the price and super easy to set up. The band can also be a wearable Alexa!

I'm becoming increasingly aware that the otherwise good app won't push notifications through after the screen is locked for a few minutes (Galaxy S10+/Android 10). Unlock the screen and all the past piled up notifications come pouring in. All notifications permissions have been set to allowed, along with app not allowed to sleep/doze w energy saver settings. A well documented failing for Android users on their forums, and sadly makes the WYZE devices unreliable for realtime home security.

I'm really happy wyze is a thing. Having a few issues with the new band. I mean, it's fantastic and all but I'm having trouble with the way the app refreshes. Battery optimization is turned off but I still need to open the app to get the weather to update. I'm sure an update it's all that's needed. It's a new product and people are busy so still gets five. P.S. the band install moved all my camera numbers up by one which could be a bit of a challenge for some people.

Great products (wyze cam and pan can) and app. Two essential things are missing: 1) geofencing... I've tried fttt but that only works now and then. Native support is needed! 2) Support for use as surveillance cam . Instead of launching a slew of new products I advise to first optimise the experience and functionality of existing products...

Great Little camera. It gives you everything advertised and a bargain at twice the price. The app does need some help, but hell, for $20 I'm not going to complain. Thanks guys. Can't wait till my wife let's me buy you security stuff! App is in desperate need of a, landscape mode.

Update: Got my first person detection notification in months today! Back to 5 stars. Was: I was really impressed until the "update" removed person detection. Solid, stable connection to my router and phone, good picture quality, but the heavily promoted XNOR integration is why I bought the cam and was considering more purchases.

Every time you change a Wi-Fi password with these cameras it creates chaos.I have two cameras and both of them don't work now. I've deleted them from the app because nothing works. Add new device still nothing. Won't scan codes..again camera will not scan codes. Yellow light blinking but won't scan. Now I have to set up a whole new account because it seems these cameras are "tied" to my old email account. It never ends I've tried everything. 60 dollars wasted. Don't change wifi or doom.

The app & cameras used to work great & were very reliable. After the last couple of firmware & app updates, new cameras will no longer record motion at all. Yes, I have micro SD cards in them all, & the settings are correct. I have 8 cameras total. 7 Wyze cams, & 1 Wyze pan cam. The last 3 I added, will NOT record any motion or sound events. I tried the contact link above, & got an automatic email response telling me to look for my answer on their support site. Really??? Been there, no help!!

I love Wyze! I got two more cameras today BUT on the only one I had before this new ones has been having issues connecting since last night. I'm planning to set these cameras on a high to reach location and I would hate to having unplug them to force power off. Please look into this issue. Thanks.

Doesn't let me create an account. I have bought a wyze cam and am not able to use it. App crashes everytime once you enter email address passwords in signup page and click the button. It sends a verification code to email. But the edittext or whatever textfield for code doesn't let me enter anything inside that.

Less Than 1 Day in- Seems some videos freeze up/don't work or in some rare occasions or they have exited the App and could still be viewed after retrying. They weren't really highly bad things to miss really "aka headlights from the road etc" and i submitted them in hopes that they help with the collection of fixxing the software Bugs.

Every time I scroll down to play events once I hit play it kicks me out off the app this is not right waste of money to subscribe to CMC you need to fix this issue ASAP.... this is a shame... EDIT. The latest app update v2.10.36 issues: Events videos turns gray for 5 seconds and keeps loading. When I want to tap settings icon it turns gray. Super Annoying

**update** 4/21/20.working great now. no massive battery drain like it did in earlier version. Massive battery drain on Android 10. Even 10 minutes of use or low amount of use causes 14% drain. No update released for days. Please fix this, its almost unusable now.

Can't sign up I just got my cameras in. I downloaded the app and signed up but need this verification code that it's supposedly sending to my email but it's not I didn't get it and I've checked all my folders no email with no verification code.
