Worked perfectly until i tried to open the app yesterday to live stream my house. It will not open through the app, however i do get notifications of sound and motion. I really hope this gets fixed. I see im not the only one having issues!

Trying to use this app to set phone and text notifications on the Wyze Band. However, when I try to set these on I get an message that tells me the function will be set when Google Play grants permission. I have granted all permissions to Wyze, Google Play and Google Play Services and still cannot set this even with the newest app update. One reason I got the band was the ability to reason these notifications- how do you get it to work?

This camera we got from HomeDepots home security section, is the cheapest priced, simple functioning, multiple sensors equipt [as stock] , wifi camera with lots of "Bells and whistles" , including an app to serveillance from anywhere you got your phone handy! oh ya! the Night vision is better then Perfect! also, when you may need to scare an idiot, or, play a joke on someone, it is equipt with sound and a intercom for you to speak into! its all on your phone app. ITS AWESOME! Thank You wyze.

Love the company's goal to democratize IOT and home security. the app is super easy to use and new features are added all the time that really streamlines the experience. I do have one request though can we please get some widgets, it would be very useful to be able to set my lights with a widget on my homescreen, without having to use IFTTT

Overall, it's OK. Pretty intuitive app. I am unable to submit a tech support request from within the app (the website works fine). I get a message saying the internet connection was disrupted. Also, the Add File option is not clickable. 😡

Updated my review as person detection has rolled out again, and I got great support for my Cam V2 when I was having issues. The user forum was a big help as well. Still having issues with Cam V2. Works well for a few days, then card filled up and now won't connect.

Love the cams, problem is I can't get the bridge to work correctly or connect any of the sensors or motion detectors. Bought a smart home starter set a few days before they went 20 bucks cheaper. Kinda upset that they don't work.
So I've had this for some time now, I absolutely love it and the idea, just wish it would still record without internet, but then it probably wouldn't be the convenient and wireless size that it is

Can't get my cameras to reconnect to my WIFI . I had to update my modem bc of my internet company and now my cameras will not connect. It is very frustrating when they had been working fine and now won't work at all. NOW I CAN'T GET ANYONE TO RESPOND FROM THIS COMPANY

Moved house and changed internet connection to a different 2.4ghz router. It connected once or twice but gets disconnected when i connect it to Google Home. I reinstalled twice and now the bulb and camera doesn't even connect to the wifi when it says "connecting".

Yes! The latest update provides a feature to recognize a person! So now I don't get updates every 15 seconds when my plants move. Love it! Thank you for adding this. Now the only alerts I get are people and passing cars. Just awesome!!

New version will not let me view my cameras on my Android. Did an app update today and they do not work. They do work on my wife's Android and she did not do the app update. It reads Connecting camera by secure channel (1/3) ? On all 5 cameras.

I love everything about these cams, however the app itself needs a night mode or a theme customization option. That standard white is soooooooo harsh and blinding to look at sometimes, especially if I'm laying down in my bed at night.

Works well. Lots of options to choose from for your specific needs. App does not install on my 4.4.2 devices [phones, tablet] thou 😔. Luckily I found v1.3.164b that runs on 4.4.2 and supports Sensors, Plugs & Rules. 👍

The new update I don't like it I have three cameras two switches and every time I open the app I cannot look at my video live or playback it says connect to connect error. You only can look at your video if you're on Wi-Fi if you using your mobile phone without Wi-Fi you cannot see your video

Stream Unavailable - Google Nest Mini Whenever I ask my Google Nest Mini to cast my Kitchen Cam (wyze cam pan) it says sorry the stream isn't available from kitchen cam currently. Fix this please. Answer: Removing wyze from Google home app and re adding the device in google home fixed the issue... 👍
Motion recording is random. I can dance a jig in front of this thing for half an hour and it won't record anything. "Person" feature doesn't work at all. Notifications have never worked.

Prior to whatever update the app did, it was okay. It detects everything, doesnt matter how low you set the detection settings.. but as oppose to no detection, ive learned to deal with it. But now its freezing up. Whats going on??

Like it very well! Will put 5 stars if only not the one concern... Access from the regular computer... No web interface for browser and mobile app is not allowed to be installed on ChromeOS for some reason...
Hands down amazing! It's like a cat cam for me! I have an elder cat and I like to keep an eye on her for health reasons! Hands down will be buying 1 or 2 more of these products!

A lot of people are having the same issue ⚠️ having the wyze sensors showing as offline but actually having full bars signal but nothing working WYES doesn't seem to be doing something about it 😑 I currently have 6 sensors showing offline NOT working ....
The person detection service doesn't work at all for me. Despite there being multiple "persons" in the frame, camera is unable to recognize them.
My cameras were working fine up until today. Everytime I try to turn them on I get an air message failed to connect. I uninstalled app twice and rebooted my cameras and still won't work.
Latest app update broke the app. Pixel phone goes into black screen when launching wyze app. After clearing cache and data it works until I close and reopen. Back to Black screen. Seems like a bug.

Please add options to customize notification of motion and sound during specific time frame. I know i can use other services like IFTTT but it would be much better if you guys can integrate this into the app.
Just got WYZE V2... In set up now @ upgrade firmware. 4 tries ending with "firmware upgrade failed" ??????? Surely, with all the 5 star reviews, the problem must be me somehow????? Lost In Space ?
After latest update, all of my cameras will connect, but show no video, it just shows black with changing bitrate in the corner. It stll works on another device running previous app version.
IR lights no longer functional with new app. We have several pan cams and none respond. The application hangs or just crashes when viewing full screen streams. That's annoying.
Keeps freezing since the update. Wont keep the time. I use this as a baby monitor, kind of need it to work correctly. Not really impressed anymore.
So far before this NEW update the Camera was working good, but ever since the NEW update installed the video keeps freezing for about 10 sec then plays, and then freezes again and so on and so on

I just recieved my Wyze band and realized it does not have an actual Blood Pressure monitor which I was under the impression it would..but I will still give you a 4 star rating for price and design. Hopefully you will add this in a future update.
Cams constantly unreachable and unstable when many others devices arround connect without issues. Incredibly, these cams are not able to alert you when they got disconnected of electricity or wifi.
Needs to bring back person detection! And cameras should work on 5g networks. Verizon broadcasts 5g and i can't connect using my Verizon router. O had to buy a router that broadcast 2.4
I wished it had a dark theme mode. Checking video (alerts) at night hella bright in landscape mode. I wished payback when you scroll you have a little popup window and stop when you see something.
Worked great until latest update. I get notifications at movements, but when I go to view them it says download failed. Formatted the sd cards on all 5 cameras with no luck
The app won't update the camera views (even though I pull down to refresh) unless I go into the individual cameras. Cameras works well enough though.
Worked great until the latest app upgrade. Thumbnails from Home page didn't upload the latest pix any more. Dont perform the latest update, there are few issues.. :-(
The Detection zone has increased now its recording all events car, bus , everything PLEASE fix this so I can decrease the detection zone to only record on my property not everything Thank you

Hidden fees. The whole reason why I bought into Wyze in the first place was the lack of subscription services. Now they keep coming out with ways to charge you for everything. You can watch someone walk up to your house but anything over the first couple seconds they will charge you for. It is ridiculous and I will no longer be recommending the product to friends and family. I recommend the cameras to so many people. It is really frustrating. What a scam.

Good device and service but cannot get idea to be connected to camera to view recorded video. If it works without connecting camera (remote site - unstable connection time to time) will give 5 stars 😉
It was great until it stopped connecting. Now it's not usable. Tell me how to connect for 5 stars I still can't get it to connect

A lot of issues with the most recent version. I have a bunch of lightbulbs and a few cameras. After the most recent update, setting up new lightbulbs has been a nightmare. The app constantly says loading, freezes and doesn't find the bulbs. I have a chandelier with 8 bulbs, I used to be able to get 4 at a time during the cycle, now I am lucky if I get one. A lot of resetting the app and my phone just to add one lightbulb. Taking me 30+ minutes to setup a few bulbs now.
Until they come up with a fix for a piece of dust on the screen for one second creating an event or sending an alert, these cameras will always be nothing more than toys.
One of the options that was a selling point for me was disabled before I made my camera purchase. So disappointing. Other than that, it is a solid camera and app.
Why are events no longer recording? All cameras are set to record events, app has been updated. What else can we do?
Blurry camera output and lousy audio. This would be a good baby monitor, but a lousy security camera. My $99 drone camera performs better.
Very informative, almost like a Fitbit for less money. You need to allow it to sync to my phone.

I have had my wyze camera since July 2019. Video clarity is sometimes too blurry. Recently when I try to access live feed from anywhere but home it tells me the camera is not connected. I know it is connected but it say wifi: not connected. But as soon as I get close to home it works?? Why is it doing that? I was going to upgrade my camera but I'm having second thoughts now.

I love the wide variety of items, they sometimes take forever to send something or is not properly packed or its quality isn't that good but only on some items, but u get what u paid for u know 🤷🏽‍♀️ I am happy with it
Absolutely, FABULOUS little camera's!!! Inexpensive & very functional. I use them for backup for my Arlo cameras when I am charging my Arlo's.
Pretty crappy device. With each firmware upgrade you get more and more bugs. Worthless at this point. Save your money and buy anything but this producy
Technical support is a joke. It seems to loose more and more functionality with time. And it seems to be unfixable.
App activates my microphone without use. If that doesn't leave you feeling suspicious, I don't know what will.

Nice app works pretty well sometimes notifications lag a little if I'm away from base station then flood in once I return home other than that works great best bang for your buck I recommend the basestaion and motion control bridge starter kit

I've stopped using my wyze cameras because on several occasions they have turned themselves on or someone else has remotely turned my cameras on and that is a huge security concern for me I was in my house at the time and had turned them off when I got home and verified they were off and while sitting at the kitchen table I heard the relay inside the camera click so I went into the app and sure enough the camera had turned itself back on
Livestream of Wyze camera v2 on Android tablet no longer works, just a black screen. Events are, strangely, visible. Livestream is visible on my Apple IPAD just not on my Android device.

Since the new upgrade: 1.)When setting notifications schedulesfor the light bulbs, the sensor of a person motion doesn't always make the light bulbs comes on, on time and if they do, they turn in for a few seconds then turn off. (FYI: Also, I set the light bulbs to stay on until 15mins.) Please fix. Thanks.
The app works great. The only problem is the type is so small and light. It is very difficult to see and read. It blends into the background. I'm sure I'm not the only old person with this problem.
Everything is good except for faulty continuous event recording with MicroSD card, missing critical events, only record 12 seconds.

When I first got it, it was fine, I gave it 4 stars. But it's gotten significantly worse. Takes forever to load live video, if it even works at all. Catches movement as it's leaving the frame and then records about 15 seconds of basically nothing. Stops recording while there's still obvious motion, even in the middle of the frame. It doesn't serve the purpose that it should. Very unsatisfied with it lately.

The cameras are fine. The app is not. Every update is two steps back. I log in, look at the camera (if it loads), then close the screen. When I go back to the app, it forever says "connecting" on the camera screen and never connects. I have to close the app completely, log back in and then maybe, just maybe, it'll let me connect to a camera. I bought the cameras because the whole system was greatly rated a few years ago, but not anymore. Thanks for taking my money and giving me a subpar product.

Too many bugs in the hub/camera. First of all they never thought about the range. If your house is big, you need more than one hub to provide good signal to all the cameras. Secondly, a lot of bugs have been there since months and they never got fixed. One of them is getting notification but no video is recorded. Also, with Arlo Ultra the videos are sometimes recorded locally but are not uploaded to the cloud. You end up with missing video and sometimes missing notifications as well.

Used to be a great app for monitoring my cameras. Over the past year however, the app has gotten more and more buggy to the point where it is almost unusable now. Motion alerts randomly work when they want to and the same goes for trying to open the app and view a live feed from a camera. Sometimes it works great, but more often than not I have to restart the app half a dozen times, reboot the camera and base station and maybe then it will play nice. I wish we could have the old app back.

When it works, it works pretty well but it crashes too frequently and must be force stopped or deleted and reinstalled to work. Most recently was when our daughter had a fever and we wanted to keep an eye on her. App crashed, then the hardware crashed and never came back. Arlo, spend less time marketing your products and much more time developing the technology and writing robust software to go with it. This is our 3rd Arlo (the other 2 died) and it will be our last. I won't buy another one.

The App is great! Sends notifications for each motion-activated trigger. I can watch the live feed for all videos from anywhere. The cameras or app (can't tell which) is a tiny bit slow to update with the new video after getting the notification, but it's not a big deal. Overall, the cameras and app are fabulous! Highly recommend!

Garbage. This app is terrible and frequently (multiple times a day) closes for no reason, logs you out for no reason, and the camera will frequently restart at any time and flash strobe lights. I've been in my son's room when it's happened and it almost gave me seizures so I can't imagine what he must go through when this happens... And it happens ALL THE TIME. I do not recommend.

Decent but recent change makes it more difficult to delete a video after it's been viewed. The delete icon used to be on the view page. It's now hidden under the menu icon. So extra steps and inconvenience. It would also be nice if it stored all camera information for retrieval when the batteries die. It all comes back when fresh batteries are installed but if you want/need that info before climbing a ladder to replace the batteries you're out of luck.

About the Arlo Baby monitor: Some of the more recent updates have broken something. Often times the Library won't open, and I won't have the option to expand the screen This was all working fine in previous versions, so it's frustrating to experience this now. I've uninstalled and reinstalled, this sometimes fixes it for a few days until the problems occur again

I've been an avid Arlo fan until lately. Can't use have the options like music anymore. They are always greyed out. I used this daily for my daughter's naps and bedtime and haven't been able to use it the last two weeks. I've done all updates, I've uninstalled and re-installed still no changes. I can't see the recordings unless on the computer as the app keeps freezing up. Please fix it!

When we bought these ( multiple ) cameras (pro 2 ) a cpl yrs ago, we've had intermittent issues, basically small ones... but as of late, the issues are becoming greater w/ the past 2 "upgrades". Range, being one, video capture length and motion detection. All the important features of a "surveillance" system! My husband and I are so upset with what has become the quality of arlo that we may purchase something else all together when we sell. Hey, if it ain't broke, why fix it!

The camera is good, clear and sound great. My issues are the time it takes to connect and the mic. I try and speak and it loads and then tells me to retry, also the volume on the camera when speaking thru the camera is also not good. But I love the cameras. If all those issues were to be resolved I would give it 5 stars, no doubt.

Glitchy! The cameras are great for the money... but the interface / app is a complete mess. Every update seems to lock up usage of it, then several days later another update fixes the problems. Even when the app "works" it is riddled with freezing issues. I am forced to manually close & reopen the app every time I change something just to see if the changes actually worked. Please work on your app!

Although the app generally works, my experience with Arlo is mixed. When their technical dept gets involved, the system gets messed up. Since I am about 100 miles from the location, it is truly a pain to resolve issues such as rebooting, resetting , etc. And when they mess with my account I have to reset everything, especially any custom modes. Cameras have to be reset too I set the sensitivity to a lower value, the next thing I know its been raised.

Generally this works well, but as we use it for baby monitoring there are a number of issues that need addressing: * It randomly stops working. The app. refuses to connect until it's killed and restarted. * It randomly hangs. We've had occasions where one device can see a live image but another is seeing a hung image even though they're on the same WiFi network. Once occasion was an image of an empty cot which caused a little panic! * It sometimes doesn't stop streaming. I've clicked the disable toggle but there is still sound and images streaming from it, often within the same app. instance on the same device, * Echo. We've had situations where the sound is coming from the app twice with a ~1/2 second delay, * Muting. Sometimes you press the button but sound still comes from it. * Image corruption. Though a device like the Nest Max the image comes through clearly without corruption, but on the Arlo app. there are image artefacts appearing. It works fine the vast majority of the time, but it does instil confidence.

The App overall works fairly decent. Its a good security measure to log in. But when something is actually wrong. By the time you log in, the bad guy is half done or actively entering your home/business. An option to stay logged in would be nice. There is also a VERY noticeable time lag between the persons/animals motion and what you see on your screen. The tracking and zoom features are nice but could use a LOT of improvements on focus timing. Those reasons are why only 4 stars.

I am using this with an Arlo Baby monitor. Push notifications are not reliable, therefore this is useless as a baby monitor. I usually hear the baby screaming from across the house before this app receives a notification. Also, camera will randomly report that it is offline. Force-stopping the app usually fixes the problem, so it seems like mostly an issue with the app and/or Arlo web services, not the hardware. I'd love to update this review with a better rating if Netgear ever fixes it. Edit: Been using the app for two months, and it actually seems to be getting WORSE. Every update seems to break more things than it fixes. Today, it is basically unusable.

They're decent camaras. The camaras themselves, I bought 2 yrs ago and they've been outdoors this entire time. They work like new. However, the app freezes a lot. When I talk through the mic it sounds like I'm speaking from another planet through a low channel AM station. The freezing worries me because what if something is actually happening one of these days and I'm waiting 10mins for the app to actually open and load my videos. Also takes awhile, same thing, when trying to view live.

Absolute trash app/security system, I've been having issues for over a year with the best phone you can get and internet, you legit have to open and close this app 100 times before the live feed will play, good luck trying to catch anyone in the act of anything. Takes forever to play a video, and I've had this problem before everyone was stuck at home due to the virus.

Unfortunately I'm returning this product. Cons are far greater than the Pros. Pros: easy install easy setup. Cons: App takes forever to load, cameras are slow and unresponsive, "motion detection" doesn't work, uploading a video from recording to server halts any ability to use the app or cameras. If someone is breaking in and I need a fast, secure and effective way of knowing who and where and what is happening....this product fails.

Arlo wasn't very good to begin with BUT since the update it's downright TERRIBLE! The awful recording LAG is a huge problem for home security. Cannot view cameras live, won't connect to camera. Keeps spinning, but never loads no matter how many times I restart. And its not my wifi... I have the fastest wifi available and it's working perfectly. I have a different system outdoors that loads instantly in real time. Arlo does NOT do that. Buying this system was the worst purchase I ever made.

Hello, I like Arlo but the app is faulty sometimes. It disconnects often and I get a message that my devices are offline. Then, I have to log out and login again and the devices are online again. Also, sometimes one of the cameras does NOT register movement and alert me of it. Do not like that. Other than that, I like Arlo! Thanks!!!

From day one this product worked. I knew very little about systems of this type and thank you Arlo i did not need to. Downloaded the app, and took it from there. The price for what i got, was wonderful. So good that i helped a co-worker who needed it get one. We placed a camera on home wifi and battery in their car, and it made a life or death different. You see whats, what before lt gets to the door. Price charged but i still tell every and any one Arlo. The only ⬇⬇⬇ is c service.

Literally a great camera with THE WORST APP. It crashes all the time. It is missing the arrows to expand to full screen 90% of the time. The baby monitor often has the music button totally greyed out so I can't select it - not just the music is off grey but literally can't open the music section at all, totally not functioning greyed out. It is jumpy. It takes forever to load. Arlo - seriously - every time you update you make it worse!! It can't be THIS HARD to figure out a camera app!

Been using Arlo for over a year as well as two coworker who own 6+ camera systems. I have a mix of Arlo 2 Pro and Arlo 3 as well as the Arlo flood lights. I haven't used other wireless cloud based systems only traditional hard wire. Few gripes about the app. First thing the Flood light need the toggle Left to Right rather than up and down. When your scrolling your devices page it so super easy to turn the flood lights on by mistake. I have Arlo Smart premium and would like the ability to review the video clip that triggered the alert as an option in addition to going to the live video feed. By the time you see the alert 90% time there is no need to look at live footage. Problem also with if its been to long accessing the app or the playstore updates the app you may be getting alerts that are never pushed and notified. You might go a day or two and at some point wonder why you haven't gotten alerts to find out the app got updated and required a login Lastly I would like to see some functionality added for tamper and siren alerts for USB power. If someone was trying to get behind and camera and unplug thinking it disable the camera (happened to my coworker, daughter thought it turned off the camera) would like to get a alert or set a siren config. Currently you would have no way of knowing if you did not regularly check battery status.

App is awful. Will repeatedly log you out, therefore leaving your house unprotected. Constantly have to re login and enable my device. Also you can't set the timer so the camera comes active at night and off in the morning because it thinks you are going back in time. Absolutely awful, get it together. This is clearly a known issue, and an easy fix. Sort it out! Cameras - good, App - terrible

This app use to be REAL TIME until the NEW APP. Now there is a time delay of anywhere from 9 seconds to over a minute so surprising someone is NOW a moot point. I havent had much problem with quality or recording time other than it is not consistant with movement like it was before the NEW app. If you want a REAL TIME app get something else until they get that problem fixed. If you want something that will give good quality pics and vids to see what's going on then this is great.

Keeps asking me to update just to open the app to see cameras. I even uninstalled the app and reinstalled. I hate this app. Update...I heard back from the support. They sent me a list of instructions to follow which I did and so far the app is working normal. The problem lasted about a week. I needed to update my phones software and then uninstall n reinstalling the app. I can see my cameras now, thanks

Platform is a joke. Arlo 2 pro is terrible. 300 mb up and down on fiber and you wait minutes for a live shot after an alert. Whats the point? Its a waste of money. Reset the base turn cameras on and off...doesn't matter. Arlo is a joke, you'll get a live shot of the person breaking in when they are standing in front of you. Good luck if someone rings your doorbell and you want to talk to them....they will have gotten back in their car and drove 5 miles before your blank live feed shows

All settings apply to ALL users who have system access, which is extremely annoying. If our Arlo baby is on and I need to receive notifications if noise/motion is detected, this automatically enables the same for my husband (who is at work and does NOT need his phone to vibrate every time the baby moves!). App also constantly requires me to log back in even when I have not closed the app or moved to a different internet source or anything.

Absolutely terrible app now. I'm constantly getting signed out and more than 60% of the time can't log in. Also has been taking forever to load the camera status and turning the camera on and off. Arlo use to be the best now it's the worst. Even wyze camera and app is better and more reliable. I'm sorry I ever bought my 5 Arlo cameras. Will never be buying again and will be replacing for another company because this is just absurd.

Seems buggy and scheduling initially complicated. Sometimes the app crashes and I have to reopen it for the cameras to register as operational. I had to go to the community help forum to figure out that I had to create a new mode to add to the 'schedule' mode in order to turn notifications off during certain times of the day. That's dumb.... I should be able to do that directly in the 'schedule' mode setup. Update: Just crapped on me. Wouldn't connect. Had to uninstall and reinstall app.

This App is Trash. Between the Base station and cameras freezing up and then now the app is refusing to recognize my phone and allow it to login when I enter the security code being texted to me. This whole company is garbage. Fix your glitches for Pete's sake. What did I pay for???? My router and phone are brand new. Its your shoddy programming. Stop blaming routers and phones and accept the responsibility

It takes 5 to 10 seconds for the live screen to kick in. When the small screen is live and I go to full screen on my Samsung sometimes its just black. I have to disconnect and reconnect several times to get it to work. This is a Pro 3. Dissapoing. When it works its nice. I expected way more from a system this expensive.

Works okay most of the time but it's not flawless. Sometimes a camera will capture a trigger ~ it is time stamped & shows what camera like say front door in your notification bar but when you click on it there is nothing to view! Hope this never happens when it counts. Other than that for the most part it is very nice to have, a great peace of mind to have on duty. (hopefully the false trigger issue/ bug will be worked out)

Bad.. I mean it being wireless is great but no video!!! Late notifications. Wont record until after i step out of range of camera. Then when i go to vew video footage it dissapears out of no where! And says no data! I have a night owl system and i will be buying another to cover the rest of my property!!!! Im returning arlo and will not be buying from them again! If you want a fool proof and sturdy system buy night owl it is wired but best ive owned so far!

App not working AGAIN after the update. Can you please fix this?? Its like every 3 months the app gets updated and then works like garbage. Or I should say doesn't work. After this last update, the app freezes or kicks me out of the app back to the log in screen. I reset the app, reset my phone, reset the base and still nothing. I turned off one camera yesterday and today I started getting random notifications stating that it's on and picked up motion. FIX THIS APP AND THE BASE SOFTWARE.

Arlo pro 2. It's a good system that works well when it works. Changed to 1 star only because live view is unavailable during a triggered event. If you get a notification of motion you can not connect to the camera while it is recording said event. And If you're watching the live feed and something triggers a notification the camera will freeze until the event is finished recording. Essentially you are blind at the most critical time. System crashes a lot.

Arlo is slowly falling off my "Go-to" gadget list... The support SUCKS! I've got 5 cameras and 3 of them will no longer sync or work... Have tried several Google and YouTube searches for a fix but no luck... It's not like these little suckers are cheap either... I'm thinking of doing a NEGATIVE YouTube video to steer people clear unless I get some help soon!

The app is glitchy. It needs to be redone. Often you can't use the mic feature or click into a certain camera. Also tens to say it's offline when it's not. The cameras are great in the system is easy to set up. For the top-of-the-line system it should definitely have a better app behind it

Everything was working great and would still be working great but when I try to recharge cameras and plug the cord in it gives me a message that it's not connected. I have the Arlo Pro . No more than I've had to charge the cameras , there should be nothing wrong for the price I paid for this system.

Constantly disconnects, constantly logs me out, constantly have to log back in but sometimes doesnt even do that, have to restart devices frequently, constantly stuck on getting status, cant even restart cameras individually, records everything but the criminals, range sucks, better use indoor, sensitivity sucks bad, the delay before starts recording is much to long, doesnt record while live view is on must do it manually, battery life sucks dead in 24 hrs. Would have put no stars if I could.

Hey guys, the app is broken again (crashes on login). Any chance we can get it fixed? - A forever regretful customer (Original review starts here) Even 1 star is basically being generous for Arlo and their team. First you have to buy a $200+ webcam and then you download the app and log in and it just crashes. Happens at least 50% of the time on every update. When the app does actually work video lags by 2mins. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND

Paid close to $1000 for these cameras and you can't get the damn video to play back! Wish I could get my money back on them if your are watching a camera live and another sense motion the live video freezes. It takes for every to load anything the new updates up sucks!! Ita always down and can't connect. DO NOT GET THESE CAMERAS

My experience is that I am constantly updating the app, why? Is once a month not enough, no I have to do it every time I check the cameras update update update, password. Please fix this issue. Siren is not set up on camera if a theif where to remove camera. These are wireless cameras it should be an automatic feature

Despite update all the previous issues are the same. So much more laggy than my ring doorbell. Approx 3-10 sec delay. Cameras often dont connect or screen goes black despite good wifi link. Voice function useless as too delayed to talk to someone. You cant set alarms to go off only when people are detected instead of just moving trees etc, so alarm feature a bit useless. Totally disappointed with whole system

If you haven't bought the product, I would strongly advise that you do NOT purchase it. The amount of glitches you have to deal with for the app will not be worth your while. For a technology-based product, it will completely fail you. I use it to watch my baby, and half the time the app glitches and the camera won't work.

4/4/20 update killed notifications. Swear this team doesn't beta test updates. Arlo Pro 2 with Samsung Galaxy S8. 5/1/20 Latest update yet again...broke. Now takes forever for app to open, often not displaying mode options. This is one of the worst engineering teams ever. Beta test your updates!! On multiple device types!! Waiting again now for the usual week out update to resolve. Seriously contemplating returning.

The Android app is pretty horrible, and almost useless on my Galaxy S9. It used to work decently, but after the last couple of updates it takes about five minutes to connect to my camera video. Once it is connected, it frequently drops the connection. Not to mention, the talkback feature has never worked for me. My wife has almost no trouble with it on her iPhone 7. Wish they would fix this as I have seen lots of other reviewers complaining about connection issues too.

Is not working like before .. I don't get the alerts sometimes.. somebody was in my backyard and didn't even alert or recorded.. I found out later that they were in my backyard which is not good.. now its saying no internet connection but I have other devices connected to internet without problems..we pay a yearly subscription for it and thinking of canceling..so disappointed

Great features but rough around the edges. Each camera creates its own notification tab rather than being additional notifications in the same Arlo thread. Doesn't support dark mode or Google Pixel's face unlock either. Latest update also significantly slowed down loading times and broke the ability to play music from the baby monitor.

Great cameras and a very easy user interface. Only issue I've seen is that the cameras take a few seconds to start recording, so I've had the occasional recording of nothing because an animal or something went quickly by the screen. However, I have the original Arlo wireless cameras, so I don't know if that's an issue with their newer products. The Geofencing tool is extremely useful as it allows your phone to arm your system based on where you are.

Bull **** ! I was completely satisfied with the setup of the original app. Then I was forced to update it , because my system would no longer function. Now. every time I try and check a notification. I am made to enter my password in order to gain access. Makes about as much sense as windshield wipers on a goats rear end. Leave well enough. Alone.

I have difficulty connecting to my cameras. Connection is very slow and often won't connect at all. I use a Netgear Wifi extender connected to the Base Station with an Ethernet cable. The base station is connected to a Verizon Jetpack. The Jetpack is fast enough to allow movie streaming over the net so I don’t think bandwidth is the problem. When I connect directly to your website, it times out before connecting. I think product is defective.

We have the Arlo baby monitor my issues with it are: If you leave the app on full screen and exit out it always makes your restart. It randomly stops working if put it on "speaker" so you can listen to the baby when you're doing something else on the phone. And I really wish it had the option to alert you if it gets too hot or too cold in the baby's room like it does for sound. I do love the quality of video and sound though and I love the monitor. The app just need some glitches fixed.

* Latest firmware update rendered Alexa interface unusable. Arlo cameras display an image now they do not stream video to Alexa shows. Arlo has a great thing going interfacing with Alexa devices and some pretty nice features in feofencing and setting up movement zones(plugged in only) but the app and it's glitchy-ness still leaves alot to be desired.

App lags, takes a long time to log in (like more than a first time parents is comfortable waiting to check on their child.) No picture in picture to help continually monitor, also randomly disconnects itself so you can't check in at all. I appreciate that it alerts me when there is movement, sound, distinguishes crying from any other sound, monitors temperature and humidity BUT the sensors are often wrong. Do better, Arlo...

Generally a decent app but... I'm not sure which genius at Arlo app development thought it would be a good idea to make the signal for the camera reconnecting to the internet a flashing light because it would have to be the the dumbest design flaw I've ever seen, all it seems to do is wake my child up in the middle of the night. Seen people complain about this in the past and Arlo don't seem to care enough to do a software fix.

If it worked correctly it would be the best baby monitoring app/camera ever. However, the quality of the stream is often so low the image is unrecognizable. It's a baby monitor. We kind of need to see our baby. That's why we bought this. My experience is by far not out of the norm here either. If you got to Arlo's forum you'll see plenty of people with the same problem.

The app was working fine before last update with zero problems. I've had the Pro 2 system for over 6 months and it's been great. But the last update caused me to get frozen spinning log in screen. Then once into the app I had to change login credentials. To top everything off I'm not getting any notifications although everything is set to on. I'm this close to buying another system but I'm hoping this gets fixed. I would hate to do this because I've already caught a thief in action. UNDECIDED

I love this system. I have a wired system as well. Arlo is much better response then my wired system. The battery life is good, when it is on the low battery usage, I don't have to recharge them as often. One of the great features I like is it can be use indoors or outdoors.

Good, could be great. If the app could show case a pop out video that lays on top of mobile UI this would be 5stars for me, also noticed sometimes the expand window arrow icon does always load, so I have to open the restart the app 2 or 3 times, other wise the functionality is good. The music and ability to record custom voice messages and add to que or repeat is brilliant Thanks

Nice cameras. Very easy to install, app and all. I am more than satisfied with my purchase. I also went back and purchased another box of 3 and all i had to due was add them to the app. Didn't use 2nd router. All cameras are on one. Didnt need the husbands help either. Lol

I got robbed purchasing the arlo. Their support agents always blame the internet connection. I have 3 base stations on different properties & they're all the same. Takes too long to buffer sensors miss half the movements & cameras freeze up constantly...glitchy video. Support people go through same song & dance of resetting the base station every..ARLO SUCKS .

Takes too long to connect video feed when opening the app. Often have to close and reopen app several times before it works. Have a strong wifi signal in area Arlo is placed but it will disconnect in the middle of the night at times. App functionality is weak (sometimes the fullscreen icon is present, sometimes it's not. Sometimes the screen will rotate with turning your device, sometimes it won't) Customer support is awful. I've had an open ticket for a month and a half. 0 stars!

Good companion app to Arlo cameras. Could be improved with a snooze function that turns system off for a preset period, like when mowing the lawn. The only options are to put up with the constant alerts (which are annoying and put a drain on the system) or disarm the system. I've done the latter and discover days later I forgot to turn it back on. Additionally, I have a Gen 1 camera that has *never* updated firmware successfully. Would be nice if the app had debugging info or kept a log.

We have had Arlo for over a year now. For awhile we had several issues with it coming up very slow but in the last few months it's working great. The fingerprint is a great option and the site comes up very quickly now. The cameras have always worked well in alerting you of any kind of movement outside. We are pleased with Arlo. I would have given it a 5 if we hadn't had issues the first several months after installing.

App does not flow the way it should. Very difficult to remove the scheduled times of activation. While easy to add the other times of activation; the times they had preset are the exact times I don't need it and could not find how to remove. It is not at all intuitive in the way you move through the app. Need to go through many processes to get to the various items you need and they don't seem to be logical in their flow.

Terrible unreliable app. Works ok... when it works!! Except for about a 15+ second delay in notifying when you have an alert. However most of the time it doesnt work! It won't show ANY downloaded videos and no longer notifies me properly. So I get an alert of motion, yet cant view it. It also very often crashes and logs me out right as I'm checking an alert!! I have to log back in again - by the time I log in to see who's on my property they've already been there for at least 30-60 seconds!

**Still contains bug which removed full screen option - Support have known about it for over 4 updates🤦** Other issues; 1.No option to schedule cam to turn on / off, 2.No option to schedule monitor from 7pm to 6am, 3.No option to disable audio alerts, 4.No option to disable internet access (use over local WiFi only), 5.No option to insert SD to increase local storage, 6.Cam keeps going offline (but active video still appears behind the error), 7.Support don't respond to feedback #Rubbish

This system is mediocre at best. Paid extra for CVR timeline and it is just ok. Video playback is spotty at times. Sometimes doesn't record important events. Update: Changed WiFi password and now the Q camera won't work. It shows up on my WiFi router but the Arlo app cannot locate it. Updated to 3 stars. Helpful hints: disconnect power and remove battery when camera malfunctions. If that doesn't work, plug it in and use a push pin to reset and start as if you just bought it.

This app has a number of good features, and is fairly easy to use. I find the notifications of detected activity are somewhat inconsistent. Although it does do a good job of screening out non human activities such as squirrels and cats. Also, I have the app running when I go to bed, but have to login again in the morning. That seems like a significant flaw.

It was easy to install even for someone like me who is slow to take up new technology. The small issue is the maybe couple of seconds delay in capturing movement. I haven't gone for subscribing to upgraded pack so the camera captures any movement including insects buzzing. The two way voice can also be a good detterent and handy to keep an eye on loved ones.

Very happy with the battery life. Of course batteries will not last when in constant use when you keep it on live picture. Motion notification on my phone is all I need to see when their's activity around. Picture quality is great and can pick out what I need . After 5 months my phone was alerted to motion on cameras and found two people snooping in my car that was left unlocked. I was able to get to my vehicle before anything was taking. Cameras already paid for themselves

Update: lowered rating to 1 star because the "always listening" audio now cuts out every night. I do not hear my baby waking up and crying in the morning through the app. Will need to switch to another monitor. I use the app for my Arlo Baby monitor. The audio will frequently stop playing when using the 'always listening' feature and I will need to go into the app to turn it back on. Less often, the video image will either freeze or go black and it takes a few minutes to resume playing.

This app is so slow. Most of the time the person has passed 2 cameras before I get a notification. It's SUPER slow to load video, and I have a really fast Internet connection, so the app is obviously the problem. I had a package stolen and the thief was long gone before I could even get the video feed to load to see why the camera tripped. Camera/video quality is fine, but the app leaves a lot to be desired.

(1) app keeps crashing in the background, so now I have a false sense of security thinking I'll get notifications of events. (2) GPS fencing is terrible. I frequently have to wake up the Home/Away mode by triggering a GPS polling in another app. Shouldn't have to do that. Again, false sense of security thinking I'll get notifications when I really won't.

It takes as long as 15 seconds for me to get notification from the camera. Then it takes at least another 20 seconds for me to open the camera app to to view the live feed. By that time, the person is gone and it takes another ten plus seconds to download the recorded short clip. Customer service was very friendly after I finally got through. They had me move the camera from outside to inside next to the base unit and I received notification in just over 3 seconds. They said that was normal.

My biggest thing is the number of times I have to open the app in order to have all the features to be available. I open the app but I'm not able to make it full screen. I open the app again and the temperature isn't showing up. I probably have to open and close it numerous times so it will work properly. The camera will disconnect from the internet randomly. It will turn on a purple light and make a clicking sound when this happens and this wakes my baby up!

The app (and associated hardware) performs pretty well; an important part of our overall security system. However, it has numerous deficiencies and inconsistencies that required us to add different security and camera systems. The Arlo system has far longer delays in triggering alerts to both cellphone and desktop than competitors we've used. The login and download of a video from an alert is painfully and sometimes uselessly slow. Two to five minutes delay is too much.

Takes so long to buffer and time is delayed. One camera will say session has expired and I need to log in again. I have info saved sol I don't have to do that. The other camera will just acknowledge my fingerprint. This was not the siren m system I was expecting but at least I can leave stuff open and go in the house without worrying about someone stealing something or walking in where they don't belong. I use my cameras for peace of mind but "I DON'T call 911".

Serious lag, will randomly decide to not show a live image, crashes all the time, can't open the app consecutively without shutting it down completely before reopening, takes a while to load up. On paper the Arlo baby monitor and app is good. In reality it's unreliable and low performing. Just hope your camera doesn't decide to stop working as you have to pay to post back and receive a replacement which takes weeks. Or you can't pay even more to have a hastened service. Big regrets buying!

Every time I open the app it says I need to update since Legacy is no longer supported. I click update, sends me to Playstore with no option to update. Only options are to uninstall and open. App has days lag time in being able to view recordings if at all. First 6 months I installed system was great. After several updates in about a year and a half and no longer reliable. Very disappointed. Looking to replace with a different company.

Right idea, poor delivery. The app doesn't always update with geofencing. Constantly saying devices are offline. If someone walks past the camera by the time it picks them up and starts recording they are gone. Adjusting the sensitivity means I get flooded with loads of false detections, also picks up windy branches and shadows, very frustrating and not reassuring. On top of all this I am constantly changing the batteries.

Terribly buggy! When it does actually work (30% of the time) its great but its rare! I have an android and this app is awful on this platform. It constantly disconnects, won't let me view library, can't view full screen 75% of the time, sends me notifications late or not at all. Complete trash. I ended up using my old plug in monitor because this worked so poorly

Works excellent, camera picks up a good area and you get alerted every time on your phone unless you turn that option off. Doorbell comes across your phone as well. Then you can speak thru it as well. Batteries last a few months, but kind of feel safer having this now. Thumbs up...

Latest update is full of bugs. Hangs for a long time, keep getting status updating and says offline when babycam is not. Old.sofware on another phone not updated works but this latest update does not. Fix the bug. Plus turning on and off baby monitor feature from app has now been removed. Please restore it.

Intermittent, doesn't always connect even after refreshing the app, lags a few seconds behind real time. Not as good as i thought it would be for a baby monitor. Also not the best video quality. Only gives sound notifications when it wants to. Unreliable.

Extremely unreliable. Do not plan to use this as a primary baby monitor. It misses a lot of movement. It has an option to stream audio to your phone continuously even if the app is minimized. But it'll lose connection and stop playing audio with no warning at all. I constantly have to close the app and reload it because if I go away and come back it'll say not connected even though I was just looking at the feed 30 seconds ago. Overpriced garbage (for this with their camera).

App does not work with Samsung Multi window feature. Online web page does not support in window full screen, only full screen. Door bell workflow is still terrible; I don't want a voicemail prompt, I want instant video during ring not only after accepted, I want to be able to decline it without letting the ringer know, I should be able to silence the door bell ringing on my phone without having to disable it altogether. Your AI is useless; it doesn't use cutting edge techniques like instance segmentation and lacks user tagging/tracing. The timeouts are ridiculous. Should be able to disable alerts on animals. Otherwise the app/hardware is workable though not enjoyable.

The geofencing is flaky as hell, just like the previous version. Takes a long time to connect to cameras to the point where it's useless to check after a notification. The 3rd rate Arlo developers are still incompetent and this app is still garbage. Update: Wow, the Arlo devs are so hopeless they just continue to make it even worse with every update. Now the scheduling is utterly broken, it's sets random schedules completely different from what you enter, which makes it worthless. Arlo - stop hiring the cheapest, most useless developers. My advice - Do not buy Arlo!

If you want all your cameras to do the same thing at the same times it excellent. Once you start trying to set cameras active in different areas at different times it falls down. It looks like you can but it doesn't seem to work. Geofencing is also a problem. It works fine with one phone but falls over if you try to add a second phone. What it desperately needs is an option to have scheduled active times with geofencing operational in the scheduled inactive times that is reliable on 2 phones

Great video, ease of mounting, sound quality could be better. Making changes to the camera could be easier to use. Love the cameras. Batteries last pretty long in between charges. Have some cameras plugged in. Work great. Night vision pretty good unless you have two cameras pointed towards each other. Then you get glare from the other ones infrared.

The app video never works, it sits there loading any time I try to open it. I get a zillion notifications for motion or sound, but it won't load if I try to open. For the amount of money that the camera costs the video app shouldn't have this many problems. Update after update I keep thinking the problems might be solved, but no. FIX THE APP!

This app either crashes or doesn't connect (just said connecting forever). I'll have it working, then lock my phone and within 10 seconds unlock my phone to go back to the Arlo baby camera and it just says connecting forever. There are way too many bugs with this app on Android. Myv wife has an iPhone and luckily there isn't as many bugs on the iOS version. There are so many times when I try to connect and I can't. My router is 10 feet away from it and I know my internet is fast enough

Having installed several Arlo cams for many years, the quality of service has been keeping deterioating since last year (2019). First, real-time viewing is not available thru website any more (always got error messgaes on Flash player etc). Second, cam gets disconnected consistently. I have to log in, re-log in to activate the cam. Some time get message like "the cam doesn't belong to you" ?!! Even worse, error may happen sporadically, which put its reliability in question.

Several times I have received notifications that there was motion detected on my cameras but when I went to check the app, it was not in the library queue. I called in my concerns and one of the people I spoke with was very hard to understand and was getting frustrated with me for not being able to understand them. I spoke with another agent who was much more friendly and easier to understand but still could not determine the problem.

Cant believe I bought this. The reaction time to start recording is slow. Doesn't record for long enough before and after. Have one for the front door. By the time the person has knocked, theyve usually left before i get the notification. This is actually useless as a security system, especially for the price you're paying

We've used one Arlo Pro 2 for about 1.5 years. Overall it has been acceptable for recording short (8 sec) clips and notifying us. Way too much delay to make microphone usable. Sometimes quite a delay after noticing motion until it starts recording. Recently the app notification method was upgraded via an app update and we cannot get notifications to work at all now. Even tried full factory reset and reconfigure. Just fails now. Generally was only recommended as a backup/redundant video system.

I like the cameras however, what's the point in having an app and notifications of recordings when they don't even show up in the app library? I've read numerous posts about this problem and nothing seems to resolve it. It happens everyday and mostly at night - the most common time I'd like to know what motion the camera is picking up.
